title: Pretty & I love it!
text: Lovely ink. Writes well. The right amount of wet/dry. Currently using it in both a platinum curidas (f) & a pelican twist (m) & it writes well in both.  Beautiful color & flows nicely. It has not clogged up my nibs.

title: 2 excellent 1 extremely dry (blue)
text: Overall I’m pretty happy with this purchase bc the ink is good & I’ve purchased it before.  The green is gorgeous.  The purple didn’t really wow me, but it flows nicely. The blue however is a disappointment bc it’s extremely dry & keeps drying in my pen. I am using the inks in the same type of pen- platinum curidas & all have same size nib. So the only difference is the actual ink.  I’m gonna try to mix a little of the ink with a tiny bit of glycerin next time I refill it & see if that helps it to stay wetter & not dry out in my pen. Aside from that I love their ink. Think I just received a dud this time with the blue.

title: I don’t get the reviews. Mine are garbage.
text:
[[VIDEOID:63276c19932aa4f3687042b8b9f8613c]] Update: tried again to return them. I have prime. Amazon wants $7.99 to pick them up. Why? Bc I return garbage products & I don’t feel like I should be penalized when third party sellers & amazon send damaged/defective products & then expect me to be happy with them & keep them. Why should I bear the burden of a billion dollar plus corporation as a disabled veteran living on disability? These skip all over the place. The yellow won’t write no matter how much I shake the ball bearing. It and the black give a second of ink & stop. I even tried warming the ink up. The black finally became more viscous, but the yellow won’t lay down. If you have a fast hand & are used to taking fast notes these are useless. At least my set is. Garbage. Utter & complete garbage. Some work better if you write slow like a toddler, but I have never had to slow my hand with a zebra fountain pen nor any of the 200 others I own. And you don’t have to shake the zebra pen!

I purchased these bc of the reviews. Maybe I receive a bad batch. Idk. Mine are awful. I have fountain pens I purchased online for a dollar and less that works better & that write every single time I pick them up. Half of these did not even work after I attached the ink. I had to squeeze the cartridge repeatedly & even then I’m lucky if I get anything to come out. For $18 I was expecting to at least get something that would write every time I picked it up. These are a scratchy mess. I have tried them on cheap paper & expensive Tomoe River paper with the same results. I have hundreds of fountain pens, but I was looking for something that I could visually see at a moment’s glance what color was in the pen & I thought these would work. I will give them a few more days, but if the ink doesn’t settle in & lubricate the innards so that the writing experience is improved then I will definitely be sending these back bc they are garbage as-is.

title: Ordering Ink online: never a good idea I guess.
text: It’s a beautiful color, but even though it had been packed extremely well imo it still arrived & showed considerable loss of ink due to shipping/handling disturbances.  It also left a stain on my bathroom vanity that I am still working on & thankfully it’s just a small one as I placed paper towels down before I opened the mess.  Next time I receive a bottle like this I’m just going to rinse it off, pat it dry, & slip a non-latex glove over it to keep everything in the vicinity safe including my hands bc the ink stained the label & wont come off except if my hands happen to be wet/moist.  The ink works well on both Tomoe River paper & cheap notebook paper & dries quickly.  As for the ink itself: I love it!  I don’t understand why it stained my vanity tho bc to my knowledge it’s not supposed to be waterproof.  Luckily after much scrubbing there is only a tiny mark left & I know it’s there, but I am really hoping my LL does not notice it.  Gonna try a little bleach on it next.  Also, I was able to mix a bit of it with a J Herbin red ink (scented red rose I believe) that I had on hand to get another shade of purple & I am quite pleased with it.  It is currently in a Dryden pen rn & it’s working beautifully with zero issues. This ink R&K is in a Lamy  “Candy” purple pen & is also working beautifully.  I wish they offered the inks in glass bottles instead of the cheap plastic.  Tho I recently received a bottle of Pilot Iroshiziku ink with a cracked lid & zero ink as it had obviously been upside down at some point during transit so glass is no guarantee that ink doesn’t get damaged. I’m disabled so I generally order everything online as it’s easier for me, but it appears I am going to have to venture out of my cave at some point. Lol. The ink is lovely if you can get one that has not been damaged or lost too much of it’s contents en route as I have.  I did notice that the cap on mine was dented & I believe that’s probably what allowed the ink to escape as they always tell us not to buy dented cans at grocery stores!  Things are only as good as their weakest links.

title: Mine are iffy at best.
text: Idk if I just got a bad batch which is possible I suppose bc let’s face it sometimes companies have bad manufacturing runs, but all 4 of my pens are a total pain to use. They skip or the ink just does not flow at all no matter how hard I press on the Nov & then I get a puddle of ink.  Every once in a blue moon if I dip them in ink they seem to work a bit better, but it’s definitely not how they were meant to be used. I am not a newbie either. I own well over 200 fountain pens & calligraphy pens of versing widths & I have a large collection of inks as well. I also tried these out on every type of paper I have from Tomoe River to Mead & composition notebooks, but the pens I have are just useless for me as they will not write fluidly.  If I wanted to stop & start a hundred x I would just stick with my dip pens.  These are a huge let down as they have so many high reviews & I just wasn’t expecting them to be so awful.  Idk if I’m going to try the amazon replacement or not.  In my experience I tend to get another item from the same bad quality lot (or worse).  Decisions, decisions.

title: Mine skips
text: First time I’ve tried this brand so maybe I just received a dud idk, but mine skips really bad.

title: Arrived damaged! Great paper. Lousy cover.
text: Great paper. I own others by this brand. This is going back for a replacement tho bc it arrived damaged. Both the front & back covers are damaged.  Even the paper on the inside shows dents from whatever damaged the front & back covers. It has creases along the bottoms of about half the pages about 1” from the right edge.

title: Quality not as pictured in advertising.
text:
[[VIDEOID:ffd2a834f42a38fd089e2bfa848e4b5d]] Idk what to say bc what I received looks nothing like the one advertised. What I received looks like someone poured motor oil on leather after they stamped it then went on a long lunch & came back & tried to fix the mess they left on the leather. It looks like they tried to distress or something which I hate to begin with as I’m not a fan of fake distressing. I find that seems to be the norm when the leather is not the best quality. When the leather is thinner or more scratched up as this is the sellers seem to think it’s best to distress it.

The stamping itself is well done. The only problem with it is that the leather is so thin & thinner even in some places that it has created humps in the cover front & back. I am not joking about the motor oil. It feels & smells like motor oil. Their is a slick substance on my hands after touching it & I am allergic to petroleum products so I’ve had to wash my hands several times & put on gloves. The distressing job was so uneven that if I decide to keep the journal I will definitely not keep it in this incarnation. I will definitely use leather cleaner to remove whatever I can sue to my allergies & then I will have to cover it with something else that I’m not allergic to, but that just adds time & money to this so idk what I’m going to do yet. I’ve even thought of painting it & sealing it. Fortunately the dye job on the front isn’t as bad as the one on the back & I’m the only one that will see it as it’s not a gift for anyone except myself.

I like the locking mechanism & feel they did a good job on thst tho it was covered in the oil too. That has made it easy to open tho. Lol. However, bc of the locking mechanism this is not a journal you will be able to paste or collage many things into. It’s a straight up writing journal imo bc it’s in no way expandable due to the locking device. Tho I suppose if your crafty/handy you can change out the rivets in the back & add a longer piece of leather there after you have filled it to ur heart’s desire.

As for the paper I don’t find it any better than any paper I’ve had in similar journals. It has flecks & bits of other papers which I personally don’t care for bc I use fountain pens & dip pens & my pens will skip on the uneven surfaces & that is literally on every page. There are also quite a few wrinkled pages in the journal which you can find with homemade journals.

So at this point I just don’t know. I need to think about it a bit more. If I had received a journal that looked as good as the advertised one & was not covered in oil & I would definitely keep it & just use different pens or use it for watercolor or bird sketches. This one requires more thought. I definitely would not give this as a gift to anyone unless I ordered it to be delivered to me & had a chance to clean it up & check it out first, but if you are a crafty person who likes a challenge or is willing to take a chance & hope for one like the pic then idk maybe take a chance?

title: Packing is awful will update pen review later
text: Literally one of the worst packing jobs I’ve seen.  It’s the lightest pen I have ever used & as I am post surgery on my dominant hand & am used to less than 5 minutes of writing even remotely comfortably I absolutely love that part.  I think it’s pricey for what it is though. The Pilot Petit are $3 on Jet pens. 8 x cheaper & imho write just as well. Where this has the advantage for me is tho I am a woman I am tall & have man hands so said two hubbies. Bloody mean things to say if you ask me. Lol.  I am in love with it even though I hate the price point & truly believe it to be massively overpriced for plastic, but being s fountain pen junkie with well over a hundred including Montblanc I fully intend to buy bc thst is what we fountain pen ppl do. We collect them in all shapes & sizes. I have 5 kids & I tend to collect them in both my & my children’s & my grandchildren’s favorite colors.  Some I gift while I am alive & others they will only inherit bc I use them daily for writing & art.  It is a little beauty & I love that the cap screws on.  This mint color is beautiful & just happens to match a cutting mat I picked up at Wally World recently. Lol. Yay me!

title: Defective hardware & workmanship
text: [[VIDEOID:c4ffdd909a55f78e5a83951e34c4528e]] Unfortunately I received a pen that has some very bad metal parts that has the actual gold finish missing in quite a few places & is scratched up in many others.  That means the metal parts actually test my skin & cut it because the metal is actual quite jagged in many places. I don’t know if the metal pieces were dropped or were caught in some machinery or what, but it makes for a very unpleasant feeling when you hold it & a very unsafe result when it cut my fingers in several places.  I liked the look of the ribbed design of the metal on the pen, but it made for a less than ideal experience when actually holding the pen as it was uncomfortable.  It’s a very pretty pen & I found it quite beautiful even though it honestly triggered issues with my vertigo. Something about the design where it looks almost holographic & like the design is actually moving kicked my vertigo into high gear which is unfortunate bc the design was the entire reason I purchased the pen in the first place. Lol.  The issue with the workmanship should be able to ne seen in the pics as there are quite a few globs of resin or acrylic down the side of the pen which are a darker yellow stain than the rest of the pen & there are globs of what must be wood pulp or shavings in the resin that end up sitting directly on top of the top layer & you can both see them & feel them when you run your hand over the pen. Which is extremely annoying to someone who likes to pet her fountain pens.  It would definitely be worth checking back in a couple of months as the crafter gets better at their trade and/or uses better materials.  However, right now with these damaged metal materials with nicks, scratches, & paint missing & with the flaws/damages to the wood I’m not in the mood for a replacement & I intend to go for a return/refund.  Though I do hope to try this seller again at a later date if I see an improvement in the issues bc I prefer hand made fountain pens.

title: My pen is utter garbage & leaks like a sieve.
text: [[VIDEOID:b5de3fbb67572893aa86f7052023b9ba]] I’m dumbfounded by the great reviews. Maybe I just received a dud? Idk.  My pen leaks like a sieve as you can see in the pics & by the ink collected on my fingers. The cap will not post which makes me crazy.  The clip is askew. It’s like a third grader put it together with left over fittings & tried to make it fit. The fittings are a hot mess too. The gold is all scratched, dinged, & dented & it came like that right out of the packaging.  I also can’t u deer and why they have 2 shades of teal making up the pen body. The very tip is one shader & it just looks like they ran out of resin imo.  The resin itself has some obvious impurities in it. Idk if it was dusty where these were made or what, but something definitely got into the mix that produced this pen.  I am a fountain pen freak & I have purchased pens off eBay for 99 cents or less that write 100x better than this pen. The nib is so scratchy it has actually torn paper & I have a very light hand & use pricey papers.  I love Jane Davenport stuff, but after seeing the cancer warnings no thx.  I’ll purchase from artists who care as much about my health as I do.

title: Damaged! Stamps don’t pick up the ink properly.
text: I’ve used Carter’s for 4 decades in a work environment & home environment for arts & crafts, but I have never in my life received one looking like this. Looks like some kid stick their fingers in it.  Lol. And the seal actually looked as tho it had been previously compromised when I went to open it. I wish I had thought to take a pic of that.  I’m less than thrilled bc I needed this asap for a current project.  The front of the pad is pretty beat up too.  It has a very obvious dent in it which I would assume is when the interior pad got messed up making it hard to get stamps to pick up the ink evenly without applying a lot of pressure & then you get parts of the stamp that aren’t part of the design. This seems like a scratch & dent sale ink pad to me which sucks bc I love Carter’s & have used them for decades as I stated before.  The pad appears to be inked well & is not dry. It even seems to close pretty well considering the huge dent in the lid, but it does not work for the purposes I purchased it for. I’m hoping I can return it or exchange it.

title: Excellent! Buy it. Buy lots in fact!
text: New to this brand & as a huge fan & collector of fountain pens I am now a huge fan of this brand.  I purchased the 5-1/2” x 8” size & a smaller one to throw in my purse.  I plan on purchasing more in the future as my fountain pens have finally found a home for their ink & words.  I am very excited about the two ribbons too.  The only issue I see that already annoys me immensely as these are brand spanking new right out of the plastic is that they are missing the green color in several places. Idk if it has flaked off or what, but these were sealed in plastic when I I received them. I have handled them exactly  one time since opening them so idk how that paint job on the cover is going to hold up to daily use.  I knocked of a star for that bc imo they should not be flaking off their color after one handling of extremely light use.  I’m disabled with a bad arm so I’m not able to be rough with it even if I wanted to. Lol. It’s lost the green color at the top & the bottom already.  That is concerning to me as it’s not even been placed on a book shelf yet, but just been lying on a table tray by itself.

title: Could have been wonderful.  Has execution flaws.
text:
Update: received replacement & the second is just like the first unfortunately. So I will assume this was made by the same crafter & from the same batch as the last. Again, the paper has been pulled too tightly & ripped through the backing. It has also been cut through the first 30% of the pages at one edge. There are paint pen marking all over the journal inside & out. This one has a cut down the front where maybe they had begun to make a scoring cut in the leather & realized it was going to be too short & then just put the design over it. They did a better job of getting a deeper embossing on this one tho. The finish is worse however. This one has a weird finish almost like pumice stones where it looks kind of crackled & porous Idk if it was done on purpose as a design or not. I wish this crafter would learn to not use paint pens to mark up leather bc it ruins the product. If you try to remove the paint pen you ruin the leather. I am double bummed for having given them a second chance.
Old review:
This could have been a beautiful little hotter notebook. Unfortunately it is not. The ppl that made it decided to use metallic paint pens & permanent markers to mark all their sewing lines ruining the aesthetic. There is not a spot on either side without a blemish. I had resolved myself that if only the inside was ugly I could live with that. Lol. Bc there’s a lot of that irl imo, but it turned out that both the inside & outside had imperfections behind what I was prepared to pay for & live with. As a disabled person I can generally live with a lot lol, but I spend my little bit of money on writing tools & I like them to be nice. This could have been a thing of true beauty as it reminds me of several Levenger notebooks I own. Sadly, while the idea was great the execution is lacking. I hope they will do it right next time bc it’s the perfect size to throw into a purse or backpack for a short trip or even a longer jaunt if you bring paper refills. The paper quality was not what I was hoping for either & as it arrived torn & already pulling away from its base I would not have used it anyways. As it is it is a hard no for me in its current state. I hope that either the seller or amazon will do right me. Someone should definitely be doing quality inspection checks bc this would not have passed even a rudimentary one. The metallic silver paint pen was a glaring no staring me right in the face the second I opened it up. The black permanent marker while it did match the journal better was still extremely obvious & still extremely annoying to see. It’s a well thought out design in my estimation just an extremely flawed execution. I hope the seller tweaks their issues & offers it in other colors bc I would totally try again.

title: Lovely, but front bent  corner & toner (?) splotches throughout.
text: It’s a nice heavy journal with thick pages.  The rose gold color is very pretty. Of course the first thing I noticed when I pulled it from the package was that the upper right hand corner had already been bent.  For some reason the quick reference page has been glued in weirdly imo so that there is no margin to the left & it makes it hard to write ur information there.  I haven’t written mine in there yet bc my entire book seems to have toner or printer ink or something on every single page like someone decided to just sprinkle some fairy dust on every page.  As I intend to use this partly as an art journal I would prefer one without the added splotches all over.  I believe there are 43 sheets of lined paper after the journal section & I am quite happy about that added bonus.  The envelope in the back is quite roomy & will hold a lot of receipts.  It’s a pretty journal & I suspect I will buy more from the manufacturer in the future albeit hopefully without these issues bc this one needs to be replaced & hopefully Amazon will do so.

title: Wrong pens!!!
text: My review is whacked bc I received the wrong pens & I am extremely unhappy about it. I have not had a very good week with Amazon in particular.  I love Amazon, but I keep receiving packages that are damaged containing items that are damaged.  Now this mess arrives. Argh!  The pens are excellent in every regard. They just aren’t the colors ordered. I wanted the purple & yellow pens & as you can see they are not in my order.  I ordered a journal earlier this week that came with some pens & stencils & the pens are too thick to fit in the stencils. These do an amazing job in them. The stencils have very tight corners & are very sharp & these handle them beautifully. I just did not want to waste ink filling them in. Lol. The first thing I noticed about these pens was the heft. I love a pen with some heft to it. Even tho I’ve had hand surgery & I can no longer write, paint, or draw as long as I used to I have always loved the feel of a well balanced writing instrument in my hand. These aren’t exactly balanced lol bc of the ink distribution & the plastic fatigue finger rest, but it feels nice in my hand.  I’m just thoroughly ticked off that these are not what I paid for & what I have been waiting for. Lol.  Back to my pen search.

title: Arrived dinged up. Not happy.
text: It’s pretty, but it’s not very sturdy. Mine arrived looking like it had been dropped on its edges either before or during transit tho I suppose it could have happened in a warehouse somewhere.  Even if I was willing to overlook that- which I am most definitely not- I opened it up to see that the tabbed monthly pages were all bent and folded too.  They are just regular paper pages with a little tan at the top that has a protective tape over it to make it sturdier i guess. Clearly it does not make it stuffy enough to survive the shipping.  I briefly thought that I would keep it & try to make it work bc returns are such a hassle for me bc I am disabled.  I get really annoyed with having to watch out for porch pirates trying to steal my returns if I put them on my porch to wait for UPS.  I am both physically disabled & hearing impaired so I have 2 service dogs, but I have found that if I try to keep my returns inside my home until UPS arrives they either don’t ring my doorbell to alert my service dogs who then alert me or they leave before I can physically get myself to the door. So yeah- returns are a big deal to me. Lol.  Bc if miss the window for UPS to pick it up (they only try once now) I then have to take it to a drop off center. Did I mention I am disabled? Lol. And I don’t drive?  Yeah. Big time fun at my house with returns.  So then I would have to pay more for a taxi there & back than what the products are worth. Lol. Not to mention my pain & suffering throughout all of it.  I just can’t help feeling that sometimes stuff gets shipped that has already been dropped or dinged bc I have received an awful lot lately  & it’s really ticking me off.  If I wanted dropped & dinged stuff I would buy used not new!  Hence the very long winded diatribe of venting here.  Let’s see if Amazon will post it. Lol.

title: Pretty Flipping Awesome!
text: I’m a book freak & I adore mine!  I use fountain pens. Cheap ones off eBay I paid anywhere from 5 cents to 99 cents for up to my Montblanc pens & Pilot pens & they all work fine. Sure you may have a little paper on the end of ur nib once in a while, but to me it’s nbd bc it homemade paper & I think they did a marvelous job on it. I’m not generally a fan of the “antiquing” of anything. I usually hate it, but I fell in love w the silver paper in this journal & decided why not?  The only thing I would change is the closure. I hate the tab thingy. I prefer the wrap around string method to close my journals or anything that does not leave me any type of uneven surface to write on later.  It’s a neat design feature to some ppl & it does look good & cute, but it’s not my personal preference.  I would not let that keep me from buying another one though. Lol. I do hope they make them with a different closing option in the future though bc I love the size of the book & the superior craftsmanship.  It’s well worth the price!

title: First one mis-delivered to??? Replacement A+!
text: It’s beautiful. I wasn’t sure if I would be happy with it given the price I paid which I felt was costly, but I’m happy enough with it. Bought it to record bird sightings in my backyard. I’m disabled & I am trying to find new ways to keep my mind off chronic pain which can consume a lot of brain cells.  Sadly, I took a disastrous fall shortly after buying it bc my neighbor blamed my bird feeders for injuring a local squirrel that likes to raid my bird feeders even though I left food for the squirrels too. The exact same food. I kid you not, but the evil little bigger decided to get on a light branch I was advised to place the feeder on by a bird conservancy place that “should keep the squirrels off of it”. Ha!  The squirrel was limping from a fall. I went out & stood on a 36” crate & took a nasty fall & I now have to have another back surgery. Proof that no good deed goes unpunished as the saying goes. Lol.  The fall lead to a concussion & repeated blackouts & exacerbated sciatica & massive swelling on my head, face, butt, elbows, hips, knees, etc. lol. Literally everywhere that hit the ground when I fell. So the irony is I have not even been able to use my beautiful bird journal to record any bird sightings since I bought it bc I am laid up awaiting back surgery. The last one left me disabled 15 years ago. Anyone reading this please keep me (Sherri) & my family in ur prayers bc if my past surgery is anything to go by i & we will need it.  So… now that you know my life story & I have saved $500 on therapy… buy the journal bc it’s simply lovely. Lol.

title: I love it!
text: It’s pretty. The color is gorgeous. It has nice paper. I can use my fountain pens in it even the cheapest 99 cent ones I buy on eBay. Lol. What’s not to love?  But it bc you will not regret it. And truth bomb: I bought this for my grandson - and kept it! Lol. Yeah- I’m that b*tch!,  but I gave him something better in his opinion as a kid. Win-win!

title: Best purchase ever!!!!
text: Where has this been since I became disabled & mostly bedridden?  I’ve been through so many subpar bed trays it’s ridiculous. This one is a gem!  I absolutely love it!  I am stunned that my art easel actually fits it & even better two of the plastic legs nicely fit into the book ledge groove to keep it nice & steady while I draw & paint.  I love the ski sled legs because it makes it so easy to move when I have to get up. One of the previous types I tried was so heavy I could barely lift it due to my disabilities, but this is sturdy & light.  The only thing I might do is add 2 pieces of small rubber to the ski sled legs at the ends by my body for added stability so that it doesn’t move when I don’t want it to because I suffer with vertigo & sleep apnea & I don’t want it to move if I fall over. Lol. So I would still be able to just lightly lift the legs w the rubber attached & still be able to push it forward easily enough. The only other thing I miss & need is a cup holder as I am on medications & need to stay hydrated & do lots of arts & crafts where I need to have water handy. I understand they probably didn’t add it bc most ppl buy it to use as a laptop table & electronics & fluids are never a hood idea, but I wish I had the option to choose for myself. I’ve thought about drilling a hole in the top & adding a cup holder or more likely just adding one to the side. As I will likely add some cup holders for my pens, pencils, & brushes, & craft supplies. I also wish that they offered an even larger size.  For those of us who are stuck in our beds & literally live in them there are very few options that are not homemade.  I would love one to go the full length of my queen bed & have designed several of them. Lol. As I live alone with 2 service dogs there’s nobody to complain about me dropping beads in the bed or spiking paint on the sheets. Lol.  To the manufacturers: bravo on a well-designed product & please for the love of God & this disabled woman please make a larger option!!!!  Mine never leaves my bed. I just push it to the end of the bed & go to sleep & wake up the next morning & pull it back towards me & resume my crafting or bills or whatever I was doing the night before. Lol.  Oh- and sometime- yeah SOMETIMES- I even use it as a food tray. Imagine that!! Lol.

title: Hard as a rock!  Lumpy. Gross. Ugly!
text: I expected to love this journal Bc I love the color & I absolutely love glitter. However, what arrived is a hot mess. It’s hard as a rock on one entire side. There is no fluid & there is absolutely no consistency in this product. All of the glitter is bunched up & melted/solidified to one side of the journal. It’s vile. This was supposed to be a gift. Thank heaven I had it delivered to me for wrapping Bc I would have been absolutely mortified for the recipient to have received this & equated it’s total lack of quality with my feelings for the recipient.  I do not even understand how a product in this condition is being shipped by the manufacturer or Amazon. Shame on both of them. It’s been a complete waste of my time & my $ (spent looking for the item, waiting for the item, paying for the item & now having to return the item)!  Unreal this is offered for sale in this condition. Not cool ppl.

title: I love this pen!
text: It writes beautifully!  Now I need it in more colors. I love the stub nib.

title: Obviously dropped while packing!
text: Aside from the fact that this was obviously dropped while being packed bc it has dirt on it & is so damaged I cannot believe it was even shipped I still cannot believe how lacking in quality these are.  I ordered two & while the second is in a little better shape I already know this will be a return for me. As a disabled person I tend to take falls & maybe the bad packaging person that dropped the book did me a favor by pointing out its obvious flaws.  The main reason I purchased these books to begin with was because the company donates a book for every book you buy and I always try to support companies that give back in this manner & to this degree, but for my personal needs these just won’t work. They just are not sturdy enough.  If they had arrived I damaged & I could have used them for a while & found that out for myself I probably would have given them a higher rating, but I think 3 stars is fair as they are usable for most oriole & priced okay currently. They are actually cheaper today than when I purchased them days ago.  Amazon always seems to lower prices after I purchase stuff. Lol. So much for Irish luck. Lol.  These will do for grocery lists or general to do lists, but you won’t want to trust your poetry or fine writing to these imo. The paper is very thin & see through & some of my pages are glued together weirdly. Idk why & it’s driving me crazy. Definitely a return.

title: Perfect!  Great size, refillable, & affordable! Trifecta!
text: Not the best pics, but I bought these to give to my kids & grandkids along with these pens I’m making for them with resin. I used temporary tattoos & then I sprayed a clear urethane over them so they the gold tattoos don’t run off & I make sure to place the tattoos above & below the rubber band thingy.  For less than $4 a kid my kids have a great planner that’s refillable & I can personalize each with animals they  like & I have since added their names using the creep $1 alphabet stickers you can buy most places.  I also do this with the black sketch books as you can see in one of the pics bc they can use them to sketch or for kites or to journal depending on the sketch book you buy. These are $3 black Daler Rowney drawing sketch books with Amazon bought temporary tattoos.  I sent my kids pics of the tattoos & let them pic their designs. The alphabet beads were also purchased on Amazon & I threaded them into the ink refills bc they kept trying to float up from the resin. I actually had to glue them to the refill bc the air spaces still made them want to float, but it was so much fun. It was my first foray into resin which didn’t go great die to some bad resin at first, but finally got some good stuff & had some fun.  I know I got off topic, but you can’t go wrong with these little journals imo.

title: Missing the lead in the pencil! Smells bad.
text: The pencils arrived with many broken tips which I sharpened, but one pencil does not even have a lead in it.  I kept sharpening it thinking maybe the lead broke off during manufacturing, but as you can see there’s no lead in there at all. It’s just an empty wooden shell!  If you have allergies or problems with strong smells prepare for an instant migraine which is what I had within 5 minutes of opening these pencils. It’s sad because they do seem to color okay, but between receiving a defective batch of pencils & the strong  & terrible odor I can’t endorse these for people with any types of allergies like mine. Amazon is supposed to send a replacement, but if they smell as bad as these do I’ll have to return them due to my allergies.  And seriously I’m an order with 3 items that arrived today 2 out of 3 arrived defective. This appears to be a manufacturing issue & the coloring book I ordered does as well unless the coloring book was damaged during packaging which was possible & utterly annoying too.  Idk what’s going on with the quality control ppl. I received resin molds last week that were also obviously damaged in the manufacturing process & still mailed out with globs of silicone left on the molds damaging them & making them unusable.  The quality control has gone way downhill at Amazon imo.

title: The Cadillac Case
text:
I was really excited to receive my new clipboard to replace my previous one which had started falling apart! My first thought on opening the box was "wow, this is huge". It's longer than my previous clipboard, so I wasn't sure how I would like toting it around at work (I'm an RN). However, the difference has been like trading up from a rickshaw to a Caddy. Not that there is anything wrong with a rickshaw!

My new clipboard fits everything but the kitchen sink (see attached pic). I wear my stethoscope, but can store it in the clipboard when I leave work, so I don't forget it at home and then have to wear one of those plastic yellow isolation-cart throwaway ones that don't work for poop. My pockets are usually BUSTING at the seams with all the stuff I like to carry around. No longer! I can cram it all inside this beast! I don't know how well it will hold up to my dropping it repeatedly, so I will post an update in a while with the durability factor.

P.S. I am one of those endlessly-researching people who look up reviews online for 7,456 items before deciding on one. You're welcome. I've done all the legwork for you. :-)

**Update, December 2016: This case is still perfect! No cracks, the top clip is still tightly secured, still feels really sturdy. :)

**Update, after dropping the case a few times over the years, a piece of the plastic broke. I'm buying a new one now. It lasted a really long time given the price!

title: Looks good, but not a high-quality purchase.
text: Hubs rates this as a solid 4. He assembled it himself, but most people would probably need a second person. You must be very careful with the doors when installing them because the wood strips easily, and even then they will probably be slightly misaligned. It's basically just fiberboard, so I don't know how long it will hold up. It works perfectly in the space for which we intended with plenty of storage inside. We purchased it because we lack a coat closet on the main level of our house. It's true what they say - you get what you pay for - so don't expect this to be a real quality, long term piece of furniture.

title: Sturdy key and mail rack
text: Other than a slight design flaw that really warranted an exchange (the bottom mail "shelf" is welded to the frame at a little bit of an angle, causing the key hooks to also have a slight angle as well), this rack works great. I didn't feel like going through the effort of exchanging it, so I kept the one I received. It fits a lot of stuff without being too bulky on the wall (hubby said nothing wooden - that looks too "granny"!) Note that it does not come with metal plaster anchors, just screws, so you may need to make a trip to your local hardware store for some additional supplies if you have plaster or drywall. Overall, pleased with the product compared to others available for purchase.

title: Top notch currency holder
text: I ordered these and they were delivered the next day. I wanted something I could use to display Honduran lempira bills as a gift to our friends who donated money to our mission trip to Honduras. These are great quality, heavy duty sleeves! I was really pleased with them and very glad I chose these over the many other options. The fit for the lempira bills is just perfect (6.5x3) and they were easy to load into the sleeves.

title: BEST Pastel Pencil Sharpeners out there.
text: I use these for pastel pencils since they seem to be the only ones that actually sharpen and don't eat pencils down to half if you put into an electric sharpener. They go dull pretty quickly so its important to have extras on hand. I've tried about twelve different sharpeners including an electric one, which creates a very fine point for colored pencils but eats a third to even half the pencil. With these sharpeners, you're able to conserve some of your precious material so that it goes on paper and not the garbage. Win win!

title: A Colored Pencil, Charcoal Pencil and Graphite Pencil Artist's Best Friend.
text:
The point, oh the point. The point this bad boy gives your pencils turns them into literal spears...the lead point is so long! And the point gets SUPER sharp so you can get some of the FINEST DETAIL into your work. A fine point is actually the 'secret' of many artists today....the finer you can get the point, the more precise every square inch of your work will be. You want your tools working to the best of their advantage and this sharpener will make all your favorite tools do just that. It uses a USB to charge, which is convenient since I always have my computer nearby and can charge it up when I take food breaks.

NOTE: THIS WILL EAT CONTE PASTEL PENCILS AS THEY ARE TOO SOFT. The photos attached show Primo Charcoal Pencils and the difference of a regularly sharpened Berol Prismacolor pencil and one using this sharpener.

title: Great sharpener. Great customer service.

I had an issue about a year after I bought it and contacted customer service and they sent me a replacement. Amazing customer service! I would buy it again and do recommend this sharpener.

Doesn't appear very strong so treat it gently. Might be a little overpriced for what you are getting.

title: Great large size package of holiday money cards!
text: This is a great value pack of gift money cards, great for me for sending to my children and grandchildren during the holidays. Colorful and sturdy, there are of 60 of them and they should last me for several years of gift giving. I love the variety as well so I can send different cards to multiple members in the same household. Highly recommend!

title: Nice poster stand for multiple purposes
text: Relatively inexpensive poster stand. I used this most recently for a party I was hosting (Oktoberfest) where I had several colorful posters, directions and game signs that I need to display. This is a nice size and easily held even the largest size of my posters (over 36"). I don't know if I would use this for heavy items (stability) but for posters and other items (canvas paintings) this works just great. Easy to set up and store.

title: Great portfolio/organizer!!!
text: My son is a teacher in Virginia and I saw this as a great aid to him. He has a MAC Pro and loves that he can carry everything with him in this organizer. He is easily able to carry this, instead of a backpack, when he is looking for a portfolio that he can carry with papers, pens, pencils and his computer. I examined the case, it is extremely well made, sturdy zipper and should last for years. It's great also that it's waterproof which is great for the weather they have been having in the northeast this summer. I highly recommend this for the student (or teacher) or business person in your life as an easy way to carry all your necessities.

title: Great highlighters, best ones for school and office use!
text: These are the best highlighters on the market today. Lightweight and fit great in your hand with an easily controllable tip which makes highlighting a breeze. Full coverage yet totally transparent, BIC highlighters are the ones to use when you want professional results. I use these all the time in the office and my so uses them for when he teaches. Great pens, none better out there!

title: Great multi-function compact printer for any home!
text: This is a great little printer. Took up half the space of my older Epson. It is sleek, attractive, and prints flawlessly. I am not technically challenged, but I was able to fairly easily set this up. I say fairly as the installation of the ink packets was not clear with the picture instructions, so I looked on Youtube for a video to show me (it's amazing how often I do find this stuff). After set up, the printer was ready to go and print quality was amazing. I love the way this printer looks, too, as it is sleek, clean, modern and a great size for my home office. I even signed up for the automatic ink replacement so we will see how that goes. Highly recommend as it comes in a variety of colors to match any home.

title: Wonderful pencils for the Disney Princess in your life!
text: These are great mechanical pencils. They are colorful and uniquely shaped to provide a great grip in your little ones fingers. Each pencil has it's own eraser and there are two spares to replace them with. The lead in the pencil is a little thicker than other mechanicals which will allow less breakage with the harder use of children. Comes with a small pack of lead refills (you can buy more later). I think this set would make a wonderful stocking stuffer over the holidays as it is attractive and functional. This would also almost be a must have for the young student in your life who is getting ready for the first day of school.

title: Best pens on the market today.
text: I absolutely love the G2 and buy it exclusively for use in the office. My son is a school teacher (middle school science) and also uses these exclusively. They seem to last forever, write smooth and clear and are dynamically designed for the ultimate style and comfort. They fit well in my hand and have to be the best pens in the market today. May seem a little extravagant to pay over a dollar a pen for these, but trust me they are well worth it. You will never go back to using another pen.

title: This is a good shredder for minimal shredding functions
text: This is a good shredder for minimal shredding functions. I actually tried doing 10-12 sheets of copy paper at a time and this shredder has difficulty completing the shred. I found twice it jammed and does tend to overheat. I would spend a few dollars more and upgrade to the Swingline ProStyle+ Super Cross-cut 14 sheet Junk Mail Shredder (see my review for that machine). If you have occasional small shredding needs, then this could be a good item for you. If you need a machine that can handle more paper/magazines and for longer periods of time, then please upgrade you will be much more satisfied.

title: Has to be one of the best shredders on the market
text: Let me mention that this shredder replaced an Aurora I had a bought a few years ago. I can honestly say that this has got to be one of the best shredders on the market. It does not overheat or jam (given it's used as recommended) and can easily handle credit cards and thicker cardboard stock. It is quiet and looks quite attractive in my office with the glass window (which easily allows you to see when it is getting full. It is easy to empty and does not spill all over the floor when the top is removed (with paper stuck in the top like my old one. This unit may cost a little more than others, but you really get what you pay for when it comes to shredders. This is a must have for any home office.

title: Great basic printer for all needs
text: No complaints with the Pixma MX452 since I have been using it (almost a month now). Prints well, copies are crisp, speed is adequate. None of the bells and whistles of the higher priced Pixma models, but it does the job intended and at a very reasonable price. As an fyi, I have used Canon Pixmas almost exclusively for my printing needs of the past few years and I really find them easy to use. This one, in particular, was very easy to set up wirelessly (had some problems doing that with others). So, if you are not really tech savvy and are looking for a good solid printer (think home or dorm use) this is a great printer to have.

title: Great Keyboard tray, difficult (for me) installation
text: First let me start with the positives. This is a quality tray, well made, with great ergonomic features. Only down fall for me (which is why I rated it 4 instead of 5 stars), is that I found the installation instructions unclear and I literally spent hours trying to install it. To be honest, I am not a 'handyman' (or handy-woman) so perhaps someone who is more used to building these kinds of projects would not encounter the problems I had. Please read the other reviews if you are more adept at doing these types of installs, but if you are a novice, please be sure that you have the time (and energy) to do this the right way.

title: Great Keyboard Wrist Rest!
text: The 3M Gel Wrist Rest is ergonomically designed and is extremely comfortable to rest your wrists on while using your existing keyboard. I can't vouch for the antimicrobial claims, but overall I am very satisfied with this rest. I use it in conjunction with my Logitech wireless keyboard daily at work and it works very well. If you need a rest (due to symptoms of carpal tunnel) you should purchase this to assist in keeping your wrists elevated and cushioned.

title: Cute idea, but not practical
text: Ok, so just so everyone knows I got this as part of the Vine program (and I got it after Christmas so I couldn't mail them). However, I often gift gift cards as presents, so I opened up the pack to see what I would get. First, the card is colorful and attractive. However, it's not pratical. It is small (4x6) and although it does hold a gift card, it could't hold much else (like if you wanted to include a note of some kind, or throw in a few dollars as a gift).The envelope is thin and fairly transparent and I think if anyone saw it in the mail box, they would know what it contained. I personally prefer to use a standard card or one of the standard cards they sell which have holders in them. This package, containing two cards and envelopes, is expensive for what you get (and you aren't getting much).

title: What else can I say?
text: I am an old school 50 something year old woman. Although my sons still are using scientific calculators, I found that the old-fashioned basic calculator works for me. This Amazonasics calculator is solar powered. The display numbers are large and clear and the keys are huge (well, when compared with my sons' calculators). I highly recommend this calculator for anyone who, like me, has no need for any fancy calculator (with loads of functions) but instead just wants a basic, large key , easy to use battery-free calculator.

title: Minimally effective - does the job but has drawbacks
text: Got this in Vine and gave this to my son in Virginia as he is an 8th grade science teacher and told me he could use it for his work. First project was to laminate some cards with the elements chart. He told me that the plus was the ease of use and the portability of the device (it was easy for him to carry in his school backpack that he uses daily). On the down side, he told me the sizes he was able to use were not optimal, as his charts were intended to be larger and this product would not support them (so he had to readjust his copies to be smaller so he could laminate them). He also brought up the noise of the unit (which I see was mentioned here in another review). He couldn't understand why the unit was so noisy as the general unit that the school provides for free is far quieter and little to no vibration. Overall, this is a relatively inexpensive device if you really need a portable laminator. However, for larger needs or if you operate in an office where noise may be an issue, this is not for you. Like I said, as a teacher, the school already has these devices for the use of the teachers, so I am not sure there would be a need for this otherwise.

title: Great value sized package - Great tape
text: Not much to say here. Scotch always has made, imho, the best tape products out there. I used a solid roll of this in the past two weeks when boxing up some stuff in the garage. I found the one roll to go very far (800 inches per roll) and I was easily able to tape up 6-7 large boxes. The way these rolls are set up, there is a protective hook which prevents the tape from sticking to itself and, if used correctly, will result in a relatively smooth packing experience. You can easily place the tape on the end of the box and using the tape frame drag the tape all around the box using only one hand. This 6 pack is economical as well and will help with any moving/packing experience you may need. I highly recommend.

title: Neat little product - not sure if it's worth the price
text: First, let me state I am a Vine reviewer and received this pop-up tape as part of the program. I have used it for almost a month now exclusively for when I am wrapping things. Positives: Cool way to dispose of tape.It grips the table, so you never can lose it amidst all the wrapping paper. Tape can never stick to itself based on the design (and I have in the past thrown away a lot of tape when it did). Pieces are a great size for wrapping presents Negatives:Only 74 pieces in the pack (so it's an expensive alternative to a regular roll of tape). If you are wrapping something where you want larger pieces of tape to hold things in place you are out of luck (these pieces are premeasured). All in all, if you are looking for an extra way to dispense tape, this may do the trick for you. Especially for senior citizens where they may have trouble with standard tape dispensers.

title: Great markers for the money - Long lasting
text: Love these BIC markers and highly recommend for the variety of colors and ease of use. I found the tip on these perfect for writing (not too thick or thin) and unlike other reviewers, I have been using them consistently in my job for over a month now and have not find any problems with the life of the markers (they are still working fine). I think you would be hardpressed to find a better set of markers anywhere. If you are looking for a great variety of shades and colors, the 36 BIC set does the trick. I am buying another set for my son who teaches school in Virginia (feel he could make good use of this set as well in his day to day job). Highly recommend!

title: Didn't realize this required a subscription
text: Ok, so the Avery Stamps.com Postal Center does do what it needs to do. I used it (under the Vine Program) for a few weeks, but had to cancel prior to them zinging my credit card. I guess if I had a small sizable business or something (beyond some of my E-Bay sales), it might have been worth it to me. But, I don't so it's not worth giving my credit card on a monthly basis for something which I would only use occasionally.

title: Only 6 months of Space
text:
Overall, it’s a great quality. After receiving it, it sort of makes sense why its only 6 months since every day has two pages and the size.

This agenda is laid out in sections.

First Section: Address Book
Second Section: 6 full month calendars
Third Section: 26 week recaps
Fourth Section: 6 months of individual day pages
Fifth Section: Notes

I expected and would have preferred for it to be month, 7 days, week recap, 7 days, week recap, etc. and then go on to the next month. This may have been in the description but it caught me by surprised.

Overall, I’m going to keep and use it the agenda. It was a great price, seems sturdy, and it’s professional enough for me to use at work. I’m overall happy with my purchase, but the oddity of the layout and it only being 6 months when I was anticipating (and originally searched for) was a year long agenda is the reason for 3 stars. Who knows? I may end up liking this format better and buy another one in 6 months. :)
