text: I love this card... funny, cute and good card stock.

title: No bleed pens
text: Ok... NOT a fan of the moustache on the pens... but whatever.  They do work as a pen and do not bleed.  Not sure why they list them as "bible pens"... they are super lightweight - I wish they were more weighty.  They'll work but probably won't buy them again.

title: hallmark shoebox bday card
text: Funny card, good card stock.  Looks good.

title: plastic clipboard with storage
text: Super janky... but works - at least for a short time.  This is SUPER light duty.  If you need something you're going to use daily - invest in a much better quality.  The plastic is thin and lightweight - super cheap construction - sharp edges.  It is black.  The clip is currently strong and working - but again - SUPER light duty. The storage area would hold another pad of paper, a pen and a regular smart phone.  I never hesitate to update my reviews should new info seem useful. Further, I never accept free products - my reviews are 100% honest and reflect my own personal experience.

title: paper flower bouquet
text: I purchased this for my mom who is at a distance with the Covid rules... It is a beautiful display and folds flat so she is going to keep it.  Win/Win!  Bright and colorful.  I even survived the mail system.

title: funny bday card
text: Super funny - good card stock - good size for a card.

title: hallmark bday card
text: Nice card stock.. looks like a good quality card.  Gift cards are just crazy expensive - so I want something that looks like it was more than $1.  This one works.

title: hallmork shoebox funny blank cards
text: There 4 versions - you get 3 of each version - so 12 cards.  They are blank.  They are nice looking and probably a better deal than buying cards individually.

title: orchid popup card
text: These are quite lovely and popup perfectly when opened.  I will say that I prefer to "hand" these to recipient rather than mailing.  They are thick and I think call attention to someone who might what to take it.. but just my thoughts.  You could put it inside of another holder to more safely mail and hopefully save from bending too.  Bending would destroy the card.  Quite lovely.  Spendy - yes, but all cards are these days.  These popup cards seem to hang around a few days longer maybe...

title: effortless stapler
text: My husband needed a stapler that would be easy to press through multi layers of papers.  This works as he'd hoped.

title: post it pop up notes for dispenser
text: I have an older popup note dispenser and seems harder and harder to find these to refill - but they are very convenient so I keep looking.  These work perfectly in what I would guess is any post it dispenser.

title: Avery address labels
text: My 83 year old Mom requested these.  She likes to print her own labels.  I do recommend you look at measurements, draw on a piece of paper the dimensions so you can see the size. These are in my opinion the perfect return label size, but everyone likes something different.  She has an apple inkjet printer and she reports they work.  Having said all of that, I never hesitate to update my reviews should new info seem useful.

title: Avery address labels
text: Purchased these at the request of my Mom.  She likes to print her own labels.  These work perfectly with her apple printer. Having said all of that, I never hesitate to update my reviews should new info seem useful.

title: pop up dragonfly card
text: Beautiful colors .. card stock very thick.  The dragonfly is beautiful as well.  The wings are laser cut out, so they are lacy.  There is a pull blank card to write on if you like..  High quality - but it is expensive.  This one might sit on a table for a few days as with regular cards at half the price - they are read and tossed.  So, maybe it's worth it?

title: reinforced college rule paper
text: I had purchased hole reinforcers before I remembered that you can purchased reinforced paper!  The reinforced paper is so much easier than the hole stickers - which make it harder to turn the pages in the notebooks.  The reinforced paper is so easy to use and turns easily in the notebook.  If you need reinforced pages, this is the way to go!

title: white hole reinforcers
text: I purchased a cheaper version that were flat on sheets - they were a NIGHTMARE to remove - so I came back purchased these - which I should have purchased first!  They are super easy to remove because of the dispenser and that helps with frustration.  I won't go back.  These are white- but I also purchased the clear just in case.

title: hole reinforcers
text: I purchased a cheaper version that were flat on sheets - they were a NIGHTMARE to remove - so I came back purchased these - which I should have purchased first!  They are super easy to remove because of the dispenser and that helps with frustration.  I won't go back.  These are clear - but I also purchased the white just in case.

title: tension paper clips
text: These are the perfect size for most small/medium jobs - I just ran out so these will probably last me another 5 years.  They are tight and will hold up to about 1/2" of paper pretty securely.  They are black with silver colored metal pinches.  Comes in a nice twist top circular tub.  You get 24 clips.

title: plastic 3 ring holders with fasteners
text: I wanted something a little stiffer and longer lasting than paper and these fit the bill.  They are smooth, but just a little texture.  There are 3 hole/fasteners.  3 folders, multi color.

title: additional handset for phone set AT&T CL80107
text: Purchased this handset for a phone system I just bought.  It linked up easily, once read ALL the directions to do so.  It works well, so far.  I never hesitate to update my reviews should new info seem useful.

title: AT&T CL84107 phone set
text:
UPDATE BELOW...I purchased this set because my local phone service offers me TEN (that's one zero) "blocks" on unwanted calls. That fills up in about 2 days - so, I have to delete my 'log' and start over. OMG. I looked into purchasing a plug in blocker box but this was actually less expensive - so I dived in. It was easy to hook up, but... it is a rather complicated and not very intuitive install on pretty much all the settings. It's a LOT of reading.. a lot of doing. But I have it set up. We shall see how it goes. I have high hopes. I did purchase one additional handset because we needed 2, but not 3 and it was still cheaper than purchasing the plug in boxes (that didn't have super great recent reviews). I believe you can purchase up to 12 (?) additional receivers if you need them with this unit - but I am not certain. The base unit is a corded phone - and the screen is large and easy to read. You can sit on a desk, or hang on a wall. The two cordless units have fairly large screens too - pretty easy to use with nice large numbers - however, they do NOT like to stay in their charging units - a slight nudge and the fall over. Eh. I am really just hoping for less spam calls. We rarely use the landline -but where we live it is necessary to get the DSL we need - so any calls coming to the landline are 99.9% spam. Says you can block up to 1000 numbers. That seems like a miracle after just 10. Fingers crossed. Having said all of this, I never hesitate to update my reviews should new info seem useful.
UPDATE: 4/6/2021... So after a few weeks...I have to say that all of sudden - it' s the sweet sound of silence. I have literally not had a single call of any kind, let alone SPAM (which is actually the only calls I get on my landline) I did activate the option to have callers "announced" (caller must say their name and be announced before call goes through) - maybe that's it.. but whatever it is - I am very much appreciating the huge reduction of spam calls. I haven't had to push the "call block" button once. In all honesty, we keep the landline only because it's the only way we can get the DSL we do - as crappy as it is. In a very small rural area, we sadly have little choice. So a system like this - stopping the long lists of SPAM calls is real relief. I do wish the system was a bit easier to use - it's a bit complicated - thus I still stand on the 4 star review. If you have reasonable ability to read a bit of lengthy and boring instructions, you can get through it. And if you're overwhelmed with SPAM calls, I would definitely recommend it. I will continue to update if new info would be helpful.

title: Plastic divider tabs
text: I have not ever purchased this type of divider before, where you can wipe off using a ball point pen or pencil.  I didn't want to wipe them, so I used a felt pen.  But according to them you can "wipe off" ball point pen or pencil.  I wanted the stiffer, sturdier divider, provided by the plastic as opposed to paper.  Works just like I hoped.

title: durable 3 ring binder
text: Durable 3 ring binder.  Neon(ish) green.  Rings work great - pull them open or use the end flippers.  I put 200 college ruled sheets inside and there was plenty of space to give.

title: bright 3 ring binder
text: I needed a small 3 ring binder with a bright outside - and this is the perfect answer.  Easy to spot/find where ever it's laying about.  I recommend you use the flippers on the end to open the three rings and not the rings themselves. The rings sort of resist opening themselves - but using the flipper edges works easier.

title: loose leaf, college ruled paper
text: I needed just a small amount and this works.  Three hole punch, white, college ruled paper.  200 sheets - since I only needed about 50 - it seems like a lot, but I guess I have extra!

title: paper hole reinforcements
text: I was disappointed that these reinforcements still had the center dot on the page.  Eh.  Just one more challenge when trying to remove JUST The hole and apply.  It takes a little extra effort, but they work.  I do remove the holes after I am done using how many ever I need - because otherwise they come off the slick page and stick on everything!  Also you get a bunch of loose pages - so get a big tension clip or an envelope to keep them in.  I wish I would have purchased the ones you pull out of the box... for a few extra cents and no center dot.  I don't have to use them very often so I am keeping these with a note to myself for the future.

title: Heavy duty book ends
text: These are old school - heavy duty, sturdy and capable book ends.  The work exactly as you would hope if you have books (I used with my warranty files (getting to be quite a collection), my cookbooks (I LOVE to collect them) and they are heavy because I purchase the ones with lots of colors, and finally a group of 3 ring binders.  In every case they are working perfectly.  Not super pretty - but  - super functional.  Well worth the cost.

title: Amazon 4x6 index cards
text: Paper is really thin and they are ruled only on one side.  Eh.  I'll use them but I have to say I am a little disappointed.

title: scotch tape roll refills
text: I am one of 10 people who still have a tape dispenser.  Yup.  And I use it. I prefer the Scotch brand magic tape.  Works well.  Doesn't stick to itself but works like tape should.  It tears easily but not when you don't want it to.  It's matte - not shiny like old school cellophane tape.  The batch is probably a life time supply - for me anyway.  It's the 3/4" width - which is the width I tend to like the most. Too bad I don't know you - I'd save you a few bucks and share.

title: page protectors
text: These are thin... and have three ring binder holes.  They work as they should.  They are super thin. So if you're looking for a heavy duty protectors, these are not those.  You get 200 of them.  They are clear on the page area.

title: index cards
text: Oops.  I didn't notice these were blank.  NO RULED LINES.  But in all honesty, they will still work.  I would have preferred the lined cards,  but my fault for not more carefully reading the listing. They are fairly thin... and sort of fuzzy (?? don't know how else to describe) texture to them.  They are not thick - I am using in my recipe card box.  So I may end up having to purchase some thicker, smoother ones..  But for now it'll work.  I sometimes cut recipes out or print off the computer and then glue or tape them to the index cards.  Some thicker, sturdier cards would be more ideal.

title: Extra large Sharpie Pens
text: I needed a selection of extra large Sharpie pens and this set (you get 4 - 2 black, 1 blue, 1 red) was just what I needed to print on a plastic sign.  Worked perfectly.

title: post it tab holders
text: I need these every once in awhile to save my place in reading reports and/or contracts.  I can reuse them a few times before they finally don't stick.. and I love them.

title: three shelf roller cart
text: This does come in a flat box, so you'll have to put it together.  But, if I can do it, most anyone can.  You WILL need a rubber mallet and a phillps head screwdriver (I have a ratcheting one - that helps) - or a power drill - I don't have one of those.  It took me about 20- 30 minutes to put together by myself.  The instructions were very easy.  I love this cart.  I use it to roll around all my portable kitchen appliances.  Works exactly as I had hoped.  It is a black plastic material.  Will hold up to 400lbs.  Rolls easily - 2 of the 4 wheels have locks.  The wheels are a gray plastic.  I chose the cart that didin't a lip edge - so it is easy to slide the appliances on and off.  I cover the cart (loaded with my appliances) with table cloth as a dust cover.  I am very happy with my purchase.  Having said that, I never hesitate to update my reviews should new info seem useful.

title: magnetic reading glasses holders
text: I have to say that a dozen years ago or so I first tried this 'style' of reader holders - they were very less than satisfactory for a number of reasons but mostly because the magnets were never strong enough properly placed.  There are several different types of these - I have 'pretty' ones and these - which are very, how shall we say, very utilitarian - nothing fancy.  Brushed silver metal.  No sparkle or cute shape. This order contains 6 pieces, 3 in each bag. You can buy individually as well.  The new, updated style is a lot better designed and offers much, much stronger magnets.  I have worn these on a lot of different material tops, thick, thin, smooth, silky, thermal, sweatshirts.. and all with secure success.  I have tried the leash type of reader holders but I hate the string around my neck - plus your glasses dangle over what your working on - or become like a bib when eating.  I am a woman so placing the magnet holder in the right spot is a consideration but I have found the perfect spot for me.  If you haven't tried this version, I encourage you to try them.  This particular style has TWO strong magnets, one on each end.  They do offer this version with sparkly dots and in gold tones if you prefer.  I wanted just a simple, plain version (I already have some cutesy versions) and these are definitely plain and simple - great for every day use.  I have found the magnets are so strong you use them on scarves and other neck treatments if you'd like.  I have even used on a thin wool ruana - worked perfectly to hold the ruana in place all day.  I never hesitate to update my reviews should new info seem useful and this is no exception.  I waited before reviewing these because I wanted to be certain I had tried in various ways.  Overall, 5 stars.  I can't think of a thing negative to say.

title: Book ends
text: These are old fashioned, but boy do they work.  The slide right under those heavy books and stay put.  Just like I remember.  I am using one on my cookbook collection and the other on the warranty/instruction booklets for all the stuff we have.  Each have a cabinet board on one side so I only needed two.  Best money I have spent in quite a long time.  Couldn't be happier.  They are black painted metal.  There is a soft, non-skid bottoms that covers the entire bottom, not just the pokey part.  Very secure support for heavy books.

title: Sharpie gel pens
text:
UPDATE BELOW....I chose the white barrel of these Sharpie gel pens. I was a bit disappointed in how cheap the white plastic barrels look. But, having said that, they are comfortable to hold and write with. They write smoothly - without skips and I haven't had any smearing. I do like these. I decided to go with the white over the usual black - makes them easy to spot for sure. It is a click use and there is a nice grip for your fingers that helps the pen stay in place - it is a slightly gray color with silver click top and a band just above the finger grip (that is NOT cushy or soft). Just wish they didn't look so... plastic!
UPDATE 1/26/2021... Just a quick update... the pens bleed through paper. Sharpie used to make a paper writer (NOT gel) that worked so well and didn't bleed. It was a click pen. I wish they'd make it again. I have precious few of those left that still function. I had to take another star off for the bleed through. Very disappointing.

title: spare magnets
text: I purchased these as a backup insurance policy for the magnetic eye glass holders I have purchased.  I have to say though, the magnets are so strong, I'm going to have try really hard to lose any.  These are really a long shot backup, but what the heck.  If you do happen to lose one on your eye glass holders, they are useless - so it's good to have these just in case.  They are very strong disc magnets.  Perfect for those holders.

title: Flat top 2 shelf cart
text: This is a great cart.  Took my husband about 10 minutes to assemble, with his power tools.  It is blackish.  No lip on the shelves - one on top, one on bottom. No edges - so you can easily slide items on and off - BUT - stuff could just as easily roll off - just to be fair. That is not a concern for how we will use it - but it could be for marbles, or balls, or other round items. There are 4 wheels (2 locking) for easy movement.  I am going to use in our storage area for easy transport from the storage area to the house.  Works exactly as we'd hoped.  Having said that, we never hesitate to update our reviews should new info seem useful.

title: manila tie on tags
text: These are big and pre-strung - work just as I hoped and are just as pictured in the ad.  The tag itself is a medium thickness which for my use is perfect.

title: bubble wrap
text: I have some framed art that is being gifted.  They are glassed, so this small bubble/bubble wrap will be the perfect thing to protect the pieces.  The bubbles are small... delicate.  I wouldn't use them in heavy duty shipping... but in handing off a gift, it's perfect.  You get 2 rolls.

title: Scotch Tape
text: For whatever reason (probably virus supply issues) I could NOT get scotch tape for the holiday season gift wrap!  Thank you Amazon!  Every once in a while I try the off brand and I am always disappointed.  There is no other choice for me - Scotch tape is the top for me.  It works exactly as it should, tears easily - and where it should.  It sticks as it should and disappears into the wrap.  You will never be disappointed with the Scotch brand.

title: heavy duty packing tape
text: This tape is thicker than  basic packing tape.  Works as I hoped it would.  I use in a tape "gun."

title: ocean themed Christmas cards
text: These are nice... a wish they were a bit less shiny... but they are better than some others I had purchased.  The colors are nice.  We live at the coast, so I was drawn to the holiday/ocean theme.

title: ornament christmas cards
text: I purchased these because they reminded me a little of a watercolor christmas card that my great father had painted and sent one year...  these... while they are ok... are pretty cheap looking.  I don't think I will be using them.  They are not matte.  But not super shiny - but too shiny to look like quality paper.  I should have believed other reviews.  Sigh.  Live and learn.

title: large banker boxes
text: We had to pack our tiny (732 sq ft) home and ordered 40 of these.  Had more than enough.  They are medium strength... not super tough - but - tough enough.  We packed them into a moving cube. Note: This worked great because the boxes were all the same size and that made packing them into the cube really easy.  They were easy to put together.  Stay together fairly well.  And I plan to disassemble and save them when we empty them on the other side.  They come in 3 sizes... small (office file stuff), medium - and large (the size we ordered)  Plenty of room without getting too heavy IF you watch what you're loading.  They aren't meant to carry super heavy stuff anyway.

title: sharpie gel pens
text: Purchased for my husband.  I prefer the old Sharpie bleed proof click pens.. I am not a fan of "gel" pens.  But these are ok.  The do not bleed through paper.  But the old ones are still better - they had a tiny felt tip.  I still have a few.. hoarding them.

title: magnetic calendar and separate list
text: I purchased this for my 81 year old mom and her fridge.  The calendar is paper - so use regular pin.  The list is dry erase type and comes with a dry erase pen.  Both are magnetic so they fit on the fridge nicely.  You could use the calendar on the fridge or on a desk.  April 2020 thru December 2021.  I tore off april to September and gave it to her.  She loved it.  She has a smaller type fridge and it fit very nicely.

title: banker boxes
text: Medium Banker boxes - I purchased for my sister.  She reports they are good.  Not supposed to have to use tape or anything to build them.  Waiting to hear on that.  I never hesitate to update my reviews should new info seem useful.  You get 20.  And it seems like a lot.

title: three holed page protectors
text: For whatever reason, I could not find these locally.  These are perfect.  They are thin... but I just put the paper I want to protect in and then it goes into a 3 ring binder.  So these protectors don't have to be super strong.  I won't need any for a while, but I'd but these again, delivered right to my door - didn't have contact with anyone.  Bonus right now.

title: sticky convo bubbles
text: You get 2... conversation bubbles... but there are very few of each.  Purple and a neonish green colors.  Not really a good money deal.. but I'll use them.

title: 1" binder
text: Neonish green 1" binder.  3 ring.  Has 2 clear pockets - one in the front.. one in the back.  Rings open easily.  Works.

title: zippered pouches
text: These are zippered, a little see through.  And you get a LOT of size choices.  I only "needed" one, but I can easily see that I will be using these in a lot of different ways.  The plastic is what I would call "medium" duty - not super thin, but not super thick.  Just right to me.

title: 4 season note cards
text: I was looking for a seasonal looking card - good for multiple occasions... and these are small, but fit the bill.  Subtle.

title: dragonfly note cards
text: Very lovely.  Blank inside with envelope.  Nice for many different occasions.  Small size - but mail worthy if you chose to do so.

title: Papyrus blank cards
text: I love the quality of Papyrus cards.  They look and feel very rich, very high quality.  These are blank inside. Perfect for a number of occasions.  They also include a lovely gold seal for each card.  Look so much richer than the money you spend to buy them. The colors are bright and clear.  Lovely.

title: printer ink
text: So, my Mom's HP printer was on the list of acceptable for these cartridges.  The only problem is that Mom's printer also needs a "small" black cartridge to actually work too.  So, Mom's 7525 photosmart should really be removed from the "works with" list UNLESS they include the necessary smaller black cartridge too.  The cartridges sold WILL work, but only with the smaller cartridge.  Kinda misleading.  Giving them 3 stars because the cartridges appear to be working (we had an old small cartridge to put in to try it) - but that feels generous given the misleading list.

title: battery operated pencil sharpener
text: This is a great little sharpener.  Works with batteries - 2 AA (also included).  They provide you a replacement sharpener blade too.  It has a nice, small footprint... triangluar shape less than 3".  You can battery sharpen or manually sharpen with a the side slide switch at the base. Super easy to empty by turning the top sharpen hole and pulling up, then dump.  Replace lid and "lock."  It's plastic, black with silver accents - a clear holding tank.  The bottom has 3 nonskid dots.  Sharpening is controlled by the length of time you sharpen - no extreme pressure needed. Actually, it's one of the best sharpeners I've ever purchased - so far anyway.  I never hesitate to update my reviews should new info seem useful.

title: deck table
text: These are really awesome.  Sturdy plastic.  Slotted, so water runs through.  The tops are flat - so stuff stays on it.  They are larger than the weaker, flimsy old style.  I really love these.  Would buy again.  I chose the gray - it's a medium gray and lovely.  I never hesitate to update my reviews should new info seem useful

title: 2 minute sand timer
text: This a BIG easy to see 2 minute sand timer.  Blue sand in a clear timer.  Turn it over and over for 2 minutes.  I purchased it to help my grandsons time the proper tooth brushing.  Works like a charm.  Very easy to see and understand.  Only thing it doesn't do is "ding" when it's done.

title: seating cushion
text: I purchased for my mom who needed slightly more height to stand up from the sofa.  I noticed she was using a folded up blanket.  She now uses this cushion and likes it.  The bottom side has little raised rubber dots that helps to keep the cushion in place.  It is black and has a zippered cover so you could wash if you like.

title: fathers day card
text: In this day and age, I try to avoid going into stores so I have been ordering cards and things online - this hallmark card is awesome.  It was perfect - funny - bright colors - quality.  And delivered right to my door.  I will keep ordering this way as I believe it to be safer at this time.

title: HP premium paper
text: Husband likes thicker, more bright paper for his personal printer... and this is his choice.  One ream at a time.

title: rubber band ball
text: If you haven't had one of these... you're missing out.  Instead of a container or drawer full of loose rubber bands - you have an easy to use 'ball' of rubber bands.  It's brilliant.  I purchased one about 4 years ago.. just ran out - so this is a replacement.  Perfect.

title: garbage can rubberbands
text: I have a big garbage can - provided to us by the garbage company... I use liners (to minimize cleaning issues) and was HOPING these rubber bands would work, but they don't for our style of garbage can.  Why still a 5 star review? Because they are still great rubber bands!  I should have done a better job looking at the design of the garbage can I have.  Because of the flip lid, there is not enough "lip" for the rubber band to hook onto.  Now... The liner I have is so big that I POSSIBLY could slip the rubber band down below the hinge of the lid... but it's a bit too difficult.  So... I now have some really big, really tough rubber bands to use in another way.  I'm ok with that.  I would, however, recommend looking to see if you have a lip/ledge that will allow the rubber band to latch on before buying.  Oh, they are green - in case that matters to you.  I never hesitate to update my reviews should new info seem useful.

title: mini retractable blades
text: I purchased these to work on bubbles in some of my diamond painting projects...  they are very small.. about 3" ovals.  Definitely fit in a pocket or your small purse.  You slide the blade out and there is a stop that keeps the blade out or you can hold the slide in the out position.  You get 3 - I received a white, turquoise and coral pink blade.  They each have little holes on the opposite end of the blade if you wanted to string them.  They work perfectly for my very lightweight use - but the blades are not replaceable and not for any real heavy use in my opinion.  Lastly, Made in China if that matters to you.  I never hesitate to update my reviews should new info see useful.

title: small pocket calculator
text: I know... we all have the calculators on our smart phones... but I purchased these to use at our neighborhood yard sale event and not everyone has a smart phone or is comfortable using one.  So these work GREAT

title: scotch laminator pouches
text: Purchased to go with a compact laminator I recently got.  Scotch brand is always reliable - at least in my experience.  Easy to fill, no bubbling.  Of course, you need a good laminator too.

title: thermal pouches
text: Purchased to use with a compact laminator I purchased... these Scotch brand pouches work great - easy, no bubbling - which also says the compact laminator I purchased is a winner too.

title: thick poster board
text: Nice, thick white poster board.  Purchased to go with a sandwich board I use at the neighborhood yard sale event.  Works great.

title: yellow poster board
text: I was hoping for a bit thicker board... it's like thicker paper, less "board."  But... it's BRIGHT yellow.  You won't miss it.

title: sandwich board sign
text: Double sided, easy to slide in and out /poster board... is quite a bit heavier than I expected.  Purchased to use with our neighborhood yard sale - works great.

title: mini note pads
text: Purchased these for use in our neighborhood yard sale event... worked great to have in our apron pockets.

title: tie on tags
text: Purchased these for the neighborhood yard sale, work great!

title: hallmark card set
text: Frankly with the Hallmark brand I expected a nice quality... these are rather dollar store like.

title: card set
text: I purchased these to have on hand... the quality is nice - good card stock.

title: sympathy cards
text: I purchased these to keep on hand.  They are nice card stock and appropriate for the situation.

title: rubber bands
text: I purchased these to use with a rubberband gun I purchased, but they are bit too big... so I will use otherwise... the rubber bands themselves are strong and sort of round - instead of flat.

title: zippered bag
text: Purchased to use as yard sale cash holder... easy to use and can be used for other purpose now.  I use it store banking and various office supplies.

title: round stickers
text:
Purchased to use at neighborhood yard sale, they worked great and were easy to see, easy to write on - we used sharpies.
They stayed on nearly everything. Not for use on oily things.

title: tie tags
text: Purchased for use at neighborhood yard sale... worked great!

title: popup hallmark cards
text: If you're gonna spend this much on a card you want it to be special and these are perfect.  They popup, lay flat on the table to enjoy as long as the recipient chooses - or perhaps part of the table decor after opening.  I've paid as much for a card and gotten way less.

title: hallmark brand type cards
text: I purchased these to keep on hand... but honestly they aren't as nice as the hallmark brand you buy in the store.  The card stock is more like dollar store quality.  Eh.

title: hallmark popup card
text: These are particularly nice as they can serve as a lovely table decoration after opening.  Just a special touch for a special occasion.  Spendy, but most cards are these days.  I've purchased other cards for the same price that are ordinary!

title: compact thermal laminator
text:
I have to say I that didn't expect much, but this laminator works really, really well. Plug it in, takes about 3 minutes (instructions say 3-5 mins) a green light comes on to tell you it's ready and just feed the pouch of whatever you laminating through. Comes out BUBBLE free. No kidding. I am very happy with the compact size (it will take up to an 8 1/2 x 11 page) and the awesome ability of this laminator. If you're looking - the price is right and I believe you'll be really happy with it. It comes with a few pouches in various sizes... just a few. So if you need to laminate a few things, you'll be ok.. but you'll want to buy spare pouches in a separate purchase if you're gonna more than a few projects. I never hesitate to update my reviews should new info seem useful.
UPDATE: 1/20/2020... Sooo.. there was a card that came with the laminator that says they will send you a free gift of your choice - 100 pk lamination pouches or 36 pk of files. All you need to do is choose your gift and email them with your full address. I do so and then got a list of emails from China demanding a positive review and PROOF of it before any gift would be sent. I had already completed my review before beginning this exchange with the Chinese seller. I am going to forward their demands to Amazon as I believe it is a violation. So - here's what I say... this laminator is 5 star, the seller is 0 stars. Seek this laminator from a different seller.

text: purchased for use when the power goes out... giant number/buttons... NOT back lit... but super easy to see. I don't use that part... but this phone was designed for an older person I think.  :)  A considerable amount of control options... med, high or very high handset volume... ringer hi/lo or off... and a slide control of the speaker volume...  It has a redial button.  A speaker button.  And a flash button.  It has a red corner on the top left that indicates the ring - so when you have the ring off (and when it is on) that light flashes.  There is a dedicated 911 button that is red. The handset sets in the cradle fairly well at the top... the bottom a bit less... and the bottom is what matters. title: coin counter
text:
UPDATE BELOW....I ordered this just to keep track of the loose change in my bowl. It is a fully plastic item and lightweight... but if it were any heavier you wouldn't be able to lift it when full of coins. The plastic bottle, while lightweight, appears to be pretty sturdy. Time will tell. The pics I have included show around $45.00 in change so I estimate the jar will hold around $200+ in change if I keep around the same mix of coins shown....It will obviously depend on what coins you are dropping in. There are two "pinches" on the side of jar, but they are pretty useless unless the jar is empty. When it has change in the jar, it's too heavy for the side pinches to be useful. The opening of the jar is about 2 1/2" . And adult cannot put a hand inside the jar, so you will have to pour the contents out. The jar is about 10 or so inches tall... eye balling it. The top (counter part) requires 2 AAA batteries (not included) AND a tiny screwdriver to open the battery compartment. Upon opening and inserting batteries, I put in a counted number of coins.. $1.67 for a test. The lid immediately failed after 3 coins and just stopped adding or reading denominations at all. I read the directions and inserted a pen into the "reset" hole on the underside of the lid (to the top right area of the battery compartment). It reset and I tried again. It worked. And continued working through the rest of the coin drops. The screen read stays on a few minutes (haven't timed it yet) and then blacks out. It re-awakens when you drop another coin in. With each coin dropped the screen flashed the denomination of the coin 3x and then shows the total. Normally I just throw my coins into a big bowl. When it gets full I load up into a ziplock and take it to my bank. Back in the day they wanted the coin rolled... now, no bank will take rolled coins. Thus the ziplock bag. The counter will take some of the guess work out of the total.. IF it continues to work... but I am ok with a "close" total. It's amazing how fast it adds up. I am disappointed it failed right out of the gate. PLUS. I HATE it when you have to use a tiny screwdriver to get into the battery compartment!! I never hesitate to update my reviews should new info seem useful.
UPDATE 2/14/2017.... the seller contacted me immediately and offered a replacement top, stating that the top should not have failed even with a restart. Currently the original top is still working. I will keep the second as a back up. It is rare to come in contact with such a responsible seller. I added one star to the rating for this response and hope the jar will keep working. It's not a high quality electronic instrument - I understand that - but I do really appreciate the effort by the seller.

title: Okay product, but quality issue with laptop shelf
text:
This one seems to be one of the more polished product among many offerings from Amazon - it (spec) holds significant more weight than others - I believe most are inflated, so I usually halve it and still meet my needs. Assembly wise, it is relatively straightforward. However, the last step on Storage Shelf gave me the most trouble - the four holes to hold it in place ARE misaligned - a manufacture defect for sure. In the end, I spent more time on this than the rest of the steps - to make it just barely hold together, at the expense of gaps etc. I am too tired to return it ...

The way the TV bracket hook on the stand can be more secure - there should be some stoppage mechanism on both ends to prevent it from moving left and right - but this is the norm.

The way it secures the mounting bracket to the stand is press screwing onto a plastic/rubber pad, it seems a crude way of securing, but only time will tell.

title: a little bit disappointed
text:
The biggest frustration with this board is the mounting - you just can't make the board stay flush to the wall. There is a gap in between the wall, enough so wobbling when you write on the lower half of the board. However, to secure it, you need to drill into the frame and possibly touch the porcelain. The instruction is not clear as to if this poses any potential issue such as breaking it.

Update: I removed one star after a few days of use. I found it is actually difficult to clean the board and remove the ghosting without using a dampened cloth. I certainly missed the old chalkboard days, but I would give it a second thought if I had to pick white dry-erase board vs. chalkboard again.

title: Very handy
text: I got this for my daughter who's trying to save $$ to build a house. I looked through it and now want one for myself. Very nice to organize and see where your $$ goes. Has little pockets for storing receipts so you have your tax deductions right there every month. It will make filing your taxes so much easier if you do this each month.

title: Outstanding
text: I bought this with skepticism. I figured it might be a gimmick, but it's the real deal. I used this to secure patriotic banners made of cloth to my front porch.  I figured they'd hold up for a few days. It's been over 2 weeks and the banners are still holding. There's 10 total and we've had 2 pretty severe storms, cat attacks and racoons who make a nightly visit scavenging for left over cat food.  They haven't sagged or moved an inch. A couple have been twisted by the animals playing with them, but I just unfurl them and they're hanging straight again. Nothing has budged them. This stuff really works. When I get low, I will be re-ordering.

title: Easy set up, great price, very versatile and effective
text:
Wanted a multi-function that would work wirelessly for the several computers and smart phones at home. Setting up the the printer on WiFi was a snap. It recognized the SSID right away and I just had to enter the password. Every computer and smart phone then recognized the printer wirelessly right away. We've tested by printing from two computers and one phone. Flawless!

The scan function works great as does the document feeder, which is really helpful for scans as you do not have to take the time to place your document(s) directly on the platen, or remove it (them). The little LCD screen is really easy to use for scanning, which is quick and of good quality. The color touch screen is bright and the icons are easy to read and easy to use.

The print and scan quality are excellent. I didn't need it to be top of the line quality, but it sure is close. The print is a little light, but other users have said that this makes the MFC870 easy on ink use.

For under $100, this little multifunction is a super deal. It is by far the best ink-jet I've ever owned and the well-designed multifunction capabilities make it the most versatile too.

The 100-count paper tray is I suppose a bit of a downside. But, if you only print 100 pages every couple of weeks like we do, it's hardly noticeable.

This is the first Brother printer I've ever owned. Sure glad I got it. :)

title: Really nice page marrkers!!

title: Horrible

text: Overall I'm very happy with the electric desk...sturdy, smooth operations and looks great.  However I think most "normal" folks will find it takes a couple of hours to assemble.  I think the directions are mediocre at best, as the pictures they don't provide enough good visual queues on assembling (front, back, motor position, etc.).  Between the instructions and the online video I was able to figure things out.  I did buy the vivo under-desk keyboard tray which I highly recommend as it makes for a much more ergonomically friendly setup (especially for people who do a lot of typing).  As you can see my cabling management is a bit lacking.  I also bought an "underdesk cable management tray) which will clean things up considerably - I intend to mount on back & under of desk.

title: If I Could Give This More Than 5 Stars I Would!
text:
This book stand is perfect!! The cushion is soft enough to be comfortable when propped on my lap/leg, but sturdy enough to stay at the angle I choose. The book clips work great; I read a 400+ page hardback book with the clips attached to the covers and the pages free. Left my hands free to grab my lemonade and to pet my dogs! I recently had foot surgery, so I’m using a “knee wheelie” to get around. When I need to move this book stand’s handle fits over my handlebars and it goes with me. I attach the clips to hold down the pages in my book and take off; holds a heavy hardcover book in place while I zoom around, without losing my place in the book! Added bonuses: the clips have rubber tips to keep them from tearing the cover/pages, and a bookmark holder in the left upper corner.
*I just purchased another one for my husband, who loves to read (almost!) as much as I do.*

Great planner

title: FEELS NICE; LOOKS GOOD
text: This has a nice feel to it and it makes a really nice mat under my keyboard and mouse.  Mouse glides easily on it, but I might not use it for the mouse, as I have a mouse pad with a wrist rest on it and that helps a lot when I am using the mouse heavily.

title: Very small labels; limited usefulness
text: This will probably be of limited use to me, as the labels that came with it are only 1 1/4 inches long and about 1/2 inch wide.  You can buy longer labels I guess, but a little pricey at $13 for 65 labels (on sale) for colored labels or $12 for white labels.  That means labels will cost you 18 to 20 cents each.  Normal price is $20 for 65 labels on the website.  You have to install an application on your cellphone to use the label printer.  I was disappointed that there didn't seem to be a way to install the application on my desktop computer.  Maybe it is because the device communicates via Bluetooth and my computer probably doesn't have Bluetooth support.  The application is a little difficult to figure out, but I was able to get a label prepared and printed. The printer is small and completely wireless, although you need a USB cord (included) to charge it.  Very compact printer, about the size of a pack of cigarettes.  Great for on the road printing of small labels, but you need you cell phone to use it.

title: Lots of features; easy to use
text: This phone has a lot of nice features and is easy to use and program.  It does require A/C power to operate, but has battery backup when there is a power failure.  It does use FIVE AAA batteries, which seems like a lot.  Batteries don't come with it.  The only problem I have encountered with this phone is that it does not work with an inline call blocking device that I have.  I have a mechanical call blocker that goes between the phone line and the phone, but if that device is plugged in, the phone will not work.  It doesn't even have to be plugged into this phone; put it anywhere on the line and it makes this phone go dead.  Unfortunately the phone itself doesn't include a call blocking feature, which is too bad.  Being sold as a business phone, it should have call blocking.

title: Compact, effective; works great
text: My wife has an electric stapler, but it is 2 or 3 times larger than this one; hers has a light on the front that flashes when staples are low and a small drawer on it for extra staples.  This doesn't have extra features; it is just a basic stapler.  The nicest thing is that it is not much bigger than a standard stapler, so it packs a lot of punch in a small size.  Measures only 7 x 3 x 2 inches.  The cord on the A/C adapter is nice and long, so you don't have to be really close to a power plug.  It does staple through a lot of pages, as advertised.  It includes a manual staple puller and a box of staples in the package, which was a nice surprise that I didn't expect.  If you don't want to plug it into the wall, it also operates from four double A batteries (not included).  The model I got is solid black in color, which is fine for me; don't know if it comes in other colors or not.  Register online and they give you an 18 month warranty.  Absolutely a 5-star product.

title: NICE GRIP, ATTRACTIVE, SMOOTH WRITING
text: Sharpie has always made quality writing implements and markers and these are no exception.  The ones I got were attractive white in color on the barrel with a comfortable grey colored grip.  These are medium tip, which seems better to me than the bold, which tend to make more of a blob when writing.  If you have never used a gel pen, you owe it to yourself to try them.  These are as good as any gel pens and probably better than some.  Gel pens are a little more expensive that typical ballpoint pens, but worth it once you have used one.  You will never want to go back to a regular old ballpoint.  One precaution with gel ink - until it dries, it does tend to smear easier than some other inks.

title: Smooth writing; nice grip
text: I have used gel pens for years as they are so much nicer than other types of pens.  I never tried Sharpie Brand, but like all the other Sharpie products, these are good quality.  They write smoothly and have a comfortable grip.  The only thing that might keep you from buying these is the price.  All gel pens tend to be a little pricey.  You can probably find cheaper gel pens, but you get what you pay for and may be disappointed with cheaper versions.  If you have never used a gel pen, give yourself a treat and get some.  Just realize that gel pens are not ideal for filling out multi-part forms.  You need to press hard to do that type of forms and gel pens don't require much pressure to use them.  In fact they are probably ideal for people who have limited hand strength and can't easily use another type of pen.

title: Wi-Fi Setup is Tricky, Control Panel a little difficult to get used to; otherwise a great printer
text: Unpacking and doing the basic printer set up and filling with ink was pretty easy.  The instruction sheet is clear and easy to understand and follow.  This printer is different than any other I have had in that it doesn't use ink cartridges, but instead uses ink tanks.  You fill each tank with the appropriate color of ink from a bottle (bottles are included to fill each color tank fully).  You can actually see the ink levels from a semi-clear window on each tank; you also can view levels from software.  Print quality seems decent with good colors.  I liked the fact that the printer is not overly large or heavy.  It has a reasonable footprint for the capability it has.  Now the negatives.  First of all, since there are tanks with ink in them, if you tip up the printer much when moving it, you could potentially spill ink out.  The tanks have covers, but not sure how secure they are; there is an obvious warning on the box not to tilt the printer after the tanks are filled.  If you wanted to ship the printer, you would have to find a way to drain the tanks.  The control panel on the printer is a little confusing until you get used to it.  I kept wanting to press the LCD display, but it is not touch screen.  You use buttons to the right of the screen to navigate.  To make a photo copy is a number of presses on the panel.  Even turning the printer off is a three step process.  Another brand of printer I have is easier to operate.  Another gripe that I have when setting up is that when you are unable to connect from your computer, if you have to end the program, you have to start all over from the beginning with a complete reinstall of software.  The only real negative to this printer is the Wi-Fi setup.  I could not get it to set up properly, until I used a USB cable.  At first I thought the problem was that my router was running at 5GHZ and not broadcasting a 2.5GHZ signal and actually ended up setting up a separate SSID for dedicated 2.5GHZ.  That did not work at all.  Finally by using the original SSID of my router, was able to connect my computer to the printer with WiFi, but ONLY by using a USB connection for the setup (USB cable is not included).  After you connect, you can remove the USB cable and then print with WiFi.  This printer only works on 2.5 GHZ and I think it is time that manufacturers start supporting 5 GHZ on their devices.  If you want to use this with WiFi, you better know a lot about your router.  Fortunately you can use the printer on a network (Ethernet cable), a USB connection or wireless.  Scanning is a little hard to figure out because you have to download and install a separate utility from the Epson website and it is not quite clear what it is that you download and install; fortunately I guessed correctly, as I got scanning to work from my computer; however, I could not get scanning to work from the printer panel.  A label on the top of the printer mentions FAX capability, but the outside box does not and apparently a different model does faxing.  As far as how long the ink lasts, I am not optimistic as the black ink has already gone down quite a bit and I have only printed about a half dozen pages.  I think once you get over the oddities of setup, this is a good printer.  A little weak on setup.  Nothing included to set it up; you have to download from the Epson website.  That's probably a good thing as you always have the most up-to-date software that way.

title: Works good; cheaper than OEM toner
text: It has always been my policy to use only OEM toner and ink, but as much as it costs, I thought maybe it was time to try a non-OEM product.  The black toner just ran out in my printer soon after I got a set of these Arthur cartridges.  I had a little trouble installing because at first I didn't realize that the ink mechanism has both a toner cartridge and a drum.  I removed both together and then tried to insert a toner cartridge, which of course didn't fit.  Then I realized that it was a two part assembly and got the Arthur cartridge inserted and within just a few minutes it was printing perfectly.  I am assuming that the color cartridges will work just as well, but it will be some time before the colors run out.  I was confused by one reviewer who wrote about a cartridge drying up.  Since toner is a dry powder to begin with, I didn't understand this.  I didn't give these 5-stars because I don't know how long they will last.  Also I noticed that my ink monitor program, while it does show the black ink level at full capacity after replacement, it has a question mark over the top of the graphic showing the ink level.  This might indicate that the printer doesn't fully recognize the refill.

title: Seems to work about the same as the full sized BIC correction Tape
text: My wife has used the regular full sized BIC correction tapes for quite some time and had good success with them.  I often have trouble with them, but found out it was because I press too hard.  I tried these mini ones and after I stopped pressing too hard they seemed to work reasonably well and about the same as the full sized ones.  It did seem that the movement might have been a little less smooth than the full size tapes, but that could be just my perception, since I don't use correction tape a lot.  Sometimes the tape didn't seem to stick as well as I would hope, but just pressing down with a finger took care of that problem.  Was able to write on the tape without any difficulty.  I seem to recall using other brands in the past that were better overall; however, more expensive.  These are not that inexpensive either, but correction tape is generally a little pricey and these are competitively priced.  Next time I would opt for the full sized reels, rather than these mini reels.  BIC products generally work well and I like their pens a lot.

title: Good adhesive; reasonable price
text: It always seemed to me that sticky notes (at least the better known brands) were priced too high.  These have a reasonable price and you get a lot of notes in the package (1,200), 12 pads of 100 in each pad.  These seemed to stick very well, maybe a little better than some of the known brands.  Two pads of each color (purple, blue, green, yellow, orange and red.)  It might be hard to see anything written on the purple or blue, but the other colors are light enough to see writing easily.  These are good quality and compare favorably to better known brands.  I would get them again.

title: Does everything I need; very heavy, but not a large footprint; fast; quiet
text: I am giving this 5-stars with some reservations.  First of, the cons.  The printer is very heavy and I had a hard time getting it out of the box; almost pulled a muscle.  Also had a hard time lifting it up on the table where it will sit.  I am 70 and I can just barely handle 40 pounds of weight; this weighs in at approximately 50 pounds.  If you can't handle 50 pounds and don't have help to lift and place it, don't get this printer.  The other concern I have is how long the toner cartridges might last and I have seen some say they have had problems with the printer reporting toner out before it is, but apparently there are ways to get full use of the cartridges before they are truly out, so it may not be a big deal.  When toner does run out, you'll end up spending about $70 a cartridge, so a replacement of all 4 (3 color and 1 black) will cost you between $200 and $300 depending on where you get the cartridges from.  What I recommend is that if you don't do a lot of color printing, just by a monochrome laser printer and supplement it with a cheap color ink jet.  Of course you have to consider whether or not you have room for two printers and also the cost of ink jet cartridges, which are not cheap either.  Now lets cover the good stuff and why I rated this 5-stars.  The printer is very fast and quiet.  It shoots out black & white pages very rapidly.  Of course color pages take a little longer, which you would expect, but are still reasonably fast.  Color print quality doesn't seem quite as good as some printers from other top printer manufacturers (such as EPSON and Canon), but it is adequate if your color printing requirements are not too precise.  Another thing I really like about Brother printers is that they include a FAX function.  Fax is a feature not as much needed these days, but there are times when it is needed and convenient.  Try to find a non-Brother printer with fax capability; I doubt you will.  The software install went easily and it wasn't too difficult to set up for wireless use.  You can use either USB or wireless.  The software is easy to use, but I did have difficulty trying to configure the printer to scan from the printer panel instead of the computer.  The scanning software on the computer is easy to use and it is easy to figure out how to scan letter or legal (or other sizes) and also not difficult to print on legal size.  For legal printing you do have to open a door on the front and feed the sheets in.  There is no paper tray for legal size, so this is not the ideal printer for printing lots of legal sized pages.  My older monochrome Brother laser could also handle legal scans and printing, but very complicated and difficult to set up.  It is fairly easy with this printer.  Overall, so far, I find this printer to be a big improvement over previous laser printers I have owned.  If I run into any problems later, I will update this review.  Note: I did not try the duplex scan, which seems like a good feature to have.

title: LIFTING HANDLE ON THE SHREDDING HEAD IS A REAL PLUS
text: The best feature of this shredder is that it has a handle to lift off the shredding head so you can easily empty the bin.  I have always struggled removing the shredding heads and have nearly dropped one a few times.  The handle only requires one hand lets you get a good grip on it and makes it so easy.  Shredders are noisy in general, but this one is reasonably quiet.  It has the added feature of a slot for CD/DVD shredding and you can also shred plastic credit cards.  I didn't try shredding 12 sheets that it is supposed to handle.  I noticed that most shredders work a lot better if you don't try to use them at full capacity.  This does seem powerful enough to do 12 pages at once, if you want to do that.  Amazingly this comes with a complete 12 page manual, explaining the features of the shredder, maintenance, trouble shooting and warnings. There is also a separate one page troubleshooting guide.  These days manuals are a rarity, so I think that is a real plus.  Well designed machine.  So what's not to like?  Even though this is a crosscut shredder the pieces are a little bigger than with my prior shredder. It still does an adequate job of shredding, but would have liked to see smaller pieces.  Also, the waste bin is a little small and will require emptying more often than my previous shredder that has a much larger bin.  Overall, this is a great medium duty shredder and I like it a lot.

title: Good Envelopes with an easy seal sticky strip
text: What can you say about an envelope, really?  I guess the best feature of these is the strip you peel off to stick the envelope shut.  It has a nice sticky strip that holds well and doesn't look like it would dry out any time soon.  No licking and sticking or bending metal clips to close the envelope.  This particular size of envelope doesn't seem as useful as one that would hold 8 1/2 x 11 papers flat.  You have to fold a standard sheet of paper in half to get it to fit in these envelopes.  The package of 250 seems like a lifetime supply for me, as I wouldn't use very many of this size.  I think most people would use either a standard business envelope or an envelope that holds standard sheets of paper flat.  If you need this size and can use this size, these are good envelopes.

title: Decent printer, but can be difficult to set up.  Ink is too expensive.
text: Stylish and attractive with a somewhat small footprint and reasonably quiet operation.  It is not really fast printing, but adequate.  Printing starts right away, which was not the case with one printer that I own that takes forever to start printing.  Making a copy is very easy; just put your page face down on the glass and press the copy button.  Unfortunately, there is no sheet feeder for copying or scanning multiple pages, so it is a page at a time.  If you do a lot of page scanning or copying, you need a printer with a sheet feeder, but you will pay a lot more for that convenience.  There is no button on the printer panel to use to scan a document; you have to use software for that.  The driver for the printer, scanning software and manual must be downloaded from a website given in the instructions.  It makes some sense to me not to have the software included, as these things change over time and having it online ensures you get the latest version when you install but that does make a little more difficult for the novice.  Also until you download and check the user's guide, you really don't have a clue on how to scan.  The software installs a program simply called "scanning" on your Windows PC and you run that to scan.  One of the first things I did not like about this printer is that there are only two ink cartridges; one for black and one for color.  I have never liked that because if you run out of just one color, you have to replace the whole color cartridge.  The printer has an "ECO" button you can press that puts out less ink to help you save on ink when you don't need the very best quality, so that's something that can help save on ink.  The ink is a very pricey, so not sure this would be as economical as printers that have 4 or more ink cartridges  This only has color and black and the cartridges shipped with the printer did not last very long..  If you want to use this on USB, rather than wireless, a USB cable is not included, so if you don't have a spare around, you have to buy one.  After you download the software, you have to run it and apparently connect a USB cable initially, even if you are going to use it wireless.  You are given a choice in the install as to whether you want to go wireless or with USB.  On one computer I had trouble with either option; it kept telling me to attach a USB cable that was already attached.  I investigated and found out that the printer was showing up in Windows and I could use it with USB.  As far as wireless, there are two options; either with a WPS button or manual where you enter your router information.  On one computer, neither option worked, even after multiple attempts; I could not get wireless to work at all.  I tried connecting the printer to another computer and both the USB option and the manual setup for wireless worked perfectly on the first try.  I could not get the WPS option to work, even on the second computer.  Since the manual setup worked, I didn't need to.  (If you don't know, WPS is a button you press on your router and then you press a button on the printer within two minutes and it is supposed to connect automatically).  Was going to contact support about the wireless problem, but since I got it working with manual settings on one computer, I didn't call.  If you are not somewhat computer literate, this is not the best printer for you to try to set up; you might struggle with it for a while.  This printer also is supposed to be able to scan remotely with your smartphone with a free app that you can download from the app store, but I did not test that capability, as it seemed to me to be of limited value.

title: Good Quality Mat; Nothing Special
text: The manufacturer hypes the fact that this chair mat has a unique shape, designed for today's needs.  I can't say that I see any great advantage in the shape of this mat over other mats I have had.  The very rounded corners may provide less of a trip hazard, as I have tripped on chair mats before (my wife tells me to pick up my feet).  I haven't had good luck with chair mats, as they eventually crack.  This mat seems to be made of the same material as other mats I have had that crack within a year or two (or what seems like it).  I would like to get 5 years out of a chair mat, but don't think I have had any last that long.  Hopefully the material in this one will last longer without cracking.  Wish I had gotten the larger size, but I realized today I have been pushing my chair mats too far under my desk, where the chair wheels never reach, so by pulling this out further, it is very much adequate size.  Seems like a good quality mat, but nothing special.  Price is okay; about what any good mat would cost and I doubt you will a find better mat for that price.

title: SOLID, WELL MADE; SEVERE LIMITATION ON HOW MUCH WEIGHT YOU CAN PUT ON IT; TOO SMALL; PRICEY
text: This is a nice looking desk, but the one I got is a little darker than what it looks like in the picture (more black than brown).  Also, the picture makes it look like one end is narrower than the other.  It's not; it is equal width on both ends.  Easy and fast to assemble.  Comes in three pieces; base, pedestal and top.  Just insert the pedestal into the base and push all the way down.  Then put the top on and push down until it locks in place.  Genius design.  It is ready to use in 10 minutes or less.  Seems quite sturdy and well made, but it supposedly only holds 15 pounds, which is not much.  Has a nice big easy to use lever underneath to raise or lower the desk to the exact height you want.  It goes up high enough to use as a standing desk or low enough to use as a work table.  It might not work quite as well as a computer desk if you are seated, as it is a couple inches too high at the lowest setting; at least for me it was.  It works good as a work table, which is probably how I am going to use it, with thoughts of maybe later using it as a standing desk.  The main problem with this "desk" is that it just isn't quite large enough.  It would be ideal for a laptop, but you couldn't put a desktop computer plus monitor, keyboard and mouse on it; it would be crowded.  Also with the weight limitation of 15 pounds, it probably is too much weight for it to hold.  It works well for a monitor, keyboard, mouse and a little space on the side for paperwork that you might be typing from and not much else.  Your desktop computer needs to be elsewhere on the floor below it, probably.  The desk is not easy to move, as there are no wheels on it.  I knocked off one star on my review for the weight limitation and the price.  This is not a $500 desk.  I think maybe $200-$300 would be a more appropriate price.  Of course you get what you pay for and the base and pedistal are all metal and the top does appear to be solid wood and not pressboard.  For the price though, locking wheels would have been nice, as well as a little larger size and ability to hold more weight.  If you know the limitations of this desk, I don't think you will be disappointed at all, as it is a quality product.

title: NICE SCALE, but doesn't include power cord
text: Nice scale that I have used for quite a while.  The only issue is that you have to supply your own power cord with the appropriate transformer.

title: Nice looking, strong and useful
text: I quit using conventional file folders a long time ago.  With the pocketed ones like these, you never lose papers, especially small pieces of paper that you might want to include.  These particular ones seem to be tough and expanded nicely.  They are decently attractive too.  I wouldn't exactly call them "leather-like" as the description says, but they still look good.  If you need expanding file folders, especially ones with 12 pockets, you can't go wrong with these.  Smead has been around a long time and they produce good quality products and these folders are no exception.

title: Avery Labels Are Always Good
text:
I was worried that these labels might peel off in my printer and jam it up. They stayed affixed firmly to the backing sheet and yet were not hard to peel off for use. Note these are RETURN address labels, so they are quite small. If you have more than a 3 line address, the printing can get very tiny. At least you get a lot per page and per package.

Avery always has templates for all their labels and they are easy to get to, but they always seem to want your name and e-mail address before they will let you get to the template. I would imagine they want to send you advertising.

Avery is the best quality and I would encourage you to always buy them, even if they are slightly more expensive. The bargain brands just don't always work as well. I have had Avery labels on the shelf for years that still work well. Some of the bargain brands can dry up and come loose sooner. Avery apparently knows labels very well and the label business.

title: Wonderful Printer, But Has a Few Flaws
text:
Have had this printer for several years and have been quite satisfied with it. The color quality of the printing is outstanding. I have a newer quality printer by another top manufacturer and the colors are not nearly as vibrant as they are with the R300. Epson apparently makes some of the best inks. I use standard 20 lb. paper in it and get good quality. Photo paper gives better quality of course, but heavier paper does jam easier in this printer.

There have been a lot of complaints about the amount of ink this printer uses, but it may be a misconception. It warns you of low ink long before you have to really replace the cartridge. You can sometimes print many, many pages before the ink actually runs out. Ignore the low ink warning and just wait until it stops printing and says the ink is actually out. One problem with low ink is that you sometimes cannot do an ink head cleaning if ink is too low.

Once in a while I have had banding problems when printing. Just run the printer through a cleaning cycle or two and problem goes away.

The only design flaw I have found in my printer is that the CD/DVD printer tray seems to have an issue with feeding in sometimes and quite often I have to give it a little nudge to get it started. Also it sometimes doesn't eject all the way and I have to pull it out. Initially the tray worked fine, so it could be a component that has worn enough to cause the problem. It has been doing it for a long time, but I can live with this slight problem, as the print quality of the CDs and DVDs is excellent and I have printed 100's.

Would hate to pay the prices now being asked for this printer ($300+ and up), as I think I bought mine new for around $100. I must have gotten an incredible buy or the prices on this have jumped dramatically.

When the printer quits, I think it will be well worth repairing. The last color inkjet I had before this one (different brand) did not last as long.

title: Gorgeous Printer; Time Consuming to Set Up
text: This is my first wireless printer and the setup for wireless connection was not too difficult, except that my firewall interfered with being able to connect, so had to shut it off temporarily.  If you plan to use this in wireless mode be sure that 1) You already have a wireless router and 2) You know the pass phrase for your router.  You have to enter the pass phrase into the printer and it is very time-consuming, but at least you only do it once.  You can use the printer with a USB cable if you don't want to set it up for wireless. The software installation on the PC was very time consuming too.  It took probably close to 20 minutes or more. This is the first printer that I have had where I had to install the print head myself.  The print head (not much more than a tray to hold the ink cartridges) is not difficult to install, but it took me a few tries to figure out how it went in.  Finally when I got it tilted just right, it slipped right into place.  This is a gorgeous looking printer with a sleek black color and a flip up LED panel with a clear bright display.  Menus are easy to understand and obvious.  I didn't get confused or stuck on any settings.  I am a little concerned about the small size of the ink cartridges, wondering how long before they run out.  There are six cartridges, so they may last a while, since printing a color page would only use a little from each one.  The printing seems fast compared to my older printers.  Initial settings do not print the best quality, so if you want good color printing on plain paper, you have to make a change to "high quality" instead of the default "regular" quality.  The first pages I printed in regular quality were a little disappointing, but the high quality ones came out great, obviously using more ink. There are two paper trays; one for plain paper and one for photo paper.  Photo printing with photo paper produces excellent quality prints.  Another big plus to this printer is that it comes with plenty of really good documentation, so if you read the manual and follow the easy step-by-step instructions, you'll have it set up with no difficulty.  It may take a while.  Took me well over an hour from the time of unpacking, until I printed my first page from the computer, although some of that time was messing with my pass phrase until I entered it correctly.  If you are an impatient type of person who doesn't want to read instructions, this is probably not the printer for you.  This is a wonderful printer, but a little pricey and slightly difficult to set up.

text: As someone who's tried just about every poly mailer on the market, and ships 25-35 packages a week, I can honestly say I was pleasantly surprised at how well made these are. title: Definitely some pros and cons
text:
This envelope making board has its pros and cons. I had purchased the original gray design with white lettering about 4 years ago. Although the print is small, I could read it without any issue at all. Then when I spotted the new pretty blue and white punch board I thought why not. I
use my old one so much that I thought it would be nice to have a much prettier one, ong with a new punch blade to justify my senseless purchase. Big mistake! The pretty new design is extremely difficult to read the tiny print. The background color is blue with white font. I never struggle to read anything, but I do with this.
My suggestion is that if you are also having an issue reading yours, just print the measurements out on a piece of paper to store away with the board.
The other issue I have is that when making the larger envelopes, the board itself is not large enough to accommodate your paper. And I mean for envelopes only like 4x6 or larger. The paper hangs off the board so you can’t score the entire paper. I have made 100+ envelopes of all sizes so it can be done regardless, but sometimes my score lines are off a bit because of this and I end up with a crooked envelope that can’t be fixed. So I end up having to throw the wonky envelope one in my scrap pile for another project.
PROS: Despite all mentioned above, I still find this method far easier that cutting everything by hand, which I did for years before the board.
Initially I thought there was something wrong with the design because all my envelopes came out wrong. I watched a YouTube video and got the hang of it after making 3-4 envelopes and now it’s a breeze and the process is very fast.
My 3 star review is because the new color combination is hard to read for some. And another star dinged because this really needs to be on a larger board platform. Us crafters spend our $ like crazy on our hobby, so why not make a larger version for $10 more. I sure would buy it! Don’t take the reviews seriously that say it
doesn’t work. They just don’t have patience and the willingness to learn something new. Quitters never win :)

title: Natural looking

title: Very cute card
text: This is a card from my past childhood. It reminds me of the old fashioned pop up books. This card is so cute. I am going to use it for a decoration on my table instead of mailing it out. It is on a long paper base that Im going to add small pine cones and evergreen branches. The tree is kind of sparkly, and pops up easily ...no need to pull anything to get it to come up.If you decide to mail it out, it is not a very thick heavy card so I dont think it would cost a lot to send. I wish there were more designs.

title: Great clear pictures. Last 100 yrs.
text: Oh, another tech gadget to learn about. I am 63, I learned how to do things on my computer years ago. I cant do anything about tvs, video player hook ups though. When I got this, I thought it would be one of the hard ones because you have to sinc up your iphone with it..ahhh..but actually, if you follow the simple directions it was easy. Yes I did have an issue connecting the two but it was a matter of being patient. I figured it would be difficult to use to print from the phone...boy was I wrong! After you install the hp socket app, you just click on it and your pictures are there. ...helpful hint, it might take a minute or two the first time you sink the two for the pictures to appear on your phone screen...just be patient, it does work. After that they come up very quickly. The unit is nice and small (fits in a shoe box even with cords)  and was packed very well. It comes with 10 picture papers and 1 ink cartridge. The ink is a nice small unit that pops right in! When you have your picture that you are ready to print, you just click on the printer icon that comes up under the picture...one word of caution here... only hit it ONCE!  This is when your patience is a virtue lol. I hit it once, then waited...nothing happened...hit it again..still nothing, hmm then the on light began to flash ( the pic info was coming thru) and the picture began its printing cycle. It prints one color comes out and is sucked back in for another color. It does this 4times, then the picture comes out, drops on the tray and is done! Easy peasy! Until the second picture began to print because remb, I hit the button twice lol because I didnt wait...I didnt know then, but now I do. The second time I printed a picture I hit the print icon and waited..the picture began its cycle. After all this I can honestly say this is the easiest gadget to set up and use! Since it didnt come with much paper, I ordered more. I compared prices on 4 different sites/stores and they were exactly the same as Amazon, 34.99 for 80 picture papers and 2 ink cartridges...Im guessing 1 cartridge for every 40 pictures...makes each pic cost 43.73 cents per picture, which is a bit more than printing in stores but I think those machines are harder to use so to me, this is def. worth the money. I just started to check on some features on the app for adding to pictures. There are happy birthday banners you can add to the picture before it prints and a lace one, pumpkins etc. It also has holiday things to add too! I bet there are so many more features in the app to enhance the photos that I will find as I get better using it!  In closing as you might have guessed, I love this machine and find it was the easiest thing to learn about! Get one lol
