title: Cute for fans of sushi and Japanese food
text:
I have loved the hallmark signature line for the last several years for their innovative, cute designs, and this sushi card is no different.

As I have many friends who are fans of sushi/Japanese food, this is the perfect cute birthday gift.

Unfortunately, the card I received had several black smudges on the white part surrounding the pop-up.

Craftsmanship itself was quite good; the card opens and closes smoothly and looks quite elegant with the gold trim.

I am not sure if the card I got was just an exception, but if you have the chance to check it out in the store before buying, check to make sure the inner part of the card is free from smudges.

title: A never ending sales pitch and mismanaged basic features, disguised as a printer
text:
I wish that useability was a feature that I could rate separately. Any printer can manage a quality piece of paper so I'm not sure that's a feature I need to rate separately in 2020. The fact is they never stop trying to force Instant Ink on you at every turn is something I'd like to rate. Where is the option to rate how often they shove their subscription service down your throat?

You also cannot actually start any features from the printer directly but you have to go back to where the app is. What this means is you cannot scan things to a location...even though it's connected to the computer via WI-FI. The scan button just tells you it will not work and you need to use the app (why include the button then??) So if you have multiple pages to scan on to your computer you must go to the printer, put the item in the scanner, go back to your computer and initiate the scan, wait for the scan to complete, return back to the printer to add another page. Or you can scan to your phone and then share the documents from your phone to your computer. There is no option to have the printer save a device or file location making this the most inconvenient scanning experience I've had in the past decade. There isn't a multi-page option either. You have to return the computer and let the app know there is another page to be scanned. Selecting scan on the printer using the touchscreen will not just send this next page to the correct place

There is an option to add the smart task app to your printer app (requires an email and password). Smart Task is for...I'm not sure. It allows you to create favorite save locations...provided they are attached to a company that paid to have them listed as storage locations like Dropbox, One Drive, and Evernote. There is no "Smart" option that leads back to your own computer. An option to email the files to a place automatically with the subject line prefilled with "You've got HP Smart app files" though. There was plenty of thought put into THAT during development. There also isn't an option to smartly scan multiple documents. So again, HP has found a way to try and profit multiple times from your purchase of this printer, this time through selling this space inside their Smart Task app to file storage companies rather than making a functional product. I guess I do know what Smart Task is for actually. Ha.

Also, while the touchscreen functions all operations must be handled through the apps HP makes you download sooo........1 star for a feature that is made redundant by their insistence that all functions ONLY initialize from the application.

title: The best
text:
I purchased two of these, the first was the black & the second was the white.
They both are a great size for my double door refrigerator and they were easy to put on & stay put.
However, I wish I bought both in black.
For me the the neon markers colors stand out much better & it makes it easier to read.
The white is good but the markers that came with it aren’t very dark/bold and I have to press harder but yet it looks as though the marker was left without the cap on and I have to press harder and go over it a few times.
I thought by buying a set of Expo chisel tipped markers they’d stand out but they aren’t much better.
I don’t know if the black board with neon markers is just a better fit or is it that the white board needs bolder colors that stand out on a bright white background.
I will probably buy another black one & donate the white one.
I’m 65 & I don’t need glasses to read but even with them on, it doesn’t help when writing or reading what I wrote on the white board as the colors just don’t stand out, but they are readable.
In my opinion, using neon with a black board just stands out & that makes all the difference.
These boards are so much better than using a notepad & sharpie markers for my to do list & to keep track of the perishable food items in my refrigerator.
I would highly recommend this product.

text:

My reason for not giving it more stars is because you can't see the photo as you are using the color edit feature. It would be nice to see it as I adjust the colors. You have to go back and forth between the feature to do this and the actual photo shown on the tiny screen.

The Super 8 film I converted was fairly low quality to begin with. You will not be able to convert this and watch it as a movie. You can only go through and convert it into photos. I converted a few shots in the film just to be able to label the film. That was a big help in sorting and deciding which Super8 film I want to spend money on converting instead of converting all of mom's old movies.

title: They're not ergonimical
text:
I hate to give this 3 stars becausd i do love the way the pens write. However, they are extremely thin. Definitely more aesthetically pleasing than practical. It's just not comfortable writing with these pens. I do have other thin pens but not as thin as these.

I think it also has to do with the fact that the outer tube material is sleek so there's no grip. My other pens that dont have grips have at least a grippy material.

Im sure with a grip the whole issue would be resolved, but I like to get a well finished product from a singular source.

title: Great way to Celebrate Dad!
text: My husband loved his card from our daughter’s! He is still opening it to this day! Great quality! Well made!

title: Good Quality
text: These envelopes are a good quality. They are not flimsy and they do not tear easily. The color are vibrant and pretty.

title: Cute Design!
text: I ship a lot of packages. When it's possible, I like using poly bags. I am very happy that these are biodegradable. The cat & dog design is cute. The bags are comparable to other poly bags that I have used as far as quality and durability.

title: Helps with Saving!
text: I have recently seen videos of similar envelope systems and wanted to give it a go. The cardboard box is pretty sturdy. I have a much shorter deadline than 1 year, so I am only using half of the envelopes. Plus, I am filling the envelopes a couple of times per week in order to meet my goal. I am not sealing the envelopes so I can reuse this next year, starting in January. I also did not seal the box. I am enjoying doing this so far. It's really not painful saving money this way. A little bit here and there is not noticeable.

title: Pretty Durable!
text: These book marks are pretty durable. They're a heavy weight card stock. The assortment of butterfly designs is good. The artwork is very attractive. I have shared some with my book club friends and everyone really liked them.

title: Excellent Chore Chart!
text: This is an excellent chore chart. I love the layout. It has space for daily & weekly chores. A lot of chore charts out there are designed for children. The soft, muted colors are pretty. I used to use a chore app, but out of sight, out of mind. I put this where I can see it frequently, which makes it easier to stay on top of things. I am very happy with it.

title: Good Layout
text: Meal planning definitely makes life easier. I have used several different meal planners over the years. My first comment is regarding the size. It's really too small for me. I tend to write a little larger with loopy letters. In order to use this, I have to write in tiny letters. Another thing, I don't plan all of my meals each day. I only plan dinners, so this has wasted space for me. The overall layout is good. I like the horizontal columns. There's not enough space on the shopping list for me. I definitely need to flip it over and use the back and even then, some days it would not be enough room. The quality of the paper is nice. It tears well. The magnets are nice and strong.

title: Great for Trade Shows!
text: My husband owns a small business and we usually go to a couple of trade shows each year. These are perfect for our table. We don't have a whole lot of flyers and brochures, but we do put a few just in case someone stops by our booth when we're not there. These seem very sturdy. It will definitely make our booth look neater as opposed to just leaving a pile of brochures out on the table.

title: Cute Greeting Cards
text: These are cute greeting cards. They are a step or two above the cheap flat ones. These are embellished. The quantity is perfect. I can send one to my nieces & nephew, my elderly father and my college student daughter. The quality is very nice and is what I would expect from Hallmark.

title: Cute Lanyard
text: This is a cute lanyard. It's also a good quality. My husband and I are taking our niece to Disney. I thought she might like wearing this at the park and start collecting pins. It would also work well for your work ID.

title: Great Looking Poly Bags!
text: These are some great looking poly bags. The designs are fun. They also make your packages stand out. This set comes with 3 different sizes. Each size has a different design. They seem durable. I used one today and the seams didn't bulge or tear. The adhesive strip worked well and secured the flap down. I would recommend these.

title: Nice Bags
text: I do a lot of shipping and I love using poly bags when I can. These are cute! I really like the color scheme. These are smaller bags than I expected because I didn't read the measurements ahead of time, so I probably won't be using these as frequently as larger sizes. The adhesive strip works well. Overall, I am satisfied.

title: Labels
text: This is definitely a good value. You get a lot of labels for a good price. The labels are decent. I didn't have any problems with printing on them. The adhesion seems good. I did find them to be a little difficult to peel off the sheets. Other than that, no problems. This will probably last me a long while.

title: Great Planner!
text: I have been using Happy Planners for the last several years. After trying out different planners for years, I am happy to have found a brand that I like. I like the Big size the best, even though my schedule is pretty light! I used to do crafts such as stamping &  scrapbooking. The Happy Planners allow me to harness that creativity in a small but doable amount. I spend one day each week decorating the next week's layout. Of course I buy lots of their stickers for that job! This planner is gorgeous. It has a calming vibe to it. There's plenty of room for me to put my "to do" lists, activities, and more. I even print out pictures. In fact, sometimes it's more of a memory book than a planner. The planner is durable. One of my favorite features is that you can remove and add pages simply.

title: These Should Last a While!
text: My husband owns a small business that he runs out of the house. Usually once a month he asks me for an envelope. I decided he needed his own stash of them. These are good envelopes and are comparable to what I would get from the store. The adhesion is good. These should last us a while!

title: Excellent!
text: My daughter is in college and almost done. She hasn't been that good with managing her money, so I thought this might help her. I know it could be worse, but I believe that if she doesn't learn some budgeting skills, it will only get worse when she's older. I wish I had something like this when I was younger. Anyway.... this is an excellent kit. It comes with everything you need to help you take control of your spending. Plus, it's by Happy Planner so it's colorful and fun! The quality is very good as I would expect from the brand.

title: Gorgeous Planner!
text: I have been using the Happy Planner for the last few years. I really like the Dashboard layout a lot. This planner theme is gorgeous! I love the flowers. They're so pretty! I have been going back and forth between the Classic and the Big sizes. There are so many more options in the Classic. My favorite thing about these planners is that the pages are easy to remove and rearrange if needed.

title: There's a Learning Curve
text: There's definitely a learning curve to using these adhesive laminating sheets. I recommend doing a trial run before doing the real thing. My daughter had a few things she wanted to laminate. Her items were on cardstock which I think is easier to work with than regular paper because it's less likely to wrinkle during the process. She has been pleased with the results and is now looking for other things that would benefit from lamination.

title: Just as Described
text: I ordered these for business card holders for my husband's business. He goes to a few trade shows each year and has a booth. He's been putting a small stack of his business cards on the table, but they frequently need to be straightened up. These will keep his table looking neater. Since there are 4 of these, he can use one for his sales person, too. They are not much bigger than a standard business card so they won't take up a lot of room. I have no concerns about the quality. These are just as described.

title: A Good Start!
text: This vision board is a good start toward creating your own vision board. There are lots of color, glossy pictures and phrases to use. The board itself uses velcro to attach your items to the included board so you can swap out items as your goals change. The images themselves are attractive. There is some diversity, but the majority of the people are white. The quality of the kit is very good.

title: Sturdier Than Expected
text: My son lives in our basement. He just started his first real job. He was looking for a small file cabinet to keep some work papers in. I saw this and thought it might work. Not only is it perfect for what he needs, it also fills another need he has. He has been wanting a fireproof box for some of his valuable collectible trading cards. This is sturdier than I expected. It will easily accommodate all of his stuff. The top part will work well for the trading cards. It can be entirely separated from the rest of the box. There are a few pockets and storage slots too. He's very happy that it's fire and water proof. Plus, if there was an emergency, the handles make it easy to grab and go.

title: Great Color!
text: I do a lot of shipping. When I can get by with using a poly bag instead of a cardboard box, I do. This color is great! It's vibrant and just like the pictures. The adhesive strip works well. The bags seem sturdy enough for standard use.

title: Great Padded Envelopes!
text: These leopard print padded envelopes are great! The adhesive seal is good. The seams of the bags look fine. It's fun sending packages in printed packaging!

title: Worked Great!
text: These thermal labels worked great! My husband has a Zebra printer. We were able to print out labels with his company logo to use at an upcoming tradeshow. We are very pleased with how they turned out.

title: Just What I Needed
text: These are great bags for packing items. They would work well for handmade gifts. The size is good. The adhesive strip works fine. After ordering these, I was looking at the pictures again and thought maybe they were white on one side, clear on the other. I am happy to say that they are clear on all sides which is what I prefer.

title: Great Assortment!
text: I've been using The Happy Planner for the past few years. I love them! I buy a lot of their stickers. I was so excited to get these. It's a great assortment. They are perfect for my planner. The quality is good and as expected. The pictures and illustrations are lovely! I have had a lot of fun using them !

title: Nice Quality
text: My husband is a software developer and needed a bar code scanner for testing purposes that could scan US driver's licenses. This bar code reader can read that bar code, but that information is missing characters when it is sent back to the computer. He contacted the seller about this issue. The seller replied promptly, but in the end, they weren't able to do anything about this problem. As far as the actual bar code reader goes, it's a nice quality. It scans other bar codes without any difficulties. It's wireless and easy to use. It has a USB charger. The wireless feature can be used with Bluetooth or a keyboard dongle.

title: Family Organization!
text: This is a set of 3 magnetic chore charts. There are spaces for daily and weekly chores. If you want to assign points or money value, there's space for that, too. It also comes with a set of dry erase markers. It's an easy way to keep track of what the kids need to be doing to help out around the house.

title: Just What We Wanted!
text: We're getting ready to move my daughter into a new apartment. We're usually "mostly" careful when moving, but she's taking some nice furniture this time, so we wanted to step up our game. These rolls work well. Dispensing the plastic works as expected. We've been wrapping blankets around the furniture and wrapping the plastic around it to keep the blankets in place.

title: Nice Quality
text: I am a fan of Happy Planner. I have been using their regular planners for several years now. I thought this would be a regular planner, but for teachers. Unfortunately for me, it's a teacher planner - for lesson plans. I already have the larger lesson planner and thought it would be fun to have my personal planner coordinate. I do like the layout. It has horizontal and lined sections for Monday through Friday. It's a nice quality as expected from the brand.

title: Great Layout!
text: I am very happy with the layout of this teacher planner. It has a quick glance yearly calendar in the front. Then it breaks down into monthly sections. Each section starts with a 2 page full month's calendar. After that, there are weekly pages with 5 days per 2 page layout. The days are horizontal and go across both pages. There are 7 divided sections which you could use for each subject or class. The spaces are lined. In the very back are a few checklist pages where you can list the students and assignments or goals. The pages are not flimsy. No marker bleed through. I am very happy with it!!

title: Not the Cheap Kind
text: These plastic page protectors are NOT the cheap, thin kind that rip easily. They are very durable. I use these for my recipes. When I find a new recipe online and print it out, it goes into a page protector and then into a 3 inch binder. These are working great!

title: Nice Cards!
text: It's graduation season! These pop up cards by Hallmark are very nice. However, one out of the 4 cards I received fell apart the first time it was opened. I haven't been able to get the piece back in the right way yet.  These are heavy weight cards, not cheap thin ones. The envelopes are lined with gold paper.

title: Pretty!
text: I love shipping things in poly bags. I try to use them whenever I can. Of course, some items require a box. These are really pretty. They seal well. All the seams are sturdy.

title: Another Great Planner!
text: The Happy Planner planners are the best! This is another great one! I started using them about 4 years ago. They are fun to use. This one has the Dashboard layout. I think this layout is my favorite. The quality of the planner is as expected. The paper is a good thickness and most pen and markers don't bleed through. The illustrations are beautiful. I'm a fan!

title: Quality Stickers
text: These Happy Planner stickers are quality stickers. The theme is "modern wild". They're mostly decorative or accent stickers, but there are a few functional ones. I enjoy switching up my sticker themes every so often, so I have been using these for the past week.

title: Nice To Do Notebook
text: This is a nice to-do notebook. It incorporates your daily to-dos with some wellness trackers. The page thickness is very good. The colorful design is fun. Each day starts with a quote.

title: Works Great!
text: I do a lot of shipping from home and I have my own thermal printer for the labels. I recently ran out of labels, so I ordered these. They work great! I haven't had any problems with them getting stuck in the printer. They print well.

title: Beautiful Planner
text: I'm currently using a big planner by the happy planner company. I wasn't sure I would like the larger size, but I love it! This new planner starts in July, which is perfectly timed with when my current one ends. The quality is excellent and just as I would expect from the brand. I love the plant theme and pastel colors of this new planner. This is a vertical layout whereas the current one I'm using is a dashboard layout. I'm not too picky when it comes to the layout and I can adjust easily to the different ones. I'm very pleased with this planner and can't wait to start using it.

title: Fun Stickers!
text: I have been using the Happy Planner products for several years now. They are my favorite planner items. I just got my first Disney planner so I ordered these stickers to go with it. The sticker quality is excellent and what I expect from the Happy Planner brand. There's a good mix of actual functional stickers such as reminders, events, etc as well as fun illustrations and phrases. My Disney planner doesn't start until July so I am looking forward to getting started with these new stickers.

title: Beautiful planner
text: I've been using planners by the Happy Planner company for several years now. I like how flexible they are. You can easily remove or add pages as needed. This is my first Disney themed planner by them. It's a beautiful planner with lots of gorgeous illustrations and details. This is the vertical style layout. I would consider this to be an academic type of planner since it starts in July and goes through June the following year. I do realize that you pay a little extra for the official Disney licensing. The quality is as expected from the Happy Planner brand

title: Darling!
text: This is a darling edition to my desk. I am a new fan to Rae Dunn products. I can't seem to get enough. This is a unique piece that can hold a cell phone or a pad of post-its. My Google Pixel 4A fits nicely into it. The piece is sturdy and well made. I am very pleased with how this functions and looks in my home office.

title: A great new planner
text: I have been using planners by the happy planner company for several years now. They are definitely my favorite planners. This one is new to me. The twin loop bound is basically a nice fancy way of saying spiral bound. It's not the cheap spiral binding that you would find on a school notebook. It's definitely a nice quality. The planner itself is what I would expect from the company. The layout is a horizontal. There is plenty of room for notes stickers and all that. I was a little concerned because it had a new binding, but when I think about it I don't usually take my pages out and reinsert new ones and you can still insert new pages. Though if you take pages out they will have to be torn out.

title: Good labels
text: These are good labels. They work well in my thermal printer. The quality seems comparable to what I have used before. The adhesiveness is adequate. With 500 labels I should be set for a while.

title: Good Boxes
text: My husband owns a small business. He does have some shipping to do a few times a week. I ordered these boxes to give him another option when it comes to selecting the right size box. There's no sense using a larger box than needed. They are good boxes - nothing fancy. They do the job!

title: Nice Habit Tracker
text: This is a nice habit tracker. What I like about it is that there's only space for five habits at a time. I felt overwhelmed when I tried a habit tracker that had space for twice as much. I think less is best for sure. I also like the layout for this. The other habit tracker had a spiral circle thingy and it was difficult to keep track of which row went with which habit. This one is simple and easy to use. There are also some tips and guidelines which I found useful in the front. On the back of each week there is some pretty artwork. I think this will work much better for me.

title: Works Well!
text: I was using my husband's Zebra printer for shipping items, but he had to use it recently and it didn't make its way back to my office. I decided to see if I could find a thermal printer for my own use. Set up was easy. I was able to pair it with my phone. I did have to download an app, but that's okay. It works very well. It prints out my Poshmark labels easily. I tried to download the app for my Chromebook, but the app doesn't work with Chromebook (yet??). I am hoping that it gets updated soon.  A few labels are included. It even comes with stand to hold the labels. Overall, I am very pleased with it and how easy it is to use.

title: Great!
text: We have been installing hard flooring throughout our house. We didn't want to have to use those ugly mats under our computer chairs, so my husband found out about these types of wheels. They are super easy to put onto the chairs. They glide very easily. They're quite, too. We've been putting these on all of our rolling chairs.

title: Colorful Folders!
text: I don't use plain file folders. I like fun, colorful ones. These are perfect! They quality of the folders is great. They are sturdy and durable. It's much more fun using these than the old manila ones!

title: Nice File Box
text: I have been redoing my home office. I thought this pink file would hold my files well and keep them safe, but also go with my pink and gray color scheme. I was right! It looks great! It's easy to put together. There are handles on the side for carrying. I only wish there was a little window/pocket where I could label the contents. I have not tested the fireproof feature, so I am just going to take their word for it.

title: Rolls Smoothly
text: My husband recently discovered these types of chair wheels so we have been replacing all of our desk chairs with them. These are comparable to the other brands we have tried. They were very easy to install. They roll very smoothly. We love that they are protecting our hard floors!

title: Just What I Wanted!
text: I wanted clear acrylic book ends. These are just what I wanted. They do the job and they blend in well. I would order these again.

title: Nice Layout
text: I am all about "to-do" lists. This one has a nice layout. It has space for the 3 top items to accomplish and then 12 more less important items. In addition there's a water tracker, self-care section and room for notes. It has the boxes next to the items so you can check them upon completion which I find motivating and helpful.

title: Great Size!
text: I just recently got a new white desk. I didn't want it to get dirty easily, so I ordered this to protect it. It's a great size. The color is more like Pepto Bismo or bubble gum pink. The pictures on the description make it look more like a blush pink which I would have preferred. It came rolled up. I put heavy items on the corners and that seemed to get most of the edges flattened. I just noticed that there's one corner still curling up a bit so I will have to put something on it for a while. It serves it's purpose. There was also a matching bracelet? I'm not exactly sure what it is.

title: Great File Organizer!
text: I am redoing my home office. As I type this, my husband is installing hard wood flooring in the room. I was going over all the things that need to be put together once the room is ready. I rarely assemble things like this. I don't read directions well. But of all the things waiting to be assembled, this looked the easiest. I am happy to announce that it was very easy to put together. The instructions were simple, too. It probably took about 10 minutes to put it together, including all the screws. The piece is made of PVC. It's very sturdy and it looks to be durable, too. You can change the size of the slots as needed, I have them spaced every other notch, but I may change that later. It comes with screws and a tiny screwdriver. I feel that it probably would have stayed together without the screws, but I installed them anyway. I suppose the weight items you fill it with as well as how frequently you remove and replace things could effect the stability over time. I am very pleased with how it turned out. It looks simple and nice. It's a great file organizer!

title: Nice Quality
text: My husband and I go to a business trade show a couple of times per year. They provide really flimsy ID badge holders. I decided that I wanted something sturdier this year. These are a very nice quality. They're very durable and should last for several future trade shows.

title: Easy to Install
text: My husband recently heard about these type of chair wheels, so we have been gradually replacing the wheels on our office chairs. These wheels were easy to install. You just pop them in. Voila! They do raise your chair a little, but our chairs are all adjustable, so we just lower them a bit to compensate. They roll easily. We have been getting rid of all the carpet in the house. We love that we can get rid of the ugly chair mats that we have been using to protect the flooring.

title: Great Box Size
text: My husband owns at home business. We do a fair amount of shipping. The size of these boxes are really good. They look very professional. It's easy to put them together. They are sturdy and durable.

title: Pretty Planner Companion
text: I have been using Happy Planner planners for the last few years. This one is not a calendar planner but rather a planner companion. I would use this in addition to my regular planner. It is designed for those who make lots of to-do lists. There is a monthly grid calendar so if you really don't need lots of space for your appointments and such, this might actually work for you as your calendar. I love the watercolor floral design. The cover is slightly translucent which is kind of neat. There are stickers that include the month/dates as well as some other functional ones. At first I was a little disappointed because it wasn't a calendar style planner, but the more I look at it, the more potential I see. I do tend to make a lot of lists, so why not keep them organized in this planner!?!

title: Good Boxes
text: I do a lot of shipping and these boxes are just perfect! They are easy to assemble and only require a little bit of shipping tape to keep them securely closed. Plus I love the pink color! I think it stands out. I would recommend these.

title: Nice Color
text: We do a lot of shipping. These pink boxes add some color to mail! The color is pink, but does have a tone on tone striping effect. The boxes are easy to put together and require minimal packing tape for shipping. They are thinner than some other similar boxes that I have ordered, but they are still a good quality.

title: So Easy to Install
text: We're in the process of putting in hard flooring upstairs. My husband and I both have our home offices up there and use rolling chairs. We considered getting mats to go on the floor under our desks but when we heard about these types of wheels, we wanted to go that route. These are so easy to install. It took less than 5 minutes for my husband to put them on his chair. It does raise the chair a little, but that's not an issue as the chair can easily be adjusted. They are sturdy and glide easily. We are very pleased with these and need to order a set for my chair!

title: Cute!
text: My daughter sells her unwanted clothes online. She likes to use poly mailers to ship her stuff. She always gravitates toward the fun, colorful poly mailers. She loves these cow print ones. The adhesive strip adheres well. The bags haven't ripped at the seams during use. I'm sure they bring some smiles to the postal workers!

title: Sturdy
text: My husband owns a business. He has a booth at a few trade shows each year. We plan to use this sign at his booth to attract customers. The sign comes in pieces, but it's fairly easy to assemble. It also easy enough to take back apart which is what we need for the trade shows. We ship everything to and from the event so we need it to be compact for shipping. When it's assembled, it's pretty sturdy. The base is heavy and should be more than adequate support. The stand looks nice and professional. Now we have to create our signs to go into the frame.

title: Buffalo Plaid Mailers
text: I use a lot of poly mailers. I try to use fun looking ones. I really like these buffalo plaid ones. They are a good quality. The adhesive strip closure fastens securely. The bags seem durable. They look great in the mail!

title: Pretty Art Work
text: The art work on this calendar is very pretty. It's a large calendar that is more decorative than functional. It's not one where you would keep track of your events. I use a planner as my calendar, so I have this hanging in my home office. I can easily look up at it to see the date when needed.

title: It Works!
text: My daughter lives away at college. She sells a lot of her old clothes on Poshmark. She doesn't have a printer in her apartment, so she has to trek over to the office if she wants to print anything such as labels. It's not always convenient to do so. Now she can print labels from her room! She has a Mac. We followed the steps for setting it up and it wasn't working. Basically it wasn't recognizing the printer and it wasn't showing up as available. My husband emailed customer support and they finally got it working. She ended up having to download an app to her iPhone and prints from her phone. She's thrilled that it is working! The shipping labels come out nicely. She is pleased.

title: It's Tape!
text: There's not a whole lot to say - it's tape! I would say that it's a mid range quality. It's not the cheap kind nor is it the super expensive kind either. It's the kind I would buy on a normal basis. It arrived just in time for wrapping presents!

title: Great Planner!
text: I have tried several different types of planners, but The Happy Planners are my favorite. They are flexible and fun to use. This one is my preferred style with the vertical layout. There are 3 blocks so I can divide up my day by morning/afternoon/evening or personal/work/health. This planner is cute, too! I am looking forward to starting the new year with it.

title: Nice Cards
text: These Thomas Kinkade/Mickey Mouse cards are cute. They have a good weight to them. I was expecting them to be flat without any embellishing, but they all of glitter which not only adds some sparkle, but a little texture and dimension, too. The artwork is typical for Thomas Kinkade. The sentiment inside is simple and there's plenty of room to write your own greetings as well. There are light grey envelopes included.

title: Great To Do List
text: I have been looking for the perfect "to-do" list. This may be it! First of all, it has a nice hard back cover. The binding is spiral and the pages are perforated for easy removal. There's room to put 36 items plus 8 more priority ones. I've been having difficulties finding the motivation to get things done. I respond well to to-do lists and I love checking things off when they are completed. I will even add things that I have already done (that wasn't on my list) so I can have the satisfaction of checking it off. There's so much room for tasks, that I can easily put on even the most mundane/simple ones. Then anything that I don't complete, I can just add to the next day. I am very pleased with with the layout and format.

title: Large Bags
text: My daughter likes selling her old clothes online. Poly mailer bags are a great way to ship clothing, especially bulky items. These bags are large and would work well for jackets, sweaters, and some coats. She is very Eco-Minded and loves that these are biodegradable. The bags seal well. The pink marble design is very pretty.

title: Good Quality
text: The quality of this meal planner is good. The cover is sturdy and attractive. The spiral binding is excellent and doesn't bend easily at all. The thickness of the paper is above average. When you have it open to a 2 page spread, the left size is your grocery list. There are 2 columns and there is a bubble for you to check off items as you get them. There's also room at the bottom for notes. Then the right side is the meal planning. It has spaces for breakfast, lunch, dinner, and snacks. I personally wish it didn't include all that. I primarily plan just my dinners. Because there are 4 meals, the space per meal is really small. If you are meal tracking, then all of those spaces would be useful. My first week just looks bare because it only has writing under the dinner column. Another thing, it says you can tear the pages out, but they're not perforated, so you're left with mess you get when tearing paper out of spiral notebooks. It's not a bad planner, but not perfect for me.

title: Decent Quality
text: When I got these, I immediately noticed that they are basically ID holders. I've gotten many like this at trade shows and conventions over the years. I was worried that they were being sold for a ridiculous price but at the time of my writing this, they were listed at $3.99 for a 5 pack. So you may be able to get them cheaper if you were ordering in bulk, but I found the price to be reasonable. The vinyl is sturdy. The last time I went to a trade show, the ID holders were super cheap and flimsy. These are much nicer than those. These have a ziploc type seal. They aren't going to easily rip or tear. They are going to protect your vaccine record. Since there are 5, everyone in my family of four can have one and we have one left over.

title: Smooth Writing
text: The other day I couldn't find any black permanent markers. I didn't understand - we should have had a lot. I have a fondness for buying writing implements! Well, I asked my husband and he said he had a few in the garage in his tool box. I went to the garage and found over 15 black permanent markers! I reclaimed most of them. These are for him, well most of them. These write smoothly. They can write on all kinds of surfaces. They're just a good work marker.

title: Great!
text: My husband had a trade show last week. He used one of these to display a flyer on his table. It looks nicer than the all acrylic ones, plus it's much easier to travel with because it's 2 pieces so the frame part can lay flat and you don't risk cracking or breaking the stand portion. The frame is covered in protective plastic, so we didn't even remove that until we were setting up the booth. I recommend these!

title: Great for Displays
text: My husband recently had a booth at a trade show. He used a few of these acrylic sign holders to display features of his products. He had some old ones that were beginning to crack from being stored, so he was happy to have some new, unbroken ones. They stack up well for storing.

title: Beautiful Poly Bags
text: My daughter likes to resell her old clothes and uses poly bags to ship them. These bags are a little larger than most that we have, which is perfect for bulkier clothing types such as sweatshirts or jackets. The bags are durable. The adhesive strips work well. We love the watercolor floral design!

title: Writes Smoothly
text: These ink pens from Zebra write smoothly. The ink flows immediately and doesn't require any shaking or doodling to get started. Great pens!

title: Great!!
text: My husband owns a business. I do his weekly shipping and I have wanted a more eco friendly alternative to the standard packing tape. This tape is great! It works well. It has a good adhesion. I like that I can tear it off the roll rather than relying on scissors. I'm so glad that I don't have to use that tape dispenser any more! I have cut my fingers on it more times than I would care to remember!

title: Great Turtle Postcards!
text: My daughter is studying wildlife biology at college. She loves all things animals. She also really likes the vintage style illustrations such as these post cards. The cards are a good quality of card stock. The pictures are gorgeous! My daughter is using some of these to decorate her room.

title: Beautiful Stationary!
text: I still send letters. I like writing to my elderly father and uncle, to my young nieces and nephew, and my daughter who is away at college. It's fun to get real mail! This stationary set has 6 different designs. Each design comes with a coordinated envelope. There is enough for 2 pieces of paper per envelope. The envelopes seal at the end not the top. The paper is not lined, but there is adequate space to write.

title: Nice Illustrations
text: These planner stickers have nice illustrations. I like the variety of the stickers, including the Black Lives Matter and the Juneteenth ones. I appreciate that they are current and timely as far as their themes. The stickers are a good quality. They are printed on glossy paper. I recommend these!

title: Works Great!
text: This is a large OPEN sign. It works great! I like that it has a remote control which is convenient.  There are holes above the sign to hang on nails or other hardware. The sign light can be on in a solid mode or flashing.

title: Tons of Stickers!
text: There are tons of stickers in this set. They're a mix of matte and glossy ones. The planner ones with goals, appointments, bills, etc. are the matte ones so you can write on them. The holiday ones, reminders, and  events that don't have space to write on are printed on glossy paper. The size would work in small to medium sized planners. I do like that the holidays are updated and include a Juneteenth one.

title: Useful
text: These clothing size labels are very useful. They have a good adhesion to them. Their size is perfect for being able to read it without my glasses! Just what I needed!

title: Updated Label Maker
text: My husband has had a Brother label maker for years. There are so many things I like about this updated version. First of all, the shape is better. The old one was wider and a little bigger. It was definitely a 2 handed gadget. This one is more of a one handed unit. I like that it has the wrist strap, though it is a bit bulky to wear around your wrist for very long. Most of the controls or buttons are the same, but this one has features that the other doesn't. This one can make cable flags and tags. This is awesome! My husband plans to label all of his computer and accessory cables. The only thing I don't like about it is that it requires batteries and doesn't include them. So many items have a battery inside and you just have to charge it with a USB cable (which you could label!). Traditional batteries is so yesterday. Plus, it requires 6 batteries so it exhausted all of my AAA size ones. Other than that, I am very pleased and happy with this label maker.

title: Easy to Assemble
text: My husband owns a business and has to ship supplies regularly. These boxes are easy to assemble and don't require packing tape to do so. We do add a little tape at the end to ensure that it stays shut, but none is needed to put them together. These boxes are a little thinner than other similar ones we have used. I would say that they have an adequate thickness and are not flimsy. It's just not as heavy duty as some others. The white looks professional. Once assembled, they stay put and don't fall apart. Overall, these are decent.

title: Good Size
text: I ordered this to replace an older magnetic wipe board that I have used for years. The old one had a lot of ink stains and ghosting on it so I decided it was time for a fresh new one. This one has a lot of space to write things down. I like the weekly view. It helps me to organize  my week. This comes with a couple of markers, but I have ones that I like better that I am using. Overall, this is a good size and decent quality.

title: Sturdy!
text: This TV cart is very sturdy. Assembly was straight forward and fairly quick. It easily supports the TV without any problems. Right now we have an older TV (that's not as thin as the current models) and it holds it securely. The wheels roll well. My husband likes being able to take the TV outside on the patio to watch sports with his friends. This cart makes that a lot easier. Then when it's not being used outside, he just rolls it into the basement workout area so it can be utilized when working out. There's a shelf that can hold a laptop on it which is a nice addition.

title: Great Lanyard!
text: This is a great lanyard by Vera Bradley. I have several VB lanyards, but I think this wider one is my favorite. It's comfortable to wear. It doesn't rub up against the back of my neck like some lanyards do. You also get a lot of the detail in the fabric because of the width. It has a key ring and a lobster claw hardware on it. It's very durable and sturdy. The stitches are even and straight. I am very pleased with it.

title: Cute Little Boxes
text: These are cute little boxes. They are easy to fold. Adhesive is not needed to assemble and close it, however, if I was shipping these, I would secure the sides with a wide shipping tape. The assembled boxes are sturdy. I love the pink color!

title: Nice Quality Postcards
text: This is an interesting set of vintage styled postcards. They are a nice quality. I selected this for the botanical, mushroom, and butterfly cards. My daughter plans to use some of them in decorating her room next year. The description mentions the types of cards in this set, but I didn't pay attention to it. So when I was looking through them, I thought it was an odd set. In addition to the botanical & butterfly themed ones, there is one with Christmas sheet music. There are about 10 or so that just don't have the same vibe as the rest of them.

title: Whimsical!
text: I'm borderline crazy cat lady, so when I saw these notepads, I had to have them! They are fun and whimsical. The shadow cat on each pad intentionally interferes with the lines on the lined paper. Because that's what cats would do! The quality of the notepads is excellent. The paper is heavy and thick. It's the great size for jotting down notes. These would make a great gift for any cat lover!

title: Great Little Boxes!
text: These are great little boxes! I love that they have adhesive already on them so you don't have to mess with the packing tape! The boxes are easy to fold into shape. They are small enough that they will fit in a standard mailbox.

title: Cute Meal Planner Pad
text: I plan my meals out weekly and then I put together my shopping list. This is a nice pad that allows you to do both. The shopping list side isn't large enough for my weekly shopping. I do have to use the back of it. The menu side is sized well. I could probably get by with a slightly smaller menu side and a larger shopping list. The paper is perforated and tears alright. The weight of the paper is a bit thin. I think a heavier paper would tear better. The floral design is attractive and cheery.

title: Fun Postcards!
text: These are fun postcards! They have a retro space age theme to them. My husband has selected a few of them to hang in his office. The quality of the postcards is very good. They are a thick card stock. The images are colorful and futuristic. By futuristic, I'm going with the 1950's version of what the future looked like.

title: Excellent Boxes!
text: My husband owns a home business and does have to ship products now and then. These boxes are excellent! They look very professional. They can be fully assembled without using packing tape! We are very impressed with these.

title: Just What We  Needed
text: My daughter has a bookshelf that is open ended and requires the use of bookends or the books will fall over. These clear acrylic book ends are just what we needed. They give the illusion that the books are standing up on their own. These are sturdy. There were little adhesive feet that keep them from sliding. We are pleased.

title: Works Well
text: My husband has a home based business. Every once in a while, he has to ship supplies to customers. We started using similar honeycomb cushion wrap and love it! It comes kind of compressed. You gently pull it out to get it to stretch. It's easy to wrap around items. We love that it's Eco-friendly. A roll this size lasts a long time!

title: Nice Quality
text: My daughter has a book shelf in her bedroom that is open on the ends. She's wanted some neutral bookends to hold her books in place. This set has 4 bookends, not 8 as in the description. With 4, she was able to get 2 shelves squared away. They are a nice quality and very sturdy. They came with little sticker grips to go on the bottom so they don't slip.

title: Stay Put
text: I read a lot. I like these bookmarks because they stay put. The colors and prints are okay. I think they could have done better on that, but what they have is okay. The magnets work well, but they are a little difficult to open and separate so you can use. There are 30 bookmarks here, so there's plenty to share!

title: Great Lanyard!
text: I have several Vera Bradley lanyards. This is a breakaway style. The quality is excellent. I love the new Rainforest Canopy fabric! It's very cheerful and perfect for summer.

title: Easy Peasy!
text: Ordering the essential school supply kit makes back to school shopping easy peasy! This kit is full of the commonly requested school supplies for 4th and 5th graders. There may be a few things you need to get that are special to your school or teacher, but the basics are covered. The quality of items is good. As a former teacher, I would be pleased if my students has these items. As a mom, it definitely simplifies things.

title: Comfortable
text: I just had the worst hemorrhoids ever. I could barely sit. I looked at many of the local stores in search of a donut pillow but the only ones I could find were inflatable. I'm a plus size woman and an inflatable pillow just wasn't going to do it. This is a sturdy pillow that you can sit on without worrying about it deflating! It's comfortable and prevents pressure on the sensitive area. This arrived at the end of my painful experience, but I'm going to be ready next time!

title: Sending Cheer in the Mail!
text: With colorful mailers like this, I feel like I'm sending cheer in the mail! The bags are comparable to others that I have used. The adhesion is good. The seams are strong. It's really more fun shipping things in pretty poly bags!

title: Cute Notecards
text: These are cute little notecards! The card stock is a good mid-weight. They're thick enough that normal writing doesn't bleed through. They have rounded corners which makes for an interesting shape.  The cards are primarily white with a colored border. There are 4 different colors of cards and 2 colors of the envelopes.

title: So Convenient!
text: Ordering school supplies this way is so convenient! We haven't gotten the supply list for next year, but this looks like a lot of the usual supplies that we'll be expected to have. Some of the brands are name brand while others are brands I'm not familiar with. We received everything shown in the pictures. We may have to add a few things once we have our school/grade specific lists, but for the most part, we're done!

title: Great for Outdoor Labs
text: My daughter is studying wildlife biology. She has a lot of outdoor labs that take place rain or shine. She likes using these notebooks because they're not effected by rain like regular paper. It's easy to write on these pages. The notebooks are small and don't take up a lot of room.

title: Great Planner
text: I have been using The Happy Planner products for the last few years. I ordered this one for my college student/daughter to use. It follows the academic year and starts in July. The vertical layout has a block style so you have 3 blocks per day to organize your life. On the sides of each page layout, the space has a dot background so you can use bullet journal techniques nicely in that space. The quality of the planner is excellent. The page thickness is good and I have found that most markers don't bleed through. My daughter is excited to start using this one!

title: Small Size, But Works Well
text: This desk requires assembly. It took my husband less than 30 minutes to put it together from start to finish. The finished desk is sturdy. The size is a bit small, but the airlift feature works well. We got this for our 23 year old son. He spends a lot of time on the computer with school and gaming. He's got a table set up right next to this to hold the overflow of gear that he needs to access but doesn't fit on this one. The overall quality of this desk is good and aesthetically it looks great!

title: Love the Dashboard Style
text: I am very excited to have this new Happy Planner. I have never used the dashboard style layout. I like the idea of having 1 "to do" list for the week rather than a daily one. Same goes for the shopping & errand lists. The larger size is nice too. I've always used the classic ones but this gives me so much more space. I like to add small pics to my planner so it becomes a keepsake. I used to scrapbook, but the planner with a few pictures is all that I can dare to keep up with these days. The quality of this planner is what I expect from the Happy Planner line of products.

title: Great Stickers!
text: I am a long time fan of The Happy Planner. I have many of their sticker books. I like the modern take on leopard print that these stickers have. There's a good variety of stickers. Some have the clear background and some have a solid color. The stickers are a good quality and what I expect from the brand. I can't wait to start using these in my planner!

title: Tons of Stickers!
text: I have been quite impressed with this set of stickers. First of all, there are so many stickers! There's holidays, occasions, work, errands, productivity, seasons, and more. Secondly, I was pleased to see several of them were printed on matte paper instead of glossy. Those ones were the ones with spaces to write on. I appreciate that so I don't have to worry about using the right markers so they don't smear. The stickers are all vibrant and colorful. They have good adhesion. This is really a great set of stickers to have!

title: Beautiful Planner
text: I have been using The Happy Planner products for a few years now. I love them! This one is a beautiful planner. The product description says this is a dashboard layout, but it's actually a vertical one. I was really looking forward to giving the dashboard one a try. Besides that little disappointment, the quality of the planner is on par with others in their product line. The pages are a good weight of paper. The flower designs are very pretty. These are great planners!

title: Nice Stickers
text: These planner stickers are nice. The fitness themed set has some different stickers that I have seen compared to other sets in addition to the standard fitness ones. The stickers are a good quality and are glossy. Because they're glossy, you do have to be careful with which markers you use if you are writing on them. The wrong marker will smear. The stickers are vibrant. Overall, I am pleased with them.

title: Adorable To Do List Notepad!
text: This is an adorable to-do list notepad! The otter design and pun is fun. There's plenty of space to write your daily to-dos. The paper quality is decent. This is a great tool to help you get organized.

title: Great Layout!
text: I am a fan of Happy Planner! I've been using their planners for the last few years. I do like the vertical layouts over the horizontal one. This layout is an updated vertical one. Instead of the 3 blocks per day, it's one large block. I that that's an improvement! I like to use stickers and this gives you more freedom with the sticker placement. I also like the addition of the lines. It helps with getting the stickers straight as well as providing lines for writing. The quality of this planner is what I expect from The Happy Planner brand. The leopard print is fun! The paper is thick enough that there's not any bleed through with most markers that I use. This is an 18 month planner that starts in July.

title: Great Colors!
text: I have a few magnetic white boards on my refrigerator. One is for the family's schedule, another is for meals, and the third is a shopping list. My previous set of markers were running low on ink. These markers are nice and juicy! They write well. The tips have a firm point that doesn't get smashed easily. The magnets work strongly and keep the markers on the refrigerator. I keep mine pointed down so the ink is near the tip. The colors are great!

title: Plenty of Cards for Your Greeting Card Needs
text: There are plenty of cards in this set of greeting cards. The cards are a good quality and a step above flat plain ones. These all have some type of layering or embellishments, but they aren't the super deluxe cards. They are not flimsy or cheap feeling. The are worthy of the Hallmark brand.

title: Simple But Cute
text: I am a pet lover and enjoy sending cards. These cards are pretty simple. There's no embellishments or layers, but the pet images are cute. The card stock is an average thickness. Envelopes are included. Cards are blank inside.

title: Lightweight
text: These page protectors are lightweight. They are not the super heavy thick ones, but they're not the flimsy, cheap ones either. I use page protectors to protect the pages in my recipe binder. Thick ones cause the binder to fill up too quickly, so I like to use ones like this. There are 200 page protectors in this set. These are good for everyday use.

title: Great Assortment of Cards
text: This is a great assortment of cards. The box includes many of the common occasions that you might need. There are also a lot of blank ones, too. The cards are decent. They're not the cheap dollar store type. However,  they're not premium, high end cards either. They are pretty basic. There's no layering at all. Some of the cards have foil accents. The thickness of the cards is good. There are 3 different colors of envelopes. With 100 cards, this should keep you going for a while.

title: Nice Set
text: This is a nice set. The daily to-do list pad is probably more than I need on any average single day, however, I've been using it for the times when I do need to make a longer list. The pens are awesome! They're fine tip and work well in my planner. I haven't noticed any bleed through from them. The stickers are pretty basic, but they are useful. It's definitely a good value for the set.

title: Colorful Variety
text: This is a colorful variety of lanyards. The clips are not attached and you have to do that yourself. It wasn't hard, but it is something that you have to do. The lanyards are sturdy and do a good job of securing your mask.

title: Great Bookmarks!
text: These are great bookmarks. The magnets work well and keep the bookmarks in place. They don't fall out and lose your spot. The images are fun and whimsical. There are plenty of bookmarks to share!

title: Excellent Quality Note Pad!
text: I go through a lot of notepads. The quality of these notepads is very impressive. The spiral wire is sturdy and doesn't seem to bend easily. The paper is quite heavy and much thicker than most notepads that I have used. The pages are perforated so you can remove them without too much difficulty. The cover is thick and protects well. I am curious if they have larger notepads since this is about a half size.

title: Easy to Attach to Your Mask
text: These mask lanyards are the easiest lanyards to attach to your masks. They use a snap closure. I have troubles with some of the metal clips and the plastic ones come off too easily. I have not had any issues with these coming undone while wearing them. The assortment of colors is neutral. I am very pleased with these!

title: Child Friendly Lanyards!
text: I've been staying with my sister to help with her kids while she's recovering from surgery. The kids are back in person to school and are required to wear masks. The youngest is in first grade and has lost several masks during the short time back in school. I ordered these in hopes that she would not misplace any more. These are definitely child friendly lanyards. They are cute and nicely decorated. The clips are easy enough for a child to use but also secure enough that they won't come undone until you want them to. My sister wishes that we had discovered these sooner!

title: Bright Colors
text: I have a thing for markers. I find it difficult to resist buying new ones! I am very fond of Paper Mate Flair Pens. These markers have a strange wide tip. The round shape allows you to fill in more surface area. It's a little tricky dealing with small corners. The colors are bright and cheery. They do bleed through paper a bit. I tried them in my planner (Happy Planner) as well as in a coloring book. Light colors are less noticeable on the other side than the brighter ones. My coloring book pages are one sided so there was no harm, but my planner is double sided and I had to be careful where I wrote so it wouldn't detract from the other side. Overall, I do like these.

title: Productivity Assortment
text: This is an assortment of basic productivity stickers. The stickers are a decent quality. They adhere well to my planner. They aren't difficult to peel off from the sheets. The images are simplistic and would compliment a variety of planner themes.

title: Good Basic Business Size Envelopes
text: This is a large box of good basic business size envelopes. The envelopes are comparable to ones that I have purchased at the local store. They don't have the adhesive strip, so you do have to seal them the old fashioned way. They seem to stay closed well. They are security envelopes to protect the contents from being visible. With 500 envelopes, we should be set for a while!

title: Fun To-Do Pad
text: This is a fun to-do pad. It's colorful and cheery. There's a space for every day of the week. There are bubbles next to each line so you can check off what you accomplish. I've been having fun making my to-do list every week with this pad!

title: Great Variety of Thinking of You Cards
text: This is a great variety of Thinking of You cards. The quality of the cards is very good. They're printed nicely. The thickness of the card stock is appropriate. I have a couple of older relatives in long term care facilities and these cards are perfect to send to them, as well as to you daughter who is away at college. The cards are all bright and cheery which we can all use!

title: Some Bleed Through
text: I have an addiction to markers. I love to buy them. Paper Mate Flair Tips are some of my favorites. I was excited to give these new, bold tips a try. The color assortment is great. The tips are strangely shaped. They're round bulb type tips.  They write smoothly. I have noticed some bleed through. My first trials were with regular copy paper. There's a lot of bleed through on that with all the colors. Then I tried it in my planner. I use the Happy Planner and the pages are a good thickness. The lighter colors such as the yellows, didn't bleed through, but the darker colors like the royal blue, did. For my planner, I prefer a finer tip anyway, but I did want to give it a try. These would be perfect for adult coloring books!

title: Perfect for Shipping Packages!
text: My husband and I save the packing material that we get from our packages. Lately it seems like we get mostly the air packs instead of the kraft paper. We find that the kraft paper works best for shipping items for my husband's home business. I have started using this wrap now. It's perfect! We can decide how long we want it to be and cut it to size. Then when you gently pull on it, it expands. When it's expanded, it gives a little cushion. I like this type of packing material!

title: Nice Quality
text: My family has had fun with this travel map. It's a wrapped canvas style print on a wooden base. My husband used Command Strips to hang it up and it seems to be staying put without any troubles. It comes with 2 colors of pins. My husband and I decided to use this as a family map. The kids are both in college and have gone places without us, so we wanted to include them. I ordered additional pins so we would have more colors. The pins stick into the map okay. I have had some trouble with a few that are directly over the wooden base, but they did eventually go in enough. While I do like this, I do think it's a bit pricey for what it is. It has given us some motivation to see more of the United States!

title: Fun Stickers!
text: I really like these planner stickers. They fit in my Happy Planner quite nicely. They're colorful and bright. The adhesion is good. They're easy to remove from the sheet without tearing. I am pleased with these.

title: Great for Post-It Users!
text: I jot down things on Post-Its all the time. I used to stick them the  top edge of my desk, but I like this way better. You get 2 plastic boards, one for each side of your monitor. My monitor is curved in the back so I had to move it in a little bit for it to lay flat. The adhesive strip that holds it to the monitor is adequate. It comes with an assortment of sticky notes. The owls on top are cute, but I would really love to see other options.

title: Works with My HP Printer
text: I thought this would be a fun way to make photo cards to send to my daughter who is away at college. It did take some trial and error to get the image lined up correctly. I didn't use any special software, I just printed it from Google Photos. I would have liked more guidance on how to do it, but I didn't see anything on the package or in the printed handout to help me. My card turned out cute, but I did waste one because it printed out the wrong way. I had to get my tech savvy husband involved to help me print it out so I didn't waste any more blank cards!

title: A Wrist Lanyard that Actually Fits My Wrist!
text: This is a wrist lanyard that actually fits my wrist! I don't usually wear my keychains around my wrist, but it's nice to know that I could if I wanted to. The pink color of this is more of an orangey coral color. I like it, it's just not pink in my opinion. The hardware is securely attached to the lanyard. I tugged on it quite hard and it didn't budge. I am happy to replace my old key chain with this nice one!

title: Good Quality
text: I have been printing out photos to send to my elderly father during the pandemic. I was printing them out on just regular printer paper, but now I can print them out on glossy photo paper. The colors are more vibrant than on the paper. These work well in my HP ink jet printer. With 100 sheets, I should be set for a while!

title: Cute Mailers!
text: These are super cute mailers! They are colorful and fun. They seem a little thin, but they passed my test of tearing on them. The adhesive is adequate. These are unique because they have handles. The handle is on the side opposite of the opening side with the adhesive. Overall, I like these.

title: Makes Decent Stickers
text: I have been printing my own stickers for my planner. The first one of these I used didn't load correctly in my printer and was jammed in the printer. I have printed a few more times since then without any difficulties. I do like that the sticker paper is divided into sets of 10 and each set is individually packaged so you're not messing up unused papers. I printed out small photos to stick in my planner and that worked pretty well. The images were glossy like real photos, though they weren't as crisp. They were more than adequate for my planner. They adhere well. Overall, I am pleased.

title: Fun Designs!
text: I love using colorful or printed bags for shipping. These poly bags have fun designs. The adhesive strips work as expected. The quality of the bags is comparable to other poly bags. These are just more fun to send!

title: What a Great Card!
text: Valentine's Day is coming up so I'm prepared! This card will be perfect for my husband who is a space fan. The card is a good quality and thickness. There are no added embellishments, but the card does have some embossed accents. Inside, there is a sheet of fancy paper adhered to the card with the sentiment and space for you to write. What a great card!

title: Very Good!
text: I have started printing out little photo stickers for my planner. I started by using matte vinyl sticker paper and they were okay, but washed out looking. I switched to this vinyl sticker paper and the difference is amazing. It nearly looks like real photo paper quality. The adhesiveness works well.  My ink jet printer works fine with it. I am loving the look of these in my planner!

title: Great for Posters!
text: I had a couple of laminated posters hanging up on my wall in the workout area. I had used the poster Command strips for them, with one in each corner. One of the posters completely fell down within a few days and the other one was barely hanging on. I replaced the adhesive with this Nano tape and I am very pleased with the results. The poster is adhering quite well. None of the corners have come up and the poster itself is still taut and straight. The tape rolls are very sticky. They have a plastic sheet on the ends which I ended up saving and keeping on the rolls because otherwise, little stuff gets stuck to it. The tape cuts easily with scissors. It doesn't damage the paint or the surface of the walls when you remove it. I am very much impressed with Nano tape!

title: Cute!
text: My nieces and nephew all love Pokemon. I plan to send them each one of these. I know they will love the sticker sheets! These are post card style cards (one side) but they do come with an envelope. They are not the mini-size that kids use for their class exchanges. They're more of a regular card size, but not full greeting card size. These are cute cards and would be great for Pokemon fans!

title: Great!
text: I am very excited about these cards. My elderly father is living in an independent living home but he's currently in quarantine since he's a new arrival. These cards have been great! I have sent a couple of them to him already. I call him daily, but I know he's enjoying getting the mail. Since he can't leave his room, he gets his mail slipped under his door for the time being. These cards aren't fancy, but they're timely and appropriate for these times.

title: Nice Basic Cards
text: These Valentine cards are nice basic cards. There are no embellishments, but the artwork is fun and the sentiments are appropriate. I think these are geared toward tweens and teens. The cards are a decent thickness and don't feel cheap. This is a good value.

title: Wow!
text: I've seen a commercial for a similar tape called Alien Tape. I was skeptical of it. But after using some, I am very impressed. Before this, I would use Command strips for hanging up things damage free. I like having alternatives. I used this to hang a Happy Birthday garland up on my son's birthday. I didn't want to use Command strips for a one time, very short term thing. I was going to get some masking tape because that usually doesn't damage the walls either, but I was concerned that it wouldn't hold well because of the weight of the garland. It wasn't a heavy garland, but it does have a little bit of weight to it. Then I remembered that I had this tape. It has a protective covering to keep the stickiness clean and unused. It cuts easily with regular scissors. It's also clear so it's not very noticeable. I left the garland up for about a week, out of laziness on my part. It was up high and required the step stool to put it in place. This tape was very easy to remove and it didn't leave any trace of its existence behind. It did get bunched up a bit when I was removing it, so I couldn't reuse it easily, but that wasn't a concern anyway because I have a whole roll of this stuff! This will be awesome in my daughter's dorm room! Or in classrooms! I'm impressed!

title: Very Cute Cards!
text: With the pandemic going on, I've been sending out more cards than usual. It's something I can do to feel connected to my loved ones who live in other states since I'm not able to visit them. These cards are perfect! They're regular card sized and not the usual smaller Valentine size. They're pretty basic with no foil or embellishments. There are 4 different designs and they're all sea creature themed. I can send my nieces and nephew each their own card as well as ones to my father and other elderly relatives. I'm sure that these will brighten their day!

title: Lots of Phrases
text: I was very excited about this self inking stamp, but it didn't live up to my expectations. The first thing was that the ink wasn't already installed. That's not the end of the world. I can understand why it wasn't already installed. However, there were no instructions showing you how to install it! I have never installed the ink to a self-inking stamp before. Well, let me tell you, it's a very messy task! I ended up with black ink all over my hands and I still couldn't figure it out. My husband took over and was finally able to get it in place, but not without getting black ink on his hands, too. The actual stamp produces a nice, clear image. There are a lot of phrases that pertain to finances or business stuff. To switch words, there's a small crank like piece that you have to turn. I found it to be very difficult to turn. I was unable to change words at all. Again, my husband stepped in and was finally able to do so. It just wasn't very easy.

title: Great Boxes!
text: I frequently ship packages and always need a variety of box sizes. I try to reuse boxes as often as I can, but sometimes the right size box isn't available. These boxes are small and perfect for many items. They seem comparable to other boxes as far as quality goes. This size should easily fit inside a standard mailbox.

title: Good Assortment
text: This pack of stickers has a good assortment. They are primarily budget/money themed, but there are some that are more along the lines of motivational. The quality of the stickers is good. They fit in my Happy Planner.

title: Smooth Writing
text: These pens write smoothly. I haven't noticed any hitches with my writing. I really like the idea that they have suppress bacteria growth. I didn't have a way to actually test it, so I am taking their word for that. My daughter is a waitress and she provides her own pens for customers to sign their checks. These are perfect for that! During Covid, she's been super careful about wiping down her pens in between customers. These pens won't entirely replace that, but as the pandemic improves and things change, these will be perfect! In the meantime, we're using them around the house.

title: Fun for Your Office Desk
text: These mood signs are fun for your office desk. The collection of pictures and sayings has a foldout base to hold it up. The pictures flip over and are two sided. So you can have one picture facing your work area and the other can face  out to the rest of the office. The majority of the pictures are of cute dogs and cats.

title: Lovely Artwork
text: I use a planner style calendar, but I do like being able to glance up and see the calendar without having to get my planner. I have this sitting on my desk in my home office. It has lovely artwork that adds some fun and color to my office. My only complaint is that the actual calendar part with the dates is really small and hard to see. I often have to pick it up to bring it closer in order to see it.

title: Fun Stationary!
text: My daughter is in college and likes to write letters to her friends and cousins. This is a fun stationary set. It looks just like the pictures. The paper is a little thin - you probably want to stick with writing on just one side. We love the gradient colors! The envelopes have color inside to coordinate.

title: Great Assortment of Stickers!
text: This is a great assortment of planner stickers! The artwork is great. The quality of the stickers is very nice. The stickers are divided into seasons and there are plenty of great options to choose from. It's always fun having new stickers!!

title: A Black Sharpie for All of Your Sharpie Needs!
text: This set of permanent markers has a black Sharpie for all of your Sharpie Needs! There are 3 different sizes of Sharpies -there's the regular and original size Sharpie, then there's the super fine one which works well for addressing envelopes or writing in my planner, then there's the super thick one that's great for making posters! All of your needs are covered. I go through a lot of Sharpies at my house and black is the color I use the most. These work just as I expected. I am happy!

title: Didn't Know I Needed This and Now I Can't Live Without It!
text: I didn't know I needed this type of mousepad. And now after using it for a week, I can't live without it. It's very comfortable. I thought it might be awkward to use, but it's not. I love the pretty floral print. The other side is slightly tacky so it doesn't slip or move around. I am very happy with this mousepad!

title: Great for Cat Fans
text: This is a cute box/organizer and it's great for cat fans. There were no instructions at all, nor was there a picture of the finished product to work with. I had to look online to see what it was supposed to look like.  The pieces have extended parts that fit into slots. Then there are elastic type bands that you put over the extended part to keep it in place. Those keep it from looking really awesome, in my opinion.

title: Prints Well
text: This sticker paper prints well with my ink jet printer. The images are matte and look good. My daughter has been having fun make her own stickers with these. The description says that it's waterproof, but it doesn't seem to be. The ink has smeared when it has gotten wet. We're going to look into a sealant as some of the other reviewers have suggested.

title: No Assembly Required!
text: Storing all of my lettering and journaling markers has been an issue. This holds a lot of them! It doesn't hold all of my markers, but definitely a good percentage. I love that I can store the ink at an angle. I hope that helps prevent them from drying out. Most of my markers have a color spot on the end so I can see the color without having to take the pen out. The unit is sturdy and comes ready to use, no assembly required. There are some protective stickers that need to be removed, but that wasn't a problem removing. I like having easy access to my markers! And it looks much nicer having one storage unit of markers rather than a few different ones.

title: Great Mailers!
text: My daughter likes to sell her unwanted clothing on Poshmark. She was thrilled to get these bags because they are larger than all of the other bags we have. The size of these will allow her to ship items that she couldn't ship in bags before. The pink and gold polka dot design is cute and quite trendy. The bags are sturdy enough for her shipping needs. The adhesive strips work as intended.

title: Fun Gift Set!
text: This is a fun gift set for Starbucks Lovers. I decided to keep this for myself. I was drawn to the cute mug!
