The set comes with 2 small bags of ground coffee, some chocolate cookies and the mug. My husband loves these varieties of Starbucks coffees and they have tasted as expected. The cookies were okay. They did have a good chocolate flavor, but they're crisper than I personally prefer.

title: Does the Job
text: These mask lanyards are pretty basic, but they do the job. The length is good. They seem to be made well. While I would prefer a variety of colors, black makes more since and would go with more outfits.

title: Cute Stickers!
text: My daughter likes selling her unwanted clothing on Poshmark. She likes to wrap items nicely and include a personal note. These stickers are perfect for adding to the tissue paper and shipping box or bag. The stickers are a good quality. They have good adhesion. We love the colors and designs. There are 3 rolls of stickers and each roll has a different design.

title: Love the Pink Color!
text: Pink is my favorite color, so why not use it to ship things! These poly bags are comparable to other ones that I have used. The adhesive strip works fine. The seams are tight and secure. The pink color is lovely! I am very excited to have these colorful bags to ship things in!

title: Cute Christmas Cards
text: These Christmas cards are printed on heavy card stock. They are embellished with foil accents. The cards are perfect for Disney and Mickey fans!

title: Good Holiday Card
text: When my kids were younger, I liked sending out photo holiday cards. But now that they're both in college, it's difficult to arrange. Last year I started sending out regular cards. These Peanuts themed cards are simple. The quality of the cardstock is good. The cards are embellished with glitter. Overall, they are good holiday cards and worthy of being shared with friends and family.

title: Simple but Nice
text: These Thanksgiving cards are simple but nice. With the pandemic going on, we are not planning to see our family this holiday season. I will send these cards to them to let them know that we're thinking about them. The cards are notecard size as opposed to greeting card size. They are flat with no embellishment. The designs are attractive.

title: Fun Gift Set
text: I have become a crazy cat lady. This gift set is fun for crazy cat ladies like me! The set comes with a mouse pad, some cat shaped paper clips, sticky notes and the Meme flip book, which is my favorite! The quality of the items is decent. It's definitely a good value.

title: Cute Variety of Stickers
text: My 19 year old daughter likes selling stuff on Poshmark. She's all into the presentation of the items she's sending and likes to add a personal note. These stickers are perfect for that. She can use them to hold the tissue paper together or put it on a notecard. There is a cute variety of stickers. They have a decent adhesion. Overall, good stickers.

title: Cute Sticky Notes
text: I have a slight obsession with office and school supplies. I was very excited to add these sticky notes to my collection. They're super cute. They have an adequate stickiness to them. I am very happy with them!

title: Great for Students!
text: My daughter is a flash card studier. These are great for her! There are 4 "units". Each unit consists of a poly storage case, a set of index cards, dividers and label stickers for the tabs. The cases and dividers can be reused when you're finished with the index cards. The cards and dividers are thin, but adequate. The cards are college ruled. The cases are translucent so depending on what you put in them, you may be able to see the contents or at least see the subject of the cards.

title: Nice Quality Blank Book
text: This is a nice quality blank book. The pages are a good thickness. I really like that they're perforated so you can tear them out if needed. It has a cute cheetah print cover.

title: Larger than Expected
text: Yoobi is a fun brand of school and office supplies. I like the colorful products that they offer. This organizer is larger than I expected. It can fit paper that's 8x11 easily. There are a few pockets for storing items. This could be used in place of a padfolio or folder for a class. There's a zipper compartment on the back. It doesn't have any specific place for pens or pencils, though they can be stored in the larger rectangular pockets.

title: Cute!
text: Whenever we go on a trip, I put all of the important papers and such in a poly envelope. It's easy to keep track of things. These are a bit thin, but functional. They're really cute though. They are slightly translucent so you can see what's inside, though because of the decoration, you can't see all the details well. The envelopes have metal snaps which are not as easy to use as velcro or even plastic snaps. I also like to use folders like this for when I need to bring documents with me, such as going to the license branch. Papers are kept well and can't fall out.

title: Cute Folders!
text: These are cute file folders. They're definitely more fun than the standard manila ones. They're a little thin, but sturdy enough for their purpose.

title: Fun Assortment of Colors
text: My 19 year old daughter was visiting this weekend. While she was home, she saw theses highlighter markers. She loves to highlight her notes and books, so she went through the set and picked out several to take back to the dorm with her. I was happy that she left some for me. It's a fun assortment of colors. I've never been a fan of the typical yellow and orange highlighter. I usually gravitate to the pinks, blues, and purples. There are so many colors you can easily use them for color coding. The markers are small. The caps can be stuck onto the pens while you are using them. There's good ink flow. The markers aren't too juicy. The ink lets pen and pencil writing show through quite well. Great for sharing!

title: Love the Colors!
text: I've always preferred fun, colorful file folders over plain manila ones. I love the colors in this set. Each folder has a different color on the outside and another inside. You could use the colors for organizing, however, if you're like me, the colors are just for fun! There are 100 file folders in the box. The quality is comparable to other brand name file folders. I am very happy with these.

title: Nice Assortment of Colors
text: I am a long time fan of Paper Mate Flair markers. I have several sets of Flair Tip Pens and I love them! Unfortunately, I was disappointed with this set. The first marker that I took out and used was fine. It smelled yummy! It wrote nicely. Then I didn't touch the pens for a few days. Then this morning, I sat down to plan my meals and write up my shopping list. The first marker I grabbed today (second overall) didn't have any ink in it! I have included a picture. The light blue  one has a white tip whereas the others all have the appropriate colored tips. Since it had been a few days since I had used the first one, I sat there shaking it and thinking that it needed to be primed. Nothing. I then started checking the others and they were all fine. I tested them all out and they wrote as expected, except for the one without any ink. Of course, the one without ink happens to be one of my favorite colors! The scents are pretty light. There were a couple that I could barely even detect. The packaging does say that they are lightly scented. I did have to hold the pens at the far end so my hands were as far from the tips as possible because I kept smelling my hand soap instead of the markers on a few of them. I like these markers, but I wish they had all worked as expected.

title: Sturdy!
text: This acrylic shield/sneeze guard is really helpful during this time of Covid-19. It's a large size. It was very easy to put together. There are 2 feet and that just slip into the slots. Once the feet are in place, the shield is sturdy and doesn't wobble. The acrylic has protective paper on it to keep it from getting scratched during transport. The paper was not difficult to remove and just peeled off, though it did rip sometimes and I had to find new places to grab onto to pull. There is a pass through at the bottom which is bigger than I expected. If you work with little children (size not age), it may not be as effective at protecting because of the size of the opening. It just depends on how much higher than the table they are. Just something to consider. You could easily pass a text book or binder through the opening. Overall, I am pleased with this and how it works.

title: Works Well
text: This is a good way to store your mask on the go. The case easily fits a thick cloth mask (with a wire nose bridge piece). The case is easy to open open and latch. It's a slim case that you can slip into your purse or bag. Prior to receiving this, I was literally keeping a spare mask in a plastic baggy! This looks much nicer. With 4 of these, I was able to give one to everyone in my immediate family.

title: Just What I Needed!
text: I got a menu planner recently, but it wasn't really working for me. It had plenty of space to plan my meals and there was a space for my grocery list, but I couldn't tear the list out. Instead, I ended up copying it onto another piece of paper. This is just what I needed! It's got a strong magnet that holds it nicely on the refrigerator. There's also a pen holder on the side. The grocery list is perforated and tears pretty well. There is space for 7 days of menus. It also includes a water tracker, which I don't really need. It's working perfectly for what I need!

title: Writes Like a Pen!
text: These are the nicest mechanical pencils that I have ever written with! It writes like a pen! I was amazed at how smooth it writes. My 2 college kids divided the package between the both of them. The set comes with extra lead and erasers. It was a little tricky to figure out how to get the erasers to twist up at first.

title: Just What We Needed
text: My son started classes last week at the university. After one day, he came and asked me if I had any extra planners. I didn't, so I immediately took to the computer and found this one. It arrived quickly and he immediately got started on it. It has adequate space for what he needs. He is able to record his assignments, test schedules, and more. He's not picky about the layouts or other features. The calendar follows the school year. It also includes a sheet of stickers for quizzes, tests, and more. This is just what he needed.

title: Adequate
text: My college student son needed some page protectors for the new semester/year. He likes organizing his notes and handouts in the protectors inside binders. These are pretty thin as far as sheet protectors go, but they are adequate. They are top loading and it's easy to insert the pages. The quantity is good and should last him the whole year if not longer.

title: Does the Job!
text: I love planners! I use one of those fancy ones with stickers for my personal life. However, I was recently wanting something to keep track of some business stuff. This has a pretty basic format. There is a monthly layout each month and weekly layouts each week. It's a full size planner (8.5 x11) and there is plenty or room for everything. The pages are average and not as thick as my fancy planner. I keep bending the page corners. Overall, it's a decent, basic planner but it does the job!

title: Great Quality Packing Tape!
text: My husband owns a small home based business. He does have to ship supplies to his customers on occasion. This tape is much better than the cheap stuff I ordered last time. It's noticeably thicker and feels stronger. It adheres well. I don't feel the need to reinforce with multiple layers of packing tape. I definitely recommend this tape!

title: Nice Variety
text: This is a nice variety of thank you stickers specifically for small businesses. My daughter sells her unwanted clothes on Poshmark. She wraps the items in tissue paper and uses a sticker to keep the tissue paper in place. She also leaves a hand written thank you note on a small card and now she can decorate the card with a sticker. There are 2 different sizes of round stickers and then there's the rectangular one as well. The stickers are a good quality. The printing is clear. They adhere well.

title: Great Idea!
text: I personally wear cloth masks, but my husband and son prefer the disposable ones. I have a large Ziploc bag in their cars filled with a bunch of masks, but these containers are rigid and will keep them from getting bent up. You can fit about 5 masks per container. My son is keeping one in his backpack. While most of his college classes are online right now, he does have 2 that meet in person for one time each week. He keeps backup masks in it so if the one he wears rips (he has had problems with the elastic breaking every once in a while), then he can put on a clean one. I like the little plastic envelope so you can fold one up and keep it clean, too. It took me a while to figure out how to use it, but it works.

title: LOVE LOVE LOVE!
text: I am more than thrilled with this set of blank note cards! I LOVE LOVE LOVE it! There are 100 different blank cards. They are a little larger than I expected. I've gotten some other blank note cards recently which were smaller than these and so that's what I was expecting with this set. There is plenty of writing room. There's no duplicating cards which is nice. My daughter is away at college and I like to send her mail frequently. When using cards from sets, I often try to figure out which ones I've already sent her so I'm not sending the same one again. That usually requires counting and figuring out how many of each type there were to begin with. That's not an issue with this set. The set comes with a few different colors of envelopes. If you're like me, you try to match the envelope with the card. There are also gold seal stickers. The quality of the cards is good, too. It's a thicker card stock. I highly recommend these cards! I've already sent out 3 of them!

title: Fun Colors!
text: I have been a fan of Zebra markers for a while. I was very excited to give these a try! The set of 12 markers comes in fun and vibrant colors. There are little rubber stoppers on the ends that are there when you get them, but they are not intended to be used after you start writing with them. These are considered capless markers and they click like a ball point pen. They write smoothly. I haven't noticed any odors. I've been having fun using them in my planner!

title: Great Boxes!
text: I send a lot of packages. I try to re-use boxes whenever I can, but sometimes I just can't find the right sized one when I need it. These are great. This size box is great for care packages (my daughter is in college)! I enjoy drawing stuff on the box with permanent markers and these boxes are perfect for that! They assemble well and as expected.

title: Cute!
text: My daughter has a fairly small desk in her room. She wanted something new to organize her pens/pencils and such. This doesn't have a large footprint, so it doesn't take up too much of her desk space. She loves the rose gold color! There's enough room to store the things she needs to access frequently when doing her school work. And did I mention that it's cute??!!

title: Great for Small Spaces
text: This rolling cart is slim and great for small spaces. We thought it would be perfect for my daughter's dorm room. There were no instructions included nor was there a picture of the finished item. I looked online to show my husband the picture in the product description so he knew what it was supposed to look like. He was able to put it together relatively quickly. The finished cart fits nicely in our daughter's private dorm bathroom. It's not the sturdiest thing. It wobbles a bit. It does seem more stable now that she's filled it with products. It comes with some hooks to put on the edge of the top bin. There's enough space in between each level that you can store full size bottles of bath or cleaning products. It does the job!

title: Great Quality Notebook!
text: My daughter is getting ready to start her second year at college. She's taking Chemistry II in the first semester. While it's not organic or bio chemistry, she is looking forward to using this notebook for the class. She enjoys doing the little extras when it comes to note taking. She has implemented dot journal techniques in the past. This hexagon notebook is pretty cool just as it is, but it comes with some related stencils, too. The notebook is a great quality. The pages are fairly thick for notebook paper. The pages are perforated for easy tearing. She is excited to use this.

title: Bright Color
text: Colorful envelopes are more fun in my opinion. They stand out in the mail. These padded envelopes are comparable to other ones with the exception of the pretty color. They have a decent adhesive strip. The padding is adequate. Overall, I am pleased with them.

title: Love This!
text: I love this set of note cards! I had a similar one in bright colors several years ago and I used it all the time. The cards don't open up, they're almost like index cards, but a little sturdier. They're unlined. There's enough room to write a few sentences. The colors are lovely. I really like the selection of pastels. These are easier to write on (and see) than the bright ones that I had before. With those I had to make sure to use dark pens when writing. These you can use colored pens if you desire. There are coordinating envelopes. I suppose you could mix and match if you want. These are great to have on hand!

title: Decent Cards
text: These are decent cards. They're a good size and not too small. The thickness of the cardstock is adequate. The cards are pretty basic, with no embossing or other embellishments. The cards are blank inside with plenty of writing room. They're affordable and will do the job.

title: Nice Assortment of Cards
text: This is a nice assortment of cards. The cards themselves are smaller than the typical single card you would get at the store. They are simple no layered cards with a little bit of foil accents. This set includes thank you, thinking of you and birthday cards. All of them are blank inside so you can write your own sentiment. The set comes with pink envelopes.

title: Fun!
text: My daughter has been taking online college courses this summer. These Zebra highlighter pens have added a little fun to her school work. The tip is not very broad, but adequate for highlighting words. If you want to completely cover a word, a second "drive by" might be necessary. The sparkle feature is subtle. It's not glittery in every mark made, but there are flecks of sparkle scattered across your markings. The colors don't interfere with reading the text. My daughter likes them enough that she said she'll take them back to campus with her.

title: Modern Alternative to Bulletin Boards
text: These wall grid panels are a modern alternative to traditional bulletin boards. It comes with 2 sets of different hanging supplies (adhesive/nail type). There are plenty of clothespin type clips to hold pictures and such. There are also some fairy lights that can be strung around it. My daughter is using one of the panels in her bedroom, but she's saving the other for her dorm room this fall. The one she has put up is fairly sturdy. It looks really cute with the personal photos and other items she is hanging from it. They would also look nice as a pair.

title: Nice Undated Meal Planner
text: A few years ago, I jumped on the planner wagon. I enjoy writing in my planner and adding stickers. I usually use stickers that say "dinner" so I can plan my weekly meals. My planner stays upstairs in my office for most of the time, but I plan my meals on the main floor near the recipe books and pantry. I thought it might be nice to keep a separate planner devoted just for meals. This planner is spiral bound and has a sturdy front and back cover. The weeks are undated, which I like. They start on Monday, which is okay with me. I am not sure that I have a preference for that. There's space for breakfast, lunch and dinner. I personally only plan my dinners. The other meals are free for all, so that's wasted space for me. On each 2 page layout, there is a shopping list section. It's not full page length, which would be preferred. I would also like it to be perforated. I had to copy my shopping list on to another piece of paper to take with me to the store. That's an extra step that I don't need.  There's a small notes section and a gratitude one. Since I keep a personal planner already, I really don't need that space. About 2/3rds of the planner is more of the same. Then the rest of it has staples shopping lists, takeout cards, recipe cards, expense trackers and more. A sheet of stickers is included as well as an expandable pocket in the back.

title: Fun Assortment of Post Cards
text: My daughter is in college. She likes to get mail, so I try to send her a postcard or card every week or more. This is a fun assortment of post cards. They're a good quality. There is a variety of older cartoons with some more modern ones. There was one (which is visible in the product picture of the description which I thought was a little inappropriate. It's of a little boy without pants. I am not familiar with that character and don't know the story of it, but I didn't think it fit the set as well as the others.

title: Nice Layout
text: This "to do" notebook is more than a simple to-do list. It has a nice layout that includes space for meal/water tracking, a grateful box, and things to pick up. It comes undated, but there is a space to include the date as well as the day of the week. Pages are double sided and a decent thickness so regular ink does not bleed through. My handwriting is a little large and I'm having difficulties getting things to fit on one line in the "to do today" section. For many items, I'm having to take up 2 lines. It seems sturdy and well made.

title: These Work Great!
text: These scratch off stickers work great! I am currently working on a reading reward chart for my young nieces and nephew. I tested the stickers first and I am very impressed with them.  They are super easy to use and they work just like they should. My brain keeps thinking of fun ways to use these. My own kids are in college, but they will still enjoy something like this.

title: Sturdy Binders
text: These are not only cute, but they're sturdy, too. I'm using these binders to create recipe books for my college age kids. I probably wouldn't have selected heart binders for both of them, but I figure they probably won't get it confused with other binders. The binders are a good quality. The rings open fairly easily. There are vinyl pockets on the inside of the covers. They are working well!

title: Decent Mailers
text: These are decent bubble mailers. The seams are secure and don't tear when the bag is filled. The adhesion quality is good.  Permanent markers work well on the surface. Overall, these are good, basic padded mailers.

title: Basic
text: These are pretty basic as far as padded envelopes. They are made of poly material which keeps the contents safe from weather issues. The amount of padding seems to be pretty light and basic, but it's definitely more padding than a traditional paper or cardboard envelope. The adhesive strip works well. The seams are pretty tight and don't rip easily when putting something inside.

title: Great!
text: I used to do all kinds of paper crafting such as card making, scrapbooking and more. This is similar to the adhesives that I would use for those activities. It reminds me a lot of the Tombow Monoadhesive. It works similarly, though I don't think it's refillable. It's also much smaller than the Tombow. I couldn't find any of my Tombow ones for a side by side comparison, but I would guess that it's about half the size or a tad more than half. The adhesive strip comes out well and not clumpy. It adheres well. I would definitely consider ordering more of these if needed. They're a lot less messy than working with glue and easier than traditional tape.

title: Nice Colors
text: These fineliner pens are true fine tip pens. The tip is fine enough to write in small spaces in my planner. They're nice colors. I haven't had any issues with bleed through while using them. The barrels of these pens are a little longer and thinner than other felt tip pens out there. They have squared sides so they don't roll on the table.

title: Pre-Cut Letters!!
text: I was really impressed that these letters, numbers, and symbols are pre-cut! That makes a huge difference! I have spent hours cutting out letters from other sets. This set has 2 letter boards - one with black felt and the other gray. There are 2 bags of letters - one white letters and the other is a mix of pink and blue. The only thing that I would change is that there is only one easel. So one board can use that while the other one has to have a stand screwed onto it. That's not the worst thing ever, but a second easel would have been easier and nice looking, too.

title: Nice Looking
text: These bookends are really nice looking. I like the design a lot. It's contemporary and adds a little pizzazz to my living room without being too ornate. I am using one set of these for our vinyl record collection. We keep them on a shelf unit that is mostly open on the sides with the exception of the corners. There are probably at least 100 records and these are holding them up adequately. I was a little worried that they might slide, but if they have, it hasn't been too much. As I am writing this, I think grippers on the bottoms would be a great addition to any bookends and I'm wondering why they don't have them! This comes with two full sets (4 bookends), the other pair is being used in the home office to hold up books. It also comes with a pencil/pen cup which I'm sure we can put to use. Overall, it's a nice set.

title: Quality Notebook
text: This is a quality notebook. Not only is it durable and well made, but it's cute, too. The paper is a thicker than what you would get in the back to school notebooks in the fall. The cover is sturdier too. There's a two sided pocket in front for holding papers. The spiral binding is a double one and it's also pretty sturdy and shouldn't get bent up easily. The paper seems to be college ruled and it's perforated for easy tearing.

title: Durable!
text: This set of 3 expanding file folders are quite durable. They're made from a sturdy poly material. There are 3 different colors to help you organize your papers. The individual files inside are different colors, too. It uses a button/elastic type closure. One thing I really like about these are that they are rather slim. They won't take up too much space inside your bag. At the same time, that could be a dislike for some because they are slim.

title: Fun File Folders!
text: Who says that file folders can't be fun? These are so cute and add some playfulness to your work area. They have shiny, gold foil elements on them. I like how these are like a cross between traditional file folders and pocket folders which each one having a pocket on one side. They are sturdier than the regular old manila ones and a heck of lot prettier.

title: Great for Home Office
text: This set of file folders and hanging folders is great for the home office. At first I was puzzled because it doesn't come with those clear plastic tabs for labeling. Then after reading other reviews, I figured out that you should crease the bottom and then that allows the file folders to peek up over the edge so you can see the label on it. That made sense. And I hated those little clear plastic tabs, so I was good with this. The file folders aren't anything special. They're the manila color, with a thickness comparable to other standard file folders. The hanging folders are fine. This set allowed me to organize some stuff for my husband's business.

title: Fun Set!
text: I wasn't sure what all was going to be included in this until I opened it up. I just knew that Erin Condren was a quality line of planner products.  It comes with habit tracker, dot journal, markers, stencils, and stickers. I'm already a huge planner girl and enjoy sitting down to work on my planner. These items can be used with what I already have plus they introduce me to the world of dot journaling.  I am using the dot journal as my food tracker. The stencils include the check boxes that I had been wanting. The markers are double ended. The finer end works well with the stencils. I have been having fun setting up my journal! These items could easily be sold separately, but they work well together, too.

title: Perfect!
text: This password book is perfect and just what I needed. I never thought I needed to keep one of these books for my passwords, but last year, there was an issue with my previous method of storing my passwords and I lost about half of my passwords. I immediately started writing down all of my passwords as I recovered them. It was very frustrating. While this is not my primary source of storing them now, this is what I call my backup plan.  The tabs are organized by letter groups (A-B, C-D, etc.). There's plenty of space to write the information which makes it easy to access the info when needed. The cover is a lovely rose gold color and just looks nice.

title: Good Quality
text: I enjoy taking time to work in my planner. I have fun using various stickers in it. The quality of these stickers is good. The variety of them is fine, but there are limited quantities so if you want to use multiple ones, you may not be able to do that. The artwork is okay, but they're not as appealing as some other ones that I have seen. They're pretty basic.

title: Nice Size
text: My son, husband, and I have started a Carb Cycling diet.  We're using this magnetic planner to keep track of our daily carbs. Our carb totals aren't the same every day so I put everyone's totals at the top next to the names. Because it's divided into morning, afternoon, and evening, it's perfect for tracking our carb totals for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. It's really working well for us. We're each using 2 columns for our entries since this works for up to six family members and there are only three of us. The marker doesn't have a fine enough tip for the space and I feel that would be an even bigger issue if we were using it as family calendar where more writing would be required. It's okay for just writing our numbers.

title: Fun!
text: This message writing board is fun to use. It's much easier than the ones with the plastic letters and felt. It comes with markers which are adequately juicy. The remote control comes with batteries, but they may need to be replaced soon because the remote was a bit laggy and required close proximity to work. When lit up, the board looks really cool and your message really stands out. It does require a wet cloth to really get it cleaned well after use. It comes with a microfiber cloth. The hangers are a just okay. There are lanyard type clasps attached to the sides to hold a wire or string to hang it.

title: Cute!
text: While these paper clips aren't the sturdiest, they are really cute! And as far as sturdiness goes, they are adequate for basic uses. If you use them for just small stacks, they work well. If you have larger bunches of paper, it does get bent out of shape a bit. They are "purrfect" for cat lovers!

title: Affordable!
text: My husband and I ship a lot of packages during the week and we go through a lot of shipping tape. While this is definitely an affordable product, the tape is just average. First of all, I had a very difficult time getting the tape started. There's a blue end piece, but it's covered in a layer of tape. I couldn't find where the tape started, so I actually used scissors to help. That was AFTER I tried to start 3 different rolls! Then after I put it on my tape gun, the tape wouldn't stay in the dispenser nicely and I had to find the edges of it more than once. The tape is fairly thin and sticks okay.

title: Smooth Writing
text: I am loving these gel pens! They write so smoothly and don't smear. I am very impressed with them. They do come with little plastic pieces over the tips of the pen that have to be removed before using.

title: Nicer Than Expected!
text: This photo cube is nicer than I expected. First of all, it's really easy to put the pictures in it. The magnetic side pieces work very well. And if you need to clean them, it's easier to do that, too, since they just pop right off. The inside storage area is a good size. I have all of my special markers in it and it looks quite nice. I am very happy with it.

title: Good Quality!
text: I have magnetic wipe boards on my refrigerator for menus and notes to my family. My dry erase markers were getting dull and dry, so I was in need of some replacement ones. These are magnetic, so it's easy to keep them in reach of the boards. The magnets hold the markers well without much slipping. The markers are adequately juicy and write well. They seem to be a good quality.

title: As Expected
text: This drawer organizer requires minimal assembly. All it took was inserting a couple of dividers before it was ready to use. The unit is sturdy and overall, it's as I expected. It fits well in the drawer on my book case and organizes some of the loose items that I was keeping in it. I hated how everything was rolling around in the drawer before this. I am happy with it.

title: Nice Variety of Colors
text: I use a dry erase board on my refrigerator for notes and menus. I keep a few magnetic dry erase markers handy for that purpose. I was needing some replacement markers because several had started to dry out. I like the variety of colors that they come in. They seem to be juicy enough. The tip is pretty fine and writes well. The magnet is strong enough to keep it on the refrigerator, but it slides a bit when bumped.

title: Worked Well!
text: My husband recently became a small business owner. This was his first time having to distribute W-2's. The forms worked well with QuickBooks Pro. There are 2 forms per sheet and they are perforated. They tear apart easily after being folded/creased. They are labeled clearly so you know which copy is which. He only has 5 employees, including himself, so he had plenty of extras just in case. Envelopes are included. It was a pretty easy process from start to finish and ordering these was more convenient than going to the store.

title: Set of 12
text: This is a set of 12 little notebooks. The notebooks have a mid-weight cardstock cover and they're filled with college ruled ivory paper. One notebook has 30 pages (60 if you count front and back). The pages have a stitched binding. Each notebook is just a little smaller than a cellphone. My husband likes using notebooks like this because they easily fit into his pockets. I like keeping one in my purse. They're handy to have with you.

title: Excellent Printing!
text: One of my biggest gripes with printers, is that the ink replacement costs are high. With my previous printer, an Epson Workforce, it cost about $80 to replace the ink and I would have to replace it at least twice a year. Because of that, I was very excited to give this printer a try. If I can go two years or even close to two years without replacing the ink, then I will be a happy person. The ink for this printer comes in bottles. The bottles are poured into the tanks. I found this to be pretty easy with minimal mess. The ink doesn't automatically start pouring out when you turn it upside down, but once it's attached to the tank, it starts flowing. The only ink that ended up on my hands was from peeling the spill cover off of the bottle after removing the lid. I ALWAYS get inky hands when doing any type of project with paints, inks, etc, so I was very surprised at how neat this process was. The print heads did require installation. This gave my husband a little trouble because it's dark and not easy to get to. Once I held up a flashlight for him, he was able to snap them into place right away. I was actually happy to see that the paper tray/holder was in the back of the printer! On my previous printer, it was located in the front. I tend to spread my work out all on my desk and when the printer would run out of paper, I would have to pick up everything just to open the darn paper tray. I personally think that this a great feature! The print quality is wonderful! I'm very impressed with how nice the photos come out. The printer noise level is fairly comparable to other printers. Though I've found it making noise at odd times. This morning, it started making noises like it was going to print out something. My husband and I were sitting in the living room at the time and he asked me if I was printing out something. I told him that I assumed he was, but he had not. So unless the cats were printing out things, we're unsure why it was making noises. We hadn't used it since the previous afternoon. Overall, I do like it. Only time will tell whether or not it lives up to the 2 years without replacing the ink claim. One last thing, I haven't been able to find the ink refills for purchase yet. I'm curious to see what those cost and if they're easy to find. I know it's a brand new printer and technically, if the ink does last for 2 years, I don't need to buy any just yet!

title: Great Dispenser!
text: I love to write notes on Post-Its and have little pads all over the house. Of course, then when I need one, I have to waste some time to track one down. This should solve that because the apple dispenser is pretty easy to find. It's weighted so it won't tip over. I put a pad of Post-Its in the dispenser but then I doubted myself and thought I had put them upside down. I switched it and that didn't make a difference. The reason that I thought it was upside down was that every other Post-It looks like the picture and comes straight out. The other ones tilt upwards. The Post-Its are accordion style and I've decided that's just how it works. The set comes with a dozen Post-It pads in assorted colors.

title: Good Quality!
text: This is a huge box of 500 envelopes. They are a good quality and comparable to other brands that I have purchased before. A couple of the envelopes were stuck together where the seal is, but most that I have used did not have that problem.

title: Comprehensive
text: I am very impressed with this food journal. It's quite comprehensive! As a person who has struggled with her weight for years, I've seen many different food journals. This one is the best!! It allows you to record whatever information you need for the diet your following. I haven't been filling out everything, but it allows me to record what I want. I'm currently following a low carb/Keto diet. There's space for me to put my carb totals which I use for net carbs. For most foods, then I just leave the other columns blank, but if I wanted to go into more details, I could fill those out, too. There's a spot to record your measurements. There's daily spots to record how your feeling. The size is good and big enough to record everything. It's one page per day and the pages are not dated so you can start whenever you want. It comes with 3 sheets of stickers. The stickers are decent, planner quality. Overall, I highly recommend this journal. Tracking what you eat while dieting leads to higher successes!

title: Affordable!
text: This is an affordable set of dry erase markers. The markers aren't super juicy, but they seem to be inky enough. The color is a lighter or muted black than some other markers that I have used. They erase fine and don't leave behind ink.

title: Sweet Card!
text: This is such a sweet card!! I am giving it to my husband for Valentine's Day this year. We got married in the early 1990's and the original Legend of Zelda was one of the video games we used to play. We've enjoyed playing subsequent Zelda games over the years. The card is a nice quality greeting card. The card stock is a good quality. There's some layering. I am looking forward to giving it to my husband!

title: Easy to Use!
text: I work at home with my husband. We have our own offices. My husband has a bigger, older shredder in his office, so I had been saving my items that needed to be shredded and then trying to find a time when he wasn't in his office so I could shred them. He told me I could get my own, but I just hadn't gotten around to it yet. When I saw this, I noticed it was the same brand as a laminating machine that I owned and liked. This shredder is smaller than his and takes up less space in my office. It can shred up to 6 sheets at a time, as well as credit cards. I don't usually have a whole lot to do at once, so this has been perfect for me. It makes about as much noise as other shredders do. It is easy to use. I am pleased with it.

title: Love This Card!
text: I love this card and can't wait to send it to my daughter in February. It's a nice quality greeting card and what I would expect from the Hallmark brand. It made from a sturdy, heavy weight card stock. There's some layering. The dinosaur humor will be appreciated by my daughter!

title: Nice Size!
text: My daughter is away at college. I try to send her a postcard or letter at least once a week. These are a good sized with plenty of space to write on. The images are cute and modern. The cards are a good, sturdy quality.

title: Pretty!
text: These page tabs are pretty! I like the sparkly holographic designs. They stick well and are easy to remove, too. They stand out enough so you can return to the page you've marked. The darker color and designs aren't really suited for writing on, but if needed, you can write on it with a permanent fine tip marker. Just allow it to dry.

title: Individually Wrapped
text: These sticky notes are bright and colorful. They have a good amount of stickiness. They stick well, but remove well, too. They're individually wrapped, so if you wanted to put together some small gift baskets, they would be good for that. They're larger than standard square sticky notes. Overall, I am pleased with them.

title: Cute!
text: These are cute sticky notes. They are fun shapes and colorful. Two of the designs are "to do" style note pads. The stickiness is pretty good - sticky enough to stick on to things but not too sticky. My daughter is using these at college for her studying and leaving notes to her roommate.

title: Adequate
text: I do a lot of shipping and go through a lot of bubble wrap. This wrap has small bubbles. It doesn't separate easily as others. It offers adequate protection of fragile items. The fragile stickers are a nice bonus.

title: Cute!
text: This kitty paw pencil case is cute! Pens and pencils fit nicely in it. I was able to get at least 10 pens in it without affecting the zipper.  The zipper works well. There's a clip on it so you can attach it to your backpack.

title: Pretty Blue
text: These are basic, standard envelopes. They are a pretty blue color. They require moisture to seal.

title: As Expected
text: These binder clips are as expected. There is a variety of sizes. The quality is good. There's not much to tell - they bind and they clip! I am pleased to have plenty on hand for whenever I need one.

title: Awesome Postcards!
text: My daughter is in her first year at college. She likes sending postcards to her friends and family. Postcards allow you to keep in touch, but without the obligation of writing a lot of stuff. These postcards are awesome!! They're vintage reproductions of various sites. The flip side has a vintage look to it, too. Most of the cards are black and white (sepia) but some have a little color to them, such as a red phone booth in London. The assortment is fun! There's one of the Moulan Rouge in Paris that she plans to send to one of her friends because they loved to watch the movie musical of the same title. There's one of a musician holding an umbrella over his cello. My daughter played the cello in high school, so she plans to send that to one of her orchestra buddies. I am definitely going to check out some of the other postcards that are available.

title: Nice Size!
text: This coin jar is a nice size. It's made of plastic, but it's sturdy. There is a lock that you can install to prevent people from taking the money out of it without your approval. It requires 2 AAA batteries, which are not included. You push a coin into the opening. The opening expands depending on the size of the coin which identifies which coin is added. We found that it wasn't always accurate. First of all, after putting in lots of coins (a mix of quarters, nickels, and dimes), our total ended in a 3 and we hadn't used any pennies. Also, we found that if we didn't push the coin all the way in on the first try, it would double count it. So while we weren't getting an exact total, it did give us a general idea of how much money we had in it.

title: Sturdy
text: While this is a sturdy desk organizer, I found it to be a little complicated to assemble. The directions were just okay. It wasn't terribly difficult, it just wasn't super easy either. The finished product is nice. It does allow for plenty of storage on my desk.

title: Good!
text: I needed some pencil cups for my office desk. These are good, basic ones. It is a set of three, so I'm using two of them, and my son is using the third one. They do the job!

title: Great Card!
text: This is a great birthday card! There's a lot of fun details in the popup portion of it! It will be perfect for any dinosaur fan!

title: Fun Assortment of Cards!
text: My daughter is away at college and I try to send her a card or letter once a week. These blank cards are perfect! I like the contemporary square shape of the cards. It's a fun assortment of cards. All of them are blank inside and have plenty of room for a message. They are a good weight of paper and the envelopes have a printed design inside. Fun!

title: Whimsical
text: This card is cute and whimsical! I really like the square shape. It is modern. There are metallic gold accents on the card. The quality of the card is on par with what I would expect from the Hallmark brand. The envelope has a cool design inside it that coordinates with the card. Overall, it's really cute!

title: Adorable Card!
text: This bubble tea themed card is adorable and very trendy right now!!! It has some metallic accents. The envelope has stripes inside which looks super cute. My daughter is away at college and this card will definitely bring a smile to her face!

title: Great Card for Peanuts Fans
text: I love this card!!! It's perfect for any Peanuts fan! Watching the Peanuts Christmas episode was always a big deal when I was growing up. This card even plays music. It's the Peanuts kids singing from that very episode. While it does have a religious message, it's not preachy at all. It does require additional postage.

title: Politically Correct
text: These holiday cards are pretty generic as far as cards go. They have a politically correct sentiment that won't offend anyone. The cards have a slight raised texture, but it's not the greeting. The words are in gold foil.  I love the matching envelopes! The envelopes look great!

title: Beautiful Journal!
text: My daughter has started to use the dot journal method. I thought she would like this journal and I was right! It's beautiful! It is covered in a nice, artificial leather. The pages are made from a high quality paper. She hasn't had any issues with ink bleeding through the pages. The whole thing comes in a nice box that makes it great for gift giving.

title: Simple But Nice
text: These Happy Holidays cards are pretty generic. They look like corporate cards that your insurance agent might send out. The cardstock has a good weight to it. The gold foil is a nice touch. The greeting is embossed. The general greeting is very politically correct and should not offend most.

title: Cute Retro Designs
text: These cute Christmas cards have a retro vibe. They remind of my holiday designs from the 1970's. The cards are smaller than traditional Christmas cards. The size is more like a note card. The weight of the cardstock is good and doesn't feel like dollar store quality. The cards all have some gold foil embellishment.

title: Good Quality Boxes
text: Good, basic moving boxes. They are comparable in quality to ones you might purchase as the hardware store. I would order them again.

title: Comparable to Other Brands
text: I wasn't sure what I was getting when I ordered this. I thought it would be 1 dispenser with 6 refills. Instead it's 6 dispensers and each one has one roll of clear tape on it. I think it would be more environmentally friendly if it only had 1 dispenser instead of 6. The dispensers are sturdier and better than the typical disposable tape dispenser. The quality of the tape is comparable to other name brand clear tapes out there. I like the idea of refillable dispensers - I just need to let my family know that they aren't to throw it away when the roll runs out!

title: Quality Journals
text: These journals are a very nice quality. They are bound well and quite sturdy. The weight of the pages is good. So far, I haven't had any issues with bleed through, but I use markers that are specifically for journals. Regular markers might bleed a little.  The pages are designed for bullet journals. The journals are labeled, which I found a little odd.  I really won't keep a journal about food. Something more generalized would be better. Overall, these are good and would probably make a good gift.

title: It Works!
text: My daughter is living in a dorm this year.  Her room came with a desk, but no shelf. This was an affordable option. While it does work and do the job,  it does shift or move easily. The pieces aren't secured together so if you bump it, it moves.  She likes it and allows her to organize her desk better.

title: Nice Selection of Colors!
text: I have been a fan of poly envelopes like these for years. Every time I travel, I use one with any documents, trip details, or tickets related to the trip. It just makes it easier to keep track of things. These are fairly comparable in quality to the ones you can get at the local stores. These have a business card slot so you can label them if you want. That looks more professional than writing in permanent marker like I usually do. There are 5 colors and 2 of each color. It's a nice selection of colors! These snap/button to secure. I think I like Velcro ones better, but these work fine. It's definitely easier to use than the ones with strings that wrap around a button. Overall, these are good.

title: Nice, Basic Trays
text: I started working at home a few months ago. I've been slowly getting my office set up for functionality. They are stackable, but when you stack them, the lower one is not easy to get to, so you have to use it to hold full size papers that you can easily reach. The trays are made from a sturdy plastic and much quieter than the old metals ones that I used nearly 30 years ago. Overall, these  are nice, basic trays.

title: Nice Greeting Card
text: This is a nice, birthday greeting card for Grandma. It's a pretty card with a sweet sentiment inside. The card is made from a good weight card stock. The images are colorful and outlined with glitter. The inside sentiment is on a separate piece of paper (not card stock) that is affixed to the interior of the card. I'm sure it will make Grandma happy!

title: Nice Floral Designs
text: I needed some dividers for a notebook that I was working on. These arrived just in time.  Some of the tabs are darker colored and black ink didn't show up well, so I used the white label stickers that came with them for consistency. The dividers are printed on one side and solid on the other. They're an adequate thickness. Overall I am pleased with them. The only criticism that I have, is that they arrived in a padded envelope and my mail carrier creatively squeezed it into my mailbox, therefore leaving them bent. There's no crease, but they won't lay flat.

title: Sweet & Simple!
text: These Christmas cards are sweet and simple. They're blank inside so you can update old friends with what's going on in your life. The cardnstock used in these cards is a good weight. I absolutely love the lined, coordinating envelopes!

title: Cute Puppy Images!
text: When I need dividers, I tend to gravitate toward cute, colorful ones rather than plain manila ones. These are pretty sturdy dividers. They're not as sturdy as the poly plastic ones, but sturdier than the cheap, manila ones.  One side has the photo puppy image and the other side is a solid color. There's plenty of room on the tab to write what you need or place a label. Overall, they're good dividers.

title: Huge Assortment!
text: This is a huge assortment of paper clips that should last a long time. There are 3 different sizes of paper clips to accommodate different needs. The paper clips are basic, stainless steel paper clips.

title: Simple But Sweet
text: This birthday card is simple, but sweet. It is smaller than a traditional card. It's made from a good weight card stock. The sentiment on the front of the card is raised/embossed. It comes with a lined envelope.

title: Cute Planner!
text: This is a cute planner. It's a great size for students. There's adequate space for writing assignments and appointments. It has a weekly view as well as a monthly one. My daughter plans to use it for college. It is dated and starts with July.

title: Basic Quality Card Sleeves
text: My 21 year old son collects Magic the Gathering cards. These card protector sleeves are comparable to similar ones found at the local store. They're a bit thin, but seem sturdy enough. He hasn't had any problems with the cards falling out, but he's always careful to keep his binders upright. If it was turned over, I'm sure he would lose a few -it's the nature of card collecting. Overall, they're nothing fancy - just basic quality card sleeves. They do the job which is intended.

title: Cute Designs!
text: I always prefer using pretty labels, tabs, etc. when I have the choice. These have pretty designs and work just like the plain ones do. They stick well on to the file folders. I've also used on in my planner. I use a ball point pen and I've had no smearing. I like them!

title: Works Well!
text: This is a thick, clear double adhesive tape. It's stronger than most tapes and designed for hanging things on the wall. The sides are pretty sticky and it adheres well. I'm afraid to try it on dry wall, but I have taped a decorative sign to one of the doors in the house and it worked well. The sign hasn't budged!

title: Fun!
text: This is a simple agenda and not for those who need lots of space for tracking appointments and more. It's bright and colorful and reminds me of one of those activity journals for tweens. It has a weekly format. Each 2 page layout contains a weekly calendar on one side and bright illustrations on the other. It's undated so you're not limited to when you can use it. The stickers are a fun addition. It would make a nice gift for a recent college graduate or other young adult.

title: Nice Size!
text: This is a nice sized desk top organizer. It requires some assembly. It comes with instructions which I found a little difficult to follow. It took me a couple of tries to get the pieces in the right direction. It has a drawer and some other compartments and space for file folders. My daughter is thinking about stealing this from me to use in her dorm room since storage space is limited.

title: Works Well!
text: I have never used a personal laminator before, but there are many times when I've thought that one would be handy. I found that the instructions for this were pretty lame and didn't really help me at all. The machine was pretty simple to figure out how to work it. Though, my first attempt at laminating didn't work because I didn't allow it to heat up all the way. I tried again and it worked well. There were no bubbles or loose edges in my finished item. It comes with a starter pack, but that won't last very long. No information was given about what kind of laminating sheets to use.

title: Nice Size!
text: I love the similar sized USPS priority boxes, but sometimes I just want to send something first class! These are perfect for that. And if you are shipping books, you an use Media rate which saves even more money. This size is really good for small care packages. My daughter goes off to college next month and this is a good size to send to her without getting carried away. The boxes come with folded/creased lines to fold. The sturdiness is adequate. Overall, a good packing supply.

title: Thin, But Nice
text: These cork boards are thin, but pretty nice. They are thick enough to allow a push pin to go through it as long as you don't push the pin in all the way. I was unsure how well these would remove when I want to take them down, so I ended up using removable poster strips on these just to be on the safe side. So far, they're staying in place.

title: Nice Basic White Board
text: This is a nice, basic white board. Nothing fancy. I ordered this for my daughter's dorm room. It's a good size for messages and reminders. The marker that comes with is a fine tip which she likes. It also comes with a couple of magnets.

title: Impressive!
text: When my kids were younger, I never found what I considered to be the perfect planner to keep track of all the different activities. This one is pretty good, however, my kids are older now and I don't have as much to keep track of now. The cover is kind of boring. Okay, it's very boring. Mine actually has smudge like marks that I can't remove. There are so many cute planners out there, I really think that is an area where this could be improved. The spiral binding was bent on the ends upon arrival. I was able to move them a little bit, but a sturdier coil wouldn't lose its shape so easily. The contents of this planner are excellent! In between each month, there is a cute motivational or funny saying. Each month starts with a 2 page monthly view, followed by a budget page, then grocery list/menu planner page which is perforated. This planner has daily pages. The top part is broken down into hourly segments starting at 7am and going through 9pm. There's a very small "to do" column to the left of that. Then on the lower section of each page is a "family to-do" section. The planner has college ruled lines (or at least similar to that). There are some resource pages in the bag such as contacts, birthdays, vacation planning, and notes. There's a clear zippered pouch and pockets on the front and back covers. The planner is a good size, although very thick, but it contains so much, it's a trade-off. You can't have a small planner with this much content. Overall, I really like it.

title: Good!
text: I like to buy sticky pads. I have a drawer full. I use them several times a day. These are good ones. They have an adequate amount of stickiness. The colors are bright and pretty. In comparison to the brand name ones, these are a little more difficult to remove from the pad. There's a slight resistance when pulling it off. The pads are individually wrapped. And while that could be seen as unnecessary, because of that, they would be great for putting in gift bags. The school that I teach had put together little goody bags at the end of the year for all the teachers and included a pack of sticky notes in each one. The one I received was not wrapped and came from a multi-pack. These would have been perfect for that! Overall, these are good and worth checking out.

title: Great Idea!
text: I think this folder organizer is a great idea. It works pretty well, as long as you don't overfill the folders. It works best when you have fewer papers in it. It opens and closes like an accordion. I like the bright colors so I can color coordinate things. It doesn't come with anything to hang it with, so you're on your own there. Overall, I like it.

title: Nice Size!
text: This little white board is a nice size and fits right on my desk. As far as the white board features go, it works as expected. I do find that when positioned (with screws tightened), it does loosen up every few days and then falls down. It's startled me on more than one occasion. Other than that, I am very pleased.

title: Love It!
text: I absolutely love this planner and I can't wait for the new school year starts so I can start using it! I love the layout of the pages. It's very "bullet journal" friendly. And while I don't bullet journal, I am looking forward to starting it. There's room for to-do lists and water tracking. I love the whimsical font used. I do wish it was just a little bigger, but I can adapt.

title: A Little On the Small Size
text: These pencil boxes are on the small size. As a former teacher, I think these wouldn't hold all of the supplies that students are expected to bring to school. The boxes have 2 sides that open. Each side has dividers inside to help organize items. Full size pencils or pens can only fit on one of the sides. I was able to get 8  (#2) pencils in that section. You could also fit erasers, glue sticks, a pair of children's scissors, and a few other items. The boxes are made from a sturdy plastic and come in a nice assortment of colors.

title: Attractive Cover
text: I have a thing for planners. I find one I like and will use it until I find another one that I like better. It's not unusual for me to switch mid-year. I like the large size of this. It's full size, but still pretty thin. It starts with January 2019 and goes through January 5th, 2020. The weekly layout is nice a large with plenty of room to write down your appointments and to-do lists. The monthly page is a good size, too. The cover is very attractive. While it is a nice calendar, there's nothing special about this or the layout.

title: Nice Assortment
text: This is a nice assortment of sympathy cards. The cards are made from a sturdy card stock. I would consider these pretty basic. They all have some kind of embossing or an added layer, but only one of these features per card. They are definitely a step better than just a plain, flat, smooth card.

title: Nice Set!
text: This is a nice lettering pen set. It comes with several brush makers as well as some fine point ones. In addition, there is a graphite pencil and eraser. It includes a booklet with tips for helping you with your lettering skills. The marker/pens work well. They aren't overly juicy and make smooth lines. This set is geared toward users who already possess some lettering skills. I think I personally need something more elementary to start with.

title: Beautiful Artwork!
text: This calendar has beautiful artwork! The calendar is a little smaller than I expected. There's not a lot of room in the boxes to write. This would work well as just a decorative calendar or one used for counting down. The spiral binding at the top is nice. This calendar follows the school year.

title: Great Note Cards
text: My daughter just graduated from high school and so did all of her friends. We've been going through graduation cards like there's no tomorrow. Thankfully, these arrived just in time. They're pretty basic. There's no embellishments or decoration. The card stock is a good weight. They're very classy and simple. These are not limited to graduation. They can be used for any congratulatory event.

title: Cute Zipper Case
text: I like the cute zipper case that this planner comes with, but I'm not crazy about the planner itself. The case has some pockets to store things. It's got a pretty floral design. The zipper works well. The planner is okay, not great. It doesn't lay flat because of the binding. I'm used to using spiral or other similar bindings that open completely up and lay flat when writing in it. There's nothing special about the format or layout. As I said, it's okay.

title: Cute Cover!
text: This spiral notebook has a cute cover. It's not a full size notebook. It's one that might fit in a purse or handbag. The spiral binding is sturdy and doesn't bend easily. The pages are a good weight. It's a good size for keeping my to-do lists - both work and personal.

title: Gorgeous Cards!
text: This is a wonderful set of greeting cards. The illustrations are gorgeous! There are primarily birthday cards, but there are a few thank you cards, thinking of you ones, and more. The cards come in a little storage box. My daughter has been using these cards up!

title: Lovely Journal!
text: This is a lovely journal. The cover is vibrant and colorful. The spine is unique and allows the journal to lay flat open. The pages are a good quality, lined paper. It's a good size and will easily fit inside a purse or small bag. This would make a nice gift.

title: Darling!
text: This calendar is absolutely darling! I got it for my daughter to take with her to college. The pages are a high quality card stock and nicely weighted. The illustrations are what makes this calendar so special. Most, if not all, have some kind of animal worked into the design such as the unicorn, alligator, and elephant. There is enough room in the squares to jot down some important events such as test dates and vacations. It's really a sweet calendar!

title: Fun!
text: My daughter bought a Fuji Instax camera a couple of years ago. All of her friends have one, too. Any comparisons that I make will be with the Instax. The kids who use the Instax want printed pictures NOW. The quality of the Instax pictures is just so-so, but they get the pictures immediately. The quality of the pictures from the Cliq is just so-so, too. They're a little larger than the Instax ones plus these are stickers if you want to use them that way. You can always leave the sticker backing on them and keep them just as small pictures. This camera is priced about the same as some of the Instax versions, though you can get some models for cheaper. The film prices is about the same, too. The biggest advantage that I see with this over the Instax is the size of the camera. My daughter likes to take her Instax with her, but the size is cumbersome. The Cliq is about the size of a cell phone and can fit in your pocket or purse without any issues. A lot of times my daughter leaves her Instax at home because she doesn't want to deal with it. So if you're considering getting an instant print camera and know that the picture quality isn't going to be very high, then I think this camera is a serious contender.

title: No Staples!!
text: I had to track down staples in order to use it. That's not the end of the world, but it was a slight inconvenience. The staple gun works pretty well and you can get to places where you might not be able to with a standard stapler. I found it a little difficult to staple on wood. It took several tries and most of the time they didn't go in all the way. I did find that if I applied more pressure to it when pressing on the trigger, I was more successful.  It's lighter weight than my husband's heavy duty staple gun.

title: Pretty Cover!
text: Planners have become quite trendy in recent years. I jumped on the planner wagon about a year ago. I used to use planners, but in recent years I started using Google calendar and became digitized. When I saw some coworkers using planners last year, I became enthralled with all the stickers and markers out there for planners. I used to be super crafty and it was a creative outlet for me. Well, after a year or so, I've found that I do like the planners. Mine follows the school year, so I have been looking for a new one to replace it with This has a pretty and sturdy cover. It's spiral bound. It has both a weekly view and monthly. Spaces are lined. There's plenty of room to write down things or to place my stickers. Speaking of stickers, it comes with some small ones to get you started. There's even a pocket page in the back. I'm looking forward to starting this one up in August!

title: Good Notebooks!
text: My 17 year old daughter prefers college ruled notebooks for all of her classes. This is a set of 3 notebooks. Each one has 3 sections. The paper seems average. The spiral binding is very sturdy and thick. The covers seem a little heavier than basic ones that I have purchased. Overall, these are good notebooks and will be put to use this fall when my daughter goes to college.

title: Thoughtful Planner
text: This is a thoughtful fitness planner. As someone who has purchased several different fitness journals over the years, I think this one has been done well. There's space for you to record your meals and workouts for each day, as well as track your water intake. There is a spot for your goals. I liked the layout, but it is very small and hard to read at my age. The cover is sturdy and the coil is strong and not easy to unravel. Overall, it's a good addition to your health tracking.

title: Smooth Writing
text: These gel pens have super smooth writing. I was surprised at how easily the ink flows without any hitching or stopping. I took the box of pens to work and shared with my immediate co-workers. Everyone was impressed with how well these pens wrote. It comes with some black, blue, and red ink pens. I will definitely order these again!

title: Fun Colors!
text: This is a set of 6 plastic clipboards. Each one is a different, bright color. They are translucent. These are perfect for vinyl stickers such as monograms. The clip works well. The actual clipboard is decent, though it does flex easily. I don't get the feeling that it's going to break, but it does have some give to it. Overall, it's a good value for an assortment of clipboards.

title: Large Binders
text: We go through a lot of binders at our house. My husband uses them for work. My kids use them for school. And I use them in the classroom. These are mid-grade quality binders. The covers do flex a little and bend if pressure is applied. The binder clips are really strong and sturdy. They're flat on the bottom and open easily when you press the release button. They will probably last the school year, but may not last for long term if used heavily.

title: Easy to Use!
text: I just discovered Bic correction tape recently. I was unaware that products like this even existed. I thought people still used the liquid White Out type products! I have found these to be a life saver! These are mini-sized and a little smaller than the regular sized ones. They are easy to use as long as you move in straight lines. I found that if I try to curve it, the tape starts scooting to the side and can eventually come off of the dispenser. As long as you make straight lines, it will work well! I have to turn in a paper time sheet every month. This works perfectly for any times when I need to make a correction.

title: Sturdy!
text: These are sturdy, poly plastic folder/dividers for 3 ring binders. There are 3 sets with 5 in each set. They are different colors. The folders are 2 sided so you can fully utilize the organization space that they provide. It comes with a few perforated tab labels. These are sturdy and translucent.

title: Good Quality!
text: When using a binder, it's inevitable that I will need some kind of  pocket. A lot of binders have that thin, tiny pocket on the inside cover, but that's usually not good if you have more than a couple of sheets. These poly folders are perfect! There are 25 folders total, 5 sets of 5 colors. The pockets are one sided. They are translucent so you can see through them.

title: Good Set!
text: As a former elementary school teacher, I think this is a good set for elementary aged students. My own kids (now much older) always loved writing with mechanical pencils, but as a teacher, they are a pain! Students would spend so much time messing with them or reloading with lead. I was happier when they used regular pencils such as these! In addition to the pencils, this comes with a couple of erasers, high lighters, dry erase markers, and ink pens. This would be good for back to school time.

title: Smooth Writing
text: These permanent markers are comparable to other ultra fine permanent markers. They write smoothly and dry quickly with no smearing or smudging.

title: Nice Kit!
text: I like the idea of these Bic kits. This one is geared toward high school students. My high school student was pleased to get this set. She uses primarily mechanical pencils, so she was glad that it came with that kind of pencil. They write pretty well and the leads to break too easily. The pens in the set glide and write very nicely. They didn't click very consistently and sometimes required additional clicks to open. The highlighter markers and dry erase markers were fine and worked as they should. This would be a convenient purchase when it's time to get ready for the new school year.

title: Nicer Than Expected
text: These report covers are nicer than I expected. The last time I bought some of these, they were kind of flimsy. They protected the work inside it, but it wasn't much. These have a sturdier cover than those other ones. They are flexible, but sturdy at the same time. The plastic binding piece slides on easily. This style of report covers has been around for ages, but these seem to be a better quality.

title: Heavy Duty Totes
text: My daughter is going off to college next year. I saw these and thought they would be perfect for her. The totes are a good size and will be perfecting for storing items. The college she is going to has raised beds that allow for storage underneath for large items such as storage tubs. The colors of the tote are her new school's colors. Since there are holes in the top of the totes, she can even add a lock if needed. She doesn't leave until fall, so I used one this weekend for transporting items. When empty, the tubs are fairly light weight. It is easy to grip the edges for lifting and carrying.  I am impressed!

title: Does the Job!
text: This mat allows my husband's office chair to move more easily on carpet. It is sturdy and doesn't move around. The size is good and it didn't take too long for it to uncurl and lie flat.

title: Sturdy Folders!
text: These are great, sturdy folders. They have the prongs in the center for hole punched papers. Since they are made from a poly material, they should last for many years.

title: Cute Valentine Card!
text: I love the Mario theme for a Valentine's card! My husband loves video games, so I thought this would be perfect for him. Of course, I didn't order it until after Valentine's Day, so I have to wait until next year, but that's okay! The card is a mid-grade card. It does have a little bit of embellishment. It's definitely nicer than the dollar store quality. My only problem with the card was that it arrived in a padded poly envelope and the actual card was bent up.

title: Excellent Quality!
text: These wedding cards are gorgeous! They are an excellent quality of greeting cards. In my world, there are 3 types of greeting cards. The first ones are the cheap, no layers and ones that you would probably get for a dollar. Then there are the middle grade ones that might have some layering or simple embellishment. And finally, there are the deluxe ones that have multiple embellishments and layers and usually end up costing a pretty penny. These are ones that I would put in that last group. They are beautiful and perfect for any wedding!

title: Sturdy!
text: I work in a special needs classroom. We use these for all kinds of things in class. These work well because they are clear on both sides so we can see what's inside. This comes with 25, with 5 of each of the 5 different colors. They are sturdy and much nicer than I expected. I am very pleased with these.

title: Excellent!
text: These are excellent dividers. They are poly plastic so they are sturdy and will last all year long. The orange color stands out and makes it easier to find your sections. I am very impressed with the quality of these.

title: Beautiful Assortment of Baby Cards
text: This is a beautiful assortment of baby cards! These are all what I would consider to be deluxe greeting cards. Each one has multiple embellishments such as glitter, layering, metallic accents and more. They are geared toward baby showers, but some of them could be used after the baby arrives because of the wording. These are definitely high quality cards and what you would expect from the Hallmark brand.

title: Impressive!
text: I ordered this to use as a work planner as opposed to my personal one. I have found it to be quite impressive! The frosted cover is extremely sturdy and gives it some heft. The spiral coil is also very strong and isn't going to uncoil or get unwind  like a cheap spiral notebook. It's a January thru December planner. Each month has a full month layout, then goes into the daily mode. There's space for hourly items, to-do, notes and more. The pages are an adequate thickness and so far I haven't had any issues with any bleed through. This has been perfect for keeping track of my work needs.

title: Thin Wallet
text: This is really more like an ID holder with a couple of slots than a wallet. In fact, it's almost identical to what I use to hold my work ID in every day. Which technically, could be used as a wallet, but it's so thin, that it's a bit difficult to get cards in and out and of the slots. There are 3 slots on the back. Whatever you slide in there needs to be thin. You can't put in 3 bank card type items because of the thickness. Plus whatever you put in the lower slot will hang out over the middle and top slots if it's a standard business card sized item. I prefer a tiered look, so I haven't been putting anything in the lower slot. The material feels plastic, but it does smell like leather. The cord is really thin, but so far it's been adequate. I like the RFID feature, but I can't really test that out. Overall, it's okay. It will work if you really don't have much to carry around and you just want to use it for your ID, a bank card, & a little bit of cash, but if you have more than that to carry around, you're probably going to want something a little bigger.

title: Nice, Simple Card
text: This Valentine's card is nice and simple. It has some metallic and embossed designs as well as cut outs. The sentiment is really sweet and I look forward to giving this to my husband for Valentine's Day.

title: Bright Colors!
text: I like the bright colors of these sticky notes. Ink shows up well on the colors. The notes stick well to a lot of surfaces and do not leave any residue behind. These are comparable to name brand sticky notes that I have used in the past.

title: Great Set!
text: I love this set! First of all, it comes with a box that requires some assembly. The box is much sturdier than I expected. I thought it would be flimsy, but it's not at all. The Valentine cards are pretty basic, but definitely comparable to other typical valentine cards. They're colorful and bright. I work in a special ed high school classroom. We distribute valentines in our class, so I will use these to hand out to the students. Many of them are fans of the Justice League.

title: Easy to Use!
text: I use to do a lot of crafting in my spare time, such as scrapbooking and card making. My go-to adhesive was a popular one in the craft world, so my comparisons are with that. This one is a smaller than my blue and white adhesive runner. It's shaped a little oddly as it doesn't fit naturally in my hand like my other tape runner. It is easy to use though. There are some ridges along one of the sides that help you grip it. It seems to hold paper together well. It's clear so you can see how much adhesive is left.
