Overall, it's a decent tape runner and is comparable to other ones out there.

title: Super Cute Message Board
text: This is a super cute message board! My 17 year old daughter loves it and has been having fun thinking of clever phrases for it. It comes with lots of letters, but you do have to cut them apart. There's also an organizer for storing the letters, but you do have to double on letters because there are not enough individual spaces, but it works. The board itself is a nice quality. Overall, we're very pleased with it.

title: Nice Quality Cards!
text: These are nice quality holiday cards. The cards are embellished with glitter and metallic accents and made with a heavy card stock. For the most part, the sentiment is good, but a couple of them have a slight religious tone which was a little off putting. Overall, they're definitely nice quality cards and what you would expect from the Hallmark brand.

title: Adorable!
text: This is a sweet birthday card. It folds flat to fit inside the envelope, but it easily pops out to create an adorable 3-D greeting. There isn't a lot of room to write anything, which could be good or bad depending on the sender. The card is made from sturdy card stock and is a nice quality. Overall, it's a cute, deluxe birthday card.

title: Plenty of Storage
text: This is a decent zippered binder that includes an accordion style folder system. There's a zippered pouch inside, too. The actual metal binder is not particularly heavy duty. It does not have the tab that you push to open. Instead you have to pull apart the rings to get it opened. It also doesn't appear to be attached very securely as it can be manipulated a bit. The zipper pouch is strong and sturdy. The folder system seems comparable to other plastic units that I have used. The outer plastic cover is okay. It's a mid-weight plastic that flexes some. It's clear so you can see the contents. The outer zipper works fine, but I did have to tug on it around the corners to get it to zip. Overall, it's decent.

title: Quick Dry
text: I have been a fan of Ink Joy pens for a while, but this is my first time with their gel pens. I have been very impressed. They really are quick drying! As soon as I finished writing something, I would brush my finger across the ink and it never smeared. The ink flows really well, too. There are no hitches or stops when writing. I want to order these in more colors!

title: Easy to Set Up
text: I have had success with Epson printers before, so when I was recently looking for a new one, this one seemed to offer what I needed. It was very easy to set up. It guides you through the steps by using the touch screen. It uses individual color ink cartridges, but so far I have been able to print out a lot and there's still plenty of ink. My son was happy that it would print from a USB drive, but unfortunately it only allows you to print photos so if you want to print out documents, you must print from your computer or device. The printer allows you to scan and copy as well as print. It's also a bit quieter than other printers we have had. Overall, it's a good, printer and definitely user friendly.

title: Highlights Almost Disappear
text: My high school daughter does a lot of highlighting in her books and notes. These highlighters come in a good variety of colors. It is nice to be able to "erase" items that you may have incorrectly highlighted. One side of the markers is the highlighter and the other side is also a marker, that when you go over the highlighted portion, it covers it up. The highlights mostly disappear, but it does leave behind a discoloration. It kind of reminds me of the invisible ink markers or oil spots. It works better on white paper, than ivory or cream paper. You wouldn't be able to sell a text book as "like new" if you've used it because of that.  Overall, they're okay.

title: Fun Shipping Bags!
text: I love how cute these shipping bags are! They stand out amidst the rest of the mail. The bags securely seal. They're not padded, but they are perfect for books, clothing, and other non-breakable items. They seem comparable to the plain gray and white ones that I bought at a shipping store.

title: Great Assortment!
text: Hallmark is my go-to brand when it comes to greeting cards. These cards are definitely what I would expect from the Hallmark name. They are made from heavy, sturdy cardstock. The graphics are vibrant and attractive. There is minimal embellishments, but they all do have either some embossing or glitter. Of course, they come with envelopes, too.

title: Nice Hallmark Quality
text: Hallmark cards have a reputation for being good quality cards. These are exactly what you would expect from them. They are made from heavy cardstock. The graphics are good. This is a great set of Thinking of You cards. Some of them are embellished more than others, but they're all sturdy, good quality cards. The sentiments range with their target audiences. A couple are more geared toward unspecified health/sympathy type thinking of you. There are a couple that are more appropriate for a child/college kid. Overall, it's a nice variety of greeting cards.

title: Fun for Harry Potter Fans
text: This has been a lot of fun for my teen daughter and her 9 year old cousin. They've enjoyed writing secret messages to each other without the 7 & 4 year old cousins seeing what they have written. The 4 year old has been getting huffy and upset which is funny because she's not really reading yet anyway! The set works as it says. The pen writes in invisible ink and the wand allows it to be visible. The journal is made well and has a nice authentic look to it which adds to the fun.

title: Covers My Mistakes in My Planner!
text: First I must say that I have never used any type of correction tape before. I never even knew there were products like it. I am familiar with Tombow and have used their mono-adhesive tape rollers for years. Having never used one before, I didn't know how this worked. There are some directions on the box, but I didn't read them. So on my first attempt to use it, I pulled the tape off the track and lost it. And so far, I haven't been able to fix it. I immediately saw what my mistake was and tried again on other dispenser and it worked well. I wouldn't say it worked perfectly, but it worked just fine. I used it to cover a mistake in my planner. I found that it was impossible to get the lines of the correcting tape perfectly aligned, but it did cover and white out the ink mistakes. I was never a fan of the liquid White-Out, but I am a fan of how easy this is to use. I now keep one in my desk at work and one with my planner supplies. These are relatively inexpensive and I'm glad that I discovered them!

title: No Bleed Through!
text: I love pens. There's something about them that makes me happy. This set comes with a terrific assortment of colors. I have been using them in my planner and there's no bleed through! I usually use Paper Mate Flair pens for my planner, but started using these instead. I like them better. They write a little smoother in my opinion. The pens feel like they glide better. The tips are a littler firmer than the Flair ones. I've been using these a lot since they arrived and I have been nothing but pleased with them.

title: Basic Greeting Cards
text: These are basic greeting cards. There are no embellishments or accents. However, that's not a bad thing. They are perfect for kids who may not appreciate a $5 card. It's a great value with each card costing less than a dollar. The images are colorful and bright. The inside text is appropriate and child friendly. I know that my nieces and nephew will enjoy getting them.

title: Great Assortment of Colors
text: Sharpies get used a lot at my house. We use them for crafts, labeling, projects and more. This is a great assortment of colors. My teen daughter was super excited to see the variety of colors in this set!  I don't know who Alex Morgan is, but I do appreciate that she is using this platform for her cause - Unicef Kid Power. These are fine tip markers and are exactly as you would expect Sharpies to be.

title: Updated Look
text: These name tags are an updated version of the classic light blue "Hello, My Name Is...." adhesive name tags. There are 4 different colors - turquoise, gray, red, and royal blue. Each sheet has 8 (2 of each color). They are perforated so you can remove them from the page without peeling off the back. The font is fun and cheery. I really do like the visual improvements! The stickers really do stick better to clothing. They seem to stay in place better and the edges don't come up. We used these at a recent band booster meeting at our daughter's high school. We were very impressed with them. We just wrote names on with markers, but I love that these are printer friendly. I will definitely reorder these.

title: Close to a Real Fountain Pen
text: I have dabbled a little in the world of calligraphy over the years. Prior to getting this set of pens, my experience was limited to calligraphy markers such as the Speedball Elegant Writer pens or the Sharpie ones. This is much closer to a real fountain pen than those. When I first opened the set, I immediately feared that this would be messy. I tend to make a mess when it comes to ink, but I didn't get any ink on my hands or anywhere other than the paper and then it was only when I intended for it to be there. There are 4 writing utensils, in varying widths. The "pens" come empty, but the set comes with the black and colored ink. You insert the ink into the chamber of the pen. The directions are very clear and easy to understand. The ink flows smoothly and writes well. I enjoyed playing around with different letters and swirls. The ink does take a little while to dry. Overall, this is a high quality, nice calligraphy kit.

title: Bright Colors
text: I have a thing for pens! I like having a variety of colors to choose from when writing. There are 24 pens in this set, 12 different colors. So far they seem to write pretty well, with minimal hitching. All of the colors are fairly legible, even the yellow which surprised me. These are affordable and comparable to other similar writing utensils.

title: Smooth Writing
text: I've purchased a lot of gel pens in recent years. I kind of have an obsession with writing utensils. These pens write incredibly smooth. I was impressed with how smooth they write. I haven't noticed any hitching at all when writing with these. They dry quickly, at least on regular paper. The ink has a beautiful sparkle to it. It's nice and bright and shows up well on white paper.  I did touch the ink shortly after writing with it to test whether or not it smeared (which it didn't) and I did notice that there was a little glitter/sparkles on my hand. Overall, these are excellent gel pens.

title: Great Value
text: Greeting cards have gotten so expensive over the years. It's frustrating when you spend $15 to $20 on a birthday present for your child's classmate and then your options for a card usually add another $5 to it. And most people throw out the cards later! This is a great assortment of affordable cards. They are appropriate for kids, teens and even adults. The card stock is a little thin, but it's sturdier than most dollar store greeting cards. Some of the cards even have shiny metallic accents and glitter! These are great to have on hand!

title: Great Assortment
text: I love poly envelopes such as these. I use them for all kinds of things. I have been using ones like these for years every time we travel. I keep all our hotel confirmations, passports, boarding passes, etc in them. I like having the variety of colors so I can use sort things. I used to keep my kids' medical forms in these when they would go to camp. The Velcro closures are securely affixed and don't give any indication that they might pull off. I have had some that use the string and loop which I don't like at all. These are much faster to get into and secure. You can see through them enough to get an idea of what's inside. These are a great quality product and comparable to ones that I have purchased in the past. I am very happy to have a bunch for my upcoming needs.

title: Good Size
text: These are nice sized notebooks that are perfect for various note taking. The paper is very smooth.  Ink goes on smoothly and dries fairly quickly. I didn't have any problems with smearing. I did find that my writing didn't bleed through to the other side, but there was a texture. It left indented marks of my writing on the backside which makes it not really usable to write on the back. The cover protects the paper well. The spiral doesn't extend the full side of the paper. There's a short bit at the top and the bottom of the side. The paper is perforated so you can tear it out. The paper itself doesn't tear easily. And when you do pull it to tear, it stretches first before tearing. Overall, it's a decent set of writing pads.

title: Easy to Raise & Lower
text: My son spends a lot of time gaming. He likes being able to stand up when playing, but then it makes it difficult to see the monitors. He even made his own standing desk top with a wooden board and some crates. Of course, his wasn't easy to convert and it was very ugly. I ordered him a real sit to stand desk top, but it wasn't large enough to hold both his laptop and his additional monitor. It was also difficult to raise and lower. We thought we would give this one a try. It is much larger than expected. The pictures don't show the size well at all. It's huge. It sets on top of his existing desk. It came mostly assembled and it only took a few minutes for my husband to screw the keyboard shelf into place. There is enough room on the top for his laptop and the extra monitor. There's even room to spare. It's super easy to raise and lower. There are handles that you grasp on the sides which smoothly raises the surface into position. To lower it, you grab the same handles, but you do have to apply some pressure to push it down. While raised, it's very sturdy and doesn't wobble. I was really surprised at how easy (and quick) it is to change positions. Now after seeing this in person and how well it works, my husband is considering getting one for his desk. He really needs something a little larger as he uses 3 monitors, but is considering changing back to 2 so he can use one himself.

title: Colorful and Cute Dividers
text: These dividers are bright and colorful. They are decorated with adorable Minions. The dividers are sturdy card stock. I would prefer if they were poly or laminated for longer wear, though these are heavier than the standard light yellow ones that are around. There are stickers for labeling or you can write directly on the tabs. I think I'll write on the tabs first and save the stickers for when I want to reuse them.

title: Best Spiral Notebooks!
text: These have to be some of the best spiral notebooks ever! I usually stock up on notebooks when they're on sale before school starts. It doesn't take long before the spiral coils start poking and getting in the way. The first thing I noticed with these was how strong the spiral coils are! It would take tools to make these spirals bend. The covers are sturdy poly material. The back is a heavy, thick cardboard. Inside there is a poly pocket for loose papers. These are college lined which is what my 17 year old daughter prefers.

title: Nice Variety
text: I hate having to run to the store to pick up a greeting card. I also hate spending an arm and a leg on one, too. They have gotten so expensive that I have had to start including the card in my gift budget when shopping. This is a good set of cards to have on hand. First of all, it saves going to the store. Plus, these work out to be a lot more affordable. They're not fancy, but they all have some kind of embellishment so they are definitely better than dollar store cards. There's glitter, metallic pieces, a little layering and more. Most of the cards are gender neutral and they appeal to my teenage daughter, too.

title: Cute Design
text: This is a simple new house card. It's nicer than a dollar store card, but not one of those expensive cards with a lot of handmade embellishments. At $3.99 I think it's appropriately priced. The card stock is heavy. There are some shiny metallic and glitter accents. It's a good mid-range card. The sentiment is a little humorous.

title: Sweet Baby Card
text: I'm at the age where my peers are more likely to be having grandchildren than babies. This card has a sweet sentiment for the new grandparent. The card stock is heavy. The words on the cover are embossed and the baby carriage is attached with foam tape for some dimension. The inside sentiment is on paper that is attached to the card stock. It's a sweet card, but a little simplistic for the price.

title: Definitely Higher Quality Than Those Back to School Sale Spiral Notebooks!
text: I usually buy our spiral notebooks at the back to school sales. We usually end up with Mead or store brand ones. These Oxford notebooks are noticeably better. The front covers are sturdy, but flexible poly material while the back covers are cardboard. However, the cardboard is significantly thicker than other notebooks. I'm guessing that the cardboard gives a firmer writing surface. The dividers are a lighter poly material with pockets on both sides. The spiral coil is so much stronger and heavier than the ones we normally get. I don't think they'll get twisted or bent during use. The paper doesn't seem to be any different than what we've used in the past nor does it tear on the perforated lines any easier than the other ones.

title: High Quality Card
text: This is a simple, but high quality graduation card. The card stock is a heavy weight. The front cover is a shiny metallic. The front design is embossed. The tassel on the cover gives dimension to the card. The inside pocket is generously sized and appropriate for a money gift. I would like to see this card offered in different colors so you could match the graduates high school color.

title: Modern Looking
text: This is a sturdy, acrylic note card organizer. It's got a modern design and looks nice. It comes with 25 dot styled index cards and 5 poly dividers. My teenage daughter loves the dot style cards. She's recently started a bullet journal and enjoys following the dot style to record her notes and thoughts. With dot style index cards, she can continue that style with her school notes. I'm definitely ordering her more dot index cards before the new school year starts. The only thing I don't care for with this organizer is the open corners. I found that when setting it up, the index cards often got caught in the opening and required some adjusting. Other than that, I think this is much nicer looking than the solid plastic box type index card organizer.

title: Affordable, Basic Cards
text: These are really basic cards. They're colorful and attractive. There's really no place to put cash or checks if that's what you're giving. There are cutout corners on one side for you to insert a gift card. I thought it was a bit strange that there's a $_______ for you to write the amount on the card. I put cash in the ones that I used and there wasn't any place to put it, so I just slipped it inside the card. The card stock is light weight and not heavy like the more premium cards. At the listed price of $5.99, that comes to about $1 per card. That's definitely a good deal and when you have a lot of graduates that you need to send cards to, this is affordable.

title: High Quality, Gender Neutral Card
text: This is a beautiful gender neutral retirement card. It's made with heavy card stock. It has a nice geometric design on the front with metallic gold lines. A few of the shapes are cutouts showing the green card stock beneath. The layered sentiment on the front is attached with foam tape to give it some dimension. The metallic design continues inside. The inside sentiment is on thinner, white paper which has plenty of room for you to personalize your note. The coordinating envelope has a different color inside. This is a great quality card and lives up to the Hallmark name.

title: Sturdy & Strong D-Rings
text: These are pretty good binders. I was actually surprised by how much I liked them. The D-Rings are especially impressive. They are very sturdy and strong. They open and close easily. The binder covers are good, but they do flex quite a bit and I see the potential of it getting bent over time. They're not flimsy like some of the cheaper binders are, but they aren't super sturdy either. These have the clear pockets on both the front and back cover as well as the spine for customization. I like these enough that I will definitely consider ordering these or other sizes the next time I need some binders.

title: Fun, Sparkly Card!
text: This is a darling shaker card! I used to make my own shaker cards and they were quite time consuming. This card is filled with different colors of glitter, without all the mess that goes with glitter. The geometric design is fun and contemporary. I love blank cards because you can use them for all kinds of occasions.  The card is a little thicker than standard cards and may require additional postage. It's well made and definitely what you would expect from the Hallmark name.

title: Fun, Whimsical Friendship Card
text: This is a fun, whimsical card for a friend. It's made from heavy card stock. There are embossed (raised) designs and accents with a little bit of metallic shine around the edges. My teenage daughter wants to send it to her BFF this summer, just for fun. In a world where everyone communicates by text or email, receiving a card in the mail is always special. This card is what you would expect from the Hallmark brand.

title: Sturdier Than a Similar Rainbow Cart That We Have
text: This is a useful cart to have in my craft room. It requires some assembly. It was not difficult to put together and took my husband no more than twenty minutes from start to finish. The drawers come flat and the sides had to be snapped into position. Once it was properly assembled, the unit was very stable and fairly sturdy. There are 8 shallow drawers. Each drawer glides well. My daughter has a rainbow cart similar to this and her drawers come out of the rack a little too easily and have to be reinserted frequently. The piece where the drawers slide into on this cart is wider with higher edges, so they stay in place much better. They can be totally removed if necessary. The cart rolls well and doesn't wobble. This cart, overall, is much sturdier than the rainbow one in my daughter's room.

title: Contemporary Father's Day Cards
text: This is a set of 6 note cards. They are small and not the same size as typical greeting cards. The assortment is contemporary and geared toward a younger market. The quality is very nice and what you would expect from the Hallmark brand. They are simple, but heavy card stock and embossed images and words. The size would be perfect to go along with a gift or to insert inside a gift bag or box. They could be sent through the mail, but they are small. None of these are ones that I would send to my elderly father. They would work for husband though.

title: Great for Traveling
text: This is one of the better looking rolling tote/cart units that I have seen. It's simple to open and fold. The handle extends easily without hitching. I'm hesitant to put really heavy things inside of it, but for light to mid-weight items, it's worked well. There are two handles on the top so you can carry it when it's not possible to pull it such as on stairs. The wheels seem secure and durable, but they aren't the spinner type ones that go all directions. It has a nice sized outer pocket and the whole thing zips to keep items secure. The material is polyester and PVC and it can be wiped with a damp cloth.

title: Great for Planners!
text: I jumped on to the planner craze this year and have become obsessed with all things planners. I love buying brightly colored pens that I can adorn my planner with. I have learned that not all markers work in planners! Some inks bleed through and ruin the look of the planner pages. These pens do not bleed through! They dry quickly and don't smear either. They come in a fun assortment of bright colors. The tips are medium instead of fine tip which I prefer, but they still work well. They write smoothly compared to other gel pens that I have used. I have had minimal ink hitches. Since these are click type pens, I don't have to remove and replace caps all the time while I am writing in my planner. I plan to purchase another set for my good friend who is also obsessed with planners!

title: Nice Variety of Colors
text: These are basic craft pipe cleaners. They are 12 inches long and come with a variety of colors. There are fifty craft stems in this package. I think the name "giant" is misleading. My daughter recently needed long craft stems for a costume and she found ones that were much longer and thicker. I know that there are smaller and thinner ones, too. These are in between. I work in a special needs classroom and the kids have been using these for stringing beads. Craft stems work much better because the beads don't slide off as easily as when working with yarn or thread. Overall, these are decent craft supplies and comparable to what you can find in the craft section of local stores.

title: Fun, Good Quality Card
text: What a cute, fun card! It's definitely what you would expect from the premium Hallmark card line. The base of the card is sturdy. The confetti is contained by a plastic overlay and will not make a mess. However, the confetti tends to bunch up in the corners and doesn't move around as much as it probably should. The colors are gender neutral. This is the perfect card for someone who gets a promotion, new job, or acceptance into a program or school.

title: Good Quality Card
text: This is a cute Mother's Day card for Grandma. The cardstock is a heavy weight. It has some shiny, embossed-like details. The removable sticker is a fun addition. The sentiment inside is sweet. At the price, I would expect a little more embellishing, but it's a nice card. Overall, it's what I would expect from a Hallmark card.

title: Higher Quality Than I Expected
text: At first I wasn't sure if this binder was really a premium, but I have been comparing it with some of the binders I already have and it does seem to be a better quality than those. I tend to buy either the cheapest or middle of the road binders. The cover of this is significantly thicker and should resist warping or bending a lot better. I really like the slanted D-rings. All of my other binders have the traditional round rings. The rings open and close effortlessly. Another thing that shows how little I know about binders, is regarding the "view" description. I thought that was due to the hole in the spine of the binder. I thought that was ridiculous because all you would be able to see is the edges of the papers which would not look any different from other various binders. I had to look it up and find out that the purpose of the hole is to put your finger in to help remove the binder from the shelf or to help when carrying a particularly heavy binder. It does have the vinyl pocket on the front cover so you can insert a cover sheet. The current price is listed at $18. My first reaction is that's pretty high, but what do I know as I always go for the cheap binders! The quality is definitely higher than the ones I am used to, so perhaps the price is right on target for that.

title: Writes Smoothly!
text: This liquid gel pen writes so smoothly! The ink flows really well without any glitches. It looks like it would be heavy, but it's fairly light weight. The ink doesn't smear, even immediately after writing which impressed me a lot. The only thing I really don't care for is the gold color. It reminds me of a gimmicky bank pen. Silver would be more to my liking. I realize that is a personal preference and does not have any effect on the performance of this writing tool. There's also a barcode sticker on the barrel of the pen which I haven't been able to completely remove yet. It's a very nice pen, but it would not be mistaken for one of those ridiculously expensive pens.

title: Basic Rulers
text: It's a two pack of standard, plastic 6 inch rulers. They're transparent so you can see through to the paper below. They're small enough to fit inside a pencil bag.

title: No Bleed Through
text: I love colorful pens and markers. It's kind of an obsession. I love this assortment of colors. They don't bleed through my planner pages which is a big deal to me. I am very happy with them!

title: Great Colors
text: Tons of highlighters! I love the variety of colors. The purple is a new highlighter color to me. They allow the writing to be seen through the highlighted marks.

title: Cute Stamps!
text: Super Cute stamp set. It's a little smaller than I expected, but it fits in my planner well. It's compact and includes all the days of the week. They snap together easily. There is an ink pad in the bottom and it works well.

title: Beautiful Foil Embossed Card
text: This is a beautiful, foil embossed Valentine's Day card. Inside, there is sturdy paper with an embossed message. There's a string with an "I Love You" cardstock tag attached to the outer front cover. It's definitely a card for a spouse or significant other. It's a high quality card and what you would expect from Hallmark.

title: Great Vintage Valentine!
text: I love this retro vinyl Valentine card! I don't always get my husband a Valentine's Day card, but I can't wait to give him this one this February. We bought a record player (and it comes with a 45 adapter) and we've had fun collecting vinyl over the past year. This record comes with 2 INXS hits that were released in 1987 which happens to be the year my husband and I met. The card itself is a heavy cardstock and good quality. It's not a "mushy" card and sentiment, which I like a lot. The card has a vintage look to it and reminds me of old vinyl records. New release albums are in the $20-25 range, so that although this is about half of that, you do get two hit songs on this, plus a card. One of my least favorite things about 45s is that you would get one song plus another that you didn't want or at least you didn't know it very well because it was the B side!

title: Cute Snoopy Valentine's Day Card
text: This Valentine card is what you would expect from the standard Hallmark line. It is made from sturdy cardstock and does have some shiny metallic decoration. It does not have any layering which is why I would say this is a standard card rather than a deluxe one. It comes with a coordinating envelope.

title: Great Quality Cards
text: This is an excellent set of Valentine's cards. I have several young nieces and nephews. I like to send them cards for the different holidays. It's such a big deal for them to receive "real" mail! I usually end up buying the 99 cent cards at the store or going to the discount store to pick up cheap cards, but these are much nicer. The cardstock is a good weight - not like those cheap cards. Plus, the cards have shiny metallic heart accents on them. They definitely are what you would expect from the Hallmark brand. Unfortunately, all the cards are the same, so I do need to get a different set of cards so siblings don't receive the same cards!

title: Great for Homemade Gifts
text: These labels live up to the Avery name. They are good quality labels. These labels are part of the Astrobrights product line and come in the bright neon colors. They are perfect for homemade gift labels! My daughter designed some really cute labels using MS Word and was very pleased with how they turned out. The labels peel off easily and they did not have any difficulties going through our ink jet printer.

title: Smooth Writing
text: I love these permanent markers! They have a fine tip which allowed for smooth, precise writing. They are definitely comparable to Sharpie brand permanent markers. They do bleed through regular paper, but so do Sharpies. They dry quickly and if you allow them a quick moment to dry, they don't smear. If you immediately rub your finger over it they will smear a bit, but that is what happens with the Sharpie brand, too. The box has 24 markers.

title: Heavy Cardstock Pages!
text: This is a beautiful baby book! It is a sturdy 3 ring binder with heavy cardstock pages. The pages are fill-in-the-blank with the history of the parents, the pregnancy and the typical first year stuff. The cardstock pages are heavy enough that your writing will not bleed through. Because it is a 3 ring binder, you can rearrange pages or add things if you would like. You could even take pages out if they didn't apply to you. The book is feminine, but not girly. There are gold foil accents on some of the pages. It comes in a sturdy keepsake storage box. This would make an excellent baby gift.

title: Performs Well
text: My first use with this stapler didn't work. I had a couple of staples come out, and neither of them actually stapled the paper. But after that slight hiccup, I haven't had any issues with it. I didn't have any stacks of 25 pieces of paper needed to be stapled, so I hunted around for some scrap paper. I found 17 pieces and the stapler handled it without any problems. I folded that stack in half and tried it again and it worked on that as well which would be equivalent to 34 pieces. The end of the finished staple was completely through all the sheets of the paper and held them securely. I was impressed with that. The actual stapler is light weight and doesn't have a very heavy duty feel to it, but it performs well. It comes filled with staples. You can extend the whole stapler so you can staple on to bulletin boards or even longer paper where a stapler wouldn't normally be able to reach. Overall, it's a good working stapler.

title: Great Office Chair
text: This office chair requires some assembly. The directions are easy to follow and it was put together in less than ten minutes. The chair is a bit on the firm side, but comfortable. It makes me want to sit up in it instead of slouch. The wheels move well and offers great stability. I love the retro design of this chair! I am using it in my home office to replace the folding chair that I have been using since my previous office chair broke.

title: Convenient Way to Print Phone Pictures
text: The Selphy photo printer is an easy way to print pictures from your phone. Set up was easy. We tried it with both an Android and an iPhone. We had to download an App for use on the Android, but the iPhone did not require one. My daughter was very pleased that she could print out photos from her iPhone without having to download anything. She is always complaining about lack of space on her phone, so if it required her to download something, she probably wouldn't keep up with it. The photo quality is good, but not great. Definitely adequate for phone pictures. The printer is quiet and it prints in about a minute.

title: Easy Set Up!
text: This was one of the easiest printers to set up. My last printer was a Cannon and I finally gave up on setting it up and had to wait for my husband to help me. This one was simple enough for my non-technical self to set up on my own. The touch screen panel works beautifully! My Cannon printer had a touch screen, but it was awkward. This one responds well to touch and has a clear, easy to read screen. The controls are more user friendly, too. I love that there are two trays and they have a large capacity. My Cannon didn't hold that much paper and I would have to go refill it because a note window would pop open on my computer telling me to add more paper. The WiFi connectivity works great. I love that I don't have to turn on my printer manually before it will print. This one wakes up and starts printing. Printed pages look nice. The color pictures on some recipes that I just printed out are a little fuzzy and not clear and sharp, but the print is amazing. I was a little disappointed to learn that there's no place to insert heavy paper. I just bought some 32 weight paper to print out pages for my planner. I will have to do that on another printer. Plus, my daughter tends to print on cardstock for school. It's not too noisy, but it's loud enough that I can hear that it's working when I'm in the other room. If it was too quiet, I would have to get up and make sure everything was working. So far, I am pleased with its performance.

title: Sturdy & Colorful
text: I work in a special education classroom. One of our data notebooks is organized a chart style notebook. We were using homemade dividers that we made from cardstock, but when I saw these, I thought they would be perfect! The dividers are made from a sturdy poly plastic. Each one is a different color with no duplicate colors. The tabs are preprinted with various medical related subjects on one side, but the other sides are blank. We have put labels on the blank side for our needs. There are 14 dividers so we have more than enough for data collection.

title: Informative & Interesting
text: I grew up in Indiana, so I really didn't know much about California history at all. I found these books to be very informative as well as interesting. The books are appropriate for elementary aged students. They're probably a bit too difficult for the younger grade, but perfect for third through fifth. Of course, younger students with higher reading levels may do okay with them. The material is told in a "matter of fact" voice. They don't try to influence points of views. There are lots of color illustrations and photographs. I liked reading some of the little side bar notes. There is a lot of overlap between the books. Some of the explorers, missionaries, and events make appearances in some of the other titles. I actually learned a lot from this book set.

title: Great Colors, But Bleeds Through Planner Pages
text: I love markers. I was hoping these would work in my planner, but unfortunately they do bleed through the mid-weight paper. It's a fun assortment of colors. And even though I can't use these as I originally intended, they are not going to waste. My teenage daughter has claimed them for her marker needs.

title: Best Spiral Notebook!
text: I didn't expect there to be anything special about a spiral notebook, but I was pleasantly surprised. After recently purchasing several spiral notebooks for my high school and college kids, I was very impressed with this one. The covers are much sturdier than the typical Mead notebook. The back cover is a thick cardboard and is actually helpful to write on because it gives a nice support. The wire spiral is also thicker and stronger. I can't easily ply it or bend it. There's a pocket inside the front cover. I don't notice any difference with the actual paper. It doesn't seem any better or worse than other notebooks that I have used. It's college ruled. I love the company's "buy one book and we give one book to the needy on your behalf" campaign. I totally think this notebook is worth the price because of the quality of the product and the outreach of the company.

title: Great Printing!
text: This is our third Canon Pixma printer. I have an older model that I keep in my upstairs office. My teenage son has one in his bedroom in the basement. My husband has a Brothers printer down in his home office in the basement.  This printer is located on the main floor of the house and since it's wireless, it's the most convenient one. It's also the newest, most modern one in the house. Comparing it to my older model Pixma, my favorite feature is the LCD Touchscreen. Our other Pixma printers have scanners/printing features, but none have the fax option. We don't need to do a lot of faxing, but there are occasions that come up a few times a year where they are needed. The print quality on this new model is excellent. Everything I have printed has been great looking. Most of my printing has been done from my laptop. Every time I print something, I get an error message telling me that it can't find the printer. I then have an "aha" moment and run into the guest room where we keep it and turn it on. Moments later, I end up with two copies of whatever I printed out because I always go back and reprint it when it was just waiting for power. My old Pixma won't print unless I manually turn it on. In a perfect world, my printer would wake up when it receives a document and not require the step of turning it on. I am really pleased with the copier mode. I use that all the time. The set up was a little tricky for me. I was able to do the initial set up and everything was fine. Then it instructed me to go to a website and that's where I had troubles. Thankfully, my husband didn't have any problems and was able finish the set up. I can be technology challenged sometimes.  I love that I can now print things from my phone without having to email it to me first. Overall, a very good printer.

title: Smoothest Pen I've Ever Used!
text: I like pens. I buy pens..... A LOT! Of course, the pens I usually buy are not 23k gold. I tend to buy fun, disposable pens that cost just a fraction of this one. I do have to say that this pen is the smoothest pen I've ever used. The ink flows so smoothly without any interruption. The cheap rollerball pens that I have, usually have some kind of hitch that require shaking or making circles/scratch marks to get the flow going again. This pen had no hesitation or interruption of ink at all which was very impressive. I was also surprised that the ink doesn't smear, at least on the paper I have been using so far. I'm sure a non-porous paper would smear, but I've been running my finger over my writings and there have been no smears at all. The pen comes in a fancy box, ready for gifting. It really is a gift worthy pen if there's such a thing. I do think it's pretty pricey, but it is a quality writing tool.

title: No Bleed Through!
text: I bought these pens to use in my planner. I was having troubles finding markers that don't bleed through. I am pleased to say that there is no bleed through with these Sharpie pens!! I keep them in a zipper pencil bag so I can take them with me when I have my planner with me. I wish there were more colors though! I bought some other Sharpie fine point pens, but those did bleed through.

title: Cute, Basic Cards
text: Good assortment of basic cards. I'm terrible about sending birthday cards to my family and friends. I thought if I bought some inexpensive cards that it might help me with my goal of improving on that. These are nice, photograph image cards. The cards are pretty basic though, with no layering or embellishments. I keep a few of these at work so I always have a card on hand when I need it.

title: Cute Assortment
text: I ordered these stickers to use in my planner. They are cute, but a little pricey in my opinion. They remind me of scrapbooking stickers. I know there's a lot crossover between scrapbooking and planners these days. The illustrations are cute and there is a nice assortment of holiday stickers.

title: Cute & Colorful
text: These magnets are perfect to use in my planner to mark certain pages. They're a little more expensive than what they sell for at my local craft store, which disappointed me. The colors are bright and they stay in place nicely.

title: Great Selection and Quality of Greeting Cards!
text: This card set exceeded my expectations. A lot of times when you have a set of greeting cards like this, the cards are thin, simple, basic and often not what you would pick out if you were buying a single card. These cards are super nice. Many of them have embellishments or layers. So many of them are ones that I would actually buy individually. There are 16 cards and they cover birthdays, showers, weddings, babies, and more. Each card and envelope pairing is in a plastic sleeve so it's protected from smudges. The cards are a mid-weight and not flimsy. You can probably add a few more cards if you want. There are dividers with stickers so you can organize them. The storage box is cute. I am very impressed with this set and I'm looking forward to having such a nice selection of cards for the next time I need to send one.

title: Cute Frozen Card
text: This Frozen birthday card is just what you would expect from the Hallmark line. It's a tri-fold card with a peekaboo front cover. When you open it up, it shows you a sticker sheet with a "build a snowman/Olaf". Then inside it has Anna & Elsa in a wintery scene. The card is priced fairly and comparable to what you would find in the stores. My soon to be 4 year old niece will love it!

title: Super Cute Card!
text:
This card is absolutely adorable!!! "Happy" is written in real looking sprinkles. They are securely affixed and don't seem to be at risk of coming off the card. My sixteen year old daughter saw this and immediately took it to give to a friend this week. It's a sturdy, good quality card, like you would expect from Hallmark. It looks like it would be one of the higher priced ones that you would find in the card section because of the added embellishment.

* I also got the "Candle Bundle" card which is from the same listing. It's another high quality, cute birthday card with embellishments. It has real wax candle-like decoration strongly adhered to the front of the card. Another deluxe Hallmark card!

title: Good Size for Documents
text: These envelopes are a good size. The poly material is not as sturdy as some similar envelopes I have gotten before, but it's okay. I've had issues with one of the envelops losing it's Velcro tab so far. The stickiness was still pretty strong, so I was able to restick it, but don't know how long that will last. The envelopes are translucent enough so you can see what's inside which is helpful for grabbing the correct one. I like to use these envelopes for documents, board passes, itineraries, etc.  when traveling.

title: Funny!
text: This is a funny, nice quality birthday card. It's made from a good weight of card stock and has some gold, foil embellishments on the beer bottles. This card lives up to the Hallmark/Shoebox name.

title: Sassy & Fun Cards!
text:
The Hallmark Studio Ink line of greeting cards are sassy and fun! These cards are slightly edgy compared to traditional cards and I can't see myself giving them to just anybody. But we all have those snarky or quirky friends that these would be perfect for! The cards are made from a nice weight of card stock. Three of the five are flat, basic cards with no embellishments at all. One has some shiny gold accents and the emoji one appears to have stickers which could be removed. They are square shaped instead of rectangular and have a note on the envelope that additional postage may be required. They are nice quality cards and what I would expect from the Hallmark brand.

**I also got the "Birthday 5 Card Assortment" which is on the same listing. Those cards are gorgeous! They all have some type of embellishment such as layering, embossing, ribbons, or glitter. Some of them have more than one enhancement. One card comes with a white envelope, but the other ones are a solid color. The cards are high quality and great for having on hand.

title: Good Assortment to Have on Hand
text: This is a cute assortment of general birthday cards. There are four different designs and three of each design. They are printed on a light weight card stock and each design is embellished with a bit of glitter. Birthday cards have gotten so expensive lately. My teenage daughter is frequently invited to birthday parties and I cringe every time we go buy a birthday card. I try to steer her to the 99 cent cards, but that doesn't always work. This set of cards is a step above the 99 cent ones and is perfect for her friends who probably end up throwing the cards away anyway. Plus, having some cards on hand saves me a trip to the store!

title: Affordable!
text: Great deal for basic name badges. These stick well to most clothing. The add-on price of less than $2 is a great bargain! Definitely much cheaper than what I can get at the local stores.

title: A Unique Wooden Card!
text: This is a very impressive card. Although I read the product description before it arrived, I was surprised to see that it is actually a wooden card! I was assuming it just looked like wood. The layer of wood is thin and light weight. That layer is attached to a traditional cardstock base. The words are etched into the wood. You can feel the indentations. The envelope has the "may require additional postage" notice. I probably will hand deliver the card to my Dad. It's a very nice looking card and a premium quality.

title: Washes Away!
text: These small labels really do dissolve away! I was quite impressed with that. They're lightly colored and nearly translucent. These are pretty small, so you can't write a lot of information on them, but they do come in larger sizes if that's what you need. The first label I used, I held it under the kitchen faucet. It started to dissolve, but I did use a wash rag to wipe it all the way off. There was no adhesive left on the container. There was a little bit of white paper remains on the rag, but after a few more seconds under the running water, that was gone, too. I put another one through the dishwasher and there was absolutely no evidence of it afterwards. I think these are very handy to have. The price does seem a bit high for a set of 50 small labels.

title: Great Assortment of Colors!
text: Great price for an assortment of sharpies! The colors are beautiful. I ordered the fine tip pens to use in my planner, but unfortunately they do bleed through a little bit. My teenage daughter was more than happy to take them off my hands.

title: Beautiful Planner!
text: I used to struggle every year trying to find the perfect planner. Then after much resistance, my husband convinced me to go digital with my calendar. I must say, it's convenient sharing online calendars and being able to access it from my laptop or my phone. Then the new school year started. My coworkers all have beautiful planners and lots of markers in fun colors. I had planner envy. I decided to create my own non-planner. I bought a bunch of inserts and supplies at Michael's to make my own "Happy Planner" which included a fitness section,meal planner,  house cleaning schedule, and to-do section.  I was becoming more organized, but I still had the planner envy thing going on because I didn't have a calendar planner. I looked around at calendar/agendas and couldn't settle on what. I didn't want to add more pages to my Happy Planner because it was already pretty full with all of my non-calendar stuff. Then I saw the Emily Ley Paper calendar. It's just basically, just a calendar. It doesn't duplicate the items I have in my other planner. Each day has its own page which I love! There's plenty of room to put the fun planner stickers and draw colorful doodles with my new markers. There are colorful tabs that separate each month.  I really like the little weekly prep feature on each weekend page. The pages are a nice weight and my markers do not bleed through. The spiral binding is not flimsy at all. It does come with one page of stickers, which won't last very long, but now I can buy some of those other cute planner stickers out there! I am still using the digital calendar. I can't deny the convenience of that. The physical planner is more of a fun, creative outlet. I get some kind of satisfaction seeing my life in a colorful and pretty book. It's fun picking out the colors and stickers that I want to use with it. I know that I'm probably over doing it, but I'm having fun.

title: No Bleed Through!
text: I just got into the whole planner craze. I bought a fancy planner and a couple of sets of Sharpie Ultra Fine markers so I could colorfully organize my life. Well, the markers that I bought (which said "does not bleed through paper") bled through the thick paper of my planner. I immediately searched for a new set of markers. I read through the questions for these pens and this topic had been addressed by a few customers. I am very happy to say that these markers do not bleed through!!! I am using the Happy Planner for everything other than my calendar and these pens don't bleed through to the other side. I have a different planner for my family calendar and it doesn't bleed through it either. This set has a great variety of colors. The pens are triangular in shape so they don't roll around which is a nice feature.

title: Good, Basic Envelopes
text: This a good, basic 9x12 envelopes. They are light weight and come with a peel off adhesive strip. They are light enough that you are able to read some of the printed material inside. They are a good value and I would consider purchasing them again.

title: Darling Illustrations!
text: This calendar/planner is absolutely adorable! It's just a little larger than my cell phone, so it would easily fit inside your purse. It has a soft cover that doesn't feel too flimsy.  The cover is in color with metallic accents. The illustrations are gorgeous! Each month is a two page spread and has a small amount of blank lines on the side for notes. Then there is a page dedicated for notes at the end of each quarter. My daughter has claimed this to keep track of her activities and projects. She likes it because it doesn't take up too much room in her backpack. There isn't a lot of room to write details, so if you need to be able to write down a lot of information pertaining to your schedule, this may not be right for you.

title: Great for Home Use!
text: I purchased a different Wolverine Slide Converter a few years ago, but it only worked with slides and traditional negatives. I was so thrilled to find this one that worked with APS flim! Back in the 1990's, my husband and I purchased an APS camera, never thinking about how difficult it would be access the film many years later. Our son was born in 1998 and all of his early pictures were taken with the APS camera. We got our first digital camera in 2002, about a year after our daughter arrived. My son graduated from high school a year ago. When I was looking up old pictures to compile, I couldn't find any digital ones earlier than 2002. I was able to scan some of his professional portraits, but I didn't have any of the candid ones. All of the original prints were glued down into scrapbooks. I am absolutely ecstatic to have digital access to those pictures now! Using the APS film with this machine was a little more complicated than I expected. You have to pull the negative strip out of the APS canister. The directions tell you to look up videos on YouTube, so that's what we did. Once you pull the negative strip out, it's pretty easy to use. The images show up on the viewing screen. The machine is easy to use and perfect for home use. The pictures look ever so slightly grainy, but for my purposes, they're perfect. Being able to see these old pictures again is priceless! We used our other machine to digitize our parents' 60 plus year old slides. We tried a few of them in this machine and the results were comparable.

title: Okay for the Price
text: It's just what my teenage daughter wanted. It's not particularly sturdy, but it's not falling apart yet. We've used white chalk markers on it and if you erase it when you're finished with it (as opposed to leaving it for days) it cleans pretty well with minimal ghosting behind.

title: Great for Times When You Need to Take Notes & Makes Lists
text: Many, many years ago, I used to use the At-A-Glance Agenda/Planner. Now I use the calendar on my phone, but there are times when I do prefer writing notes/lists on paper instead. This notebook is a good quality and what you would expect from the At-A-Glance line. There's room for notes and a side section for lists. It has a double spiral binding which is pretty sturdy and doesn't look like it will bend easily. There are no dates on the pages, so you can use them as you need them. The pages are perforated so you can tear them out. The only thing I would like to see added, would be for the list section of the paper to be perforated as well. There are times when I might want to just remove the list, but leave the notes bound.

title: Long Lasting Leads that Don't Break Easily
text: My teenagers love these mechanical pencils. These were priced lower than what I can find them at my local stores. At this price, I ordered each of my kids a box. According to my them, the leads don't break very easily when writing with these like some mechanical pencils.

title: Great Deal!
text: A great price for a dozen Sharpie markers! I've been a fan of Sharpies for years and these are just as expected. My teenage daughter found them already and has started using them for her own purposes. There is a good selection/variety of colors.

title: Love the Assortment of Colors!
text: I am a longtime fan of Paper Mate Flair Felt Tip Pens. The quality of these pens is comparable to other Paper Mate Flairs that I have purchased and used in the past. The assortment of colors is amazing!! I love using Flair pens to write my shopping lists, or to add events to my calendar. My daughter likes to borrow my Flairs to write in her school agenda. The colors seem to be all different, but there are a few that are pretty similar. I haven't had any issues with smearing unless I intentionally rub over my writing immediately afterwards or while I'm still writing. If I wait a couple of seconds, it seems to be dry which is pretty fast in my opinion. The tips are nice and fine.

title: Works Well
text: I am the treasurer for my daughter's high school orchestra. We didn't have a "for a deposit" stamp so until this arrived, I was having to hand write to endorse all of the checks. This works well and as expected. Every image is inked well - but not overly inked where it globs. It's easy to use and has saved a lot of time for me.

title: Decent Assortment of Colors
text: I have joined the adult coloring craze. I find it very relaxing and satisfying. I also have two teenagers who enjoy coloring, too. These pencils are not as good as I had hoped, especially with the BIC name. First of all, the tin won't stay closed at all. Once the plastic shrink wrap came off, the lid hasn't been all the way closed. I plan to have my husband look at it and see if he can fix it. I do like that it comes with a metal storage tin. Usually that would be better than the cardboard boxes many of the pencils come in. There are 24 pencils in this set. The barrels of these pencils are black. At first I thought that was cool. They look really contemporary. But with some of the colors, it is really difficult to tell them apart from one another, especially some of the darker colors. Plus, some of those darker colors require a lot of pressure to reach their actual color and that is not something that you can tell from the leads at all. The pencils have an engraved number on each one, that I assume is a color code, but it is meaningless to me. The color names are not printed on them either. The colors require a lot of pressure. Even with full pressure, the colors are not as vibrant as I expected. Several of the tips broke off when I was testing them. The actual leads didn't break, but just the sharp tips. They sharpen easily in an electric pencil sharpener. There is a decent assortment of colors for a smaller set.

title: Similar to Ones at the Big Stores
text: This receipt book is very similar to what I have purchased at the big chain office supply store. It is a little narrower, but that's the only difference. You do have to rip the cover off to use as a protector so it doesn't transfer through to the other pages, but you have to do that with the ones from the big stores, too. They tear apart pretty easily. They do the job.

title: Great Price
text: I keep buying variety packs of coin wrappers and then I run out of the quarter ones. I decided I needed just quarter ones since I go through those the most. They are just as expected. A few were flattened, but they are easy to reshape. I prefer the ones like this that have the finished bottom so I don't have to keep my finger there to prevent them from falling out. This price is much better than what I found at Wal-Mart or the office supply stores.

title: Great Combination of Pen & Stylus!
text: My favorite pens are the Paper Mate InkJoy ones, so I was thrilled to see that they have come out with a pen/stylus combo. I have several packages of the regular InkJoy pens and prefer them over other inexpensive writing utensils. The pen shape/pen performance of this is just as I expected with an InkJoy pen. The ink flow is amazing for a pen. The barrel is thick enough to get a proper grip. I don't regularly use a stylus, but there are occasions that I do , such as playing certain games on my phone or tablet. The rubber stylus tip is a good size. It slides across the screen well without catching or hitching. The only thing  I don't like about this is that the pen looks so much like the regular InkJoy pen, that I sometimes grab the wrong one. It does have the word "Stylus" written along the side of the barrel, but other than that, it looks identical to all of my regular InkJoy pens. I am excited to see this offered in other colors, too. I will definitely be purchasing more of these.

title: Beautiful Lap Desk!
text:
This lap desk is so nice! My first reaction to it when I saw it was how beautiful it was. The bamboo is beautiful! The edges are smooth and nicely finished. It's solid feeling but not too heavy. It's a large enough size to comfortably fit my seventeen inch laptop. My Samsung Galaxy J7 fits in one of the phone slots, even with the case on. There's plenty of room for my wireless mouse on the designated pad. My mouse moves pretty easily on the felt-like pad. I didn't realize how warm my laptop is when it's resting on my lap until I got this. There was an immediate difference in the temperature. It went from warm to cool instantly. The slats allow air to flow and circulate and keep the laptop from overheating. I had a plastic bean bag style lap desk, but this not only looks better, but it's really does provide a better work surface for me.

* I received this for free directly from the seller in exchange for my honest & unbiased review. My thoughts & opinions are my own.

title: What a Time Saver!
text:
[[VIDEOID:6875c9856d9bd29398981f4ef0bfb4c6]] [[VIDEOID:44d4f511495276e59344a0104ff9175c]] Somehow I got suckered in to being the treasurer for my daughter's school orchestra. They are just finishing up their candy bar fund raiser, so this could not have come at a better time. First of all, this worked straight out of the box. I was able to use it by myself which says a lot. Often, I have to rely on my husband's expertise on things like this. You put a stack of bills into the machine and it gives you the total number of bills. This is going to save a lot of time! When I used to be on the school PTA board, we would have to count money from various events. I can't tell you how many times I would have to restart because I lost my place. We always had to double count (two different volunteers) so if the numbers didn't match up, we would start over. Here, you just find out how many bills you have of a particular denomination, then you calculate the value of those bills. This also detects counterfeit bills, though I am not sure how it does that. Every time I tested some bills in the machine, I hand counted them to make sure that it was accurate and it was. Extra parts are provided which is nice. I am not dreading counting all the candy bar money now!

*I received this for free directly from the seller in exchange for my honest & unbiased review. My thoughts & opinions are my own.

title: Not Blank on the Back Side
text: I always read the reviews before making a purchase, but I was in a hurry to buy these so I didn't read any before ordering them. I figured, that they're tickets, how bad can they be? These are considered "blank" tickets. The description picture shows a blank ticket. I knew that they still had the numbers on them. I just was expecting the back side to be blank too. Instead they have a huge advertisement for the company. I understand the need for promoting your business and all that, but to take up the whole back side of the ticket! I had to change the way I was going to use these because of that big logo on the back. I was very disappointed when I discovered this. As far as the actual tickets, they are standard ticket quality. They are stapled which is a pain, but not the end of the world. Overall, they are just okay and that's totally because of the writing on the back.

title: Decent But Not What I Was Looking For
text: The school I work at provides employees with a hard plastic badge holder for their work ID. Mine broke and I have been trying to find a replacement. Unfortunately, this is not it. The title says hard plastic, but I would say that they are more like the sturdy vinyl ones that often come with lanyards. I knew it was risky ordering them sight unseen. They are also slightly larger than I expected. When I did put my ID badge inside, it moved around through out the day. The quality of these is fine, they are just not what I was wanting.

title: Better Than I Expected
text: I usually wear my work ID on a lanyard. I rarely wear jewelry, specifically necklaces, because it interferes with the lanyard. I have been looking at retractable ID reels so I can clip my ID to my pocket or belt loop. I don't completely trust a lot of the ones out there because of their cheap clips. When I saw these had a carabiner type clip, I thought this would be perfect! The carabiner clip is easy to use and feels very sturdy. There is also a metal clip if you don't have anything to clip the carabiner too. The badge retractor glides without glitching. It doesn't have a cheap feel to it at all. I wonder what my coworkers will think now that I am wearing jewelry!!

title: Great Value!
text:
These wristbands are perfect for so many different uses. The quality is comparable to ones that I have seen at the party store, except they are significantly more affordable. I couldn't believe how expensive the party store sells these in quantities of 100 wrist bands! The color is a beautiful blue. It doesn't really seem like a neon blue, but it's pretty nonetheless. They are plain, but they can have your text printed or written on them. The adhesive works well and they really do seem on par with other brands. I would say that these are good for a single use event. They are made of a coated paper.

*I purchased this at a discounted price in exchange for my honest & unbiased review. My thoughts & opinions are my own.

title: Nice for Organizing Desk Supplies
text: My son is going off to college in a few weeks, so I ordered this to help him be organized. I had looked for similar items at my local office supply store and local discount store, but what they had cost more than I wanted to pay. This has enough spots to store a variety of desk supplies and it was a good price. The material is sturdy enough for storing pencils and such. It was just what a I wanted.

title: Good Dry Erase Markers!
text: This is a great assortment of dry erase markers. The magnet works well enough to keep them on the refrigerator next to my dry erase board. The markers are plenty juicy enough without being too wet. They erase easily and don't leave any ink stains behind.

title: Easy to Remove and Reposition
text: This dry erase surface is really easy to move around and straighten up as needed. I didn't measure the door on my refrigerator before hand. It barely fits. I have to position it so that the edge is just under the door handle. I was able to get the big bubbles out, but when you look closely at it, there are small bumps remaining that I haven't been able to get out. The grids are adequate sizes. It erases and cleans well. My family likes being able to see our weekly menus and it saves me from fielding their "What's for dinner" questions.

title: Teenage Son Loves It!
text:
This mouse pad is a good, decent mouse pad. It works as a mouse pad should. The League of Legends design is very appealing to my teenage son. The thickness is appropriate for a mouse pad. My son uses a gaming mouse and it slides and moves well on this pad. The images are very small and difficult to see individually, or at least they are for my old eyes, but the overall look is pretty cool. Up close, they are a little blurry or pixelated. Overall, we are pleased with this.

*I purchased this at a discounted price in exchange for my honest & unbiased review. My thoughts & opinions are my own.

title: Adorable!
text: This is really cute! I ordered these for my teenage daughter. I wasn't really sure what design we were getting, but it ended up being a cute animal one that isn't even listed in the picture. My daughter loves it and she is looking forward to using them in her school agenda. They seem to be comparable to brand name removable bookmarks/tabs. I am taking away one star just for the unclear and confusing description. We lucked out, but since the one we received was not shown in the pictures, who knows what we could have ended up with!!!

title: Great Lanyards!
text:
I have to wear an ID badge at work, so I prefer to wear it around my neck on a lanyard. I like basic black lanyards because they go with everything. These lanyards are a nice quality. The ribbon is a smooth grosgrain ribbon. This type of clasp is super easy to use. I hate the ones that are like old style key rings. This comes with 12 lanyards and 12 plastic/vinyl ID badge holders. I also use these in my classroom as student passes. We keep a few lanyards in it with our class room number/teacher name on it for the students to use when they need to leave the room during class. Our class lanyards need replacing, so I am excited to have some nice quality ones to use when the new school year starts. The lanyards are sturdy and well made. They don’t budge when pulled on at the seams. These should hold up well at school!

*I received these for free in exchange for my honest & unbiased review. My thoughts & opinions are my own.

title: Great Quality!
text:
This rolling 12 drawer cart is awesome! I can't wait to start putting my craft supplies in it. The cart took about half an hour for my husband to put together. The TV was on while he was assembling it, so he was distracted a bit. You could probably get it done in less time if you were focused on the job. The cart (and wheels) move easily around on the tile and wood floors. I plan to use this upstairs in my craft room which is carpeted. It still moves on carpet, just not as effortlessly as it does on the solid flooring. The cart is sturdy and doesn't worry me about its longevity. It's going to last! The drawers slide out pretty well. They are just sitting on the metal ledge. There are no additional hardware pieces to help the drawers slide in and out. The drawers can be easily removed if necessary. I could see it being easier to take out a drawer of ribbon so you can access it better rather than leaving it in the cart. You can store stuff on the top of the cart, too. I am very excited to organize my craft items!!!

*I purchased this at a discounted price in exchange for my honest & unbiased review. My thoughts & opinions are my own.

title: Great for Invitations!
text: My son is graduating from high school at the end of the month and these were perfect for his Open House invitations. The paper worked in my inkjet printer without any troubles. I only wish it came with envelopes. I had to run out and pick some up because I was out of that size.

title: Nice for Small Measuring Needs
text:
This is an attractive, good looking scale. My husband and I find that some of our favorite recipes require weight measurements instead of standard measuring cups and spoons. It gives a more accurate measurement that way. This scale works very well for small measurements. We found that for some larger cooking measurements, this scale's range wasn't large enough. My husband will often put the large mixing bowl on the scale and set it to zero, then add an ingredient. Then he'll reset it to zero and add the next one. He does this to save on dish washing afterwards. This scale only measures up to 17 ounces and most of our mixing bowls weigh more than that empty. With that being said, this is working out very well for measuring the chemicals for the hot tub. It also works well for measuring mail to calculate postage. This scale is easy to use and works well. It came with batteries, so it was ready to use almost immediately.

*I purchased this at a discounted price in exchange for my honest & unbiased review. My thoughts & opinions are my own.

title: Great Variety of Drawing Pencils
text:
My teenage son loves to draw and sketch. I ordered a set of drawing pencils for him around the holidays, but this set is so much nicer. It contains 12 pencils, all of different hardnesses. The softer pencils allow for some really nice shading. The leads are soft, but they don't break easily. The harder pencils let you give details to your drawings. His other set only had 8 different pencils, plus some of them broke easily without applying too much pressure. These sharpen well, too. They come in a metal tin and all of the pencils are labeled with their hardness. My son has really enjoyed drawing with these.

*I purchased these at a discounted price in exchange for my honest & unbiased review. My thoughts & opinions are my own.

title: Great in the Classroom!
text:
I work in a special needs middle school classroom. We have two autistic boys who love to color with colored pencils. I was keeping special colored pencils for them to use in a regular zipper pencil bag. Often they would end up taking all of the pencils out to look for that one special color that they needed. And when they did that, at least one pencil would roll off the desk. Now, they can unroll this pencil wrap and see all of the pencil color choices at once and no pencils are rolling away from them. Plus, both of the boys are particular about order and now the pencils are grouped by colors. One of the boys can't tie bows, so I end up having to tie the wrap back up, so a velcro closure would be nice, but this works fine. The wrap is well made and looks like it will withstand daily use.

*I purchased this at a discounted price in exchange for my honest & unbiased review. My thoughts & opinions are my own.

title: Great for a Cheap Pen!
text: I work in a classroom and prefer using purple ink or other fun colors when grading papers. These pens have been a favorite of mine for years. The ink flows well and writes nicely. They don't often leak like some cheap pens do.

title: Love this Stuff!
text: I love Mavalus Tape! It's the best tape for keeping things up on classroom walls! I used to have to go to the School Box to get it, so I am so happy to be able to order it online. Mavalus tape is the only thing that works on the concrete walls! This year we started out using duct tape to hang up things in our classroom. Every morning there's something on the floor. Now when something falls, I replace it with the Mavalus tape and those signs and posters aren't falling down anymore. My son goes to college next year & I will be sending a roll with him to use in his dorm room.

title: HIgh Quality Vinyl Badge Holders
text:
These clear vinyl badge holders are really nice! They are a heavier, thicker vinyl than ones I've used in the past that rip and tear easily. They are a little wider than my work ID, but it's better to be a little bigger than too small. The badges are sealable with a zipper type closure. When my children were younger, I used to make tags for their backpacks and I would put the tags inside vinyl badge holders. Usually I would have to replace them at least once a year because the vinyl wouldn't hold up. I totally believe these would have lasted the entire year! This set comes with 10 badge holders and a bonus cloth wipe, too.

*I received these for the purpose of trying out & reviewing. My thoughts & opinions are my own.

title: Great for the Classroom!
text:
I work in a Special Needs Middle School classroom and the DinoFire wireless presenter has come in handy! We have 1 teacher and 2 teacher's aids in the classroom and whenever we have a power point to watch, one of us has to sit at the computer to advance the slides. Now, we can all be moving around the classroom. The DinoFire was easy to set up & is easy to use. I love how the usb adapter is stored in the presenter itself. We probably would definitely have lost it it wasn't! The rounded edges give it a streamlined appearance and fits nicely in one's hands. The laser beam is a nice feature, too!

*I received this presenter directly from DinoFire for the purpose of trying out & reviewing. My thoughts & opinions are my own.

title: Professional Looking
text:
I have to wear an ID badge to work every day. I prefer wearing a lanyard with mine so I have a few different ones that I rotate through on a regular basis. This one is one of my nicer ones. The lanyard itself is thick & durable. The metal clip is sturdy, tool. I've included a picture of it next to a thin, basic lanyard for comparison. My work ID fits nicely in the leather badge holder. There's an additional pocket on the reverse side which I slip a couple of dollars in case needed. This is a nice, professional looking badge holder/lanyard.

*I received this for the purpose of trying out & reviewing. My thoughts & opinions are my own.

title: Good Value!
text:
I have a job where I am expected to wear an ID badge. I prefer to wear a lanyard and this style is my preferred style. I like ones with the metal J clips and the cord/string that you can put a flash drive or key on it. These are a little on the thin side, but they are durable enough for everyday use. With this variety of colors, I have actually started changing lanyards to go with what I'm wearing. If they didn't have a J clip, I wouldn't bother to do that, but it's super easy to swap out. Usually at this price, I have only been able to find the ones with the more difficult clasp instead of the easy J-clip.

*I received these from Wisdompro for the purpose of trying out & reviewing. My thoughts & opinions are my own.

title: Easier than Regular Key Chains!
text:
My daughter needed key rings for a craft project she was doing when I was offered the opportunity to try this out. I LOVE these cable key rings. They are so much easier to use than regular key chains. The steel cable is strong, yet flexible. The connector threads easily and securely. These will work for so much more than just key chains. These will be great for times when I need to use a cable tie, but instead of having to cut the cable tie, I can just unscrew the cable.

*I was given these cable wires from Marrywindix for the purpose of trying them out & reviewing. My thoughts & opinions are my own.

title: Great price!
