title: Not as good as Post-It flags but good enough; must be removed from flat end - 3.5 stars
text:
There are supposedly 1120 flags in this set in 8 separate packages of 140 each package and 20 flags of each of the 7 colors per package. Obviously, I did not count them.

These work similar to Post-It flags. I use flags all the time. They are great to mark a specific section in a book, point out a particular recipe, point out where to sign a document, etc. These are not as good as the Post-It because they do not come in a dispenser type format. Instead, I have to separate the flat end with my nails to remove a note. It is very easy to remove more than one. There is also no clear section as there is on a Post-it flag. See my photo for the comparison.

The current price of $6.29 ($6.99 minus 10%) comes to $.79 cents per pack of 140 and there are 8 of those in this set.

title: Extremely delicate; works well for eyeglasses or masks with thin ear elastics
text:
This chain has three purposes. It can be worn as jewelry or to hold eyeglasses or a mask around one's neck. There are removable silicone loops inside the hooks that can be put around one's eyeglass ear arms. To use with a mask, the silicone loops need to be removed.

This chain is attractive and delicate or what I would call somewhat flimsy. I do feel it is easy to lose the silicone loops for the eyeglasses, so I have to be careful not to lose them.

The current price of $9.99 is competitively priced. Note, however, that my absolute favorite mask chain is [[ASIN:B08HQZ1D1Z the Luxure Store Chain]], which is almost four times the price but is incredibly well made.

title: A bit flimsy but works well for eyeglasses or masks with almost any type of ear elastic
text:
This chain has two purposes. It can either be worn to hold eyeglasses or a mask around one's neck. There are removable silicone loops inside the clips that are best to remove before putting around one's eyeglass ear arms. The silicone can be left in place when using the same clasp around a mask's ear elastic or it can be used without them.

Nevertheless, I like this chain as it is basic but stylish even though it is a bit flimsy. I do feel it is easy to lose the silicone loops for the eyeglasses, so I have to be careful not to lose them.

The current price of $9.99 is competitively priced. Note, however, that my absolute favorite mask chain is [[ASIN:B08HQZ1D1Z the Luxure Store Chain]], which is almost four times the price.

title: A bit flimsy but works well for eyeglasses or masks with a thin ear elastic
text:
This chain has three purposes. It can either be worn as chain jewelry, to hold eyeglasses, or to hook onto a mask that has a very thin elastic. The silicone loops have to be removed to use for a mask. The clasp is not easy to get around a mask's elastic as I had to be careful to make sure the elastic was inside the hook. At one point I got it caught at the end of the hook simply because there is not much "hook" room to play with.

Nevertheless, I like this chain as it is very stylish even though it is a bit flimsy. I ordered two of these (one in gold and this one in silver). The gold one arrived with the clasp broken so I am concerned a bit about the quality of this chain.

The current price of $9.99 is competitively priced. Note, however, that my absolute favorite mask chain is [[ASIN:B08HQZ1D1Z the Luxure Store Chain]], which is almost four times the price.

title: Fun set of mask lanyards
text:
There are four snap closure lanyards in this package in some fun designs. These are a reasonable solution to hold one's mask. Each lanyard is only 24 inches long and when closed at the end snap, it hangs above my chest area. Nevertheless, these are perfect to keep my masks around my neck so that I don't have to go fishing through my purse for it.

The current price of $11.99 ($19.99 minus 40%) it comes to $3 per lanyard, which is pricey but still competitive compared to some others like this that I have seen.

title: Heavy heavy-duty electric sharpener; excellent quality; simple operation but overpriced
text: This pencil sharpener is a very heavy, heavy-duty electric sharpener. It sharpens well, catches the shavings without going all over the place, and is simple to operate. As long as I gently held my pencils in the sharpening hole, the tips came out pointy. It has a large footprint and may be overkill for some. Even though this is well made, I still feel the current price of $49.99 is about $20 too much for this unit. That is the only reason I took off one star.

title: Easy access for a month’s worth of pills; case is good as long as I do not move it
text:
This is a nice set of 32 dual-compartment pill cases in a tray. What I like is that the compartments are very easy to remove and each cell is easy to open. Each day of the month is labeled. The dual compartments are labeled AM and PM. There are extra stickers supplied with this and I do not know why that is needed--perhaps if the numbers wear off the compartments or if someone wants to label the other side of the tabs.

The only negatives I see with this case is that the compartments want to pop out if I move the case. Second, the cells are large enough to hold a "horse pill" or two but not many more. The footprint is large as well but not as large as some monthly cases I tried before.

In summary, this is a nice monthly pill organizer for two times per day dosing. Each dual cell is mobile and can be taken in a purse. The biggest negative is that the compartments want to pop out of the organizer if I move the case because my fingers are pushing them out from underneath during the grab.

The current price of $16.98 is typical for this type case.

title: OVERKILL – Big, heavy sharpener; dial difficult to move; otherwise works fine
text:
For years I have been trying to find a good electric pencil sharpener that is suitable to my simple needs. Unfortunately, I still have not found one as this is not for me.

It is a huge sharpener and very heavy. There are six holes for various pencil diameters. I just used the regular hole. It sharpened my pencils well as can be seen in my photo. I did have to hold the pencil in the sharpener as it is strong. I love the large catch tray for the shavings and the tray empties easily. The biggest problem I see is turning the dial. I had to put in a marker into the hole and strongly use that as leverage to turn the dial. Otherwise it is impossible to turn. Had I wanted to sharpen another diameter pencil, this would annoy me. 

I wish this were a bit easier to use and took up less space. Otherwise, it works as designed and the current price of $29.99 ($32.99 minus $3) is reasonable for this. This heavy duty sharpener is best suited for those who have grade school children that need lots of pencils sharpened.

title: Not really invisible & requires a tape dispenser but it tapes – 3.5 stars
text: First of all, it was not easy to figure out how to open the box with the white label stuck around the entire box of tape. Second, I thought this was six rolls of tape with the typical plastic dispenser most tape comes with; however, this requires a tape dispenser. That is disappointment number 2. Third, the tape is not exactly invisible (see photo) but many invisible tapes can still be seen. It is more like regular tape and it tapes fine. If one is looking for an invisible tape that is less seen or does not have a dispenser, then pass on this set of six rolls.

title: Takes 2 pencil sizes; USB or battery power possible; sharpens well but... - 2.5 stars
text:
I wanted to love this but I do not. Yes it works but the design is so, so.

In the box is the sharpener, micro-USB cable, instructions, extra sharpening blades, and a screwdriver. This can be powered via 4 AAA batteries (not included) or the supplied USB cable (A/C connector not included). I plugged this directly into my laptop, and as long as I held the pencil tight, it sharpened well (see photo).

However, the canister for the shavings is not really a canister at all. It is just a plastic cover with a small lip that keeps the shavings from spilling out. Instead, once I pry it off, the pencil shavings go all over the place. That is a terrible design. In addition, the unit feels very cheap. I doubt it will last. Also, I personally would not want to fiddle with the sharpener to change the blades.

This is just an OK, cheap sharpener, with a poorly designed shaving canister. I consider a price more than $6 too much for this unit.

title: Displays 46 pages not 48 because there’s only 23 sheets inside; still very good
text:
This binder holds 46 viewable sheets inside and not 48. I only had 23 sheets and not 24 and I counted several times.

It has a front pocket as well as a pocket opposite the regular sheets inside. There is also a small full length pocket on the binder.

These are excellent for presentations or just to store recipes like I did. It has so many uses.

The clear pockets are thin and they do get staticky. Other than the one less sheet, I really love this binder.

title: Attractive 5" x 7.5" 6-ring binder; NO PAPER; feels cheap
text:
When I ordered this I had no idea this did not come with paper. It is only a 5" x 7.5" 6-ring binder. Either I would have to order 6-ring paper or order a 6-hole punch to create my own paper inserts. I have no intention of doing either, so this is a disappointment.

The binder itself feels cheap but the color is attractive. It has a magnetic snap closure. The binder rings open and close easily. There is a full length pocket on the right and left. There are also four credit card pockets on the left and a pen holder elastic. If this came with paper, it would have gotten four stars. There is not even a recommendation on Amazon as to which paper to buy as there is no guarantee the holes on the paper will line up with the binder rings in this planner. It is best if one has a six-hole punch to create their own paper inserts.

Currently there is no price on Amazon, but I do not feel this should be priced more than $7.

title: Good case if one wants portability for the days and large compartments
text:
I have this fetish for pill cases. When I started having to take medicine, I purchased several cases and was disappointed with all but one and that one was a case that is EXACTLY like this one with one difference. That difference is that my case also has the moon and sun written on the front.

There are seven colorful compartments for two pill doses per day. The lids open most of the way but it is best to bend them back to get full access to the pills. Each cell can hold many small pills or a few "horse" pills. I like that the days are written along the sides. I do wish the moon and sun were on the front of the case along with the AM and PM. The reason is that without the pictures, it is easy to mistake which side is which. This set of seven has its own plastic carrying case. It also comes with extra labels for days and the numbers 1 to 7.

This type of case is not for everyone. It is a bit bulky due to the fat cylindrical shape. However, I like that each day is portable and it does fit a sufficient amount of pills.

The current price of $9.99 is competitive.

title: Sizing is all wrong which reduces capacity; envelopes are still a useful at 3-1/2" x 7"
text:
First of all, I did not expect this to come in such a huge box large enough for a super large microwave. However, since this is a 480 pack, I should have expected this, so that is my fault. I only needed a few of these envelopes.

Second, the size on the Amazon site is totally incorrect. The useable sizing is only 3-1/2" x 7" - below is the sizing depending on how the envelope is being measured and none of the sizes match what is on the Amazon site.

4-3/4" x 8-1/4" - this is when envelope is fully opened (flap is unsealed) from end to end

4-3/4" x 7-1/4" - this is when envelope is fully closed and flap is sealed

4" x 7" - this is the area of padding as measured from the outside of the envelope

3-1/2" x 7" - THIS IS THE USEABLE SPACE INSIDE THE ENVELOPE and is what matters

Based on the sizing above, 4" x 6" print photos cannot even be mailed in these envelopes. I tried to get a 4" x 6" card in the envelope and could not. I had to fold it down to 3-1/2" in order to get it in this envelope.

The seals on the few envelopes I tried were great.

In summary, each envelope comes to about $.11 cents based on the current price of $49.99. However, unless one is mailing a few bulbs of garlic, a 100 pack set of stamps, a small perfume bottle, or a headband or foldable mask in this envelope, the usefulness is limited.

title: Well-thought out bookstand, laptop desk; eating or drawing desk
text:
This is a relatively well-designed bed desk. I can use it for my laptop, coloring, reading, eating, etc. It is also collapsible which is great when storing.

The desk comes with a plastic bookstand that can be used separately or placed in the top of the desk slot. It gets stored away underneath the desk. There is also a drawer on the left side for pencils or glasses. There is a laptop oval that fits in the front slot of the desk to prevent the laptop from sliding off when the desk is tilted.

The legs are foldable and adjustable up or down. The tray also tilts. The only reason I rated this well-designed desk 4 stars is because it is a bit tricky to collapse and expand the legs and to engage the tilt. Sometimes, I could not get it to adjust and had to play with the release mechanisms. The desk is also a bit heavy. Other than this, it is a great large desk and perfect for small spaces due to its ability to collapse.

title: Eight festive cards but there is no "Christmas" mentioned; write on back side only
text:
These cards are simple and festive. Its pop-up feature is a nice touch. To keep the cards standing, the two tabs in the back have to be pushed in.

The car's license plate says "Merry" and on the back of the card it says "Hope you'll enjoy every happy thing the season brings." (See second photo.) I am disappointed that there is no Christmas written on the plate or at least X-MAS.

The only space to write on this card is on the back of the card where the one sentence saying is located. Of course one can write on the one inch rim below the car tires, but there is not much room.

Besides the limited writing space and the lack of any Christmas in these cards, I do not like all the packaging it comes with. There is no need for such waste as the cards could have been shipped closed.

Also note that these cards are not very functional. It is a bit awkward to wedge money behind the driver's seat.

title: Cute blank cards with funny inscriptions on cover
text:
These cards have very cute sayings on the front. They are blank inside, so they are more versatile and can be used for any appropriate occasion.

There are 12 cards with envelopes spread over 4 card varieties.

- Three cards say "Cat Treadmills" on front and has two cats shredding toilet paper.

- Three cards say "Whoa, STRAIGHT FLUSH! Must not wag tail. MUST....NOT...WAG....TAIL! on front and has a cat and three dogs playing cards with the pug who is saying this.

- Three cards say "Oh, Crap! Was that today?" and has a picture of two unicorns looking hopelessly on as Noah's Ark sails away.

- Three cards say ""She Loves Me More!" with each saying over one glass of wine and one cup of coffee.

I really love the cat and Noah's Ark cards and I like the other two. These are great for friends or love ones who have a sense of humor, whether given on birthdays or just for some other "thinking of you" type of special occasion.

title: “Post-It” impostors with a larger sticky surface in six vibrant colors that make me smile
text:
Boy these fooled me. These are Post-It impostors from "vanpad," which I assume is one of the many Amazon businesses. 

There are a total of 24 pads in 6 vibrant colors (pink, orange, yellow, lime, blue, and purple) with 70 sheets each pad. There is also one tiny package of "Post-It-Like" flags which I use to bookmark pages in a cookbook and can be written on.

So far these are working well for me and are sticking. I love the electric colors and the larger sticky area on top of each sheet. The only negative I found so far is that when I write on the dark blue flag, it is hard to read the writing because of the dark color. I wish that blue were just a little lighter; however, this applies to the flag only as the blue pad is lighter and shows my writing much better with a blue ballpoint pen.

title: Very nice 3D like housewarming card with a simple message
text:
I ordered this for a friend who plans to get a new home soon. This is a perfect card for that new chapter in life. On the outside is a 3D-like raised cutout three to four layers deep if counting the printed picture behind it. It is three layers at the roof but four layers with the door, fence, and chair.

The inside message reads "Congratulations on finding a new place to call your own." The envelope is red with white interior with a red and green flower-like pattern. A blank sheet is supplied to put over the front of the card so that the 3D-like image does not get destroyed during insertion into the envelope.

Overall, this is a very inviting and simple housewarming card for the person who has a new apartment, condo, townhouse, house, trailer / manufactured home, or any other place to call their own.

title: Vintage-looking journal with a few "dirty" pages and cheaply dyed leather; nice design
text:
I ordered their [[ASIN:B07PZVN2WN tree journal]] and was not happy with it. However, this journal is cleaner and the paper whiter. It is vintage-looking but not too dirty and worn that it offends my senses.

As is typical of a leather-bound journal, the paper is not replaceable. Writing on the paper with pen or pencil works well. A few pages have smudges on them and I did see some thread or lint between some pages. The underside of the leather is poorly dyed looking as if it is dirty and does appear to have fingerprints dyed in the back of the journal. I do not care for those fingerprints. The tie is just a string of leather and not set in a way that makes it intuitive to tie the book shut. The embossing on the outside is very attractive, however.

There are five sections that are "stitched" into the book. Each section has a centerfold string.

The six photos show the following in order:

1 - The attractive stitching on the binding and the outer leather embossing.

2 - The front of the journal.

3 - The back of the journal.

4 - The blotchy spots found on some pages pages.

5 - The front inside leather cover and blotchy dye work.

6 - The back inside leather cover and blotchy dye work with fingerprint stains.

In summary, they succeeded in making this look dirty vintage and handmade from scrap. The exterior embossing of a dragon design is super attractive and so is the binder stitching. The leather is cheap and the paper is sometimes blotchy with occasional pieces of lint. This is definitely better than the [[ASIN:B07PZVN2WN tree journal]] I ordered from them. Since the intention here is to look vintage, I would say they succeeded. I would not expect to pay more than $18 - $20 for this in its current condition. It has "found in the attic" sort of vibe to it.

title: This cart is extremely versatile but I wish it was 8-12" taller
text:
I absolutely love this cart in every way but the height. I'm 5'5" and this cart comes up to the top of my legs. This wheels easily on both low-pile carpet and a regular floor. Setting it up is less than a few seconds; just grab the sides and pull outward. It then locks in place. To close, just pull up on the levers on either side of the locking mechanism and it folds.

I ordered this for two purposes.

First, when I do canning, I want a work area to the left of my stove for holding my jars, cutting up ingredients, etc. Because this comes below my stove (see fourth picture) and below my waistline, it makes using this a bit more awkward and uncomfortable for this purpose. Since I am standing, my arms are stretched out more than they would be had this been taller.

Second, I also want to use this when I clean off my dining room table (which I use for storage). I need a place to put the items temporarily and this two-tier cart is perfect for that.

Nevertheless, this is an excellent choice as long as one is not going to work on this regularly in a standing position. Set-up and breakdown is a cinch and it is guaranteed for three years.

title: Contains 50 sheets of cardboard-stock-like note sheets that are gold embossed
text: I counted the sheets in this pad because I originally thought there were 100 sheets. However, the note sheets are so thick like cardboard that there are only 50 sheets. They are really high quality and the Micky emblem and the sides are gold embossed. This would make a great gift but, in my opinion, at $12.99 this is too expensive for everyday use.

title: Perfect organizer for a backpack or to store on a shelf
text:
I expected this in purple but it does say the color may vary. The color I got was green. I can organize my 8-1/2" x 11" size or less documents (taxes, papers, etc.) with this.

There are a total of the seven pockets but only six have tab dividers. There is one sheet of pre-printed tab inserts included that are labeled days of the week (like Sat/Sun) or months of the year (like May/Jun). There are two ID card slots with what looks like a miniature ruled index card in each slot.

This claims to hold 400 sheets but I am skeptical how well the folder would hold up under such a load. It has an elastic closure that provides for expansion. Overall, I am very pleased with this folder; I just wish I could choose my own color.

title: Good cushion for my car seat but not for my office chair
text:
I sit many hours per day for my job. I recently purchased the [[ASIN:B010TLSFA6 ComfiLife Premium Comfort Seat Cushion]] and find that to be good but not perfect. Therefore, I decided to order this. It felt very comfortable when I first tried it. However, after sitting on it for a couple of days, I feel as if I am sliding forward in my desk chair. Also, it is not as comfortable as it felt the first moment I sat on it. I decided to move it to my car and it works well there because my car seat in slanted back, so I do not feel like I am falling off the cushion.

Overall this is just okay. I have not found anything yet that is perfect but the [[ASIN:B010TLSFA6 ComfiLife Premium Comfort Seat Cushion]] is a tad more comfortable to me and thicker too. One thing I really like about this HNOS cushion is that it is a solid piece and does not have a hole in it like my ComfiLife.

title: This eraser does not fully erase my Rembrandt or #2 graphite pencil mistakes
text:
I have never used this type eraser before so I have nothing to compare it to. However, after reading online how good "plastic" (a.k.a. vinyl) erasers are supposed to be, I expected better than a fair job. The eraser shreds itself during use so there are tiny pieces left behind as there would be with a pencil (a.k.a. rubber) eraser. Those pieces have to be brushed aside.

This eraser is tiny and requires manual dexterity to use. Nevertheless, it only did a fair job. It is true that it did not damage the paper but it also did not do an exceptional removal job.

The first picture shows a purple flower with two purple colors. In the second photo, I erased the light color on the left but a haze of the old color remained no matter how I tried to get rid of it.

The third photo shows a quick outline made with a #2 graphite pencil. In the fourth photo, I erased the eyes. A haze was also left behind.

The last picture shows the Rembrandt pencils I was using as well as the # 2 graphite pencil.

title: Elegant yet plain THANK YOU cards to be reserved for the finer gifts
text: There are 10 blank cards with 10 interior gold-colored envelopes in the box. At the current price of $11.99, it comes to $1.20 per card.  These are elegant and feel like quality and should probably not be used for just any THANK YOU. The blue face with gold lines is okay but a silver / platinum hue would have screamed super elegant.

title: Excellent cushion that makes sitting a long time comfortable for me
text:
I sit many hours per day for my job. My boyfriend purchased one of these because he has some pain that he attributes to sciatica. He has all his packages delivered to my house and when it arrived, he said I could try it. I was previously sitting on two seat cushions and after I tried this, I am in love with the comfort even if it is a tad too big for my posterior. In addition to this I use a [[ASIN:B004V7P6MA travel pillow]] for my back. The combination allows me to sit for an extended period of time without aching. So far this is the best cushion I have tried and gets 4.3 stars from me. Another plus is that it has a carrying handle making it easily transportable.

I like this so much that I plan to order some of their other items including the one with the gel, the knee pillow, and the Cocyx & Posture Support Seat Cushion that is currently out of stock.

PS: By registering this cushion with the company, I was sent a 10% off for the next purchase on their site which is just a few cents better than the Amazon price. They also offer free shipping.

title: These clips are gorgeous and hefty and hold up to 20 sheets of paper but sometimes marks are left behind on the border
text:
My first impression of these clips was "WOW" these are really nice. There are twelve small clips in the package in three different colors. The colors to my eyes are eggplant purple, light bluish/gray, and slate gray. They look elegant and are hefty.

Each clip holds 20 pieces of paper together and they easily slide on and off but not so easy that they will fall off. I was able to get 21 pieces of paper under each clip but it was a tight squeeze.

I love these except for two issues. The colored coating that covers each clip is really only held on by an adhesive. A few of the coverings were pulling away until I pressed them back down on the metal part of the clip. Second, the act of clipping and unclipping pieces of paper sometimes leaves a light brown mark on the edge of the documents. This is my biggest disappointment. Despite this, they are very nice, feel good in the hands, and do the job they claim to do which is hold up to 20 sheets of paper together.

title: This notebook has four pockets, a TOC section, 100 ruled sheets but does not have the tabbed sections I prefer
text:
I am not as enamored with this notebook as I thought I would be.

The front cover is a plastic pocket with two sides. A full 8" x 11" sheet of paper can sit in the front of the notebook that can contain anything from a picture of what is inside, one's name, subject matter, or anything that fits on that paper size. It can also just be used to store any number of papers. The back of the front cover is a half pocket like one would find in a standard two subject paper folder. This can be used for more storage. In addition to this there are two half pockets that fit smaller pieces of paper and other items.

The first two ruled sheets are table of content (TOC) sheets where the date, topic/description, and page number can be hand written. The rest of the notebook is ruled with a sidebar for notes or a vertical subject and a section at the bottom for the page number. I would have preferred a pre-printed page number on each sheet. However, I guess the manufacturer made a decision to let the user to write in the numbers in case some sheets are ripped out of the notebook.

There's also an 8 x 17" folded "thick" sheet in the back of the notebook for reference notes. I personally do not like the checker-box rule on this sheet and would have preferred a blank un-ruled piece of paper.

Personally, I prefer notebooks with dividers in them and tabs that stick out so that I can easily see the subject of each section. If this notebook had tabs and the page numbers were preprinted, I would have rated this 4 stars. If they included tabbed sections and each section had pockets on either side, then I would have rated this 5 stars. As this is currently designed, it is just okay for my taste. However, this is a personal preference. On another note, I do like how the pages turn smoothly. Some notebooks I have used before are "sticky" with its page rotation and the one I received does not have that problem.

The video on the Amazon site gives a good idea of what this notebook is about and what is included.

title: I use this to store items on my fridge; LOVE the product; HATE the label on front
text:
These magnetic pockets are absolutely awesome. I use them on my refrigerator. Attached is a picture of one of those pockets. I love that I can label them with the tab included if desired. Also, the pockets hold at lot because they expand and the magnet is strong.

I would have rated this 5 stars except that I absolutely hate the company name on the clear plastic part of the pocket as it obstructs my view of the contents. I store my seasonality chart in the front of some other stuff and I cannot fully read it with that writing on the front. Instead I have to remove the chart and would prefer that I read it while it is inside the pocket. That is the only disappointment I have as it will hold up to 8.5" x 11" size items.

title: This paper worked fine in both my inkjets but it is thin, geared toward non-business documents, & a tad $$ than my regular paper
text: This paper is thinner than my regular ream of white paper I normally use. It is also best for flyers and non-business documents or just for artsy projects.  At the current price of $8.99, this is a few dollars more than I usually pay for the white thicker stock paper. I printed documents using this paper on both of my inkjet printers--an Epson XP-520 and an Epson ET-2700. It printed fine. The quality of the printout is good and the paper did not jam. Other than the slightly higher price for recycled paper that is colored, this works fine.  The green makes any document stand out among a sea of white paper.

title: Write nicely but are difficult for me to hold for extended writing
text:
These pens write well and are mostly smooth. However, because they are small (around four inches not including the press top), I find them a bit uncomfortable to hold for extended writing.

I love the 10 colors, which are:
- black
- blue
- light blue
- teal
- green
- light green
- orange
- pink
- red
- purple

If these felt more comfortable to write with, I would have rated this four stars. The small size, however, allows one to carry them around easily. So there is a bit and give and take here.

title: An excellent blank one-subject notebook that also supports a cause, so it's a tad expensive
text:
This spiral bound notebook has 100 double-sided college ruled pages. In the front is one double-sided blue folder compartment that can hold a limited number of paper on both sides. The cardboard backing is thick and the front cover is a bit thinner. What I like is that the pages do not get hung up on the binding as I have encountered with some other notebooks. There is also a loose note inside in the shape of a bookmark that says one notebook is given to a child for every notebook purchased. That is a nice touch. You can actually enter the unique code to see who received that notebook. I entered my code and attached a picture of who received the corresponding book.

According to their website, AUGUST BLANKS is a non-profit organization with a vision to give every child in the world access to a notebook every year for his (or her, I assume) education.

The only reason I rated this 4 stars is because $4.99 is a lot for a one subject notebook. Yes it has one double-sided folder compartment in the front and yes the cardboard backing can withstand a lot of abuse. However, this notebook is not that much different than others available for purchase for almost half the price at Walmart. Other than the price, it is an excellent blank one-subject notebook. If one does not have the money or does not want to support their vision, then one can find cheaper notebooks elsewhere.

title: These labels are almost too easy to remove; they are small and thin as well and almost half price on the Avery site
text:
The labels are super tiny, sort of thin and see-through, and easily come off. Attached is a picture of one item I labeled so that the size can be seen.

I do feel these are great for canning because the labels can be easily removed. However, they are almost too easy to remove. I was able to lift the corner of the label and remove it immediately. When I ran the label under water, the adhesive disintegrated as it should.

One other dislike I have besides the small size and thin texture, is that I found it almost impossible to see the label outline and as a result it was difficult for me to remove it from the paper backing it came on. I guess I can chalk that up to older eyes but the delineation between the label and the sheet it comes on needs to be clearer.

Nevertheless, these do work as designed and are easily removed from plastic, glass, and canning lids. The fact that a laser or inkjet printer can be used with the appropriate Avery template from their website is a plus. At the current price of $14.14 for 50 tiny labels ($.28 cents each), I think this is very expensive for what they are. However, when I looked on the Avery site, the list price for the same labels is $6.25 so I would order them there.

title: Good thin document-sized envelopes that have sufficient but not great adhesive lids
text: At the current price of $12.99, this 100-pack of self-adhesive envelopes comes to $.13 cents each and are perfect for mailing or storing unfolded 8-1/2" x 11" documents. The peel and stick lid makes these easy to seal. Each lid has just enough adhesive to hold the envelop closed. I do wish the adhesive surface was larger and closer to the outer edges of the lid, however. The paper stock is extremely lightweight yet still protective in the sense that the white envelopes are not see-through. Overall, I think these are a good buy if one needs a 100 pack of document-sized envelopes.

title: Good document-sized envelopes that have sufficient but not great adhesive lids
text: At the current price of $26.34, this 250-pack of self-adhesive envelopes comes to just $.11 cents each and are perfect for mailing or storing unfolded 8-1/2" x 11" documents.  The peel and stick lid makes these easy to seal. Each lid has just enough adhesive to hold the envelop closed. I do wish the adhesive surface was larger and closer to the outer edges of the lid, however. The paper stock is lightweight yet protective in the sense that the envelopes are not see-through. Overall, I think these are a good buy if one needs a 250 pack of document-sized envelopes.

title: A functional and light step stool that takes up a lot of space folded and raises me 14 inches off the floor when needed
text:
I have been wanting this for a while and finally purchased this at Harbor Freight with a coupon for $22.49 plus tax. This is easy to set up with two clips that fold in place and easy to break down with those same clips. I like the carrying handle and how light yet sturdy this is when standing on it. It raises me 14 inches off the floor. The box claims it holds up to 350 pounds.

Of course, I would prefer that this collapsed into a smaller package. When collapsed the legs sit away from the base so that the step stool is around 9 inches at its widest point (meaning the legs fold on top of the step and not into it). Overall, it's functional and light but does take up a lot of space folded.

title: Holds up small, light, or thin books for reading but it is very flimsy
text:
My boyfriend purchased two of these by accident from Amazon, so even though I already had a large cookbook stand I decided to purchase the extra one from him.

This stand is all plastic and very cheaply made. A plastic lever in the back allows me to lock and unlock the angle of the book when reading. The levers on the front hold the pages nicely but for many books, I have to remove the book from the stand to turn the pages.

Besides the cheap quality and the potential possiblity of the foot lever lock breaking easily, this is really only for light, short, or relatively thin books. For example, I was reading a tall thin cookbook with this and since the pages were not evenly distributed, the stand wobbled.

Had my boyfriend not purchased two of these by mistake, I would not have bought this as I prefer paying more for a much higher quality item. Nevertheless, this does the job it is supposed to do which is hold up a book for reading.

title: This would have been a five-star desk calendar if it weren't for the cheap edge savers; would not re-purchase this
text:
I normally buy the no-frills "at-a-glance" desk calendar and this year I accidentally purchased one that was an academic calendar which ended in June of the following year. Therefore, I decided to buy this calendar to replace the partial one. After having used this, I would not purchase this again.

The calendar is pretty and the flowers are all pink. The one major disappointment are the edge savers on the bottom. Mine arrived totally cut on both sides. Even if they were sealed, they are flimsy and weak. Since I use this on my desk, it is important for me to be able to tuck items along the bottom edges as I do with the cheaper at-a-glance calendars. If the edge savers were sturdier and not sliced, I would have given this calendar 5 stars. However, because these edge guards are extremely important to me and on this calendar they are useless, this is not one I would re-purchase in the future.

title: This is a perfect birthday card for the non-sentimental person who loves the outdoors
text:
There's nothing not to like in this birthday card other than the price. I'm a nature lover and find the cover of lake, trees, and mountains inspiring. I also love the saying because it's atypical. At the current price of $4.29, this is expensive, especially since there are no "bells and whistles" to this card. Also, the Amazon description of "with foil" is misleading; it's the message on the cover and inside that is in gold foil or what looks like iridescent copper. There is no full foil interior.

The cover says:

Happy Birthday
This is your year!

Inside is written:

Hope it's one
of new possibilities,
new opportunities,
and wonderful
new beginnings!

title: Sturdy rolling "no-frills" book cart but not flawless; I was able to get between 75-80 cookbooks on each cart
text:
I purchased two of these in the "Tropic Sand" color because I wanted the ability to roll them out of the way when I needed to get to the stationary bookcases I positioned behind them. These are sturdy and roll pretty easily on carpet. When full with books, it takes a bit of effort to move but not too much. The casters are big and were the only part that had to be installed.

The quality is okay. After reading all the other reviews, I was a bit nervous that I was going to get a defective cart. One cart had a chip in it and the Sandusky label was pasted haphazardly on the side of the unit. Other than this, they appear to be fine. I was able to get 75 to 80 cookbooks of various sizes on each cart (about 25-27 books on each shelf), which works perfectly for me. See attached pictures.

If I were in the market for more of these, I probably would purchase the SmithSystem Booktruck or one of the other SmithSystem carts. I saw them in the library today and they appear to be better made and flawless in its finish. In fact, had I known about that brand I probably would have purchased them instead. Nevertheless, these carts are a "no-frills option, are sturdy, and hold a lot of books on three shelves.

PS I put the URL to the SmithSystem brand in the comments section of this review.

title: Pretty card for Christmas to be presented to a family of more than one but it's expensive
text:
This is a pricey (at the current price of $6.49) but beautiful Christmas card for a family (more than one person as you can tell by the inside saying of "your hearts"). The words are fairly typical and can probably be found on boxed based Christmas cards that sell in quantities of 12 for the same price. However, for those who want to spend more and not have a cookie cutter card, this is a simple alternative and pretty with a lightly glittery house in front and lightly glittery tree inside. Below is what is written in the card. I used caps where they use caps.

On the OUTSIDE cover is written:

Christmas

HEARTS REACH OUT
AND MEMORIES COME ALIVE
IN THE WARMTH OF LOVE

On the INSIDE cover is written:

Once again, it's Christmas -
that delightful time of year
When hearts are filled with gratitude
and homes are bright with cheer,
When everyone's remembering
good friends and loved ones too -
So naturally, the warmest thoughts
and wishes go to you.

OPPOSITE the INSIDE cover is written:

My your home be filled
with happiness,
your hears with love,
your days with joy -
at Christmas and always

Merry Christmas

In summary, the card is very nice

title: Easy Assembly, Cheap Price, Not a Permanent Solution
text:
I received a 6 pack of boxes which are really 6 individual and deep file drawers. Each box is assembled with 3 separate pieces of cardboard with the instructions on the back of the file drawer. Also included is one metal square rod to reinforce each of the 6 file drawer casings. In addition, there are 12 plastic rails; 2 rails slip onto each file drawer for use in storing hanging files.

PROS:
- Easy assembly
- Boxes can be used for hanging files with supplied plastic rails
- Somewhat sturdy considering that they are just boxes
- Can be used for more than just files; for instance I would use these as cheaper and much sturdier versions of moving boxes whose only drawback would be that they might be somewhat awkward to carry but are very easy to open and close.

CONS:
- The 6-pack is actually 6 individual and separate file drawers
- The box says that the drawers can stack 5 high with the interlocking clips (which are not included and which I assume must be purchased separately)
- The file drawer part has a "Panel A" piece that says to detach for additional support but there are no instructions on how to use it. I guessed on how to install this piece but I can't be sure if I correctly used it to reinforce the handle located in the back of the file drawer.
- In order to reduce the shifting of the file boxes during use, I had to put it against a wall. Although it still shifted without the interlocking clips, it worked effectively enough as file storage.

In summary, I would only consider purchasing these boxes as temporary file storage or as very basic moving boxes that are cheaper (at the current price of $20.57 for 6) than regular moving boxes. Without the interlockinig clips, I would stack these boxes 5 high ONLY if set against a corner and back wall where they are supported on two sides by the walls and on the third side by some furniture.

I do not consider these boxes sturdy enough to use for permanent file storage where the files are frequently accessed. They are a good solution, however, for permanent file storage where files are accessed infrequently such as for old cases in a law firm or police, library, banking or other personal records.

title: Template for card stock works well once you get the hang of it
text:
These cards are made of pretty good card stock with nice envelopes. The template I downloaded did not have any envelope printing option; there was only a template for the card. Designing the card took a little bit of experimenting before I got the writing and picture to be organized correctly in the template. There are really no guides in the template. It also took me a while to orient the paper correctly in the printer, but once that worked, the output of the picture on the card cover was rich.

This is for inkjet printers only and before I selected this product, I had missed that description. I did try it in my laser printer with the duplex option set and the card stock got jammed as expected. However, it did print the front of the card beautifully before that happened. I then printed a saying on regular paper and glued it to the back of the card. Obviously, if you have an inkjet printer, you won't have to do this. Instead, I had my friend use this product on her inkjet printer. Below is her review:

"The paper has the perfect weight for card stock. The paper fed through my printer with ease each time (not too thick), and it worked well for double sided printing with no bleed through. Both black and color ink printed perfectly. I would purchase this brand card stock paper again."

In summary, if you like printing your own cards and have an inkjet printer, then this Avery product is a good option.

title: Notebooks can be bound in a 3-ring binder
text:
Except for the color of the notebooks which was not as stated in the Vine order (a black instead of purple notebook was included), this Five Star product has a nifty 3-ring binder feature.

The backing of the notebook has three punch out and flip out holes that allow you to attach it to a 3-ring binder facing in. This means the spiral end of the notebook will be facing out toward the opening of the binder. This is a nice feature for students who want to secure their notebooks to prevent loss. You can write in the notebook while it's attached by opening the binder and then opening the notebook to the left--in which case the notebook and binder combined take up a surface area of three 8-1/2 x 11 sheets of paper side by side.

The notebook comes with two inside pockets. The paper is also perforated for easy removal.

The only negative issue I found with all three notebooks is that the second pocket is perforated too close to the edge so it might rip away from the spiral binding easily.

For about $4 each you get a decent one-subject notebook with a nifty design that allows you to secure it in a 3-ring binder.

title: Nice stamp
text: I had ordered these stamps for my boss because he has to sign many documents. It was easy enough to upload his signature and get them ordered. We had a problem with delivery through no fault of the vendor. Beware, these come through the post office not Amazon. I always put both our PO Box and street address on everything but the post office sent it back. Anyway, the vendor was very good with communication and getting them resent to us. The only reason they didn't get 5 stars is because they sent the wrong color. I wanted blue and they sent black. Normally, I wouldn't even take away a star for that but when I was reading the reviews, someone else mentioned getting the wrong color as well. They need to be more careful, but the stamp itself is great. It makes his life and my life much easier.

title: Could be better.
text: I love the design, it’s very pretty & just my style. My only complaint is I use it for my badge at work & the plastic screen that’s supposed to protect your content is very flimsy.

title: Good value
text: These poly mailers are thinner than what I'm used to but nonetheless they are quite durable despite being thin. The adhesive is great and sticks completely. The pattern is very cute and can be used year-round. You get a great price for the value. I would recommend and repurchase in the future when I run out!

title: Satisfactory labels

title: Thin
text: Not the best adhesion, but definitely quiet. On the thinner side. Worked for a quick packing job for a move.

title: Love the black/gold quality look- wish this wasn’t so tightly rolled..!!!
text:
Included are x3 various “seek ń conquer” type itineraries that you can use as a gift for one person or split up as you see fit! I love the idea of a National park map! Not something I’ve ever come across prior.. I’ve seen the idea of 100 fav.’s or top choices.. only I’ve seen it done in a “retiree” version- Im not certain if these would be the same destinations as I’m guessing probably a good handful of them could be? Tbh, I do wish there was an uncovered version.. One that the buyer could have a glimpse at for confidence in what they’re purchasing.. Yes! I’ve also seen the US map and find this trio very nicely done… A set that could be displayed in unison or separately- it definitely provides options!

For a price point of $55 it’s on par with a single map x 3 for all included. The embossed gold and black is very universal for most decor- I’d consider it unisex.. however, it tends to hold a more masculine feel- it has a “stately” type vibe and would make a great addition to any office or man cave! In a living room- it may look a little off or in between as states or squares are being removed- but, truly it’s all part of the fun!

All inclusive… Even includes the nifty gadget to remove foil! My one dislike is how tightly wound up these are- as it will take a hefty amount of undoing or, permanent tacking down to release the bend! No damage is seen to the foil overlay just the nuisance to lay flat. Makes a great gift for any with ample wonderlust, recent College grad, retiree, or.. newlywed couple who’ve got the world at their fingertips waiting to be conquered! The rules are there to make- regardless of what is spelled out. Very unique and clever gift giving idea.. Hoping info helps your decision- stay safe everyone. Bon voyage!!

title: After all- what can I say… it’s tape!!
text:
Certain things are just no fun to spend money on.. the “have to” buy items like cleaning products, toilet paper, office supplies.. tape! (ha, am I right..!!)

So a hassle free multi pack purchase that wont break the bank is great.. and this 12pk does the trick! At $9.. a roll is $1.50 which is a solid deal for large amount of tape per roll!

Built on standard 1” wheel this tape has regular width and full transparency.. rolls are a bit bigger (double rolls!) but will fit a standard dispenser.

What can I say, it’s Tape! Sticks without issue knock knock no yellow or discoloring ready to load tab! peels off the roll solidly as it has strength- the only issue might be.. it’s “cut” ability! It’s strong so be sure the teeth on dispenser are sharp and you’ll be home free and happy.

Hoping info can help make your decision- stay safe everyone!

title: Great for keeping projects organized..
text:
Recently accepting a position to help a tech company order and send off all their supplies for their multiple events each month (3-6) I needed a product to keep me organized.. this accordion file is doing the trick!! Love its ability to be divided by months, abc, #’s.. the option is yours. I needed to file supply lists by month, the ability to locate lists easily and keep me from mixing up spread sheets as they all look alike! Color coding by month has made this such a hassle free solution..

The fact this zips shut to safely enclose documents is a lifesaver! Along with the fact, I still have room to include receipts, shipping invoices, etc. in the coordinating slot with the ample room provided- saves me from needing a second holder.. how convenient things can be kept together. It’s beyond ideal this fits into my bag or, is durable enough to carry on its own.

I do wish when opened completely.. this had a built in way to securely become a stable solid unit. Note: it does tend to bend in middle- but that takes care of itself once it contains a certain amount of paper bulk inserted. Not a deal breaker.. for $16- I’m happily impressed with overall integrity and ability.

File system includes adhesive sheet of label allowing you to use a system for your needs. Provides ample room for 25+ papers per slot.. able hold more- however, this amount gives easy moveable space without frustration! Great for work, school, bill filing system… whatever the need. Hoping this info helps your decision- stay safe everyone.

title: Good $ for array- not most durable…
text:
Standard set of 6 spiral-bound notebooks and YESSS!!! these have a dual sided pocket in located right in front.. This alone is what I was after- Something to catch loose papers that must make it to/from class as necessary.. and the pocket allows that to happen! Having said that- the pocket itself could stand to be reinforced if holding excess amounts of handouts.. it doesn’t feel as durable as some other brands- so, just something to keep in mind.
As for exterior cover and durability.. depending on your need, I find this too a bit weaker then others… it is bendable and cardboard feels flimsy.
For a high school student who does most work on a laptop.. this may not be an issue. However, if being utilized by a student daily then, it may pose an issue with longevity and its ability to hold up through a semester. Paper inside is also of a thinner material. You know the type.. it’s paper! It works- but, harder to erase any markings and not crinkle while doing so! (Almost a recycled thinner feel..?)

Spiral wire does feel sturdy enough and ends are clipped and tucked in to avoid catching or undoing. These come in a set and all vary in color so, easy and helpful to assign a specific color to a class subject. Priced at $22 for the set of 6- this is a respectable deal. I would just be sure of my end user and the daily needs- if this is used by younger students or written in daily.. it may be best to choose one with more durability. Hoping his info can help your decision- stay safe everyone!

**see photos included- you can see bendability and some of my concerns.. photo of pocket as well, notice it’s made of paper vs. plastic. Hoping this helps give a realistic image.

title: Great for personal thoughts and ideas!
text:
A solid set of notebooks made with a nice exterior cover. Although not genuine leather- I prefer the synthetic as it doesn’t “break in/down” so it seems to keep shape and integrity better. Plus, any smudge or spill can easily be wiped clean without issue. So light weight it easily slips into purse, backpack or briefcase- and flat structure allows for easy stacking.

Lines on paper appear light.. a guide for those using journal style (ha! these keep you from writing up hill!) they also help to create metric measuring if needed- In fact, I’ve made a few loose sketches in the book and these don’t interfere with doing so! paper quality exceeds expectations- using pen or pencil Ive has no issue with tear, bleed, smudging- A smooth finish

As with any composition style notebook- they are a challenge to open flat and not interfere with what you were doing.. this notebook has tried to combat this issue by using flexible stitching in the seam.. it’s not perfect! But, far easier to work with then some of alternative glued spines.. I think those who prefer to use this type of journal know it’s a trade off; ease and convenience to keep/carry and the known struggles with the binding!

These make a great gift or personal purchase. At a higher price point of $19 you were paying for quality and these journals have integrity. Hoping this info can help your decision- stay safe!

title: This one let me down.. start to finish, unfortunate!
text:
Let’s start at the beginning… Assembly is a nightmare! No instructions or label pieces. No step-by-step and trust me, it matters!! Especially if a piece could be put in upside down without knowledge until it must be removed. Yep, this happened to us.. problem is, hardware struggle to fit correctly at start and we had bent, tweaked and rigged this to tighten down- all to have to undo..?!! We had to replace hardware ourselves since it was too damaged from our oopsie upside down attempt. (NO! If it wasn’t any better of a hardware fit flipped upside right!)

Once assembled the final touch was the wheels at the base- WHY..?? Why plastic? It doesn’t make any sense. For those about to assemble- I’d just omit altogether. If you want them… You want them to work. These won’t roll correctly and will splinter plastic under carts own weight. Adding heavier items- you’ll be in trouble! **Most definitely get furniture/floor protectors so base will not scratch tile or wood floor.. (The one downside without wheels!) The bottom edges are a bit sharp!

Putting this to work.. I found height of shelf was just not tall enough for a standard air fryer nor, the blender.. we can fit the toaster and electric frying pan- to give you an idea of which kitchen appliances may/not fit easily.
Ohh BTW, ordered this for overflow kitchen cookware.. with air fryers, Dutch oven, fondue pots, Panini makers etc. being all the rage- I find cupboards bursting at the seams.. So my solution was an excess accessory cart! Bc appliances come in such fun colors these days.. it would add a little flare to the kitchen and make things easy to get too- therefore, more likely to use.

Maybe this could meet ones need in another arena. But, the painful assembly, lack of instruction and difficulty with hardware- not to mention inadequate shelf sizing.. this isn’t for us. Hoping this info can help your decision- Bon Appetite!

title: **NOTE: Pocket cannot fit standard size paper..
text:
These are the worst for the purpose they should serve.. I would love everything about them except they have one major flaw and honestly, this creates a useless notebook..!!
Durable- sure!
Sturdy- can hold its own..
Value- um, sorry no.. Why?
The problem seems very simple to fix and make this purchase worth while.. a total over site making this. BUT, the fact that the notebook has a 2 sided pocket in the front only, IT DOESN'T WORK...THIS
DOES NOT FIT A REGULAR SHEET OF PAPER..!!!

SOO frustrating!! And the worst part is I bought a pack of them for my sons classes in high school. Yes, the notebook has full size lined sheets of paper inside- But, If you were to use this for a class and receive any handouts- The only way you could utilize the dang pocket to store a handout- is to fold it in half..!!?
Why?? Standard size paper is 8.5x11... of course, the top/side margin might vary slightly in the print. And I did see measurements of this paper was a tad smaller 8.5x10.5- NO, I Didn’t expect pocket to be different then, a universal paper size.
Worst part of all… I have now made this error X2 years in a row.. ahh!! I have x3 kids in school- x1 in high school, x2 in college- supplies are expensive for all Of them.. and errors like this just set you back bc, these can’t be used with any merit. So, not only am I out the $ for buying.. kids don’t have class supplies by expected date.
I will tell You, I know why I navigate to this particular one subject notebook over others listed.. is the fact, the pocket is made out of plastic not card stock!!
So- if you’re buying, be aware... Standard size paper will NOT fit in this front pocket. Not without folding it- Total deal breaker for me. (Now, I just have to remember next semester!)

text: I am using this planner for piano practice: there is so much from scales, arpeggios, theory, rhythm, practice pieces, etc.  I have a hard cover planner, but it’s not working.  I wanted something simple and non fancy: this fits the bill and that said, the quality of the paper is thick if you use ink, no bleed. Although there is nothing on other side.  Perfect for planning and little daily targets.

title: strong lead!  hope the mechanism will last for a while
text: love this brand as it is light, has plastic rubber to make writing comfortable, and the leads are strong and do not break when in use.  I use pencils all the time and i dont know, yet, how long the mechanism will hold and not break.  for value and useable leads are a plus for me right now.  Hope it last for long time as I am cognizant of mother earth and too much use of disposable products.

title: Nice pastel color, but few improvements needed.
text: I like this brand, have had a few of their mechanical pencils.  Whilst I love the pastel color, a little disappointed with the small barrel to hold the leads, 2 maximum otherwise the mechanic jams, too much plastic for holding too few leads, rather wished the leads were held in fewer containers.  Otherwise, the lead is more a B than HB.  Most of the leads were strong, but did break sooner than other leads of same brand.

title: Good value , but not sure it will last as long as a major brand.
text: Decent pen, but shake it a bit for ink to flow better to the nib.  Use it to cover name and address to packages or sensitive information before throwing out.  Nib is medium and decently thick.  Not sure how long they will last versus a major brand..as mentioned earlier, initially, ink flows slow and looks dry.

title: Works as expected, but needed to clean some rust like powder on some pieces.
text: Whilst easy to assemble.  I wasn’t happy to see ‘rust’ like powder on some of the pieces, which prompted me to clean all the pieces before hand.  Once removed, I didn’t notice any major rusted areas.  The organizer works great to manage all the folders and files - no more panic attacked looking for the correct folder.  It fits anywhere, but do measure your area if not placing on a desk or counter space.

title: Easy to use, quieter than older models. HIPAA compliant and P4 security for most personal uses.
text: Quieter than our current shredder and the ‘engine’/ top part is lighter too; but be aware of clipping your skin as it was quite easy to cut your fingers as you put the top onto the basket.  Very easy to use. The lock is quite basic/manual and won’t work if the central slider is not in the neural position.  I tested it with 11 sheets of normal paper [ie not the thick fancy paper] and it works with no hiccup.  This is P4 security, which after some research should cover majority of personal uses.  We were seeking an upgrade from p3 to p4 to be HIPAA a compliant.  Nice and compact.  I hope this lasts as long as our current one of over 10 years!  Only upgrading for the ‘added’ security.

title: great to keep bunch of paperwork together before sorting them out.
text: love that it is A4 size, longer than letter size.  I have moved towards these folders as I cant be bothered with hole punching everything.  And something I just want something to hold onto a bump of paperwork before I sort them out.  I noticed there are couple of tiny prongs sticking out - haven't scratched myself yet - but wished they had smoothed them out.  nice durable plastic.

title: A few mm short for letter size.
text: Just fits letter sized paper, a few mm short imho.  Otherwise love the concept and thinness, just what I need for my piano related paperwork.  Plastic is thin enough and yet strong enough to write on. Live the clip concept without a hole puncher.

title: thin card but fans out for a  nice display
text: For the price point - the card is thin, but a nice design.  Allows the recipient to fan out the card for a nice display.  The wordings in the card were positive and in line with Chinese's requirements.

title: Great unit, but knowledge is thinly spread amongst level 1 of service team.
text:
We were early adopters and our 2nd gen ooma unit just broke down, in fact it happened gradually over a period of 12 months. The unit lasted 7-8 years. As a user : you ahve to call into customer service 1st before you power up the unit. Then you use the setup app to do the rest of the set up long with a quick refresh of the account on website.
If you are a new user: follow the instructions on the unit.

What should be improved is better training for their customer service: I was given 3 different ways to transfer to the new unit, none of which was correct. Sales were awful - as we needed to cancel an order we made with them [ended up buying the unit on Amazon] and the unit still arrived from ooma. Sales dept, too, had different answers and some were rude and unhelpful.

That said, we still love the promises, and whilst you need to escalate to the senior engineers if you are not getting the expertise you need. Thankfully, it is once in a blue moon that we need that level of assistance.

title: Shame the lead was brittle in some pencils.
text: For a small number of pencils, the lead was very brittle.  Not cool.  I probably won’t buy any amazon 0.5 leads.  However , the design is comfortable and colors are pretty.  Great for refills and hence should last a long time.

title: Great for HB and softer leads
text: I scribble and make lots of notes during my sourdough, bread, baking journey.  And pencils are my go to, which is always my preferred writing tools.  This rubber works great, especially for HB, B and below, a tad less effective for the harder lead pencils -requiring a little more effort.  Handy shape.

title: Notes, to do, no more calendars/planners for me

Now I have something I can carry with me to jot down to do lists, bread recipes, music homework...it comes with an A5 notebook.  I like the various pockets as I am always scribbling notes down.  The phone just doesn’t do it for me.  Slim, small, and functional.

title: love the colors, tad thin

ActualLy, it can be a great mat to protect the floor when you get off a spin bike...Which we found this use accidentally when we noticed a number of dings on our wooden floor from the spin shoe. They are pretty .thick - not flimsy.  Love how organized my front door is!  I love the colors, cheerful.  Cute, I love them.

Yup, I spend more time fighting the tap. Recommend you out it in the fridge to use first..I am serious, especially if you live in hot environment.  I may stick to 3M/command.

title: super ink flow.
