title: Epson CX6600 costly to use and veryt fickle
text: I got my CX6600 new at Comp USA at a deep discount.  Photo quality print was excellent but it really sucked a lot of ink.  Ink was costing me twice as much as with my Lexmark Z52 and the photo quality was not significantly better. Less than three months later the factory had to ship me a replacement. Why? Because just after I printed out about 20 beautiful 8 x 10's of my wife, the printer sat idle for two weeks, and the print heads dried and would not work with brand new Epson ink cartridges no matter how many times I ran "head cleaning."  Epson said the second printer they sent me was new but it had the loudest paper feeder I've ever heard.  It also sucks ink though so far it produces beautiful prints.  I have to run "head cleaning" anytime I go more than just a few days without doing some printing which uses all of the color cartridges.  I'd not buy this printer again.

title: Labels don't stick and printing ability doesn't last.
text:
We've had this label maker for a few years, but only use it maybe once a or twice a year. I tried using it a bunch when we moved to label our plastic tubs, but as others have noted, the labels don't stick to anything but paper. Which is kind of useless. So I ended up printing labels and using packaging tape to tape over it.

What irritates me more is the whole "doesn't need ink!" claim, like it'll last forever as long as you get more tape. After my printer started doing a shoddy print job, I looked up on how to get more ink and found out there's no ink or ribbon to be had. So I looked up instructions on how to fix this--and Dymo said I simply had to "clean" the printer parts with this little wand thing inside the cap. Ok. So I cleaned it as per instructions, and when that didn't work I tried every other way under the sun and it did absolutely nothing to help the problem. I have a whole reel of tape going to go to waste because of this.

Needless to say, I won't be buying another Dymo to replace this one.

title: Doesn't print half the time
text:
You never know if this printer is going to decide to print or not. Usually it doesn't. And you can forget about scanning. IF I can manage to actually get this piece of junk to print, it's by hooking it up with the cord. The wireless connection won't work even after you use the "wizard" and type in the password and it says connected and everything. On the computer it'll say "printer error" but won't tell you anything about it and the troubleshooter is useless.

I'm never buying a brother product again. When I contacted tech support they said they can't help over email, that it'll have to be over the phone and probably have to take over my computer to do it. Yeah, right. I'm going to trash this piece of junk and buy something more reliable.

You have instructions on bottom of card to push in tabs to try to get card to stand up.  Many people with dementia cannot accomplish that and since I have never before purchased a pop up card which one merely opens the card and it pops up, that is what I expected. title: Poorly Engineered
text: I cannot believe that I have to sacrifice almost an inch of tape on each label if I want my text centered on a PT-210 label.  Sometime that makes the labels too long.  I have an older, less expensive PT-80 that allows me to have nice, short margins.  I have seen some of the work-arounds, but none of them should be necessary.  If I want smaller margins on at least one side, I need to also have a pair of scissors handy and a broom for all those little extra pieces cut from the left of the two dots [the manual cut line for a centered label].  Worse, with all the good reviews, I expected to love the PT-210 and bought a two pack of tape.  I wasted all the sample tape just trying to get my labels to come out centered, with smaller side margins, and not needing to use scissors.  I guess this PT-210 and labels go on Craigslist.  My next label maker certainly will not be a Brother, nor will any other product.  Crappy engineering on one item [Brother confirmed that there is no "fix" for this] isn't a particularly good advertisement for future purchases.

title: I Won't Be Ordering These Pens Again
text:
With nerve damage to my hand I need adaptive ergonomic tools to help me write. And I love to write. Well I had the opportunity to buy a pack of 24 BIC CRISTAL XTRA SMOOTH BLACK 1.0mm medium Ballpoint pens & a 24 pack of BLUE ones as ADD ON ITEMS. Unfortunately while the pens do write smoother then some, even when I press harder I still don't experience anything close to how well the BIC CRISTAL XTRA BOLD BALLPOINT PEN (1.6mm) writes.

I will not we using these pens. I will make them available for my friends and students to use. I already feel my hand hurting from using these pens, unlike when I use the XTRA BOLD (1.6mm) which Glide across the paper. I just need to move my hand to the right & cursive writing is effortless. The packaging was poorly done as well. All the black pens had fallen out of their smashed box while the blue ones remained intact in their box. I tried to return the unopened box of blue pens but Amazon would not allow it. Maybe because they were an ADD ON ITEM, but in actuality I don't know why.

If you all looking for a basic medium point pen that is cheap as an ADD ON product this item just might be for you. They write with a little prompting and continue until the ink is gone. With transparent barrels you can see how much ink you still have remaining. If you have no problems with your hands these pens should present no problem for you.

title: Durable Stainless Steel Black Pen
text:
I purchased this Add-On set of two pens based on the recommendations of others. I am a Pen Connoisseur. I love office supplies and am constantly buying new products, as well as re-purchasing those which really write smoothly for me. I kept forgetting to add this set to an order over $25.00. Received on August 1st of 2018. I'd waited so long & was very eager to try them out.

Unfortunately in my pen set the first pen was not as smooth writing as I expected. While it certainly was a Fine point I was disappointed - that is until I tried the second ZEBRA 301 pen. It wrote smoother, but I like a darker coloring in my black pens. I see these as more of an utilitarian pens.

I don't see myself purchasing this pen again, but I will keep it inside the spirals of my Reviews of my STENO notepad since it's so thin. It'll be convenient. Not having to press down hard to write is a decided advantage. I would recommend them to others. The ink doesn't bleed through or look visible on the back of the page.

If both pens wrote equally as smoothly I would have offer 5 stars instead of 4 stars. I'll keep one pen in the car. The stainless steel body gives it some weight and it is refillable, as well as a retractable ballpoint pen. I hope you get a chance to write with this pen and you find it to your liking.

title: 3.5 Stars Actually seem like Fine point pens
text:
I purchased these pens at the same time as four other Black gel pens all approximately 0.7mm. Unlike the KYINFLOSE pens which write with a bolder stroke despite being the same caliber, these CALIART pens are definitely Fine point. They write smoothly. The grips are comfortable. The ink seems light weight and it certainly does not bleed through to the page behind.
These pens are retractable & refillable. When I write in cursive I have no problems, but when I began to print the pen skips I believe it is because I have to take the tip off the paper as I individually form each letter. I found myself having to retrace some letters to get them on the paper. Now even the more I write in cursive there is some skipping. I plan to share the remaining pens with others. There is a plastic bit on the tip of each pen which has to be removed before the pens work.

title: Great Utilitarian Fine Point Gel Pens
text: These are definitely Fine point pens. They arrived in a plain white box with an ISBN label. Sometimes it seems like you have to press down a bit harder with these pens than many of the other gel pens I've recently ordered / used. So far as I test it out there has been no stuttering or skipping as I transition between cursive writing and printing. It is an adequate gel pen. It doesn't bleed through paper so you can write on both sides of a page. It does write better than CALIART Gel Roller Pens, but I still see it as a basic utilitarian pen though the outside design looks professional and stylish. I forgot to put the cap on the pen last night. It took a couple strokes for the pen to flow properly again, but that happens with my BIC Flairs and I love them, the owner of these pens have to remember to put the cap back on. I'll keep a few at home and take the rest to work where I am constantly reaching for a pen. I spend a great deal of time writing at work.

title: Regular Permanent Marker
text:
Once again even though this marker it is labeled as Durable Fine Tip, as well as being lifted in comparison to other Fine Point markers. For the very cheap price they are worth it. There is a smell, but not too strong.

This marker not only bleeds through to the back of the page, it also leaves dots / flecks on the next page, which might be words if the writer has a tendency to press hard when writing. The Utopia Art Fancy marker are decent permanent markers that if I didn't have so many (pack of 12) I might be tempted to buy again.

title: Nice Marker, but not fine point
text:
This marker was touted as Fine Point - which it definitely is not. It is a nice marker. I believe equal to a bolder marker from Sharpie. And it is very reasonably priced for a 12 set box. There is a slight odor, but not as strong as other permanent markers.

The Amazon Basics Permanent Marker most certainly bleeds through to the back of the page. If I ever run out of them I'd order these markers again to label things and address packages.

title: Beautiful calendar that depicts mostly Smooth coated Doxies
text:
Dachshunds come in many colors, two (really three) sizes: Standards, Miniatures, and Tweenies (in between sizes) and three coat varieties: Smooth, Longhaired, and Wirehaired.

This makes for lots to love for anyone who loves Dachshunds. In the past the Daily Box Calendar captured that diversity of types of coats. So when I purchased not only one but two calendars one for home and one for my office it was in anticipation of seeing several Wirehaired Dachshunds like my little Miniature girl each month.

I was shocked when in trying to show someone at work the difference between the coats and I could only find ONE Wirehaired in the entire calendar! What?! And there were only several Longhaired Dachshund pictures out of over 300 pictures...Really?!!

The calendar consists of mostly Smooths. Which is fine if Dachshunds weren't so diverse. So if you're a Smoothie owner and Dachshund lover you will enjoy the entertaining photos very much. The pictures are beautiful and depict the antics of silly & serious Doxies.

I just wish there were more Wirehaired and Longhaired Dachshunds to enjoy with their Smooth brethren. It's like a owner of a Chocolate Lab purchasing a Daily Box Labrador Retriever calendar and finding mostly Black with only a couple Yellow Labs and the picture of ONE Chocolate Lab. They love all Labs but it's so great to see your variety represented too.

I plan to give my second Daily Calendar to one of the many Smooth Dachshund owners I see while I'm out with my little Wirehaired. Someone who loves Dachshunds as much as I do, who will love & enjoy a calendar that depicts their low long baby in all it's tail wagging happiness.Of course I am keeping one of the calendars because though I have a coat preference I am still a Dachshund Devotee. As my Dachshund ladened bookcase attests.

title: nice cart, moves well, sturdy!
text: Happy with the cart - it was fairly easy to put together (even as just 1 person) and the wheels are good - it glides nicely.  I like it for storage to bring out all my craft supplies out at once and then I can put it back into the closet easily to clean up.  I do sort of wish the handle were a bit smaller or there was another option for the handle as this one sticks out quite a bit and I would like the cart to be a little less deep but without a handle it seemed weird for moving it.  That's minor issue and I could clearly see the handle and the dimensions so it wasn't a surprise but it does seem like they could improve it by including to handle options or putting a smaller lower profile handle on the other side so if you didn't want o use this one you could just use that one (if you don't move it that often)

title: very good highlighters
text: These are highlighters, boring subject everyone knows what they are etc.  I do really like these though because they are good about not smudging the ink and the small tip is very nice for highlighting text in small pages like the journal articles and patent documents that I am usually highlighting.  Good price and I was happy to have a nice big box so I don't run out!

title: I bought this but not very impressed
text: I bought this to put on the top of a chest freezer to identify what is in it.  I had a very hard time getting it to be flat on the surface - there were so many air bubbles.  It is VERY sticky and that makes it hard to get a smooth application.  This might not be so much of an issue on the wall - on the other hand it might be.  It is nice I suppose that it is very sticky so it should stay on there well but I could not get it without a lot of bubbles so I'm less than thrilled with the results.  Also, and perhaps more relevant to other people I found that it is not a great quality dry-erase surface meaning that once you erase something with the eraser there is a bit of a smudge/residue and you need a cleaner/wipe to get it clean.  I'd rather pay more and get a better quality one that actually erases well.  Perhaps that is a common issue with the cling-type because the other cling-type one i have (a calendar) as the same issue while the more traditional board with frame is great and erases no problem.

title: very good quality dry erase board
text: i was a little weary that it might not be good quality since it was cheaper than most other alternatives but so far it's great.  It erases well (which I have had a bit of a problem lately with newer dry erase boards I thought they didn't erase as well as the old ones, but this one does).  It looks attractive, i really like the frame.  I mounted it to a door with the 3M painting hanging strips and it seems quite stable up there which i was very happy with.

In viewing these address labels I was drawn to the style, colors and setup of the label. I did order the labels and it was very easy to put our information in the setup area. There was about a 2 week wait, which was fine with me. However, the downside, for whatever reason, there were unable to deliver the package. The company did write to me saying that they had no idea why they weren’t delivered and instead returned to them. Our address was correct, so I have no idea where the glitch was. Too bad because they were cute labels.

title: When this company doesn’t like what you say they harass you into deleting it
text:
THIS IS AN UPDATE: July 6, 2020. Just to let everyone know. I have been getting emails from this company to either change my review to make it a 5 star review or to delete altogether. The said they would pay me $30 if I would do this. Then several emails later the bribe went up to a $50 gift card to change my review. I have refused and also turned this company in to Amazon for being disreputable. Yet I am still
Getting these emails offering to bribe me so that I would change my review. I have left my original review intact because I felt it was fair and accurate. I hope no one else gets harassed like This. The following is my original review.

As will all toner it doesn’t last long enough. This is for our home printer and basically we print sporadically, recipes, a very few personal letters. Not much

That's more inherent in the design of the smaller cartridge, though, and I suppose if I was made of money I'd buy the larger ones.  For now, these will keep on slapping ink to paper in my home.

title: Too thin & flimsy, causes printers to jam
text:
I thought 20 lb bond was what I usually bought, but this seems really thin, too lightweight and kind of flimsy.
I have a brand new printer, and a year-old printer, and both of them are having trouble with this paper. it picks up more than 1 sheet at a time and is jamming both printers rather frequently. I have never had this problem before with either printer, even when I re-use paper on the second side. I will not use this paper any more in my printers, I will give away what remains. I purchased some 24 lb bond instead, and that seems to be working much better.

text:
I use this at work. It works great. It helps relieve numbering countless of papers. But I gave 4 stars because it’s heavier than I had anticipated my hand gets tired after long term use. It can get very messy refilling the ink, resetting numbers back to zero can be frustrating if you don’t have good vision.
I take frequent breaks on between numbering to relieve the discomfort in my wrist, wear my reading glasses to reset and try not to use too much ink. I am happy I bought it no regrets!

text: My toilet paper roll on my house is on the left side of my toilet. Not only that, it's kinda farther back to the left, so that's more work then I want anytime, especially at night. This thing here, I can put anywhere! You kinda have to hold it though, or be careful you don't grab it too hard, it might tip over. Little light weight. I so like the little tray right under the roll. You can put your phone, magazine, or ashtray there. Guys kinda camp out, so that's kinda important to them.

title: Yep it's a paper notepad.
text: Not 9x11 or even close. Maybe 5x8? It's paper. Smaller than expected. If you need a smaller pad this is for you. Other than that the quality is the same as anyother notepad. Not exciting not bad; it's a pad of paper. You can't even chose the color. It's paper

title: Good buy for the money
text: Kind of loud but works well. Bought for home use.

title: Just buy the erasable gel pens & save your $$
text:
I so wanted to LOVE this item! For me, though, using the pen that came with the RocketBook, the writing was like... you know how you use a gel pen and it's *thisclose* to bring out of ink, so the writing is 'spotty'? You find yourself shaking the pen and trying to finish the word or sentence or list you started without having to go back to the kitchen junk drawer or top desk drawer or your purse to find another pen? That's the way the writing was coming out on the page. So, off to the big box 'office supplies for twice as much... that was easy [money for them]' and I bought a package of the Frixion pens. It wasn't until I was standing there, forced to actually shop in person, that I realized that these Frixion pens write on ANY paper and erase with... 💡DUH!!... friction. Bought the multipack of pens, got home, tore the pack open, went to finish my list and the black pen in the multipack wrote just as cruddy. As did the navy blue, the royal blue, the red... all of 'em. So, I grabbed a clean sheet of paper and used one of my new pens (clickable with the rubber 'eraser') and they write splendidly on paper. They also 'erase' perfectly on paper.

Verdict: The RocketBook is not for me. I'm too ocd or too perfectionist or lack enough patience for a $32+ book with like 5 pages that makes all my lists and notes look like I have a dried out pen. I don't need the app, probably would have never used it anyway. So I sent the RocketBook back for a full refund. Maybe the book I bought was old and whatever film or whatever they use on the pages (to make them wipe away with water and the included microfiber cloth) was old 🤷🏼‍♀️ I won't say the entire product is worthless, because I'm not going to spend another $32 to find out.

title: Carpal & cubital tunnel sufferers, this one's for you!
text:
4.5 STARS overall, just because the grip itself:
I've got mild to moderate carpal tunnel. I've got moderate to severe cubital tunnel. I'm a girl of a certain age and I don't write much anymore (thankfully - lol)... all these factors and gripping a little Bic is, well, a BI*C* (😜). I came across these Dr. Grip well over a decade ago. I think this is about my 4th. I bought replacement ink once, it lasted less time than the ink in a new one, so now I just get a new one. That's on the manufacturer if it isn't the greenest option. I like how smoothly the pens write (first few weeks/months,; they tend to run out of ink rather quickly). I think they could be a better value if they came with one replacement ink thingy.

title: A family tradition Christmas gift for us
text: My Granny gifted these every year for 40+ years. We miss her immensely still, and this is just something I do for my Mom and sister that's keeping my Granny in Christmas for us girls. I do recall she used to find these (maybe not this brand but the liens wall calendar towels of similar quality) at the Dollar Tree, so it hurts to pay $11 each for them. But maybe that was because they were sooooo out of fashion back then and the nostalgia factor had brought them back 'round? They're not perfectly square, that bugs my OCD, but they are what they are and that's all we want them for...

title: One of the 2 Combination locks didnt work
text: Easy to return, though, without additional cost to me. I probably just got a dud as I've had a lockmed before and it lasted years with twice daily use. If the lock hadn't been messed up, definitely 5 stars.

title: Good paper but arrived damaged
text: I would normally give Hammermill paper 5 stars, especially since the ream of colored paper was reasonably priced!  However the outside wrapping of the paper was torn and the top 20 sheets of paper spilled out and got bent and creased.  Not worth my effort to return for $7 so just going to keep it.

title: ( Second one works great.
text:
Ordered the 2 pack. First one I put in didn't work :(
Second one works great.

title: It has some type of date calculator that shuts it ...
text: It has some type of date calculator that shuts it down after x days.  I rarely use the printer, so I might get one or two uses out of the box.  Would never have bought this printer had I known about this flaw.

title: great product fits the cup holder well and easily loads ...
text: Could use some type of cover or flip lid.  I sometimes have to work in places where coins in plain sight = broken window.  Otherwise, great product fits the cup holder well and easily loads and dispenses coins.

title: The great thing about this heavy duty unit is that it ...
text: The great thing about this heavy duty unit is that it sits a couple inches higher than a standard one.  That means even fully compressed I never sink to a level below normal working height.  This effectively eliminates any downward adjusting, but also means that even if the piston fails, the chair will be at a usable height.

title: Four Stars
text: Gets the job done and takes up very little space in my laptop bag,

title: Four Stars
text: Great little portable printer.  Fits in my laptop bag and works nicely.

title: Two Stars

title: Two Stars
text: Not a good value for amount of paper you get.

title: Junk.

title: Simple
text: While this is as simple as I could find this has confused my father who has Alzheimer’s

title: Used for an Alzheimer’s patient
text: This is a push button phone made to resemble a rotary phone. I purchased this for my father who has Alzheimer’s as the current modern phones were confusing for him but he understood how to use this.

title: Terrible quality
text: Only one pen functioned properly. The 1st was fine for about a month. They were used for customers to sign receipts in low light areas. Three had no functioning light feature on 1st attempt. The last one I gave to a friend and his worked only a week. Horrible quality.

title: I feel like they are QUITE expensive though
text: These are okay.....I need them for my shop. I feel like they are QUITE expensive though.

title: I thought these would be nice pens being from Bic and all
text: I thought these would be nice pens being from Bic and all. The tips have a big hard fuzzy substance on them. Probably won't get them again. And I had to wait forever for these to be delivered. When they finally got here the box was crushed.

I was hoping to organize my pens and light weight sharpies with this but it won't stay in place. It keeps sliding and moving. A Strong magnet it DOES NOT have.
It drives me crazy so I just shoved it in a drawer. Now I'm skeptical of buying anything like this at all.
Waste of money. 8-(

title: Flimsy paper

title: What happened to OUTPUT OPTION - book binding>  Geez.
text: What happened to OUTPUT OPTION - book binding>  Geez.  I bought this printer primarily for booklet printing. Although you see BOOKLET in the preferences area, you cannot actually select it when you try to print an individual document. It has nothing to do with Windows , or my duplexer, or even the document viewing/editing software, because I can print smaller booklets using these 3, using my hP8630 unit. Searched everywhere online for a remedy, new driver, reloaded software. Geez, what bleeping joke. Not happy at all.

title: Not bad
text: Pretty large but Not quite what I expected. Lot people I gave them too really like them though. I just like the small regular size. This could hold a wallet size picture and still have left over space. Also zip up lock up kinda bag. Nice touch less likely to get wet inside

title: It's crooked.
text: The spine of the binder is crooked and throws off the cover, so it sits crooked. Very irritating.

title: Won't stay in one place!
text: The cover is only big enough for the top part. If you want to use both pieces, you don't have a cover. Also, the worst part is that it slides all around. I have to keep reaching down to move it, which is not great for my back. I am going to return and find something that stays in place.

title: Nice phone poor volume
text: Nice looking phone, but not loud enough

title: Soooooo small
text: Honestly the photos on this listing are so damn misleading but I guess I should have just paid closer attention to the actual measurements. Super disappointed. Way too small. Can’t even fit a pencil in lengthwise in any of the drawers.

title: The pictures are nice; the calendar was not properly thought out
text:
If you just want to look at the pics, it's great. If you want to actually use the calendar as a calendar, it's horrible. The backgrounds on the calendar months are too dark to see what you've written there (the calendar backgrounds should be white). The paper is too slick to write on with a pen.
I recommend just looking at your porn online, then purchasing a regular calendar.

title: Not very strong
text: I thought that these paper clips looked like an excellent value - I have purchased ACCO clips in the past, but not the "jumbo" size; I never had any complaints about their regular-sized clips. I had assumed that these would be the same gauge of wire that their regular-size clips are, but these seem to be a much thinner gauge that barely holds onto a few pieces of paper.

title: Not good
text: This was not a good product. Printed two sheets and they were out of ink.

title: Empty
text: One was empty.

title: Greatly regret buying this printer!
text:
The Epson ET-2650 was ordered Oct. 2, 2018, and delivered Oct. 4, 2018. It worked as promised in the description -- at first.

First issue: It drinks ink! I had no reason to think we used more ink than average until this printer. I quickly went through the first four Epson color ink bottles and was already halfway through the second box of Epson ink refill bottles when the unit failed, after only 4 months of moderate use. The description suggested the ink refills would last up to two years. I didn't expect the refills to last that long, but less than four months is quite a bit short of the predicted ink use. We don't print every day, and certainly not in huge quantities.

Second issue: From the time of purchase, I needed to clean print heads frequently due to the print quality being unreadable on parts of the page. I'd never experienced this with previous printers. Photo 2.

Third issue: This printer became unusable when it could no longer print documents from a website, like Amazon. Instead of the printer recognizing and printing letters and/or numbers, it substituted blobs of ink instead. End result, I had a printer that couldn't print receipts or other online information. This problem developed about two months after we purchased it. Photo 1.

Replacement policy: When I contacted Epson, the phone rep indicated that he thought it was possibly a hardware issue. To get a replacement printer, Epson would send a box for the printer. I was to mail the printer back to the company. Once they received the printer, they would send me a replacement. However I had to send them a check for nearly $200 before they would send the box.

I would have been happy to receive the return box and mail the printer to Epson, then waited for them to OK the return, and send me a replacement printer. That wasn't an option.

I opted to NOT send Epson either the printer or the money. Instead, I'm recycling the printer and have purchased an HP.

-- Former Epson customer

title: Wrong size
text: Wrong size

title: Wanted to like it, but ended up never using it  - too small!
text:
I had high hopes for this shopping cart cover, and in some respects, it did deliver. Unfortunately it mostly goes unused, and we've started using one of the extra-large, elasticized "floppy" covers instead.

Basically, the cover is very well designed, it's just too small. I love the little side pillows, which can be removed as baby gets bigger. The pockets and toy straps are really useful, and the way the bag rolls up into a neat little duffel is pretty ingenious. The design for attaching the cover to the cart using Velcro would be terrific - if it fit! Unfortunately, this cover is too small to be used properly in an average size shopping cart. I tried it on the carts at Target, and there was no way I could actually wrap the front of the cover around the handle of the cart and attach it with the provided Velcro. If I had, the bottom of the leg openings would sit about five inches ABOVE the seat! I've examined the photo included with the product description closely and concluded that either the one they sent me is much smaller, or the shopping cart used for the photo is incredibly small.

Oh, and one other thing - the color and pattern. Not a big deal, but the color/pattern is not as pictured on the product description. It is indeed a "sage pin dot" - that is, it's sage green with white pin or polka dots.

Overall a great idea for a design, but poorly executed. Unless you're shopping at stores with tiny carts, I'd look for a different style of cart cover.

title: More letters than you will know what to do with/won't be able to find letters you are looking for
text: Wayyyyy too many letters. Don't purchase this if you have children in your home. But the amount of letters make it very hard to find the one you are looking for. It should come with an organizer

title: Not for use on painted walls
text: I had a canvas that I used this to hang for VBS at our church. It’s easy to use and the adhesive is awesome but when I tried to gently remove it, it took the paint right off the walls. Read the directions before using.

title: Good for Portable Printing Needs
text:
Documents are usually transferred and shared electronically, but there are still those times when you need to print. Having a printer that is easily portable and easily connectable is great when you’re on the run and this need convinced me to get this HPRT Wireless Portable Printer.

Setting up this printer requires a few simple steps. First, you need to open the top, take out the paper roll, and tear it to get it ready to print. You then feed the edge of the paper through the slot and snap the lid shut. Next, you need to go online and download the printer driver, then install on your pc. If you want to print from your phone, you just download the Hereprint app.

The best feature of this printer is its portability and its best use is printing from your phone, through the app. I already have regular printers at home and at work, so I don’t really need help in these places. But I often do need to print from other locations and I like that this small, skinny printer can be taken anywhere and that I can send documents to it, straight from my smartphone.

As for quality, this printer is best for printing documents. I have tried printing pictures and the quality is not the best. The other issue I have with this printer is that it requires rolls of paper, which means you need to have a supply on hand, and they are not that easy to find. I would prefer just feeding individual 8.5 by 11 inch sheets, but you can’t do that with this printer. You have to use a paper roll.

Printing will never go completely out of style. Printers are generally inexpensive nowadays and are available most anywhere. But portable printers are not widely available and thus a printer like this fulfills a specific need. It is limited in its ability to produce a quality print and the need to buy rolls of paper is a concern. But this is still a useful printer when you’re on the go and need to print.

title: Motivational Sayings Can Make a Difference
text:
Children can benefit from receiving reminders when they do well and from receiving encouraging words when they have doubts. In a classroom setting, one easy way to achieve this is with posters and a possible choice for encouragement is this Growth Mindset Posters Bulletin Board Set from Tenare.

This set contains small, individual sayings intended to motivate kids. They are made from carboard and can be placed on walls, chalkboards, or any place else where kids can view them and, hopefully, be encouraged by what they read. There are two pieces shaped like halves of a human brain, a rectangular piece, plus individual words and short sayings, separated into two subgroups: Fixed and Growth. The Fixed have to do with fixed mindsets; the growth have to do with ways to change or improve.

One issue I have with this set is that some of the statements are negative. I understand that the whole idea is to get kids to realize that these negative thoughts can be changed through growth. But if you’re working with kids who are under performing, they may already be thinking those things and certainly don’t need to hear it or see it permanently displayed on a wall. If they’re not thinking these negative thoughts, then I think it is best not to plant the seed.

So, to make the set best, I recommend using only the positive ones. The colors on both definitely brighten up the room and if you stick with the positive statements of encouragement, the desired outcome will be achieved. Yes, these are just sayings but sometimes, this is all you need to get children to do better.

Statements of encouragement can motivate children and this Growth Mindset Posters Bulletin Board Set is generally good overall. I don’t like the negative sayings, but the positive ones are nice and they do look good on the classroom walls.

title: Not a Monthly Calendar, Too Small
text:
With so many things to keep track of, I like having calendars and planners nearby. It’s also useful when there is a central calendar that everyone in the family can see and my desire for such a calendar led me to get this magnetic dry erase calendar for my refrigerator.

When I first received this and looked at the calendar, I wasn’t pleased because it wasn’t what I was expecting to get. The page shows an actual calendar, complete with squares for each day of the month. This calendar is really a weekly calendar so I don’t know why they refer to it as a monthly calendar. Another issue is that the package contained only one marker when there are supposed to be three.

Moving right along, I thought I would try this out anyway, even though it isn’t what I wanted. But I quickly discovered that it doesn’t hold itself flat against my refrigerator. Parts of it curl/buckle up, which doesn’t look good and makes it more difficult to write on the board. It’s too small, too!

I still like being organized and alert to what is going on and I still like the idea of a refrigerator calendar. But this one isn’t the answer to my needs and its various flaws make it a product to avoid.

title: Can Barely See the Marks, Hard to Wipe Off
text:
With whiteboards in classrooms, business spaces, and homes across the nation and the world, you need a good set of colorful markers to write words, draw objects, etc. There are many fine options out there, but one that is less than satisfactory is Green Piece Safe Expressions Chalk Markers.

These markers come complete with a set of eight different colors, which includes all the primary and secondary colors, plus white and pink. The colors you need, for basic use, are all here. The problem is that the colors don’t appear very well on a whiteboard. Even with added pressure and effort, there is almost nothing you can visibly see.

Another issue I have with these markers is that the marks are not easy to wipe off completely. With other, dry erase markers, a whiteboard eraser does the trick. With these, I had to use spray cleaner and a paper towel to remove the marks.

I did find that these worked better on a blackboard. However, they don’t work well on a whiteboard which is primarily the reason I got them. The limited usefulness and problem with cleaning earn these chalk markers a below average rating and non- recommendation.

title: Keeps Papers Organized
text:
If you have work that needs to be stored in a three- ring style binder and organized, then you likely need a way to keep the paper separated into sections. This is where binder dividers are handy and a good choice for the task is AmazonBasics 5 tab Plastic Binder Dividers.

These plastic dividers are typical of this type of item. They are made for use in 3- ring binders and are good for separating sheets of paper into specific sections. They are multi- colored, which makes it easier to distinguish one from the other.

Speaking of the colors, one small issue I have is the choice of hues. There are two blue tabs and they are a little too similar in shade. It would have been better to have a different color for one of the blue tabs. Making one of them red would do the trick. With colored tabs, more contrast is better.

I use three ring binders and having a simple way to sort/organize items is valuable. The AmazonBasics 5 tab Plastic Binder Dividers is a sufficient item for the task at hand. They work as intended and are good enough for most needs.

title: Good for Open Organization of Paper and Mail
text:
Among the most basic of office supplies is office trays. If you deal with paper documents or receive mail, it’s handy to have trays to keep everything organized and one possible option is Newfield Studio Premium Front Load Tray, with Supports.

With this set, you get a pair of stackable trays with the opening in front for easy access. The trays are black and nicely polished, for a pleasing, stylish appearance that matches any décor. The rounded edges are nice because there are no pointy corners, thus no chance for the annoyance of hitting your skin against the point where the sides converge.

These trays come with four supports for stacking, but this is where the set of trays loses points in my book. The four supports are not attached. They merely rest between the trays. That means a good bump is all that is necessary to knock the top tray down. I am not sure why they made it this way, as this is definitely a design flaw.

Because of the problem with the supports, we have decided to use the trays unstacked and, in this way, they are fine. You could apply adhesive of some sort to hold them together, but that could be a permanent fix, which means they would be permanently stacked.

Paper and mail are still present in my office and a set of paper trays is good for open organization. Newfield Studio Premium Front Load Tray are okay for the task, but the issue with the supports convinces me to lower my overall rating.

title: Good for Small Hands
text:
Office supplies are a necessity and even though we don’t use as much paper as we once did, paper still hasn’t gone away completely and we still need a way to attach pieces of paper together. A stapler is the best and easiest means for this task and one possible option is the Staplers Office Small One Touch Stapler.

Compact in size, this stapler fits into small spaces so it’s easy to store. It uses standard staplers, so you don’t need to shop for anything special. It doesn’t hold as many staples as other, larger staples and that means it runs out more quickly and must be refilled more frequently.

The best feature of this stapler is that it requires less effort to use. You don’t need to push down hard with your hand- a softer touch is all it takes. Don’t get the wrong idea- it still requires pushing, just not as much effort as conventional staplers. I’ve used electronic staplers that truly are touch- activated, but this one isn’t quite like that. You still need to push.

Due to its small size, this stapler is best suited for young people. I like that it can hold up to 25 sheets of paper but the small size makes its use limited overall. I still think it has some good points to offer, but I can’t give it more than an average rating for the reasons stated above.

title: Swingline Optima Handles the Big Stapling Jobs, Most of the Time
text:
Stapling is still a necessity in the office and often in the home, but most staplers cannot handle very many sheets of paper and require too hard/swift of a push to get the stapler to work properly. For these purposes, an electric stapler does the trick and the Swingline Optima Stapler is one worth considering when you need to staple lots of paper with little effort.

I use staplers in the home, but I use them even more at work and my greatest frustration with regular staplers is that they cannot staple a thick stack of papers. You might be able to make it work, with a really hard, fast push, but mechanical staplers are just not made for this type of task. With the Swingline Optima, the staples are delivered quietly and with little more than a touch. They easily push their way through a large stack of paper and I have found that I no longer need binder clips like I once did. This stapler can attach where my mechanical one could not, so the binder clips can be saved for other uses.

This stapler is larger and heavier than most and it does take up more desk space. It has a nice appearance and it does work in most instances. I have, however, had a few problems and one is with staple jams. Not all standard staples work and I don’t like that the manufacturer claims they will work BUT guarantees smooth operation only with the recommended optima staples. Still, the jams are not that frequent to really matter, at least not for me. I can staple twenty times in a row and have only one mishap, so I suppose that isn’t too bad.

Stapling will be around as long as paper is around and it is nice to have an electric stapler capable of fastening a large stack of paper with a light touch. I have never put this stapler to the test by attempting to staple 45 sheets, but I have used upward of 30 with satisfactory results. It’s a good product, but it does have some issues and unless one really needs the power of an electric stapler, it may not be worth it. I’m going to give it the middle rating of 3 stars, as I feel it has its share of pros and cons.

title: Cross- Cut Security for a Low Price
text:
The Aurora AS890C Shredder is a small to medium size shredder perfect for those who need to shred on occasion but do not need a large, heavy duty machine to do the job. Its size makes it useful for either the home or office where it can easily fit into small, compact spaces.

Shredders are necessary for destroying confidential information and one factor that sets them apart is the way they cut. This shredder is a crosscut shredder, which means it shreds the paper into small pieces rather than in long, ribbon- like strands. Many like the cross cut method better because it makes it nearly impossible to join the pieces back together. I agree that crosscut is better, but keep in mind is that, while the manufacturer likes to say this is a confetti type shredder, this statement should not be taken literally. It doesn't cut the paper into tiny squares, like pieces of confetti, but rather into rectangular pieces about 1.5 inches in length and three- eighths of an inch in width. This is not what I would call confetti, but it is certainly good enough to deter potential thieves.

I like the way this shredder slices up paper and I like that it can handle credit cards, paper clips, and staples without jamming. But I still have a few issues with this shredder and the first one is its claim that it can handle up to eight sheets of paper. Unless the paper in your hands is tissue paper, eight sheets will likely not work very well. Place eight sheets in this shredder at once and it might be able to handle them, or it may jam and have to be reveresed. I find it works best if the number of sheets is limited to no more than six.

The other important issue I have with this shredder is one you don't notice at first, and that it its lack of a continuous "ON" setting. What that means is that you cannot turn it on and leave it running while you feed through multiple stacks of paper. There is nothing more than an Auto setting and while this is fine for most shredding uses, it doesn't work so well when you have a large stack of paper to shred at once. With an Auto setting, the shredder shuts itself off a second or two after each shredding. With a large stack of paper to shred, the lack of an ON setting will add some time to the task.

Shredders are essential for both the home and office and while most are similar in what they do, there are some key differences that make some better than others. The Aurora AS890C Shredder is lacking in a few areas, but it is still a good shredder for home or office and one I will continue to use when sensitive documents need to be safely eliminated. The cross- cut action is very good and while I would like it better if there was an "On" setting and other features, it still has many good qualities and it is tough to beat for the price.

title: You're Better off Removing the Batteries and Sharpening Manually
text:
Pens are the writing utensil of choice, but I still like to use pencils from time to time, due to their erasability and other factors. The reason many hesitate to use pencils is, of course, the inconvenience of having to sharpen, but this problem is easily remedied with the right pencil sharpener. A good electric sharpener does the work for you, eliminating much of the inconvenience that makes people avoid using pencils in the first place.

The Stanley Bostitch Minisharp Battery Powered pencil sharpener is, unfortunately, not the good, convenience- enhancing pencil sharpener I was hoping for. This pencil sharpener is about as simple and basic as an electric powered sharpener could be, with nothing more than a small blade on the inside that looks much like a tiny, manually operated pencil sharpener. It turns when a pencil is inserted, but the problem is that it doesn't work very well at all. At first, I was convinced that I was doing something wrong but I found that no matter how I held the pencil, whether I held it steady or turned it back and forth, the blade just didn't do the job. It sharpened so slowly I gave up and resorted to manual sharpening.

Another issue I have with this pencil sharpener is the lack of instructions. You will eventually figure out how to perform tasks like opening the battery compartment, inserting the batteries, and releasing the door for waste removal, but the manufacturer should have provided a simple set of instructions explaining this. Your frustration level is piqued from the beginning, and it doesn't get any better when you discover that the device doesn't work.

If there is anything good to say about this pencil sharpener, it would come down to two main things: The compact size and the portability. It is small enough to fit in the tiniest desk space or school bag and because it doesn't have an electrical cord, it can be taken anywhere. I also like the see- through compartment that holds the shavings because you can quickly see when it is full and know when to empty. Compartments on some pencil sharpeners are tinted and you can't really see the shavings very well, which can lead to overfilling. There is no problem like that with this pencil sharpener, but considering its performance, it is highly doubtful the shavings compartment will ever reach its capacity.

Everyone who uses pencils needs a good, convenient sharpener but this Stanley Bostitch model isn't one of them. I finally gave up, took out the batteries, stuck my pencil inside and turned it manually. The sharpening was faster and better than using it powered. And this says quite a bit about the quality and usefulness of this device.

Avoid it, spend the extra money, and get a better product.

title: Plain White Envelopes? Yes, and Recycled Paper Construction, Too
text:
Ampad #10 Recycled Envelopes with Moisture Seal Closure are one of several envelope products made by the Ampad company and they are one of many different Ampad products that are manufactured in an environmentally- friendly way using recycled paper. These envelopes provide most of the qualities an individual or business wants in an envelope for a fair price.

I'm generally not too picky about envelopes, but I do insist on a few minimum qualities. One quality I like that I didn't care about in the past is the use of recycled paper. If you think about it, there is really no good reason not to use recycled paper when manufacturing envelopes because they are not something we purchase to keep. They are disposable, and all that matters is that they are good enough to protect the contents on the way to the final destination. Recycled paper is fine for this purpose, and these Ampad envelopes are made completely from recycled paper, so they earn extra points in this area.

Are Ampad Recycled Envelopes without any flaws? Well, I do have two complaints, and the first is the thin, flimsy design. From my experience, these envelopes are still fine for mailing letters from home and they have no problem holding up for most uses. But one has to be a little careful with overstuffing the envelopes because they may tear. Another potential problem is with postage machines. If you need to run your envelopes through a postage machine, there is once again a chance these envelopes will tear. It depends on how much is inside the envelopes and the type of postage meter used.

Envelopes are a product most people take for granted and few give much thought to what they purchase. Ampad #10 Recycled Envelopes with Moisture Seal Closure are a good envelope from Ampad with a few drawbacks that prevent them from receiving a great rating. These envelopes could be improved with a little thicker construction to prevent tearing and since there is no security lining, they may not be suitable for mailing certain items. But they are still a good envelope for general use.

title: It Doesn't Get Much Simpler than This!
text:
Office Depot 880 ranks among the simplest calculators I have ever used, offering nothing more than the basic functions needed to perform simple math. This bare- bones calculator is considered a desktop device but it is small enough to fit in the palm of your hand with a good stretch of the fingers. It is the type of calculator you turn to when you need to add up some numbers quickly and don't have a need to pull out the larger, bulkier, or more sophisticated devices.

This calculator has large buttons and pretty large display for easy reading. This is good for those with larger fingers and for those who have trouble reading a small display. The display tilts toward the user for easier viewing and the LCD panel holds eight digits so it is fine for most business uses. This means, of course, that it will only hold numbers less than $100 million. If a function is plugged into the calculator that exceeds this value, the display will show an error. It won't switch to scientific notation like some of the more sophisticated calculators. It will error- out.

Office Depot 880 calculator is battery and solar powered. The solar panel is small, but it is really all you need to power something this simple. The one I have has been using the same battery for years and I don't know if it will ever run out. The solar panel (and my limited amount of use) keeps it going strong.

There is no print function on this no- frills calculator. All you get is a device that performs the most basic mathematical functions. It is small, lightweight, easily portable, and will fit in a large coat pocket. Its thin design makes it easy to tuck away in a small space for future use.

Office Depot 880 is one of the least expensive calculators one can buy. It sells for a very low price- one that seems fair considering its limited use. It is definitely too simple for someone who needs a calculator with a little more functional ability but for basic needs, Office Depot 880 gets the job done. It's a no- frills calculator that is good for balancing check books, totaling a list of numbers (the addition key is the largest, since it is the most frequently used), or computing simple percentages or square roots. It cannot be used to solve a complex mathematical problem but for most business uses, it will suit consumers just fine.

title: Hewlett Packard Lays an Egg
text:
Hewlett- Packard's model 4215 multi- function machine is an office device that can be used for printing, copying, faxing, and scanning. Its multiple functions make it appealing to those who want a single machine capable of performing many functions. It is offered for a fair price, so it seems like the type of purchase where one can't go wrong.

But if one looks beneath the surface, it won't take too long to discover some of the flaws inherent in this device. I have been using this at my workplace for about seven months and there are many annoyances about this office machine that make it less than desirable. Starting with the fax, I like the fact that there are 80 preset numbers you can program for speed dialing. But I don't like the slowness of the feed and the slow, limited memory. I also don't like the fact that I often have to push the first sheet of paper to get the fax going. It often is unable to grab the first sheet on its own.

For scanning and copying, this device works ok but again it is very slow. I don't recommend its use for copying because the slowness is too much- you are better off waiting in line at a real copier than pacing back and forth while this machine attempts to make copies.

Printing is the machine's other function and here, it earns average marks at best. It feeds the paper through at a decent clip (17 ppm for black and 12 ppm for color), but it uses more ink that most printers. One ink cartridge sells for only about $20, but a single cartridge is good for only about 400 sheets using black ink (color cartridge costs about $35 and prints just 350 sheets). This is more costly than other printers in my office and that is the main reason why I don't use this device for printing.

This machine makes a decent one for faxing, but its other features rate either average or below. This isn't one of Hewlett- Packard's better printing devices and while I agree the base price is good for a multi- function device, I don't think this product is up to the usual high standards for a company like HP.

title: Lethargic Little Shredder from Royal
text:
Royal VF1000MX is a medium to compact size shredder for home or office. This unit is multi- purpose and is capable of shredding paper and other items, like CD's and credit cards. It features crosscut action, slicing papers and various forms of media lengthwise and then sideways, making it tougher to piece the shredded material back together.

The cutting action of this shredder is ok, even if not the best on the market. But there are still a few things about this shredder that I find less than ideal. First of all, the receptacle that holds the cut up paper isn't very large and it fills very quickly. There is a small window on the front that you can glance at from time to time to see if the level is too high. The problem is, since this shredder usually sits on the floor, you tend not to notice the level in the window. And if it overfills, the shredder will not accept any more paper. To add to the problem, removing the receptacle when it's overfilled with shredded paper creates a huge mess because the clippings spill out quickly, before you can catch them.

This shredder is also a little less durable than other makes. The one I use has begun to malfunction after just 18 months of use. The problem is that it no longer shuts off automatically following the shredding of a piece of paper. With the setting on "auto", this is how it is supposed to work. Now, I have to manually move the switch to "off" or it will not stop.

Other problems with this shredder include overloading and excessive noise. Royal claims this shredder is capable of handling up to ten sheets of paper at a time, but the company must be referring to tissue paper, because if I attempt to cram ten sheets into the opening, it makes an agonizing noise, overloads itself, and the blades stop turning. At this point, you have to move the switch to reverse to get the paper out, separate into smaller piles, and try again. It is also very noisy for a shredder its size, producing a loud grinding noise that makes it impossible to talk on the telephone within ten feet of the device.

If you need a shredder for small jobs in the home or office, this shredder might be adequate. But for a large office where many people need a shredder, this device is impractical. It cannot handle larger loads and frequent use for very long.

title: Not a true Legal Size Scanner
text: We purchased this scanner, specifically to use at Archives and Libraries for legal size documents.  There is always a challenge with these larger and very fragile documents.  Based on the size of the scanner and the advertising saying it does sizes up to 8.5x14, we made a bad assumption that this was the dream scanner.  Bad news, to get sizes larger that 8.5 x 11 you have to use the ADF (automatic document feeder), which is unthinkable with fragile documents... not to mention forbidden.  There is a sentence in the nice long description that says "the 8.5x11.7 inch flatbed", which we missed.  This is our fault for not reading the description 3 times over.  I can not testify as to how well it works, sets up, etc... we had simply unpackaged it enough to open the lid when we determined we did not buy what we needed.  If someone needs a standard size scanner without a document feeder, save yourself $145 and try Canon CanoScan LiDE210 Color Image Scanner (4508B002) [[ASIN:B003VQR1TS Canon CanoScan LiDE210 Color Image Scanner (4508B002)]].  We have used these style Canon scanners for 1000s of documents.  What a workhorse, easy to use, crisp copies and it is very portable.

title: Updated: Just Need a Simple Mousepad with Some Wrist Support
text:
Very nice mouse pad, especially for the price. You can't really go wrong with this pad- it helps relieve pressure from your wrist so you're less likely to get hand cramps or have your hand fall asleep. It's a convenient size too so that it'll nicely fit on your desk without forcing you to make more room for it. The little bump out on the left of the pad aids in the natural movements of the mouse so you will be able to use your mouse without falling off of the pad. The bottom has a slightly sticky rubber to keep the pad in place on your desk but will not leave any residue. If you need a mousepad with some gel wrist support for a good cost, you won't be disappointed with this one. JETech has always come through with simple and cost effective products for people who need something and don't have specific demands- great for offices.

UPDATE: I've had this mousepad for longer than a year but with less than average use. Like other reviewers' pads it has come undone at the bottom with the gel coming out. I can no longer recommend this mousepad. It was really nice while it lasted, but I can't say it was for as long as I expected.

text: First...this is totally my fault for not reading the description fully. I just needed a planner and I bought this because it had the best reviews. I didn't realize this was not dated. But I had already spend the money so I started putting all my dates in it and working through it. The more content I put in here, the more aggravated I get that I bought this thing. I hate the layouts. I hate the full month pages; the set up is weird. The weekly pages are not terrible, but I wish they had some better indicator to find them....this thing just isn't for me.

title: Not user friendly
text: As much as I have loved HP printers in the past and I've had at least 6, this one has to be my least favorite. It's not very user friendly....doesn't have a screen to monitor ink levels, there are touch pad buttons but it's not very clear how they work and the user guide isn't much help. The exit tray extender (so your printed pages don't fall onto the floor) doesn't automatically pop out when something is printing, like all of my previous HP printers did. And the automatic ink is debatable, I'm on the fence with that. It's pretty pricey, but we cancelled it and put replacement cartridges in and used up both cartridges (color and black) in less than 40 prints. I'm not sure which is more expensive now, the automatic ink or the cartridges. You can be your own judge on that. Overall, I am very disappointed with this printer.

title: a mouse pad calendar
text: It is a mouse and it is a good one. The mouse glides over it smoothly. It is well sized. However, as a calendar, it added two days (2/29 & 30) to the year. Editor, please. Will probably go with a different pad when I replace this one.

title: Good product if it’s a very small item if you’re trying to fit a DVD forget it

title: Not good for fountain pens
text: the elastic holders in this will only comfortably fit a standard pencil. The diameter is far too small for most fountain pens.

title: Mine wouldn't write, had to return
text: I have a few Waterman pans, and really liked the looks of this one. It wrote wet and smooth, but EVERY start would be late by a couple millimeters. It was just too annoying in the end, so I returned it and got a pilot custom 74.

title: Cheap

The fabric around the arm rests are loose and hang down super low. I guess for the price it’s decent, but I regret my purchase. Should have spent more money for better quality.

title: compact planner
text: The planner is a good compact (and I mean really compact) planner.  It is a little smaller than I was expecting, so I will keep looking for a different planner.  The cover was also pretty thin compared to other planners I have used by this brand and others.

title: Had for 3 months and all the ball bearings started falling out on the floor.
text:
When I first got it, a great smooth roller. In the past month got harder and harder to make directional change. We started finding ball bearings on the floor. At first thought old drawers had broken open, until I heard it fall on the floor as I rolled along. Tonight my husband turned the chair up-side-down and saw a variety of ball bearing sizes that just looked tossed in a two sided chamber, Eight came out just turning the chair over. All of the wheels are failing now. Was a great start ,but didn't last long at all.Tonight I ordered from a different company with a guarantee.
The picture shows the varied sizes and condition of the bearings falling out, in the last two days.

title: SAVE YOUR MONEY AND LOOK ELSEWHERE.
text: I AM VERY DISAPPOINTED IN THIS PRODUCT.  IT COST TOO MUCH TO BE SO BAD.  IT DOESN'T WORK USING THE USB, SO I PUT BATTERIES IN.  MOST OF THE TIME IT DOESN'T WORK, AND WHEN IT DECIDES TO, IT DOESN'T DO A VERY GOOD JOB.  I BOUGHT BECAUSE THE BLADES ARE REPLACEABLE, BUT A MANUAL SHARPENER WORKS 100X BETTER.  SAVE YOUR MONEY AND LOOK ELSEWHERE.

I DON'T NEED THE TRAYS.  THEY ARE JUST DUST COLLECTORS.  YOU CAN USE THEM FOR PAPER CLIPS, I GUESS.  I'D RATHER KEEP MINE IN A DRAWER WHERE THEY CAN STAY CLEAN.

Have to find something else or get some duct tape maybe, but I don’t have any at the time. Can’t recommend this product.

However I bought these in February 2020 and just put them in printer yo use in May 2020 right after placing an additional order for same ink cartridges. HP 63xl black and color. I was printing a large amount of documents got the message ink is low before I got thru 1st 30 pages. I print econo!  I checked and the color cartridge was on 1/4th left & black was abt. a 3rd left. Of course it is too late to do anything about it, but these cartridges cost $80+  As a long time loyal customer I am very disappointed. Supposed to be brand new OEM HP CARTRIDGES!
