title: Could have been so much better
text:
This journal is decent, but could have easily been made so much better. The cover is stamped with an owl on the front which I didn't know was going to be the case from the pictures shown, and it does deter from the looks. The clasp is very poor, it does nothing to hold the book closed and now comes out through the hole it is supposed to sit in.

The paper itself is just a cheap block of paper, which is why I don't understand the price of this item, it should in no way cost what it does. Very disappointed in the end.

title: It does look awesome if you don't touch it too much
text: The copy I got was so dark it wasn't red anymore, but more a shade of brown/black. Whatever they coated the cover with was sticky and the book smells awful. I tried to wipe the cover with a moist paper towel to get it to stop being sticky and the coating flaked off in parts and looks bad. Would make a great decoration, but best not to touch it too much or wipe it off.

title: Tiny and fragile
text: Pencils, markers and pens fall out of this thing because they are too big for it. Even my mini art supplies are too big, so what am I supposed to put in it? I suppose if you have super tiny things, it may be useful for you, but it's also fairly flimsy, so don't move it around too much or be rough with it.

title: Really nice but some of the elements aren't where they should be....
text: Some of the elements are under the wrong labels and out of order. I'm surprised more people haven't caught this. We've found at least 4 like this so far sadly. It's very nice looking but it's on the small size and has some elements out of order.

title: Perhaps I'm spoiled by having good pens..
text:
The nib that comes in the pen when you get the set holds the most ink of all the nibs and is usable; not great, but the least worst part of this kit.

I found this very difficult to use, as the ink ran straight off the nibs, meaning I could only write a letter or two at a time. Many of the nibs were also slightly bent and needed to be adjusted.

The ink is much too thin, I'd suggest letting it sit out a bit to evaporate the water. The ink bottles shape is not the right shape for a pen set like this, it should be short and wide, not tall and skinny.

The letter opener is so blunt, it doesn't really open my mail easily at all. The letter opener also was not at all smooth and had bumps all over it.

The pen holder is not designed for the pen in this kit. A pen holder should hold the pen itself, not allowing the nib to touch the bottom. This one is too wide and the pens nib simply rests on the bottom.

The feather was perfectly fine and the wax stick was a wax stick, so, better parts of this kit oddly enough.

title: Nice pen set
text: The glass pens don't hold much ink on them is my only complaint. They look nice though and it's a fun little set. For what it is I think I'll use these for fun or put them on display or something. As calligraphy pens, they're kind of awful seeing as they hold so little ink. So if you want a really nice calligraphy pen, don't get this. If you want pens that are prettier and just go on a shelf then go with these.

title: But the calendar layout is great.
text: The markers show up a lot lighter than in the pic.  They are almost indiscernible.  But the calendar layout is great.

title: Do NOT waste your money.
text: I put 2 on a small plastic LED light to mount inside my toolbox.  The light weighs maybe 8oz and even 2 magnets didn't even come close to holding the light to 2 magnets I adhered to my tool box lid.  Ridiculous.

title: Mediocre Quality - Good Concept
text: This could be an awesome book, except it is not traditionally bound. The inside contains several independent "books" , it is not like a regular book. The cover is separate from the pages, and the pages are contained within their own individual books. If I had known that, I would have found something else.

title: It's Ok
text: This is good double sided tape, however, it refuses to stick to new and clean outdoor paint on the side of a house. I am trying to attach a small dummy camera to the wood siding with fresh new paint, but it will only stick for about an hour then peel off. It sticks to the thin metal of the dummy cam, but not the fresh dry and warm paint facing the sun. It should stick really well, but does not. Have to nail the dummy camera now which I was trying to avoid.

title: Not Worth The Price
text: Got this and was shocked how cheap and flimsy the wood is. If it was any cheaper, it'd be balsa wood. This should be sold at a dollar store.

title: Ok but has issues
text: It's a decent printer. Was easy to set up. It likes to time out and disconnect from the wifi constantly, so have issues printing on the fly, which is not fun at all. Not too convenient, gets less stars because of that issue.

title: Meh
text: These are ok. Write just OK and have a flimsy small feel to them.

title: Not Quality
text: Not good, leads break really easy. Won't buy again.

title: Not so good
text: The pencil leads on these break much easier than other brands. I would not recommend these.

title: Not the best
text: These do not work as well as hoped. The tip tends to clot and bleed over a little, especially when first using it at the start of your day.

title: Sharp edges
text:
These look look cute and fit in well on my desk, though the wedges are pokey and sharp. Any time I try to move them I get jabbed. We have kids in our office daily and I had to move these up high so they are out of reach just in case.

I like the finish on them and the color. The lines are straight and none of the metal was bent or warped. I just wish they weren’t so dang sharp!

title: Flimsy and won’t hold shape
text:
These went together okay though I had to fight one of them. It seems to have arrived warped and won’t sit flat.

I’ve put some heavy books in the bottom to try and straighten it out but so far it’s only helped a little (see picture to compare). One also appears to be bigger than the other which I hadn’t expected.

Overall, these are OK. They will go together and will physically hold something as long as nothing leans on the side. Not really a fan unfortunately.

title: Thin and inconsistent
text:
These are an okay set of “pin boards”. As described, they are a brown felt with adhesive, though they are much smaller than I had initially expected and quite thin. The pins don’t always stay in all of them and I had to be careful to make sure no pins fell out and were lying in wait on the ground.

I have since retired them as pin boards and instead use them for hanging kids artwork and decorations with Velcro which works much better.

title: Not actually mesh
text:
This is a nice value for the sheer number of pouches you get. They don’t feel all that durable so I’m a little worried about them holding up well over time. For now they are doing a great job storing art and craft supplies.

These are labeled as “mesh” but they are solid clear plastic with a mesh inside of it. You can see what is in it but I was initially wanting to use these to clean toys easier but there are no holes in these. Just solid plastic.

title: "Magnetic" only with magnets that come with the board
text: I purchased this board for our pediatric clinic's sensory cave to use with our blacklight reactive dry erase markers and a set of magnetic blacklight gears. The markers worked well and glow decently under the light as other reviewers have mentioned, however, this board is hardly magnetic. None of the magnetic gears will stay on this board despite sticking to filing cabinets, baking sheets, etc. Thinking that maybe other magnets would work I tried it with our magnetic letters and words (the type you would place on a fridge), tiny magnetic stuffed animals, and a magnetic mirror (like the type used in kid's lockers) and none of them stick. Literally, the only magnets in our entire clinic that work are the ones that came with it. This greatly reduces its use for us and while it is a board and can be written on, a huge purpose of this purchase was the fact that it is described as magnetic. We would have been better off painting the wall with black colored whiteboard paint and saving the $50.

title: I Wish it Worked
text:
Okay, I'm revising this review. The machine didn't turn on when I got it. Though it was very carefully packed and undamaged, it just didn't work. That happens sometimes with all machines. I sent an email to the company after trying everything on my end, and, in spite of the quarantine, they got back to me in a couple of days with a customer service number to call. I haven't had a chance to call yet. It isn't their fault. I'll revise again when I get in touch with them.

I wanted this shredder for tax season. You know how it is. You toss statements and receipts in a drawer all year, and then have a ton of paper with sensitive but useless information on it to shred for the dump.

The box arrived, very carefully packed--a smaller box inside a larger one, very sturdy and neat. I eagerly lifted it out, (The shredder top is HEAVY.) I set it on the receptacle (like a wastebasket for holding the shredded paper) and plugged it in.

Nothing. I flipped the switch to forward. Nothing. I flipped it to reverse. Still nothing. (There is no separate power switch.)

I plugged it into a different socket in the house. Nothing. I repeated the process lugging the thing around. I then visited the company website and sent a message to support with my email. I haven't heard anything. Now, to be fair, I am writing this is n the middle of the COVID19 shutdown, so that could be the problem with support. If I hear from them, I will let you know here.

title: Thin junk
text:
I read reviews before purchasing this product a Costco table and decided to take a chance... Boy was I wrong. The reviews with the smooshed tables, crack tops broken uneven table tops, non normal bent legs. Super unsteady on carpet and slides all over on wooden floor.
Pass pass pass
Run run run

The best part is the box that it came in was in perfect condition. Which leads me to believe that it was placed in the box in such condition.
I returned the table.

title: disappointed not sticky enough
text: The colors are bright an beautiful.  The sticky is not strong at all very disappointed sadly not worth the headache

title: Never gonna get it again
text: The books supposed to be made of  leather but it's not the paper is stained  pretty bad and the outside paper cover that's supposed to be leather  has gouges in it

title: Not very happy.
text: Genuine sharpie markers but I received a package that was opened and missing 2. Not very happy.

title: Scratches right off.
text: [[VIDEOID:e6345d93ff5be9ca950be1c02adcb1c0]] Don't get it. It's useless for any product that will actually be used or touched.

title: Just a metal board
text: It's just a metal board. Nothing fancy or special.

title: Doesn't Work
text: I am super disappointed with this receipt printer. I couldn't get the app to sink with the printer no matter how much I tried and trying to find the right app is the hardest thing I've had to do for an item like this and I am still not sure I found the right app. All of the apps that were said to be used with this printer could never be found to even use. I was able to download the example app and was able to sink everything together and use the printer to print out all of the example stuff. However, when I go to try and find the actual app to use with the printer, it's nowhere to be found and you can't use the example app for anything other than learning how to use the printer and how it prints.

title: Beautiful but Missing Envelopes
text:
These cards are beautiful and simple with nothing written inside so you can write in them anything you want.
The huge complaint I have with these tho is that they didn't come with enough envelopes for all 18 cards but only came with 9 envelopes! How am I supposed to send off the remaining cards with no envelopes. The envelopes that did come with the cards are a heavy weight and has a slight shiny sparkle to them that is beautiful. I'd have given these five stars if I'd had gotten all the envelopes. I'd also return them if I knew I'd get replacements in time but I know I won't.

title: Beautiful but Not Worth the Price
text: I love love love these boxes so much and they are totally perfect for shipping out my custom tumblers even when they are wrapped and packaged. These are so super pretty and love that I am sending happiness to people even in the packaging I use for my products. The only bad thing about these is that I've not been able to find the 8x4x4 sizes since getting these and not only that but these are not cheap by any means, and honestly they are really expensive for shipping boxes. So because of the price and not being able to find this size anymore, I totally can't recommend these no matter how much I really love them.

title: Super Cute but Doesn't Work
text: I'm going to be honest, I had high hopes for this thermal printer and they have been crushed greatly. I have tried to print from my computer, doesn't work. I've tried to print from my phone, from several different apps, and none of them have worked. I tried going on the website and download the driver for my computer, wouldn't work. Also, I can't get the app that is recommended for this printer to work at all on my Good Pixel at all. It downloads but then never opens no matter what I try to do. I tried downloading other apps and either they can never pick up the printer or I can never get it to print from the app. So I'm done. This should totally just be a plug-and-play kind of thing and it is anything but that. I got another thermal printer and it was so much easier to set up and actually use. It prints great so this one is totally not worth the price or the headache. Do not recommend.

title: It’s tape.
text: It’s tape... so that’s great, but it’s hard to cut on our tape dispenser and the paper is waxy, so not invisible tape.  Works well for paper, but wouldn’t be strong enough of other media.  Cheap.

title: Not good for photos
text: These cartridges are not for printing pictures. I used draft quality and only printed 10 pages of photos (2 4x6 per pg) and by the 9 pg the ink was already running out.

title: Generic seems to cause errors in hp printers :(
text: These cartridges gave me various results mostly the computer/printer says depleted cartridge or damaged cartridge

title: Mixed Feelings
text: Kuyal Office Chair Mat for Carpets is accurate to it's description, and does prevent carpets from having deep indentations from your office chair. The big downside to this mat is the curled memory of the mat. I had some difficulty getting it to lay flat to use on my carpet with my chair.

title: Mixed Feelings
text:
I have some mixed feelings about the Big Fudge Comic Book Storage box. It is a laser cut kit that you assemble yourself. It's precisely cut and the assembly is intuitive. I recommend having some blue painter's tape and wood glue to assemble the box. The sturdiness will depend on the adhesion of the 1/8" plywood pieces.

The acrylic frame is easy to install, but in doing this, you loose access to the carrying hole on the front. This is fine if you only intend to use the box for display, but it makes moving the box a bother, since there is no good way to get a secure grip. There are vague assembly instructions on the inner lid of the cardboard box. The pieces are printed in shapes, but the assembly steps are omitted.

I like that this is wood, which should age much better than the cardboard alternative, but I feel like the cardboard type is more sturdy overall. If this is a box that will primarily be used as part of disguised storage in plain sight, then it would be a great option. However, if the assembly and lack of a handle on the front is an unattractive thought, then I would consider a different type of box.

title: Must Use Gently
text: I had hoped that the Wooden Tape Dispenser for Washi Masking Tape would let me tear tape using only one hand. This is mostly true, but it does tend to slip off the spool holder very easily, so I really have to be mindful of the angle I'm using to grasp the tape and tear so it doesn't slip off the spool. The finish on the wood does no favors to help the tape grip onto the tearing plate. It often will just wrap back onto the roll. Washi is a low-tack tape, so if the wood was left unfinished, it would have a better surface to grip. I also got one splinter the first time I used it, so it could use a bit more sanding before being sent to customers. It comes with a fabric bag, I'm not sure why...... I like the idea and presentation of this tape holder, but there is certainly some room for improvements. I will use this tape holder until I find one that functions better for me. I like the drop-in spool style much better for one-hand tape dispersion. Thank you for reading my review. I hope you find my experience helpful to you, and you kindly will click the button below.

title: These don’t work as mentioned 😞
text: The gel pen stops very often which ruins the artwork does not work properly. Very disappointed. Highly do not recommend.

title: Great for a kitten cushion
text: As a relatively full bottomed lady, I like a wee bit of extra cushion between my tush and my lazy-boy office chair. This is not that. My bony 11 year old sat on it for homework and said they actually had a more sore back and bottom after use of this ridiculous “cushion”. However, thanks to our cat, it doesn’t have to go into the rubbish bin. Invest a little more for a memory foam or the real Purple Pad,

title: Just okay
text: For the pencils that work, they work fine. The first pencil I tried was jammed and I couldn't get the leads to go in, or the pencil to work. So, it's kind of hit or miss whether the one you pick up will work or not.  It comes with a lot of extra pencil lead, but I like my leads a little softer. These ones are too hard and want to tear the paper. These are cheap, but another brand may be of more value, just based on functionality.

title: Very tiny and thin
text: The colors are very muted on these. These are extremely tiny and thin. It is if you want something really, really small. They are so see through it is hard to see the design on a lot of them. They are definitely different than I imagined. However, it does have the design as pictures, and they are good if you just want something very very thin. Just make sure you look at all the dimensions so you know exactly what you are getting.

title: Good Overall
text: This is overall a good system for organizing.  The stickers are not perfect, I wish there was a printable set too.  And it could use a few expanding folders to fit more stuff in.  But it's a good idea that just needs a bit of tweaking to be perfect for me.

title: Good Features, Poor Quality Build
text: This seems like a great presenter remote.  It is the size of a fat pen, the batteries last a long time, and it has a laser pointer built in.  I really wanted to like it.  But there are two issues.  The first is that it can't work with bluetooth.  I'm not too put off by that because the USB adapter fits inside the unit, so it's still portable.  But the second is that the battery case never stays closed.  The lid falls off all the time!  This makes it hard to travel with and I had to tape the lid shut to use it.  However, that tape makes the unit look bad and also will cause problems when I have to change the batteries.  So next time I'll go with a different brand.

title: Love the idea, cheaply made
text: I really like the idea of these. I remember these from when I was a kid, and thought they were great and fun. It's so cool to get all these pens in one. The problem is these are pretty cheaply made. The plastic seems really light and flimsy and breakable. It is definitely not hard for an adult to accidentally break one and since these are for kids, it is not the greatest. It is a great deal for the amount you get, but I think quality is suffering. So it is a balance between the value and seeing if they will hold up to your needs.

title: Good Card, Questionable Tune
text: I took off two stars because they chose a song that is about losing someone.  Okay, they cut it off before you get to the bad part in the song, so it sounds okay at first glance.  But then you keep singing the song in your head and it's like WTF???  Anyway, the card worked fine, it's just the worst possible choice of song......

title: Cute but quality issues
text: I love the idea of these. I think it is great to get a pen that has all those colors. We had some quality issues. First half of them were undone when they came. The top part was off and needed to be screwed back on. I can't imagine why half of them were like that. They aso felt so flimsy. They really did not feel durable. If you are giving them to kids, it could be an issue. Once I got them together I could push them. I thought the value was fine for what you got, but worried about how they are going to hold up through time.

title: One Giant Jam...
text: I was so excited to get this product.  I've got a shredder that can do 8 sheets at a time, but the ability to shred 100 pages at once is great!  First lesson, unless you are shredding a bunch of printouts that were taken straight from the printed, you'll spend longer arranging the papers into a neat stack than you would have taken to just feed them in.  Second lesson, envelopes, folded pages, and stapled pages do not feed in.  So my roughly 30 page stack took about 10 minutes to shred.  Then I tried just feeding the envelopes and things into the top that can take up to 8 sheets.  Even a single envelope jammed.  I spent the next 30 minutes troubleshooting and trying to get it to work correctly.  Then I tossed the whole thing in the garbage.  This was a HUGE dissapointment...

title: Not pleased
text: I love the idea of this. It really can be a useful thing, especially with kids studying from home. We have several versions of this, but I am not happy with this one. I just felt like the quality was really poor. It did not seem well made and parts of it started breaking right away. It's too bad becuase it is a good idea and nice that it tilts up. But I just don't feel like it is well made.

title: Not Worth It
text: This product has a neat idea, but a poor implementation.  First off, you have to scan a QR code to find out the website address where you download their app (they really couldn't be bothered to type it out).  Then you have to download the app and sideload it because they didn't want to publish through the app store.  If you haven't done this before, it involves turning off several security features in your phone.  Next, you have to turn off the "avoid bad wifi connections" feature if you have that turned on (in advanced wifi settings on an Android).  Then you can finally use the app.  After doing all of that (and against my better judgement) I tried this out and found out that it only prints one color at a time, and the ink cartridge they included was yellow.  A yellow which barely shows up on white paper, and looks like a stain from popcorn oil on my skin.  It doesn't show up at all on anything else.  So if they had included a better color I might have been able to tell you how the printouts look, but as it is I can only tell you about the myriad of other flaws and not about the one main thing that I would have liked to be able to tell you about.  I'm now left debating about whether I want to go to the expense of getting a better cartridge or just return this thing now before the poorly designed app is used to hack my phone.  I really wish I hadn't gotten this product.

title: Did not write well
text: I was disappointed in how these wrote. I just didn't feel like they wrote well. They were not smooth and it didn't come out well. The eraser feature is nice and that did work fine. You get a lot and they are relatively reasonable. But I just really did not like to write with them. I tried them as soon as they came here and did not leave them out anywhere, so they shouldn't have been dried out or anything.

title: Terrible, cheap, crap... Try another listing!
text: I had one of these from another seller that looked the same in the picture.  This one is plastic or resin, the coloring doesn't even look like metal.  The base isn't wood either.  It took a lot of force to fit into the base.  And the pen arrived broken and a part is missing so I know it was shipped that way.  Never buying from this seller again!

title: Cheap, But Also Cheap
text: These are cheap to buy, but they are also cheaply made...  I am quite mixed on this one.  I wouldn't give them to kids, they are just too poorly made.

title: Not as good as other Avery products
text: I have used many different Avery labels happily, but these were not quite as good, especially when you consider the cost compared to plain labels. There wasn't a template, which made it far more difficult to print these out. They were not so easy to apply. Yes, they are better than plain paper in durability, but you had a lot of work to do it. You might want to look at the other similar products Avery offers.

title: Not as good as competing products
text: I was a little disappointed in this product, especially considering the retail price. It was a strong tape, but it did not reach the level of Gorilla tape. For this price, I thought it could've done better. The color is very bright. If you are using it as something to mark or see, then it is great, but many would prefer a black tape that is going to fit in somewhere, especially because at this price point you might be using it to fix something where it will stay permanently. It does stick on a lot of different materials, which is a plus.

title: Low Quality Sound And Short Distance
text:
I received this phone for free. As a free phone it is great. By that I mean it hasn't been thrown out. But if I had paid for it I would have returned it. The sound quality is low and the phone doesn't stretch to outside (even just the other side of the concrete wall that it is mounted on). The bluetooth feature is a neat idea, but I don't charge my cell phone in the room I wanted this mounted in so I ended up not using it after the initial testing period. And really I mostly use the phone to call out, not to receive calls, so that's not a necessary feature for me.

Battery life is good! Otherwise I don't recommend these phone for people who use a cordless phone a lot.

title: Didnt fit
text: Didnt fit

title: Not very good quality
text: We were so excited to get our poster, but we were pretty disappointed in how hard it is to scratch off the silver. We tried several objects to take it off and a quarter seemed to work best, but it still doesn't work that well. We do really like the diverse books (for different ages).

title: Great printing technology (Zink), bad user experience.
text:
Polaroid has been around for a long time, but instant photos are just fascinating to me. There's just something about having a keepsake that one can have immediately. It's why photo booths are still so popular.

Zink is a very very nice technology. Doing a little bit of research, it seems to be a thermal technology, yet it can produce high-quality color photos. Not expecting much from a small 2x3 photo paper, I was quite impressed by the quality that was produced.

With that said, there are many Zink printers out there and the PRT 2x3 Mini Portable Bluetooth Photo Printer MT53 is not one of the better ones. The printer itself comes with a 5-pack of photo paper and not much else. Its directions do not point to the correct app to download and there just isn't much instructions overall.

First, take off the top cover by sliding it off, then take the photo paper out of its package. DO NOT throw away the piece of cardboard that is on top of the deck. Place the entire deck, including the paper card, into the printer. Slide the cover back on. Unfortunately, I had a hard time with the top cover as one of its clips just would not slide back in place and I would have a gap. It took me quite a few tries until I was successful in sliding the cover back on. Even now, there is a gap in the cover (see my picture).

Next, turn on the printer. The paper sheet will be fed through and the printer will be initialized. Now download the app. When searching HPRT, many apps show up with no clue as to which one will actually work with the printer. The correct app is "HeyPhoto". HeyPhoto can be used without signing up for an account, which is good. Select the correct printer (MT53) by swiping to the left. Be careful where you swipe because the sliding action only works if you put your finger on the blank spot under the name of the printer. Anywhere else and you'll end up selecting the printer instead of sliding. It's quite frustrating.

From there, it's fairly easy to choose the picture you want and even do some touchup. When ready, tap on the printer to connect and print.

For those who are on Android, you will notice that there is an icon in the notification tray that tells you the HeyPhoto app is still running in the background. Tapping on it takes you to the app info screen where you can force stop the app. This is just bad programming.

So in the end, the printer works and the photos are of better quality than a classic polaroid, but the PRT printer makes the whole experience a pain to deal with.

title: Shady Grey market junk
text:
This does not feel like an old Parker Jotter. Its packaging marks that is clearly made for ONLY the Indian and Nepal market. Quality is not there: ink smears.

JUNK!

title: Stylish, but mediocre quality at best on the rare occasions it is working properly
text:
This printer sucks. It sucks ink, it sucks your time, sucks your productivity, and sucks your will to live. In particular, the scanner feature (which is one I would like to use often) constantly "breaks down". The scanner light comes on when it feels like it. Otherwise, you make repeated attempts to scan and get vertical multicolored lines instead of the page you wanted to see. Calls to HP support are friendly, but time consuming and only sometimes resolve the problem. I bought the extended service plan, but even so am regretting not returning this piece of crap when I had the chance.

If I wanted something stylish, thirsty, and unreliable, I'd get a supercar. At least that would be fun when it worked, and not just a printer.

No more HP for me!

title: Cute case and nice varitity of colors
text: Pros: Cute case and nice varitity of colors! Love the neons and metallic. Cons: I find it unconfortable to color with these since they're a hexagon shape and my fingers start to hurt after a while and they're imposible to sharpen, I used 3 different sharpeners and every time the leads broke off, i ended up with a third size of the neon pink and red pens and I still didn't get them to work! Very disappointing

title: Broke within minutes
text: The outside & pen are cute. But the product itself is not put together very well. My daughter opened to write in it & the seams immediately ripped apart.

title: I mean it was a 1$ lol
text: I understood what it was.. I thought the whole book would be laminated. But it was just the covers. The inside wasn't, just regular blank paper. I got it for my daughter to practice writing on, but now it's just a one time use doodle book. I can see it being useful for a teacher though!

title: Not 5x8!
text: This is not 5x8!

title: Three Stars
text: Not Washable!!! Found this out the hard way!

title: Not Happy
text: I shook it a few times like it said, pressed the tip until the paint came down, started to detail and then everything went wrong. The paint dripped onto the canvas I was working on. I wanted to detail a specific area on my canvas and the paint kept pouring out. Waited for these pen markers and I'm so disappointed, Couldn't continue to use the white one afraid I might ruin what I'm working on now.

title: useless pens
text: Poor quality pens. Might have used each one once before they started running out of ink. What a frustrating waste of money.

title: Pretty, one fell apart in a month
text: I like these, very pretty. I thought the wire would be better than string. They are good, but if I used one pretty heavily and the wire broke in a month. The others are still good.

title: Functional
text: Works for what I need it for, but I expected a much more sturdy product that doesn't catch on every nook and cranny as its pushed or pulled. Still it's better than trying to carry a weeks worth of food in my backpack when I already have problems with my spine.

title: Not The Best
text: The black isn't very dark and the box is confusing. Looks like Epson ink and isn't.  No problems with the printer accepting it.

title: Not Real Burlap
text: For some reason I thought this was the real thing and got it for the texture aspect. It is just a printed product with very little depth.

title: Useless
text: I thought this was going to be a nice addition to my desk. Unfortunately, it doesn't work at all. I tried multiple pads of post it notes and you can't pull any of them out the slot. The top fits too tightly on the pad and if you can get it to move the paper just tears. Trash can here we come.

title: Very Small
text: I needed a journal to store infusing information in, so it is readily available. This arrived and I am disappointed in the size and the cover and the paper.  I have gotten several other journals from here. This is by far the worst quality and presentation. Hopefully I can find something that will write on this paper. There is handmade paper and then there is whatever this is.  Not attractive to hold or use or look at.

title: Very Weird Product
text: This does say "packing material" right? It just came and I had to pack an e Bay order I just had.  I thought I'd give it a spin. Very weird stuff. I have gotten things packed in this and it seemed sturdier. This is thin and when you stretch it out it doesn't stay stretched out. If there is a trick it would be nice to have some guidelines included in the packaging, instead of some way too large Fragile labels with very poor English on them. The real kicker is that none of the tape I normally (Duck Brand packing tape) would stick to this. At all. Nada. Not something I will be using for sure.

title: Don't Fit A Fiskar
text: I don't know what these are designed for, but it isn't a Fiskars trimmer for sure. Too big, too wide, over engineered with a retractable cover.

title: Beware
text: I am not happy at all with this product. I needed a new tape dispenser for my shipping table. My advice is to send it back if you've ordered one. DO NOT TAKE THE PAPER OFF THE STICKY FEET!! This this is now so stuck to my table I cannot even begin to move it without causing some kind of damage to the finish.  Dumbest idea ever for a tape dispenser. Once it's down it can't be moved.

title: Between a Three and a Four
text: Oh the face of it this is a really nice organizer. I loaded it up today on my art drafting table and then realized the short comings. The dividers are a little too tall. Unless you have really long items they are hard to grab and pull out of there. If your bins aren't full and things fall over it's the absolute devil to get them out. It's OK for some things, but not a one size fits all.

title: Disappointing
text: I was hoping to use this for various projects. Unfortunately it doesn't stick to itself. If you have an overlap of tape on top of tape the upper piece just curls up and comes off.

title: Too Hard To Use
text: For heaven's sake. I have used brand name sticky dots for 20 years. Never an issue. These are the hardest things to use ever. Very small. No need whatsoever for the additional piece of paper to peel off the top of each one. It is almost impossible to do. Ridiculous.

title: Crappy Quality
text: I thought these were binders with a real cover. Not so. Just thin, flimsy plastic. Good enough for school, but not for storing anything in.  Crap.

title: Bad Choice
text: These are OK for kids. For some reason I thought they might be larger and able to be used to help seal packages. Lots of tiny stars. Not as many big ones.

title: Misleading Description
text: The pens are magnetic and attach to the board. The board has no magnetic hardware to attach it to anything. Like the fridge...

title: Pretty Poorly Made
text: I have bought a lot of these over the years. Big ones and small ones. By far the most cheaply made ever. The plastic is so thin that it deforms when you look at it. Be very careful putting on the wheels. I actually popped part of the top lose doing that.

title: Flimsy
text: For some reason I was expecting a fully formed metal mesh item. This needs to be assembled and comes folded flat. Not very sturdy and lining up the little screws is hard to put it together. Nice I suppose if you want to store it and then put it together, but of all the items I've gotten like this this is the most poorly made

title: Awful
text: I did a trial with this in my art studio. I have some 4 x 4 canvases that I want to hang. They weigh almost nothing. I used a pea sized piece of this according to the instructions and everything was on the floor this morning. I couldn't get the tacky stuff off the paint or the back of the canvas. What a mess.

title: Interesting
text: Once again I didn't get a clear description of this item. They are full 81/2 x 11 sheet labels. Which to me really isn't a label it's an adhesive piece of paper.  They fed fine in the printer. There is no indication of the front and back and looking at them, you can't tell. I had to peel a corner to figure it out. I won't be using these in the office but will send them to the studio to use as a mask for painting.

title: Jammed My Machine
text: I got one of these to print, but it was a lot lighter than the name brand labels I use. The next one jammed the machine and that was that. I'll find a way to use them somehow, but unfortunately not in the machine as intended.

title: Strong Smell
text: I used this today while I was reviewing some vinyl. I am used to paper transfer paper and I really didn't like this. It worked OK, but I didn't have a very complicated design. I think if you were using this for something with a lot of bits and pieces, it wouldn't work too well. Just didn't seem like it wanted to pick up the vinyl off the backing. And it smells awful.

title: Not Very Sticky
text: This is a nice weight envelope, but the adhesive needs to be better. I sealed an envelope and then opened it right up without damage. Not sure I want to mail anything in these since they can be breached so easily. I have had others like these in the past and the other problem that happens with the adhesive is that it dries out completely if you don't use them fast enough. I have a whole box that won't seal anymore at all without tape.

title: Too Cutesy For An Adult
text: The picture on the front of this is adorable. The planner itself is full of way too cutesy asides and notations to be useful for me. It seems like a quality product with a good binding and a good sturdy cover.  If you need a simple, straightforward date book to be able to write in, this isn't it.

title: Special Staples??
text: This seems like a really nice stapler for a woman. Small enough to fit the hand. It did not come with any staples of a size that fit, so I can't review how hard it was to dispense staples into the project. I tried all the regular sized staples I had in the workshop, but apparently these are a much smaller size.  Would have been nice to include just a few so we could really try this out.

title: It's OK
text: For some reason I  thought this was going to be bigger even though the size is plainly stated. In any event, this is not really a document storage device, but more for a receipt book or job book.  Not big enough for letter sized paper at all. I wanted to try one of these in one of the landscaping trucks for the guys to keep papers in, but they way it is made it would last about 2 weeks even if it were the right size.

title: Difficult To Use
text: Love hate relationship with this. The glider itself is hard to use and the tape doesn't always peel or spool.

title: Kind of Mushy
text: Normally I use Tombow erasers in my art studio every day. This is not one I will use much unless all the others are gone. For some reason it seems to be very soft and jiggly and difficult to control.  Not my favorite eraser for sure.

title: Not 4 x 8
text: These are only 7 inches long. They are 8 inches with the flap that you fold over.

title: Gotta Have It
text: Necessary, expensive evil. Still seems to last longer than HP products.

title: Assembly Nightmare
text:
Oh where to begin with this item. I am conflicted on a lot of levels with this.
Pro's:
Looks nice
Very comfortable seating
Good rollers
Good ability to adjust height

Cons:
The arm pieces that connect the back to the seat are molded plastic. By the time this was assembled they were already scratched and dented.

Difficult to assemble on many levels. Where the arms attached to the back piece 2 screws are used. I could not get them to be tight at all. Even pulled out the drill and an allen bit and still could not get them to go in far enough to contact the chair they way they are supposed to be. Partially inserted screws that stuck out too far had to be attacked with a phillips screw driver.
When trying to screw the arm pieces to the seat to connect the back to the seat, same issues. Screws were very difficult to line up on some of the holes. Best advice I can give you is don't tighten anything until it is all together.

Next problem in assembly was the foot rest ring. There is a spacer in the center that was deformed in my chair. This spacer has to fit down over the pneumatic lifting part of the chair. Impossible to do without a rubber mallet. If that is supposed to be adjustable for height there is no way it moves. Lousy assembly instructions which don't tell you anything verbally.
I'm not what material the base is made of, but it isn't very heavy, so be aware.

Lots of plastic in this chair, but some quality parts as well. As I said, it LOOKS nice and is comfortable, but there are issues to be aware of.

title: Necessary If You Have Chameleons
text: Speedy shipping. Hate that I have to use so many of these. Wish they were a lot more durable. The whole system is a rip off from that standpoint.

title: Attractive and Sturdy With Assembly Issues
text:
I give this chair five stars for looks and comfort and take away five stars for ease of assembly. Very sturdy chair. Attractive and comfortable. It ends there.

Cons:

8 screws in a chair like this should take about 5 minutes to assemble 45 minutes later, one rubber mallet and 2 screw drivers and it is complete. Virtually impossible to assemble for one person. I put together a lot of stuff at my house and this was the pits. The washers are way too big and just get in the way. The bottom goes together fairly well, but putting the back on is tough. The screws are almost not long enough to allow for the padding in the chair. The padding has to be really compressed and then if you are lucky you can find the hole and get things together. There is a plastic cover that is supposed to "snap" over the screws on the back to pretty the whole thing up and cover the screws and washers. There is no snapping this thing on. I had to use a rubber mallet and they will probably still fall off. The manufacturer recommends tightening the screws on the chair every 6 months. Not happening if you have to pry off that cover.

Good color and comfortable as I said, but the assembly of this put me off.

title: Need Better Adhesive
text: I use a lot of these and wish they were better made, but they are affordable. They just need to run the adhesive strip out to the edges better. You will have to tape the ends down on both sides to prevent them getting caught in the postal machines.

title: Way Too Thin
text: I am somewhat disappointed in these index cards. It has been a long time since I purchased any, but I seem to remember them being a whole lot thicker stock than these are. These are almost paper thin, not even as heavy as cheap card stock. Not going to be very useful for my purposes, so i will end up using them as scrap note paper.

title: Odd Idea
text: The coloring craze has gone one too far now. These are well illustrated, black on white for one side and white on black in the reverse. Thin paper that doesn't hold much hope of durability.  Guaranteed to lower production in your office as everyone sits and colors. Not a great idea.

title: Couldn't Get Them To Hold
text: Had to send these back because they didn't work on carpet as advertised.

title: Not The Best Markers For Art
text: These are by no means artist quality markers. They are streaky, dry and not blendable even though they are water based. I suppose they would be fine for coloring books in detail areas. If you have to try to fill a larger area, the point isn't really big enough and they streak very badly. Some of the markers are kind of dry on the first use. The colors are nice enough, but the other faults of these markers make them something I wouldn't spend money on.

title: Not Thin
text: Very disappointed in this pen. It is nowhere close to the size they say it is. In Micron pen terms it's the equivalent of a 2.0. Not even close to a .10. The only good thing I can say is it's refillable, but with the size I won't ever be able to use it, so that doesn't matter a bit.

title: Looks Better In The Picture
text: I have to say I am really glad I didn't have to pay for this item. It is way overpriced for compressed board furniture. It does have some weight to it. The handles and the casters are above average quality. Putting the casters and handles on was easy as far as things like this go. The drawers seem to not quite close properly. I was hoping to use this in my office to decompress the filing drawer in my desk, but frankly it isn't that eye catching. It looked a lot nicer in the picture than the actual reality.

title: Pretty Much A Waste
text: Very difficult to use. The tape moves around all over the rollers and comes off. God forbid you should tear the tape because that is a whole other problem that is hard to fix. Very disappointed at more wasted money on adhesive rollers.

title: Upgraded Staple Gun
text: As a female DIYer I have fought with staple guns of all manner over the many years. This one is quite an improvement in the ease of which I can be loaded. The staple compartment is accessible and easier to load. Instead of pushing the staples along the feeder mechanism, you turn this one upside down and load them from the bottom. The tension can be controlled by the plus or minus lever and all the staples I shot into a pine board were flush. No need to go behind and pound them in. Even with my age and limited hand strength I was able to squeeze the handle to use this. I gave 4 stars originally, but took one off for quality. By the time I had loaded the staples the rubber side inserts were already lose and falling off. They actually are not even pictured here in what I am seeing. Since they are not a functional part of the gun, I think this will still be fine.

title: Very Small
text: One of these days I'm going to read the dimensions on these things. This one is quite small. Lots of plastic, but it seems fairly sturdy.  The long compartment on this is barely 8 inches long, so keep that in mind. This will work for small things and I will use it in my studio for bits and bobs. I can barely get my fingers in the 4 smaller compartments to pick things up.

title: No Comb Samples Included
text:
This probably isn't fair, but the one star review is because this machine comes with ZERO binding combs, so it is impossible to review it's functionality fully. The instructions are fairly clear and it punches out the holes well. Since there are no sample combs included I can't say how well it actually binds the pages together. No where in the fine print does it say that you need to get the combs as a separate entity. Having never used one of these before I didn't realize that. As soon as I get some shipped here to the hinterlands, I will post an update.

UPDATE: Still a one star rating based on instructions as well as no combs. I ordered combs, which came yesterday. I just spent some of the most frustrating moments of my life trying to use this thing. Be wary also that the points of the comb separater thing are very sharp.

title: Room For Upgrades
text:
I've had a love/hate relationship with Xyron for many years. They make a useful product that is not quite as good as it could be. This is yet another one of those items. I currently own every size of Xyron except a 9 inch. The reason I got this one was because you can use the 5 inch in it as well. Hoping that I could maybe eliminate just one of the bulky little buggers from my workspace.

This comes with a 9 inch cartridge, but no 5 inch, so to test it out, I had to pull one out of another machine. Making the switch is easy and after seeing how they did it, I think they could easily make this one machine fit all the sizes, or at least all but the very smallest size.

They have finally solved one of my biggest gripes, which was the waste factor. This cuts a lot closer to the edge that the older varieties. The sliding cutter is a little tight and kind of binds up, but after a few cuts it seems to get better.

title: Bad News
text: This pen was a huge disappointment. First off the shipping from Japan took weeks. Close to a month. When it finally arrived, the instructions are in pictures. Trying to decipher them to insert the ink cartridge seemed straightforward, but after several attempts the pen still wouldn't write. Then the writing nib bent and broke and that was that. Never did get it to function at all. Huge waste of time and money. Hope I get the refund I requested because this was a 40.00 mistake.

title: Expensive As Always
text: A necessary evil for printers as we all know. HP has consistent quality and performance. Would sure like it if they could price themselves better.

title: Not Great
text: These are OK, but the flaps don't stick worth a darn and don't have any glue up at the corners. If the corners aren't secure on your envelopes that is the first and biggest reason that mail gets caught in the cancelling machines. Have to tape each corner even after you seal the flap.

title: Light on Glue
text: These envelopes just came and I am not thrilled with them. I was hoping they would be better than the ones I've been paying big bucks for from Staples. I guess once again you get what you pay for. I send at least 50 pieces of mail a week trading ATCs with other artists and I use a lot of envelopes. The biggest failure of the post office is an envelope that isn't stuck shut at the top corners because it catches in the machines and rips open. These envelopes only have glue about partway up the flap so I will have to use a lot of tape to get these shut securely. Bummer.

title: Lovve/ Hate Thing
text: For many years I have had a love hate relationship with Xyron. It's a good product, wildly overpriced and somewhat wasteful. My biggest gripe is that they still, after all these years can't figure out, or more likely won't put a warning strip close the end of the roll. I have ruined countless pieces of artwork by running out halfway through a piece. I've written, but no one cares.

title: Huge Rip Off!!!
text: These little guys, and I stress little, are the biggest rip off I've been a part of here on Amazon. What you can't tell from looking at the picture is that these are very thin and that the clip isn't even attached permanently to the board. For what these cost with shipping, I could have made about 2 dozen with binder clips from the office supply store. HUGE RIP OFF!!

title: OK
text: These are OK envelopes, better then some, so as good as others. Necessary fo mailing overseas even though we don't have Air Mail any longer. They are good for drawing attention to International Mail.

title: Oh Well...
text:
This printer was a replacement for another HP model that I got that had to be sent back for faulty parts. I've never had anything but HP printers since they first existed. Never had a problem with a one until now. This thing is hinky in way too many ways to count.
Firstly if it is shut off the computer doesn't find it again when you turn it back on and the whole thing has to be reinstalled.
Secondly it won't configure for printing envelopes in my Stamps.com account. No how, no way.
Thirdly when it does print, it shakes the desk so badly that the cat can't decide whether to attack it or run for the hills.
I will have to reconsider HP products in the future for sure. Does anyone else remember when you bought something new and it actually worked right out of the box?? Guess I'm telling my age. :))

title: I like the product
text: Not as strong as expected.  Fairly easy to remove.

title: Ok
text: Ok

title: Confusing
text: Confusing

title: Tape for labeler
text: Not user friendly

title: Expensive binder! Very cute!
text: Very cool binder,not quite what I wanted! I wanted this for organization of school work,homework,assignments,but unfortunately it is very small and does not hold much! I think my son will have it broke within the first week of school! I think it is an adorable one inch binder,but if your looking for something for organization,this is way to small and not very durable.

title: Very expensive binder! Very cute though!
text: This is a great folder! Very cute,but not exactly what I was looking for! Not very much room,just enough for a few holders! I love my daughter loves it! She thinks it is absolutely adorable! I would compare it to a one inch binder with a clasp that shuts! I think it is definitely a cute expensive binder. I would personally not buy again! I wanted it for organization of homework and assignments. I wouldn't recommend this item.

title: Very thin paper
text: This is very thin paper!! There is no way to hang it unless you make one. I like that there is a lot of room to write stuff, it is not what I wanted. If you write on it it goes through to the next page! If it was thicker I would have been happy!

title: Coukd get it to work
text: Had to return the two of these I bought. After several attempts to add my fingerprint to it.

title: Not super durable.
text: Zipper breaks really easily but is a super cute pouch.

title: Letters dont spell Happy Birthday....
text: A really nice banner... all except the fact they apparently cant spell birthday. Instead of R they gave me another P- HAPPY BIPTHDAY....

title: Not purple
text: Four out of five were pink and the last was a lighter shade of purple. More than a bit irritating

title: Board is warped, magnets are weak
text: So, my board was bowed/warped so bad half of the chore magnets barely stay on. I tried placing it under heavy books to flatten it out to no avail. It's still somewhat useable, but I find myself picking the chore magnets up off the floor more often than I care to. Even the stars on the flatter portion of the board slide around. They must've used the absolute least amount of magnet material possible to even refer to it as a magnet board.

title: It's ok...
text: So, I installed this on my corner desk. It really doesn't extend far enough to go past the desk, so I have to have my chair lower in order to type on it. Also, it's not really big enough for a keyboard and mouse. I kind of knew that from other reviews, but I guess I would like to reiterate that as well. It tilts easily enough, but sliding it in and out is kind of rough.

title: Just OK - Missing Rooms - But Stays Affixed
text:
We recently completed an 800 mile move. I’m not sure there are many ways to make moving less painful. When I saw these stickers I hoped they would help but we found even with the stickers we still had to write on the boxes.

Several common rooms are not included in this set - garage, attic, shop.

Unlike another set I tested these stickers stay affixed very well. You won’t have any issue with these falling off. The Fragile stickers are definitely important and come in really handy when having movers assist in transport.

This is a decent set of stickers that, while not perfect, is better than others.

title: Decent Set of Wrist Rests
text:
I was really looking forward to reviewing this set primarily for the arm rest as I have other wrist supports.

All three products are well made and work exactly as described.

What I found is the arm rest when attached to my desk surface lifted my shoulder to an unnatural position and over the course of the day actually caused pain.

I thought i might just have to adjust my seats height and that would resolve the issue but unfortunately it did not. Unfortunately I found the arm rest did not work for me.

While the set is well made the arm rest needs some way to adjust the height so it is not level with the mouse pad’s surface. If I could have lowered it by .5”-1” I believe it would have worked great.

title: Color is pretty faded
text: I bought this mousepad for my daughter who is doing online school this year and therefor on her computer a lot. The wrist rest is very soft and comfortable but I'm taking off two stars because the color is really faded, which was a big disappointment.

title: Disappointed
text: I'm super disappointed and I really wanted to love this planner but it's kind of silly that I have to buy (at least) two a year.. who wants to carry around two planners to plan their year out? For the money this planner is totally not worth it... :(

title: Super bad quality, Don't waste time!!!!!!!!
text: It was so cheap and so easy to tear off, stay away from this product. I am going to return it.

title: Very cheap, poor quality
text:
It was cheap made and like a paper.
I believe it is even worse than 99 store. And, they are not allowed to return.
BEWARE OF THIS SELLER!!!!!!!!!!!

title: They ARE NOT normal size......
text:
Edited: they dont stick worth af. My info/note fell off back tv within couple of days.

Is this a joke? They are micro size.. you would think it was be regular post it notes.. NOPE, they itty bitty. I would return but it's not worth the hassle over 7$...
If micro size is what u want, it's a great case and good product and I wouldve been happy AF is it was normal post its.

title: Paper quality is horrible
text: They are really light, not good to use with kids. The break easily

title: Not the best
text: The pen goes through multiple pages, they are not reinforced.

title: Average gift for the price
text: This is an average gift set, everything is smaller than you expect. These mugs are tiny for being premium Starbucks mugs, the mugs in store are much larger. The coffee bag is small as well. I would say this gift set is worth more in the $15 range. I do like that it comes pre wrapped and takes the hassle out of finding a gift and wrapping it!

title: You might as well throw $50 in the trash.  Do you not buy false advertising
text:
Do you not buy false advertising.

In the description of this item it claims to fit an envy photo 7855 it clearly does not. I just threw $50.00 out the window.

title: Useless
text: This item is useless it is too thick and will not go under the staples.

title: Good chocolate, ok calendar
text: Chocolate was tasty, but all the pieces had fallen out of place when it arrived.

title: Good cheap option for landline
text: It’s a landline phone that has a shrill ring, echoes a bit, but had a very good caller ID display and is easy to use. Overall a good heap option for a landline if you don’t mind the slightly tinny sound in the line or the ring that can wake the dead

title: Decent record keeper for 6th graders
text: Not too much ability to scrapbook but asks cute questions for the 6th grader to fill in them self. Some photo pages in the back and places to put things in pockets. Not too bad, could have been bigger pages with scrap ability, but otherwise cute

title: Don't do it. Just don't.
text:
I am begging you: Don't buy this printer. Don't do it. The price will tempt you as it tempted me. I've lived with my canon printer for 2 years now and it is truly terrible. The worst part is honestly the ink. I NEVER get more than 60 pages per ink cartridge. That is a really low yield when the black cartridges cost $17-20 each. That means for a $17 cartridge, i'm paying almost 30 cents per page printed. So this "inexpensive" printer WILL COST YOU when it comes to ink.

Let me also add that i've never printed photos until last week. What a racket. It won't let you print on 8.5x11 photo paper. You can ONLY print onto 5x7 or 4x6 photo paper. Well, okay. That's annoying but i'll play your game printer. So when I used a NICE piece of glossy photo paper and I made sure all the settings were correct, I printed a photo and it looked awful. I expected it to at least look decent. But no. It looked like garbage.

I am seriously a cheap person and I will never buy a canon printer ever again. I've learned my lesson. Sometimes cheap is just CHEAP. I'm going back to HP. I got a free printer from HP with my laptop back in college and it lasted me 10 years before it finally died. I can probably recall every time I bought ink for that thing. It was a crazy work horse. This canon printer? I know i've bought ink at least a dozen times. Do yourself a favor and get something better. You will kick yourself for having wasted your time and money on this printer.

title: Warning get your own wingnuts!!!!
text: Easy to use great height. If you buy this get new hardware the wingnuts are very cheap and strip out as soon as you put them on and then the whole thing wobbles.  The instructions could have been way better written. It is a good product besides the hardware.

title: not perfect
text: Three of these pens actually work without an issue. They would be nice pens if they were not dried out, but many of them did not work even after scribbling with them for quite a while. Nice idea, but poorly executed. I Will not be purchasing again.

title: Not terrible, but not great
text:
These highlighters have some nice colours that aren't as shockingly bright as some of the other highlighters, which is good if you are working with very bright-white paper. Reduces the eye-strain. There are some interesting colours in this pack that set them apart from the standard fare, and they cap and uncap easily enough. My only issue with these is that some of them do not seem to have as much ink in them as others do, and one arrived so dry that I had to try and revive it with water--it is still a bit wonky. Perhaps this is just the pack that I got.

For the price, I expected to get a set that was not flawed, but, I didn't figure it would be worth sending them back over one, single pen. The others in the pack are mostly okay.

title: It wasn't as good as I had hoped
text:
When I bought this, I had read many of the reviews and the entire description and it seemed like a good solution for my needs. One of the selling points for me was that you could use any paper with it and didn't have to buy anything special to go with it. Immediately though upon opening it and reading the pamphlets that come with it, you find out this isn't true. They recommend that you use the special paper their company makes or the device may not work as well as it would otherwise.

That was only problem number one. The app you have to use with it is the only way to make changes and it is a pain to get the documents to go where you want them to go. Sometimes the app wouldn't connect at all and the blue tooth refused to even try to connect. The battery life is not nearly as good as advertised and I was only able to find a mobile app to use, not a pc app, which makes it hard to edit the document, since everything is so small.

The text conversion is a nightmare. You would pretty much have to write all in block letters for it to understand what you wrote, being extremely careful of the pressure you are putting on the pen in order for it to recognise what you have written. Truly, it was worth a laugh, but not much else. I bought this in order to save time, but it ended up just wasting time instead. It was a good idea in theory, but not so much in practise. I was glad Amazon allowed me to return it.

title: Not quite 50...
text: Sooo...hmmm. There are actually only 47 cards in this package...not 50, so that is kind of odd. The paper is wonderful, but the envelopes leave something to be desired, being either way too large or just barely big enough to fit the cards themselves. I like the canvas style on the paper, but these would not work well if you need a guaranteed exact amount of them. As far as inexpensive note cards, they work okay.

title: it works when it feels like it
text: I think this is a great idea, but I would say this is more of a beta product. The tape doesn't always come out cleanly and easily like it is supposed to. I have actually popped the thing apart on accident because the tape got stuck. I do have to say, if this worked right it would be genius. Maybe later models will be better. I wouldn't recommend this exact one.

title: I miss my old printer
text:
I had a Canon printer previously to purchasing this one that I loved. I "upgraded" (I use this word lightly) to this printer because I wanted the other functions and the old printer was just a printer. The first time I went to use this printer, the first sheet of paper it tried to pull through jammed and stopped the process. The second piece of paper did the same thing. Finally on the third try the printer actually printed, if that is what you want to call it. I tried to print the words "Let's see if this works." What I got was an ink blot that looked like one of those pictures the psychiatrist would hold up in front of their patient. Turns out, the cartridge that came with the printer had been leaking for a while. I got to spend and hour cleaning it out after that. fun.

The most I can say for this printer is that, although temperamental, it does actually print nicely when everything is working correctly. It does tend to jam up on occasion and you can't put too many sheets of paper in at once or it will try to pull multiple sheets through at the same time. The XL cartridges are what I have been using and I don't find that they are too expensive. I have not tried to refill these cartridges with a kit yet, so I don't know how that would go. I am not thrilled with it, but it's okay. Just okay.

title: Days of the week are different, be careful!

title: Not good enough.

The shaving basket is easy to access and fits snug onto sharpener. Sharpener is heavy so it doesn’t slip around.

title: This is NOT easy to set up
text:
Unless you are a computer tech guru, this printer is not easy to set up... I've been trying to set it up for 2 hours now and still no go. My computer has no CD/CDR so I had to download the driver from the website. I have NEVER had a problem downloading drivers for printers--until now. There are no instructions as to which driver to download. You have a choice of 100mb or hpb30mb ?????

I downloaded both and hoped the printer would choose the correct one. NOT. So I hooked up my computer to the printer with a printer cable. Yea! They recognized each other, but it won't print because there is a problem with the network setup. I don't have a network except for the wifi,the computer, the printer. How hard could this be? Apparently, it's too hard for me to fathom.

Even if you think you know what you are doing, get someone who really does know and get them to hook your printer up. This is frustrating beyond belief.

Most of the products I get from the Vine Program are top notch, and I give very favorable reviews. I'm sorry that I cannot do this for this one.

title: Ok magnet, terrible adhesion
text:
The good: The magnets work, you know... magnetically. They can stick to metal like your fridge, and you can use several of them for heavier items if needed. Pretty simple.

The bad: While the magnet part sticks, the sticky adhesive back part is awful. The adhesive barely holds on to anything heavier than a paper. If you want to hold up a small dry erase board, for example, you can use as many magnets as you want, and the board will fall after a day or so. The magnets still on the fridge, just the board on the floor. They won't stay on. I even have a small light plastic name tag that fell down.

The package itself, in fact, came with almost half the magnets off the backing paper and just floating around the the bag. I was going to ignore it as a fluke of shipping, but I see that other reviews are complaining of the same thing. And now that I've seen it fall off of things with my own eyes that aren't that heavy, I can attest to the fact that the adhesive side is utter trash. Its the product that is faulty.

I was able to get around this by using super glue to attach the tiles to my whiteboard and plastic tag and it has been fine ever since. So you CAN make use of these by using your own glue/adhesive, but sadly I can't recommend them knowing you can buy similar products that will work out of the package. If you get this very very inexpensively, you can "fix it" using glue like I did. Hence 2 stars. Otherwise, I'd recommend looking elsewhere.

title: Cute but the side decorations are odd... Where is mum on Friday night?!
text:
I like the idea behind this planner, especially as my family is quarantined together currently due to the Coronavirus and we are trying to keep everyone to a schedule to stay sane. It's a nice large size and easy for everyone to read and write on.
It works well for organizing and planning and the kids are really into it, but the design is a little bit... odd. Around the border it has decoratory messages like "Who is taking me to school" and "What will dad do on Sunday morning?" and my personal favorite "Where is mum on Friday night?". Seriously, what kind of specific and possibly chauvinistic questions are they trying to imply on this thing? Also, as an American, no one I know calls their mother "mum". This is one of those situations in which less is more, I think. They should have left the border blank, this feels odd and strangely out of place in our home, it makes me wonder who this was really designed for. The description says great for a family or student house, etc... what student house wants to know what mum is doing on Friday night, and then why have a spot that says "the _ family" on top? I have so many questions about the motivation behind this thing. I think I'll be replacing this with a more vanilla and less bizarre planner when I get a chance.

text:

title: Purchased from Metronic International
text:
Purchased from Metronic International.
1) the width of tape strip is about half of the size pictured (about as thick as a pencil). On the first bag tested, I was able to reopen it about 80% of the way, before the sticky part ripped the other side of the bag. I'm concerned about using them already.

2) The 1000 bags came loose in a priority sized box. Not lumped into groups of 50 or a 100 like other sellers sent them in the past. The box also arrived ripped down the side because of the weight of the bags. I have no way of knowing if I got a thousand 'unless I want to waste an hour counting them (which I'm not gonna do). In addition, loose bags are a pain the butt to store away. I'll have to keep them in the box they came in and hope none of the strips come loose and they don't get tangled up in each other. We're short on space here, so being able to store the bags elsewhere would have been nice.

title: Completely inaccurate when measuring small packages that weight only a few ounces
text:
Absolutely terrible for small packages!
I resell on ebay and the majority of my packages are very small.... weighting between 1oz and 8oz.
I've tested this exact model THREE different times. Yes, three!, My mom also bought herself one and my sister one for Xmas based on the reviews.
Depending on where the package is set on the tray, I can get a reading difference of up to .5 ounces off!! And I'm not talking that far left of the tray vs the center of the tray. Even dead center verses half an inch to any side will result in a different reading.
Sometimes my profit margins are small on the auctions, and I can't afford to "guess" or "round up" on every package. I'd loose a ton of money. I recently figured out that after "rounded up about 25% of the time (because I didn't trust this scale), I was probably giving the post office another $20 a month . Completely inexcusable.
Oh, and the battery cover has fallen off of all three of ours already!!!!!!!!!

title: Pro-Packaging not recommended for small things
text:
Ordered from Pro- Packaging and ended up using twice much as I have in the past!!! I know it sounds weird, but there is just to much space between the bubbles and/or the bubbles are slightly too small.
I sell small figurines on Ebay and I like to wrap them until I can't feel them through. One, sometimes two layers is more than enough. Ended up doing three or four layers with the Pro-Packaging B.W.. And it is VERY smooth and slippery. Neither name brand Scotch tape, nor generic tape would stick well to it. Three or four layers meant I had to use bigger bags, which also cost more. And then of course there was my time I had to spend wrapping each twice as much. Urgh.
So why two stars? Well I sold a few square boxed games on the side. It only took two layers on those. And I used the box tape (not scotch tape). So if you're using a stronger tape and only have larger square boxes, this would work for you.

title: Flimsy, cheaply made lockable container
text:
I am a real estate agent and I use combination lockboxes to safely store keys for contractors to have access to do repairs in my clients' homes when they are vacant.
I have tried several brands of combination lockboxes and thought I would check out this 'Rudy' one.
Sadly it is just so cheaply made - thin steel case, short U shank and flimsy locking mechanism.
A sharp tap with a light hammer would break it.
The door doesn't even fit tightly into the case - a 7 year old kid with a penknife could open this in a heartbeat.

I recommend you spend a few extra dollars and get a decent combination lockbox, this is just a cheap lockable container.

title: Jammed on first use -very cheaply made

title: Hard to read and not very durable

title: Nicely packaged and looks pretty .....but useless
text:
It is easy to purchase dozens of different makes of Pens with a Capacitive stylus from the very cheap to the very expensive, but when you search for a Mechanical Pencil with Capacitive stylus the choices are extremely limited.
This one from Griffiti looked promising and despite a couple of negative and rather luke-warm reviews I decided to purchase from Amazon.
It took all of 2 minutes to realize that this was not the pencil/stylus for me!
The lead wobbles excessively in the barrel when you are writing and moves up and down, breaking constantly.
There is no tube to support it so no wonder.
The stylus is very unresponsive and is painful to use on my iPhone 6 and iPad devices - you are better off using a finger.
The packaging is great and it looks pretty - so 2 stars.
Sent it back to Amazon.

title: Good Scanner, Mediocre Sofware and Terrible Document Feeder
text:
The title of the review says it all - the quality of scanning is good, the software supplied is mediocre, however the ADF is absolutely terrible. I lose pages, even in a 5 page stack - it is especially worse with 'fresh' office printouts of say 20-28 lbs that have only been printed and not read. Fanning your documents is essential, and even that doesn't help a lot of the time.
Forget about using the ADF for just one page - it doen't happen! And sadly, scanning 20 + sheets is extremely unreliable with miss feeds and jams.
The pages are always skewed or just don't even feed.
Flatbed scanning, especially with photographs is great - no ghosting, accurate color and good, even illumination.
My main use is for a medium duty document feeding scanner, and this just is not good enough.
This is suitable for home use only, definitely not for professional use.
So after a year of frustration, I just took delivery of an Epson GT-S50 as I thought the vertical and straight paper path would help with jams and double paper picking that I always get with the Epson GT 1500.
BUT that is for another review - YIKES!

title: Do not recommend. Do not buy
text:
Disappointing. The desk top only screws on at 3 points so one corner is wobbly. The section/corner where the two desks come together is not at the same level and there is a gap at one point and not level with the L part of the other desk. The x's in the pic represents where the top screw down. Too much of a pain in the butt to return.

I would not recommend. For this price you can get way better.

I have an HP wireless that was easy to set up but this could not be done... even the IT guy couldn't do it.  It was Soooo slow.  Also, whenever it prints it has a box on the bottom of your screen showing that it's printing, I guess it is so proud of itself for being able to do something.  You cannot minimize the box so you have to work with it there - very annoying.  Prints color when you specifically set it for black and white.  Piece of junk!!!

title: A moſt joyleſs fate
text: Oft I haue dreamt of ſuch an inſtrumente wiþ which to adorn my faire maidenhood. As ſoon as I ſaw þeſe moſt curious trinkets, þe need to poſseſs ſuch a beautiful inſtrumente was moſt preſsing. I beſought Faþer ſome coin for which to buy bread at þe market, and tarried not as I went þiþer and purchaſed þeſe wares inſtead, þinking myſelf a cleuer imppe. As I attempted to make þem of vſe, I ſaw þat my hands were vncomely for a gentle and noble woman and I wept in deſpaire wiþ þe knowledge þat I would neuer know þe loue of a kind and noble lord or knight wiþ loaþſsome hands ſuch as þeſe. I was beſet wiþ woe and ſorrow and erewhile I am but a lowly ſeruent wench in an ale houſe, curſed ſtill by þe gods, who haue ſeen fitte to liken my fingers to þe gnarled branchs of a wizened tree. I have ſiþence returned þe "BIC Criſtal For Her Balle Pennes" and ſuffered my joyleſs fate. Perchance a more ſightly lady of grace will find þeſe to her likeing.
