title: You get what you pay for.
text:
I bought this wallet because my puppy chewed through my old one, so I was looking for a relatively inexpensive purchase in case my still teething puppy decided to eat another wallet when I wasn't looking. I have had this wallet for over a year, and I have to say that for the price it is exactly that I was expecting, I mean you aren't paying a whole lot so you can't expect it to be the best product out there.

My biggest complaint with the wallet is that once I put items in it, it no longer snaps closed. I don't carry cash or coins, so the back portion of the wallet isn't used at all. All I have are my license and ID, and a couple of credit cards, the wallet is not full by any means, there are open slots for more cards in my wallet. But even with it not being full I still can't get the wallet to snap closed. After about a year of used the seams have also started to fray, especially on the outside, so it doesn't look very nice anymore. It's definitely time for me to upgrade.

But if you are looking for a cheap wallet, like maybe you are going on vacation and want something you won't worry about losing or you are like me and have puppies who chew, this would be a great wallet to get you through, while not putting a dent in your bank account if something happens to it.

title: Any suggestions for another brand
text: HP makes terrible printers in the photosmart line.  They DO print beautifully, IF you can get it to print.  It loses the link, you can't keep it on wireless, the paper perpetually jams and it won't even spool print anything over 1 meg, which is most of my CAD rendering.  I would really appreciate anyone giving me a suggestion on what brand of printer is dependable.  The nature of my work demands a dependable printer and HP IS NOT IT!

title: Run..as fast as you can, away from HP printers
text: Unless you can get an old one such as the 1600 series, stay far away from their Photosmart series.  You will be spending most of your time: sending it in, waiting for prints that never print, photo paper won't go thru the printer, and constant lock ups where you can't get items out of the spooler, even if you go to temp files and delete them.  The ink is super expensive.  BUT!!!  If and when you are fortunate enough and it happens to work when it feels like it, the photos are lovely... if it works.  Will never buy ANY HP product after the disaster of this one.  And 3 other people I know had bought the same one, they have since gone on to other brands.  So far, I just use my old HPPCS1600 and well, I use my Photosmart when I want to frustrate myself.

title: Don’t waste your money
text: I bought these to do sketching with. I got them yesterday and the blue that I have been using is already empty due to it breaking in small sections inside the pencil. There is only one piece of lead in them. Just not worth it.

title: These are NOT artist quality colored pencils.
text: I got these pencils yesterday and was so very excited about them. I owned a small set years back and loved them. These however are definitely not the professional grade they used to be. I destroyed half of them just trying to sharpen them. Bring a colored pencil artist I am very aware of the delicacy of sharpening colored pencils. If you look at the pics...the leads inside most of the pencils are already broken from the factory. I am beyond disappointed not only in my purchase, but to see that Prismacolor is putting their name on such a horrible product. I will never purchase their verithin pencils again. I feel I could get equal quality at the dollar store. Possibly better...So sad! Even some of the leads are not centered in the wood! WTF! Definitely need to take off "Artist Quality" from their packaging.

title: Buyer Beware!
text: Possibly the worst piece of electronics I've ever purchased!  From day one, nothing but headaches with this printer.  Just turn it on and it displays "unable to scan, copy, or fax".  When I do get it to scan, the image is doubled.  Trying to copy, it displays the UNABLE message.  I've had 3 other people look into this with the same results.  HP wont send a replacement or refund, and my return window with Amazon has closed.  So I'm out over $200 and I still can't get my work finished.  Buyer Beware!

title: Not User Friendly!
text: Too many little screws. Not user friendly for beginners.

title: Drawers Stick!
text: Although it was easy to assemble, the drawers closer toward the bottom doesn’t close without a struggle.

title: Just pretty
text: Pens are beautiful that's all, the point would not come out to write.

title: Didn't last a week and they run out
text: Great colors and vibrant pens, erase very well, but they run our after a week.  Really. That stinks.  Going back.....

title: 1/2 are unusable, poor quality and too light.  Other 1/2 are great
text: Half of  markers are so light you cannot even see on a white or glass whiteboard from a few feet away.  I. Wondering if I received a bad batch.  . It was interesting half of the colours were dark and quality, the others were wimpy and light.  I attempted to return.  It was a no go, sorry Charlie........

title: Not good paper quality. For a monthly calendar
text: Love the idea, not happy with the quality of the paper, it’s too flimsy for a calendar that you flip back-and-forth through each and every day. It also didn’t have any pages in between the calendar months. That would’ve been super helpful

title: It’s going back
text: It looked cuter online than it does in purpose, very bland but I guess if you think it’s cute. I will be returning mine

title: Not worth the price
text: Super expensive and just flash cards.

title: Smearing shows decline in quality
text:
Purchasing art pens and markers is something of a regular occurrence for me and PIGMA is a brand I trust for what I expect the Sakura pens to do. I use these from writing on photos because they are non smearing and archival, I use them for art projects, and I use them to label gifts I've made.

My expectations are that they do not smear as all of the PIGMA Sakura Micron pens I have used have never smeared even when coming into contact with moisture.

In the photos, I wrote on a yellow post it and on a piece of paper I use for my art work. Neither type of paper has allowed the PIGMA Micron pens to smear prior to this set. The photo I first wrote on to include in a Christmas card smeared badly, as you can see.

The smaller pens might dry quickly because the nib is smaller, so there's less ink, however each size pen had some smearing.

This is disappointing because I count on these pens for work and for hobbies, but it's obvious the quality of this ink has declined over the last few years.

Bought these to label photos for Christmas cards and now I'm researching pens when I thought I found my go to pens years ago.

title: Nice but very high
text: Nice but too high.

title: To bulky
text: This did not meet up to my expectations. Its to heavy and bulky and hard to recline where its easier to get on laptop. Its hard once you sit down to get off you so you can get up.

title: Its ok
text: It is really ok

title: Good but thin
text: I bought these to store my weed in, i dont like the bulky containers the medical stuff comes in. These arent to bad especially for the price. You can store a good amount of weed in there to. I like the fact they are small and pretty much smell proof, the only thing bad is they are kind of thin were the cap is screwed on. Already had a couple of them crack on me. Other than that they're pretty decent.

title: Would not buy if I knew it was like this. Spend a few bucks more and get ...
text: For the money it serves its purpose, they left out a  part when they sent it.  To much of a hassle to package everything up and send back, so i kept it and just deal with it. It is a little flimsy but functional. Would not buy if I knew it was like this. Spend a few bucks more and get something more sturdier.

title: Unstable and Frustrating
text:
The material is light, but NOT STRONG. Unstable on any surface except a hard surface like a desk or table. They show people using it on the couch or bed... no. It will not work without tipping over in just about any configuration.

Adjusting it is a NIGHTMARE. There are so many knobs and joints that getting it in the right position takes forever, and changing positions on the fly is not an option.

It has been totally worth it to return this and buy a slightly higher priced version to work from home.

IF you are looking for laptop stand to put in one position on your desk/table to use as a standing desk, this will be ok. Otherwise, don't bother. Pay a little more for something that will make your life much easier.

title: They do not stick!
text: Cute, but needs to work on adhesion…

title: Comfortable and doesn’t tip when leaning over
text: Nice chair well built, but the cylinder does not stay up. Really disappointed. I thought with buying a chair that holds more weight would of had a better cylinder on it.

title: That it does not write any better than any other pen.
text: It did not write very dark. I thought it would write heavier. I couldn't tell what color the ink was. Disappointed. Would not buy again.

title: Messy
text: So wet to gets on your hands

title: Look at it very carefully. It wasn't what I expected.
text: I liked the size. But when I got it it was not what I expected. I was disappointed.

title: Check the product when it comes in.
text: The plastic box the vinyl is actually put into by the company was torn like it had been previously opened. Not just opened but the plastic was actually ripped. The other Vinyl packaging was fine. Even though the vinyl seems to be in good condition I’m not sure why they sent a used product when I paid for a new one.

title: NOT STURDY
text: It's all made out of lightweight plastic, which I knew that before buying based on reviews. But gave it a shot anyway. I got this for reading my thick books in bed and it doesn't hold them, it flops over. Maybe on a hard surface it could work but I need this to be sturdy for reading on a mattress. Also it's very small maybe good for a small tablet and not huge school books like mines. Returning.

title: One Star
text: Wheels and drawers break way too easily! Waste of money!

title: Duck EZ Start is Better
text: I always use Duck brand tape, but have not bought this type before. The EZ start type is quieter, thicker, adheres better and worth the extra money. Regretting I bought so many rolls of this kind.

title: but the constant error is annoying.
text: These cartridges make my Brother printer show an error at all times, and not recognize the ink level. It will print with them in it, but the constant error is annoying.

title: Not Greeting Cards, Not Folded
text: As the description says greeting cards, and the answer to the one question says they're folded, that's what I was expecting. They are postcards, not folded. Will return.

title: Not Metallic At All
text: The colors are very deep and flow beautifully. For the price I expected accuracy in advertisement, but the ink is not at all metallic. Very disappointed that I spent so much on these. I’ll see if I can use them as watercolor application but I bought them because I wanted metallic and they are not.

title: Paper Stop Bent and Crooked
text: When I removed the table top from the box, the paper stop was attached but it was bent and crooked. This led me to believe that the product was poor quality. So I'm returning it.

title: Did not come with laptop stopper
text: There was no laptop stopper included. The sticker on the table says "insert A laptop stopper here" so maybe they don't include them anymore, in which case the advertisement should be changed. This is a big table. The depth just about works if I'm sitting traditionally on the couch, because I'm quite thin. Otherwise, it's more suitable for sitting with your back on the armrest of the couch, which is not conducive to orthopedic health. The table doesn't tilt to a high enough angle for my needs. 36 degrees isn't much of an angle. I think it's quite heavy. It's reasonably sturdy, but awkward to adjust both the legs up and down at the same time. The deal breaker for me is the lack of laptop stopper, so back it will go. So close.

title: Very sharp edges
text: It wasn’t bad to put together. The bar on the bottom is not a good design. Paper will not slide over it easily. It’s okay for my purposes because the size of paper overlaps the rim anyway. The BIG problem is the very sharp edges all over it from poorly finished metal mesh. Check your tetanus shot.

title: Complete Junk
text: I managed to write exactly one Christmas card before the first one ran dry. Then I managed a second card before the second one ran dry. The yellow one wouldn't write at all--dry. I want my money back, but what a horrible waste of time. Doesn't anyone make anything of quality anymore? UPDATE: Not one of these pens has any ink that will flow.

title: Cheap glossy poster board
text: These are not matte as described, but glossy, and as another reviewer noted, pretty much the same as poster board. No good for stamping as the ink stays shiny. I imagine this would apply to other ink applications. Returning on a one star because of the deceptive description.

title: Strictly Two Stars
text: Yes, the corners arrived bent. What I dislike most about it is the tiny monthly tabs that can only be reached by opening the whole book, unlike other brands that open up directly with large accessible tabs. Also on this planner the tabs open to the first week of the month, rather than the month itself, which is the more logical place to start planning. I picked this planner because I don't like buying plastic. We are drowning in it. But it comes with two plastic rulers, a plastic pocket in the back and a thick plastic spiral binding. Not value for money, not good design. Not sure who all the people giving it five stars are.

title: Beware the Magenta
text: The magenta marker leaves permanent marks that cannot be erased ever. My dry erase board will never be fully clean again because of this.

title: Alright
text: Works alright if you learn how to use it.

title: False advertising
text: These are not forever stamps. Stamp prices keep rising. Who wants mail returned for insufficient postage?

title: Arrived damaged
text: Table top edge is chipped/cut.

title: Broken
text: It’s already broken

title: Was ok. Looked nice but too high for me
text: Was too high. Not able to bring down lower

title: To be able to see the color
text: Was too light not easy to see

title: Just ok.
text: I tried to use these to get metal college emblems to stick to a car. Easy to cut and affix to the emblems but the magnet wasn’t near strong enough. Would work to hold something light to a refrigerator but not something a little heavier to a car.

title: Nasty chemical smell.
text: Nasty odor.  Bought two sending unopened one back.  Literally burns my eyes.  Smells like lacquer or some heavy chemical scent.  Has been aired out for 3 days and smell still there.  Throwing the one package that’s already open out.  Don’t buy if you have any sensitivities to smell.  I have asthma and it bothers my lungs.

title: Good but... beware!
text:
The texture IS NOT what the pictures make you believe! I'm very disappointed!

There is no way you can keep objects on the surface of the table at any inclination: they slip down inexorably! The actual texture is not as rough as the one shown in the pictures, and certainly not "anti slip" as the pictures make you believe! It is still kind of soft, but the friction is almost zero! If you are planning to use it with some level of inclination, be prepared to buy an extra anti slip pad for it.

On the good side all the rest is as advertised. It's expensive but the design and the overall quality is outstanding. It also looks like durable. It would be a 5 stars with the advertised texture!

title: A Dented Calendar
text: It arrived as rolled up calendar.  When I opened the calendar, I notice the dented line due to being rolled up.  The magnetic works great, sticks well to my refrigerator.  I am using it as school calendar for my daughter.  I was just disappointed that there is a dented line that I cannot do anything about it. I will see how this goes in few months.

title: Already broken 😞 had it less than a month.
text: Not a month and already broken 😞

title: Do not buy
text: The pencil will fall.

title: First it gave me a hard time to recognize it ...
text:
First it gave me a hard time to recognize it by the printer.
My second purchase well they are not doing so well.

title: Weak adhesive
text: Did the supply crunch affect adhesives?  These labels dont stick. They are removable since it lifts UP on its own.

title: Best bed tray?
text:
Pretty sturdy given its weight. Definitely not flimsy. All the pros you can read in their description, which are actually pros.

Cons: the height should be adjustable even lower but it starts off a little high. Also, the surface while nice for the keyboard is less than idea for a mouse. It doesnt track well at all. You need to use a separate mouse pad otherwise it will difficult to use.

Definitely recommended. Caveat- not a pro at bed tray merchandise.

title: not quite what I was expecting
text: It does a great job sharpening, not so great about working instantly.  Sometimes it's automatic. Sometimes you have to press and hold the gauge. Even then, you may have to wait, and you always have to use two hands. Worst, if you have to pull the pencil out to try again, it is so tight it feels like you're damaging it. Rarely, do I leave a bad review.

title: Too tall
text: It is to tall for me on the Lowest setting. Therefor it it hard for me to use in my chair

title: Too Big & Too Heavy
text: It’s great and way too big and heavy, which makes it uncomfortable for me.

title: Not worth 100 bucks!
text: Though it serves its purpose,  it's not worth $100.  My wife made a joke as its a good fit for a student on a budget.  l would estimate a fair price for this piece would be around 20-25 bucks only.  I remember, last year around Christmas time, I had seen a similar laptop bed desk for $19.99 at Macy's.  I might return this unit as I can probably find a better-looking unit for this price at any furniture shop.

title: It's plastic, not leather
text: The title says leather, and the description says leather. You have to look pretty closely for the one location where they mention that it's not actually leather. It's pleather. Upon receiving it, I discovered that it's really just a sheet of hard plastic. Pretty disappointed. On the positive side, it's the dimensions I wanted, and it is easy to clean, since it's just a sheet of hard plastic.

title: It's small. Does not fit 5star pocket folders
text: I like the style. Its sturdy. But it's too small to fit folders, very disappointed

title: Strong Plastic Smell!
text: The mat looks fine, and the size is perfect for my C shaped table, I really wanted to keep it. However, it came with super strong plastic smell, and it’s been a few days since I received it, the smell is still there. I rolled it back and repacked it to send it back, after this, that smell just stayed on my hands for a while, no matter how many times I have washed my hands with soap. I’m returning it!

title: Received an used product?
text: Whoever paid nearly 100 bucks for a small bed table deserves a better result instead of a defective product which appears to be send-hand. There’s multiple scratches and black stains on the legs and table edges, and they can’t be wiped off by any means. I’m considering returning it!

title: Skips and ink dried up in 3 eeeks.
text: Disappointed. Dried up in 3 weeks. Started skipping after 1 week of use. Third week it’s dried up.

title: Waste of money.
text: Waste of money. Dried up ink.

title: Not happy for high price. price.
text: Too stiff for me. Hard to get in and out of. Zippers are stiff.  Disappointed because high priced.

title: Beautiful pens. Ink skips.
text: Beautiful pens but the ink is blotchy (is that a word?) skips. Not smooth.

title: Mom loved it... while it lasted...
text:
Mom loves it! She's 83 years old. Makes dialing much easier.

UPDATE: Audio decreased markedly within just 3-4 months' light use.

title: Interesting printer... Update!
text:
I have to say, this printer really does print very nicely. However, as far as "fast" is concerned... well, sure it's fast - once it gets going. Unfortunately though, more often than not, it takes an inordinately long time to get to the printing part. Like just now, I asked it to print one black & white page and it took about 20-30 seconds for it to get going with the actual printing. First there are a lot of gnashing, gear smashing sounds that emanate from it (every time!) that make you wonder if it's really just a printer or perhaps doubling as a garbage disposal... I have to grin every time I hear it doing those weird sounds because I swear it sounds like it's about to spit out a few nuts and bolts and then just fall apart. However, we have been using it many times daily for over 3 months now and it's still going strong, so it must be just its own little personality shining through.

I don't recall seeing any other reviewers mention anything about the unearthly noises that this printer puts out, so I guess it must be just mine. Hope that doesn't mean it is going to be prone to a short lifecycle. Only time will tell. (Indeed. Sometimes redundancy or stating the obvious can be poetic. I have my doubts about this instance though.)

As others have stated, it sets up quickly and inserting the cartridges and monitoring the ink levels inside them is super easy and clear. I too love the duplex printing. It does two-sided copies all by itself. No waiting for the odd numbered pages to print out, then trying to figure out how to put the stack back in properly. This puppy does it all by itself. The first time I had it do one of these, I actually sat here in awe, watching it flip 40 pages all by itself, immersing myself in the beauty of delegating a previously irksome task to the care of a capable machine.

Today, it stopped working and we downloaded a nifty program from the HP site called "HP Printer and Scan Doctor". It walked us through a few troubleshooting steps and, within less than 5 minutes, the printer was gnashing and printing merrily once again. Wonderful! That program works for many HP printers on different operating systems. I will give the link in the comments section, where it won't get erased.

Finally, so far, with steady daily use, we have never yet had a single paper jam. Wow! How cool is that? And I forgive it today's one and only glitch so far, because it may have been my own fault. I think I pushed a couple of buttons in the wrong succession.

12 28 2015 Update: Still going strong. Not noisy anymore either. No idea why... But still has never had a paper jam and prints beautifully.

07 08 2016 Update: Not so impressed anymore. After less than two years, this printer has failed. Something to do with the printhead not being recognized. Tried the fixes that were recommended on the HP site, but none of them worked. Now, my options are: I can get a $120.00 new printhead from HP, or a refurb for about $50.00 from China. But, I can also get a brand new printer (same model) for under $120.00 from a seller on Amazon. Seeing as how I'm stocked up on expensive ink cartridges, I am going for the new printer, as I can't wait through the shipping delays from China and I'm not even sure the problem will be fixed by the new printhead.

I will also get a 4 year SquareTrade warranty to go with it this time. That oughta work a bit better than this last go-round... Still, I'm not happy. I expected more from HP.

title: Smooth writing, but major quality issues.
text: I bought a bunch of these In all the different colors last year and the writing action really is the smoothest ever. However, the body of the pen is unmitigated crap. I have been using these for about a year now and the thread is not holding up against the pressure of the pen when it is in writing mode. The bodies are now falling apart on me, one after another. When I try to screw them back together, they just fall apart again. I find myself saving the insert to use later in whichever of the casings happens to withstand the test of time. However, this means I will have to also be sure to somehow let myself know what color the ink is in the altered pens. I can slide the color-coded silicone sleeve off of the faulty pen and install it on the other, but that will not look so cool, since the top of the pens are also color-coded and so won't end up matching unless I am "lucky" enough to get a working casing that matches the color of the insert. Huge disappointment that this product's body is of such inferior workmanship. I do so love how the pen writes...

title: Smooth writing, but lots of issues - Read updates re price & quality.
text:
I borrowed one of these from a Staples employee when I went there yesterday and immediately noticed how smoothly this pen writes. Totally even flow, effortless glide on the paper. Feels like a top of the line fountain pen. I bought a combo pack at Staples and also two 2-packs of the green colored ones here on Amazon. I totally love this pen!

Note: July 21, 2012. Since the first part of my review in April of this year (i.e.: a mere 3.5 months ago) the price on these pens has increased by over 60%!!!! I bought mine for $4.18 per pack of two pens back then. Typical human reaction: product gets a few good reviews and the greed kicks in. Well, I came back to buy more, but will not be doing so until the price comes down again. Way down from $6.70.

Note: July 25, 2012. WHOA!!! Seems like somebody fell asleep at the wheel while updating this item's price... 4 days since my last update and the price has skyrocketed to a ridiculous 258%+ of what I paid for these pens in April. And I thought the $ 6.70 was an excessive price hike. I will adjust my rating when the price comes down to a reasonable level. Right now, so not worth it. These pens are not gold plated, nor do they spew magic ink. Absolutely ridiculous pricing at $14.99

My original rating was 5 stars at $4.18 for the set. Not anymore...

Update Oct. 22, 2012: I see the price is coming down some now. But it's still way higher than the $4.18 I originally paid for these. I will check back again to see if reason has caught up with these merchants.

Update: 4/25/2013: I originally gave these pens a very enthusiastic 5 stars. But now, sadly, I have had to amend my review, and not only because of the inflated pricing either. I bought a bunch of these in all the different colors last year and the writing action really is the smoothest ever. However, the body of the pen is unmitigated crap. I have been using these for about a year now and the thread is not holding up against the pressure of the pen when it is in writing mode. The bodies are now falling apart on me, one after another. When I try to screw them back together, they just fall apart again. I find myself saving the insert to use later in whichever of the casings happens to withstand the test of time. title: Awesome pen! Truly crap body. (see my update)
text:
I borrowed one from a Staples employee when I went there yesterday and immediately noticed how smoothly this pen writes. Totally even flow, effortless glide on the paper. Feels like a top of the line fountain pen. I bought a combo pack at Staples and also two 2-packs of the green colored ones here on Amazon [[ASIN:B0047CP6UQ Pentel EnerGel Deluxe RTX Retractable Liquid Gel Pen, 0.7mm, Metal Tip, Green Ink, 2 Pack (BL77BP2D)]]. The two pack is a much better bargain than buying a twelve pack right now. I bought the two pack for USD 4.18. Six of those (to total 12 pens) would come to USD 25.08. A much (!) better deal than the USD 40.49 they are asking for this 12 pack right now, you'll agree...
I loooove this pen!!!

Update: 4/25/2013: I originally gave these pens a very enthusiastic 5 stars. But now, sadly, I have to amend my review. However, this means I will have to also be sure to somehow let myself know what color the ink is in the altered pens. I can slide the color-coded silicone sleeve off of the faulty pen and install it on the other, but that will not look so cool, since the top of the pens are also color-coded and so won't end up matching unless I am "lucky" enough to get a working casing that matches the color of the insert. Huge disappointment that this product's body is of such inferior workmanship. I do so love how the pen writes...

title: Stains everywhere. Beware!
text:
I purchased 3 of these cartridges last July. I use my printer but not all that much because these toner cartridges are truly crappy and just scatter and bleed ink everywhere on the paper. So, I only finally went through the first cartridge last week. Since I have two printers, I do have some choices, fortunately. I was really hoping to use this one more, but I can really only use this printer for printing out personal stuff. Like ebooks that I don't want to read off my screen, but prefer to print out to read in the living room or dining room or elsewhere. As far as that kind of printing goes, it's mostly legible. Just waaay not clean enough to use formally or professionally.

I waited until I was on my second cartridge before writing this review. I figured, maybe the first cartridge was just a lemon - that can happen... I did not try to exchange it at the time because I bought these before my original cartridge ran out, just to have backup ready. By the time that happened and I realized that the new cartridge was crap, it was really too late to raise the issue. I bought it from Blake Printing Supply at the time but, since I never tried to return them or even complain, I can't speak to their service or responsiveness in this situation.

The second cartridge I started on last week seems about 70% better than the first one. Still not clean enough for formal applications, but less frustrating for my personal printing needs.

So, if you're OK with having a cheap cartridge that makes your paper dirty, but still can print out your personal stuff relatively legibly, then go for it. If you want it for an office environment, or for printing out your new manuscript, stay far away from it.

title: I'll give it 5 stars when
text: ... they update the description and remove the maximum media size of 13x19. There is no way to print anything wider than 8.5. While I was looking for a printer that could accommodate 11x17, as long as a buyer is aware this unit CANNOT print that width. Once the description is updated, I'll change the review to 5 stars. If you don't need anything wider than 8.5, this is a terrific printer. Easy to set up and superior print quality to my ET-2760 (which, to be fair, I have no complaints about, but it was donated to my daughter in law to use for schooling.) I'm happy to keep and use this printer but will continue to look for one that can print 11x17.

title: A lot of little issues that add up with this product
text: There are a lot of “little things” that are odd with this product. Adjusting the table, from tilted to flat, is incredibly difficult and it sticks so you have to pull or push on it really hard. The height is a bit too high for me, even on the lowest level, to use while flat (I’m 5”2 so there’s that). The surface is also not as “anti-slide” as it proclaims to be, things like my phone and other objects slide right off. This would be okay if the removable bar at the bottom were longer, but this is not the case. I will say the removable stopper for the bottom is very helpful and it’s size prevents it from getting in the way of your warms. The drawer is pretty small but will hold pens. One of the most annoying issues is the book/paper holder. It does not secure very well to the table for propping up an item or when putting it away underneath. It just doesn’t stay and continuously falls out. It can’t hold a book very well which defeats the purpose. Not worth the 60 some odd dollars in my opinion. The one good thing are the legs, they slide easily on the bed (table itself is pretty heavy) and there is enough space for me to sprawl my legs onto without feeling too limited.

title: Nice but doesn't fit a whole lot.
text: Don't get me wrong, I think this was a good deal price wise and the material is in good condition with the exception of a few frayed strings but nothing major. I was expecting to be able to fit more inside while also zipping the binder shut but this is not the case. If it were wider it would be better. Just a heads up if you are planning to put your Mac or notebook in here.

title: Hard time assembling, and this chair doesn't give enough height for short people

title: Helped my sciatica, but not the best cushion you can get

title: Mixed Review...Table size is not as advertised.
text:
False Advertisement: The tabletop is 58 and 3/4 inches long v 23.5 inches......bad...that is false advertisement and technically a breach of contract as it's advertised as 60 x24 inch
Assembly: You must get power drill to set it up. The directions tell you to drill while the table top is flat on the floor or table. DO NOT do that!. The holes don't line up! That is a major manufacturer issue. Best to do it towards the end. Step 4 tells you to drill holes...DO NOT DO IT! Wait till the very end. Logically you would do it then but the pre-drilled manufacturer holes may not line up. Mine did not. You will have to wait till Step 11 to drill those holes...which requires you to get flat on the ground on your back while under the table. One set of the pre-drilled holes on either end may line up with the white underbar. The other side of pre-drilled holes may not line up. If one side lines up, then drill holes with your drill on the side making sure they line up with the white bar......and that requires that you drill through the white bar holes. You will better understand when you get to Step 11 of the instructions. I had 2 buddies of mine...one is an electrical engineer and the other a mechanical engineer. They vouched for it because they said it was a manufacturer issue.

The sticker cable holders didn't stay on pass 1 day. So I will have to get 3M stickers .

Delivery: Delivery was expected in 2 weeks but it arrived the next day after I ordered. Awesome.

So far so good. The mechanics work as of now. But the table dimensions are smaller than what is advertised. Hopefully, it keeps working for a long time.

title: The first two cartridges worked great! The third wouldn't work because it said it ...

title: PDF File Size is H U G E
text:
An 8 page B&W text only document yields a 2.5MB file size! How can a company use this product for high volume file storage, when even simple documents are this large?

I called the NeatDesk tech support and someone answered quickly, but their suggestion (to save the document to the product's inbox, then export to my desktop at the lowest quality) not only added extra steps to their simple process, but it still got me a 2.5MB file. I have posted to the company's help forum but I see unanswered complaints from others on this issue, so I do not have much hope that there is a resolution.

title: Disappointing user experience.
text: I've owned many printers as a business owner for 27 years. This is below average in ease of set up, first page speed and documentation. However it is of average quality overall.

title: Too expensive to keep.
text: Once the IPC belt expired and I reset it once I was done with this printer. Print quality is now awful. Even if I replace the belt at a cost of $300-$500 I may still need to replace additional parts to insure print quality. While it worked it worked well but it's not worth hundreds of dollars in parts to keep when similar printers can be purchased new for nearly the same price. Also, the scanning software was not compatible with Windows 7 so I had to purchase a third party product in order to scan to PDF files once I upgraded my operating system.

Even the Mac which has HP software installed doesn't detect the printer sometimes. Often I need to access the printer through intranet webpage and then it starts working. So if you are not tech savvy and use iOS/Mac devices, there may be some issues detecting the printer.

title: Too expensive for such a flimsy construction.

Edit: I want to add that I contacted the seller who responded immediately and sent a new box. So a great experience there. Unfortunately the same failure occurred on the new box within a few weeks.

I also found that this is pretty flimsy and I don't know that you would want to put anything to heavy on the shelves.  I'm just using it for papers though, so it works fine so far.

title: Works, but is Tricky
text: This stand is not the prettiest and is a bit bulky, but works well.  I want to say up front that there's nearly no way to put this together without an electric drill.  The screws are really long and they only get it started into the wood.  We could only put in each screw just a little bit and had to finish with a drill.  So far, it's working well.

title: Nice Size and Easy to Transport
text: This is such a nice little cart, that was fairly easy to put together and folds up so easily.  It holds quite a few items as well. The drawback of this cart is that it doesn't maneuver easily, as it only rolls front and back.  You can tip onto the back wheels to swivel, but that quickly wears off the pins in the wheels.  Before I knew it, the pin popped on one of the wheels, so now I need to replace it before I can use it again.  Honestly, I don't know how else to get the wheels to stay on more securely, so I'll be getting a few pins for the inevitability of them continuing to break.

title: Huh? Not All Funny or Make Sense...
text:
I picked up this calendar for a friend of mine who has lived in NYC for awhile and recently moved to Washington, D.C. I'll be honest in saying that I somehow expected there to be some pretty funny, ironic comments that my friend would appreciate. There were some, but I thought that a lot of them were not quite as funny as a daily "thought" to overhear and pull from your calendar. Yes, you laugh at the stupid things people say, especially about LA or NYC, but some are just too ridiculous!

Honestly, go check out their instagram account to see examples of some of the things that are on the calendar. It's strange that I somehow enjoy getting a quick snippet on instagram, but don't absolutely love it in a calendar.

title: Too wobbly for significant use
text: [[VIDEOID:7ea413ea76dfefa9f2a4bd8539f3613e]] Overall, it seems to be fairly well made and is a nice size.  Unfortunately, the stand is so wobbly that it is unusable for anything that requires typing on a laptop or writing notes, drawings, etc. on paper. (see video)  This limits it's use to a book holder, which can also be a problem if you are sensitive to motion when reading (as the book will wobble).  Second, while the product photos clearly show it being used as a standing desk, this is not feasible as the skids are so slippery that the desk will not stay put. In an attempt to rectify this I added non-skid rubber to the skids, which works fine.  Unfortunately, the desk still wobbles and is unusable, and cannot be returned because of the rubber which I added in an attempt to use the product as depicted in the manufacturer photos. This may work as a dining tray in bed, but I can't see it being usable for any sort of work or writing / drawing, etc.

text: Love that it can hold so many keys, just wish the hooks had been a little larger.  It is difficult to hook a regular key chain ring on these hooks because they don't stick out from the back far enough and are very shallow.

title: Legs do NOT fold down
text: I understood from the description that the legs were adjustable and would fold underneath the tray for easy storage.  I purchased the larger one and the legs do not fold down.  You can adjust them up or down.  I keep them as low as they'll go and it's nearly too high.  I didn't return it, but wish I had because I have no place to put it!!!  It sits out all the time because it's large and bulky and the legs do not collapse.

title: Missing the bars, which defeats the purpose!
text:
And instead of sending me the missing bars, they wanted me to box up the boxes and return them. Not practical, especially in the middle of a move. So, I used them for pillows and blankets.

Bottom line - they worked great as a large moving box. Period.

title: Not as pictured
text: Add us to the list of customers who did not receive the notebook prints that are pictured.  If I wanted random colors and patterns I would paid half price for a more generic brand instead of more for this one.  Buyer beware.

title: Not full
text: Ink was great, cartridges fit fine, but ran out quickly with very light printing.  Not convinced they were full and will not purchase again.

title: White ink is awful
text: The silver and gold write fine but the white ink is awful. Will not buy again.

title: Not for drawing
text: The led is super weak. Not for drawing. Maybe writing??

title: You get what you pay for
text:
It’s pretty but the paper is SUPER cheap and thin and easy to tear. One of the dividers was partially ripped out and they are easily warped and bent just after 30 minutes of use. Lots of paper, so that’s a plus- but it looks/feels cheap. Bought two different designs (the polka dot and leaf designs) from two different sellers and both had the same issues. Wish the polka dotted one didn’t start out with the dotted pages first because they are used less so I have to skip to the middle to use lined paper and the rear part for drawing.
Not quite sure why these are so highly rated other than the fact it provides lots of paper and it’s pretty.

title: Just not it.
text:
I had to return it. It jammed every other minute. It doesn’t matter how fast it’s sorting the coins if half of them miss the holder. I almost returned it with money inside. To get them out I had to turn it upside down with the machine on.
It was so cheaply made that one of the rubber feet fell off when I opened the package.
We were going to split the cost and wrap our own coins. After my experience, I took the rest of my coins to the supermarket and just paid to sort them.

title: Cheaply made

I wanted to do like I did with the strips I bought before we painted but I was being cheap and bought this instead cuz I thought I’d get more use but they keep coming off the remotes!!!  Argh!!!

title: TOO messy!!!!

title: DON'T BUY THIS!!! Drinks ink like a man stuck in a desert!!!!
text:
I have to be honest, this is my first Epson product. It had all the features I wanted and I liked the speed and compactness of it all. The specs, on paper, was great!!!
Now here is my main problem with this printer: It drinks ink like a drunk at Mardi Gras!!!
I work from home and do NOT use this printer as my primary printer. In fact, I print very little on this printer, but I've spent so much to replace cartridges on this printer that I have to say that it is more worth it to me to sell this at a loss and get a new HP. The cost just is NOT worth it. I do NOT believe in buying those ink replacement things.. After the warranty is up, however, I may have to try this.

I've only owned it for 8 months and I've replace 3 black cartridges and am replacing color when I barely do color printing. If ONE cartridge is out, it won't let you just print black like my old HP. I think after this I will be going back to HP. My old one was a workhorse and lasted YEARS!! This printer is truly just a way for Epson to make money on ink!!!

title: I loved it at first.
text: I've had this product for a couple of weeks. It was just what I needed and wanted but now it is not working as it should. The left leg's lock/button is not working properly. When I move the table top from underneath the left leg's height changes. This is a slight inconvenience. The buttons were never very functional. If you pull the leg without unlocking it the height can still be adjusted. I'm not sure if I received a faulty product or if that's the case with all.

title: Full ink cartiages
text: While the cartridges came full of ink, great shape, my HP 6962 printer refused these ink cartridges, saying depleted or noncompliance. Turned out to be a waste of my money.

title: Item does not work

title: Quality Issues
text: Was excited to get these toner cartridges at a price that couldn't be beat. Well, that soon faded once streaks started appearing on pages with less than a quarter of the cartridge toner gone...What do you do now....sometimes spending a little more pays in the long run this is a perfect example if you find a re-manufacture toner company that does a good job stick with them as it it pay in the long run. Maybe I got a bad batch but do I want to try again for another $100? you decide.

title: Too heavy
text: This laptop bed tray is very heavy. Thought it would be lighter weight. Too heavy for me. Will be returning this item

title: The WORST tape I have ever used!!
text:
I use a lot of tape, and these rolls I received are going in the trash! I hate to give it to the thrift store and burst someone's bubble when they think they found a little goldmine with these rolls.

It tears! You cannot tape it and let it roll across a package...... it rips. Tiny strips, worthless strips.
You cannot grab the edge of the tape to unroll carefully ........it rips and is more trouble than it is worth!!! DON'T AGONIZE YOURSELF WITH THIS, IT IS THE WORST I HAVE USED...... OR NOT GONNA USE!

title: SOMETIMES PHONES CAN TRY TO INCLUDE TOOOO MANY FEATURES!
text:
I generally do not want a cheap phone, and at this price, I consider it cheaper. I want a phone that is quality and the only reason I picked this is because it is MOTOROLA, a well-known dependable name.

My other phone is a Panasonic 6.0. I like it, except for few things. So I plug this one in, and get it charged up. And, holy cow! The booklet is like a BOOK. When I saw the thickness of the small booklet, I thought there might be different languages, but no, one language. There are a TON of features here. And, for me to get this phone working up to par and benefitting from the features..... is a long shot!

I like some stuff that I accidently discovered, like Block Number. and the Handset can be Speaker Hands Free. I had that once, then couldn't figure out why it wouldn't do it again.

I also did notice that I could not CALL BACK a number directly from the messages. I used to have that option. Also, I want to figure out HOW to not have beeping everytime someone leaves a message. I would rather check the phone's number of messages than have it beep.

So, my question is WHY do companies need to include a ton of features. I don't need a ton of features! And, if you have elderly folks in the home, forget them trying to set this.

All in all..... The phone has too many features, that will not be easy to work out. This phone will take me a long time to get it the way I want and the way I understand.

title: May hold the grocery list, but the pencil slides down!
text:
So far, the board is sticking to the refrigerator. However, the items I place, like a pencil, tend to roll off. It appears to not be strong enough. I did have a 5x5 card stock paper, which held up, but the pen.... just slides down.

There may be more, and I will update as needed. I cannot imagine the sticky part, not getting dust and becoming ineffective.

Will update!...... Rizzo

title: If it works good, when it works good, IF NOT, then it is too sensitive, troublesome!
text:
I purchased a brand new one. I was wasting more labels than using them effectively. The Printer kept rolling out several at a time, I could not get it to stop. Then, I could not print from the computer page...

These machines are sensitive, and I could not rely on it to work properly and consistently.

It may work for some, but I could not longer take a chance.

title: If you live in a world of FIVE DAYS a week!
text:
This nice, lightweight board is handy, and useful, if you live in the world of five days a week. That's right, there are only five slots for the days of the week.

Basically, this is long, lengthwise, meaning you have to have enough space to hang it, as it is long. A more square-look would have been better. It would be much easier to find a spot in the home or office.

The board comes with a small pen, which works well, the pen writing on the white board wipes off clean, not needing special cleaning liquid. Now, for the placement of the pen. Most people in this world are right-handed, and if you are, you will need to reach way over to the left side and grab the pen. But, for me, a left-hander, it works ....for the minority of people.

There is a very thin layer of cork that has the capacity of tear off easily. And, if you put too many tacks, you will certainly make holes. So... the cork layer is too thin.

Anyway, for how long it will work, it is worth the usage you get out of it. Lightweight!

title: The Bubbles were 50% popped already
text:
I don't know about this product, but I ordered from a vendor, and this package that I received... nowhere did it say it was DUCK BRAND, which appears to be a good name brand.

What I got is Bubble Wrap that is popped. It is on a roll, but so many of the bubbles are popped. What is that about?

When you order this, Duck Brand, make sure you get Duck Brand on the labeling.

To this day, I cannot guarantee I received Duck Brand....Rizzo

title: Why re-invent the notebook??
text:
I cannot understand why we need to re-invent the good old fashioned notebook binder. Although Pendaflex has produced some excellent office and home filing products, I don't see a need for this.

First of all, it's not a real notebook where you can secure your messy paperwork. The premise is a binder with plastic inserts that will "slide" into the base of the binder for securing. The binder constructed of hard plastic and you have an inside pocket, however, the plastic pocket is not durable, therefore you can see it will tear soon. To attach the inserts, there are about 5-6 slots. The attachments are easy enough to dislodge from the binder if needed. There is a slot on the outside of the notebook for labeling.

You will get an envelope with string attaching it closed. On the outside is a smaller pocket with a flap. This is hard plastic, not easy to get in and out of. Then you have another item that is geared to hold maybe flash drives, and cds. It includes two slots for CDs and two for smaller drives. Do students still use the CDs for transferring data?

Then you have the two secure file folders and they are geared for simply putting loose sheets into. A string secures the closure of these files. And, last there is a Clipboard, sturdy enough for its purpose. Note the contraption that holds the paper does not spring open like a normal clipboard. One can only "slip in" a paper, maybe two sheets at a time.

I have used notebooks and discovered available pockets and doodads for carrying your smaller stuff. This is cumbersome, not comfortable. And I believe you will find that it won't work!! Again, I know at times we have reinvented the wheel, but why the notebook? .......Rizzo

title: Too sticky, easy to break
text: The adhesive ness is very strong and so strong that it was almost impossible to peel and align it neatly on the surface, as the peeled off parts kept stick themselves together. In a desperate attempt to separate the sticky parts which were also crisp, I torn off the paper twice. I have to wonder how much damage the surface would suffer when I will tear it off sometime in the future. I would look for a different product next time.

title: Don't waste your money

title: Do not waste your money
text: This is a big fat waste of money.  Almost impossible to use.

title: I like it but it hurts! 3.5 stars
text: I bought the Silver version and I really like it. It looks great and I love that they give you the lanyard and the clip. I have only been using it a week or so, so I haven't experienced the issues that others refer to regarding the stones falling off but I have a few other issues that keep me from giving it more stars. 1) The retractable clip - the retractable "string" is about 2 feet long fully extended. Unfortunately, that is about a foot shorter than my previous one meaning when I have it clipped to my pocket or belt it is too short to reach the "key pads" that we need to swipe to get in the doors of our building so I have to unclip it from my person every time I want to use it (defeating the purpose of having the retractable part to begin with). Also, the clip is weaker than others I have used and when it is clipped to my pocket and I pull my badge to use it, the clip isn't strong enough to stay clipped to my pocket and comes flying off - again, defeating the purpose of having the clip. 2) The lanyard - I really like the way it looks but it actually pulls my hair out of my head and/or basically slices through my hair every time I wear it. The "gem" edges are sharp and when my hair gets in between two of them, good-bye hair! So I can't really wear the lanyard at all (unless maybe I have my hair up?). So....to recap - looks great, not the strongest clip or longest retractable string, and if you wear it too long you might go bald.

title: Missing ink
text: After opening the Pen to check the Ink all of them were missing a quarter of ink. I am not sure if they were used or old and dried up.

title: Leg Room
text: The only complaint that I have is that I am a short person that has a tiny frame. Even we the desk is at it's lowest level, it is too high for me. I wish that was a way to adjust the legs to go lower for smaller people. My arms are uncomfortable having to work at such a high level.

title: Looks Nice But Too Small
text:
I got this because I notice in the photo that you can put two remotes next to each other in one slot. Well, they must be really teeny remotes because you can't double up any of ours in this holder except maybe for the Roku remote with the soundbar remote. Everything else like the Dish Network remote, the Blu-Ray player remote, etc. only one can fit to a slot.

Have put this in the spare bedroom to hold the remotes for the TV there, but there are fewer remotes than we have out in the living room, so it will work.

title: Not Magnetic Enough for Me
text: This will perhaps hold a photo on a fridge, but not much else. I was hoping this would be as strong as the little silver round magnets they used to sell at a local craft shop, but it is not.

title: Looks Much Nicer Online Than It Is
text:
I thought this would be a nice unit like the Knodel Bamboo Monitor Stand Riser (2 Tiers) I also received from Amazon. Alas, no. Oh, it's a clever idea that you can position the two portions in different ways (straight, corner, sideways) as in the video, but the quality of the product leaves a lot to be desired. The brown "finish" of the shelves is simply a veneer and you can see the lighter wood it's laid upon at every corner of the board. The instructions are pretty straightforward, but I advise you to use a Phillips head screwdriver with a lot bigger handle to make the torque of the screws a little easier to bear. At least three of the pilot holes drilled in the boards must have gone sideways, because when the screws were all put in securely I had three bulges in the wood that looked like they were going to crack if I had had to put the three screws in any more. Also, two of the boards came scratched, and I didn't pay attention and ended up putting one scratched board on "top" where everyone can see it.

The worst thing about this set of shelves is that its kept packed tight in its box using a terrible styrofoam that leaves tiny little flecks of foam EVERYWHERE when you unpack the box. They give you a cloth to wipe down the boards, but with all the static electricity around in the winter you'd no sooner wipe the top of the board than all the little flecks of foam accumulated at the bottom of the board. When I finished assembling the unit I had to vacuum it, the carpet, my pants, and anything else I was near to get all those little shredded pieces of foam. ICK!

title: Fine Point Pens The Best Part, But Others Okay
text: This is a nice starter set combo of drawing/calligraphy pens. My only minor problem with them is something I often see in felt-point calligraphy pens--the tips on the 2- and 3-point calligraphy points are often quite stiff at first and sometimes skip part of the width. The fine-point tips are quite nice to draw with, and can provide a lot of fine detail. I am taking off one star because the description for these pens clearly state several times that they are "waterproof." Nowhere on the packaging does it say that; it says they are "watercolor." However, I did get them wet after allowing the ink to dry for one day, and they did not smear when I wet them, so maybe they are "waterproof."

title: Nice Unit If I Could Get It to Work Properly
text:
I think I'm exactly the opposite of everyone who got this unit; I'm thinking most people got it for photo printing. I took it because I actually wanted a scanner of my own--the scanner I use most often was issued to me to be used for teleworking, and it's seven years old--and the photo printing was just lagniappe. If nothing else, I could actually print a decent photo of my husband and send it to his mother, since we tend to save all our digital photos and post them on Facebook/my blog rather than print them out.

The positives: document printing is great, nice dark black print, sharp, good looking. I'd willingly print a manuscript on this. The control panel is tiny, but thankfully I have small fingers. It's a bit irritating that you have to know to pull out the upper tray before printing, and sometimes you don't get it out far enough, but it's a small enough complaint.

My problem, not the printer's: I still haven't figured out how to get it to print out the photos. I guess it takes more than positioning the photo paper properly and resizing the photo in the correct proportions, because I haven't been able to do it yet. I'll get there, but it may be at the cost of all the ink.

The bad, for me: the scanner isn't that good (but keep reading, there may be an explanation). I scanned four old photographs from 1980. They all came out slightly blurry. I thought it might be because of the age or because these were matte finish. Nope--rescanned them on the seven-year-old HP scanner and they came out sharp and perfect.

The really bad part: I never, ever got the software to complete loading from the CD. It got as far as the step where the computer is supposed to recognize the printer. It stops right there, saying it can't find the printer, and refuses to complete the install. The kicker? Both computers on the network can see the printer, and print from the printer! I can scan if I use the buttons on the printer itself and it saves to the computer, but I can't get into the scanner software to scan from the computer, reset the scanner to save to a different folder, etc. Perhaps the scanner needs to be set up in the software and that's why my first scan was blurry--but I don't know that because I can't access the software.

And yes, before you ask, I contacted Epson. The technician walked me through deleting the printer from my computer and then reinstalling it, only have the install get stuck in the same place, where the computer is supposed to recognize the printer, doesn't, and won't go any further. He was baffled, so was I. I'm using Windows 7 Professional, and any suggestions will be welcomed.

title: These Are Okay
text:
I have a small collection of Sharpies and am always looking for unique colors, so I thought I'd give these a try.

There's not much you can say about them. The yellow is highlighter quality; the other colors (pink, blue, green, and orange) are bright and (forgive the pun) sharp. If one is having 60s flashbacks, you could quite enjoy coloring in your black velvet Peter Maxx poster, and it would look pretty spiffy. The bad news: all the colors do glow under black light--except for the blue. Not sure what went wrong with Sharpie's formulation there, but there's no glow from the blue.

title: Disappointed
text:
In the past I had done some pencil sketching and have been considering taking it back up. I'm a bit anal retentive about my pencil point; I like it good and sharp. So when I saw this pencil sharpener I was interested. I could set it on a corner of my drawing table and refresh my pencil whenever it got too blunt, rather than having to get up every so often to sharpen again on my wall-mounted Boston.

Unfortunately, I find it is good pretty much only for your garden-variety number 2 pencil which, indeed, it does put a nice sharp tip on. I was less successful with softer drawing pencils and also with colored pencils. Even with the nice sharpening job it did on the number 2, sometimes it would sharpen to the nice precise tip, and other times it would only sharpen one side so that the opposite side had a sheath of wood on it.

I must confess that once it didn't work on several of the different kinds of pencils that I already use, I did not try it out on other brands of pencils, or on larger pencils I was considering buying for shading purposes. Perhaps I'm pushing the pencil or holding it at a tilt, although after the first non-centered pencil, I did deliberately try to insert the pencil as straight as possible.

I haven't given up on it yet, but so far my old manual Boston does a more consistent job of sharpening straight.

title: Not happy

title: Did not work for our HP printer
text: Did not work with my HP printer. The package arrived soaked in black ink. It ruined some of my mail . And I had to wash everything in the box before we could use any of it. The instructions came in a little ziploc bag, so they were still legible even if splotchy. However, the Instructions were horrible. I had to look at YouTube videos for other brands to figure out how to use this. It did not come with all of the tools necessary to fill the cartridges. The black was too runny for the syringe to hold. In the end, the printer wouldn’t recognize the new ink, I had ink all over my floor, table and hands, and I still had to buy a new printer.

title: Bookmark with fragile legs!

title: These are too light for me
text: I purchased these pastel highlighters for school. I wanted something pretty. After using them, I realized I should have just gotten the regular bold colors. These are too light for me. I don't use them at all. They may be good for others, but they just don't work for what I was needing.

title: Not worth the price
text: I love the fact that these are geared towards left handed people. But they are not worth the price. I ordered 3 because I am going back to college in my adult life.  I always hated the binding on "normal" notebooks hurting when I write. When you finish writing on the front and flip to the back of the paper, the binding is on the left again. So what do you do, not write on the back of the paper. If you flip the notebook upside down to keep the binding on the right, now the back of the paper is upside down. For me it will just have to work since I don't have to turn papers in. But if a student needs to actually turn in the paper, it's not ok. The idea is good. But not for me. If you are a lefty, look for a notebook with no binder. It also would have been nice to pick what colors I received.  Overall, great concept. But I would not buy again.

title: A really nice product
text:
Update: I just realized that I spent $84 on this, instead of $64. I took off another star. I had already thought that $64 was overpriced, but $84? If you can't do any better, then try this table, but I would recommend that people shop around. This product is over-priced and the movable parts are made of cheap plastic that have to be moved with considerable force. They definitely could have either done better. They could have priced it better, or they could have done better with the production.
---
It is pretty sturdy, but it has a "cheapish" feel to it. The moving pieces get stuck and do not move smoothly, and the plastic moving parts are definitely on the cheaper side. However, the table, itself, is sturdy. There is plenty of leg room and the table height can be altered with relative ease. Overall, I'm quite happy with this purchase and hope to have this table in my life for a long time to come.

title: Tips Over Too Easily
text: Got this cos it was super cute and loved it for a couple weeks. Now that schools started though, I constantly have to pick it up and re-add utensils to it because it keeps falling over. Probably not made for students using desks with adjustable surfaces, but that's what pandemic-caused remote study has left me with. I would say only get this if it's going to stay in one spot. Otherwise, get one with weights at the bottom.

title: A bit expensive and can't handle textbooks
text:
I don't think this was worth the price, but if you don't mind that or the fact that the book holder absolutely does NOT hold a textbook (it's basically useless and I have lost it since I received this desk because I couldn't use it) it really isn't a bad purchase. I do like it for when I'm sitting on my bed reading a book or using it as a food tray when I'm eating and studying at the same time (which is most days).
Overall - if you can find the same thing at a cheaper price, I would recommend. Otherwise I would find a better product for this amount of money.

title: Miss leading photos
text:
Product image shows the stand up and angled for use with the phone and tablet upright. This is not possible. You can only use the phone holder and book/tablet holder when the surface is flat. And tilt and your stuff will just fall on its face.

Would not spend the extra money for those attachments again. The stand itself is great quality. It’s a shame they let functional details slip through.

title: Dried out in about a week.
text: Gel simply didn’t last very long.

title: Pretty cork board but where the cork is painted white, mine was messed up.
text: Pretty frame and cork board was nice but the white paint had terrible runs in it and looked terrible. Only reason I didn’t return it is because I bought it to cover it with fabric and make a bulletin board to hold pictures and notes.

title: Height Issue
text: If using in bed it was a little too high for short person.  Legs could not be adjusted any lower.  If manufacturer would fix it is an excellent laptop table.

title: These don't stick well at all
text: I wouldn't buy these as they don't stay on the wall for long. Do youeself a favor and go buy something more permanent.

title: A good compact table
text:
This is definitely a very good accessory to have, especially in today's time where we are working remote and often like to sit on a couch or lay on the bed while working on our laptop. This table (X-Large size) provides good workbench to keep a laptop and mouse. There is enough space to rest your hands on the table and keep your laptop towards the opposite end and not closer to you. Although the product picture shows many items kept on the table, it isn't practical to have many such items while you are actually working on it. A laptop, mouse and may be a small notepad / book.......this is a more practical usage of this table. The adjustable heights and the adjustable table angels are good and useful.

Unfortunately the product that i received has problem with the height adjuster locks, and hence i had to return it to get replaced with a new product.

I am looking forward towards my replacement table.

title: Decent Quality. Way Overpriced.

title: Nice Design, Poor in Use

title: Great Pen with a Bad Clip
text: This is a fine pen. Heavy construction, solid, and a pleasure to write with. The only drawback I have found is that the clip doesn’t seem to be fastened to the body of the pen very well. It slides easily from side to side when clicking/unclicking the pen for writing, so I’m unsure as to whether it will snap off eventually. Aside from that, it’s certainly a great pen.

title: PenAgain
text:
As everyone has their own slight variations in how they write, hold a pen, pressure used when writing, etc., I am sure this pen will work better for some than for others.

For me, it seems to slightly alleviate the ache in my hand that occurs after long periods of writing, however, it also makes it more difficult to write neatly and the ink tends to "glob" quite a bit. It is not a quality ink being used in the production of this pen. I can use it when neatness is not a concern, so I suppose it is useful.

Not a bad idea, but not yet a complete product.

title: Worse Than Useless - It Borders On The Dangerous
text:
There are three significant issues for me with this floor mat. By far, the most serious is that the edges keep rolling up. Not only do the wheels on my desk chair get caught on those edges but twice I've almost tripped and fallen over a curled up edge. At 69 years old, a fall like that could easily break a hip or worse. Every couple of days I flip the mat over but by the next morning the edges have started curling up again.

The second issue, irritating but not life threatening is that the mat continually slides around on the floor. The last issue is cosmetic but very noticable. The black mat is an absolute dust magnet and looks terrible on the floor. Given my age, boxing this mess up and hauling it down to UPS to be shipped back is a non-trivial exercise, not worth the $30 involved. Still, I will not buy anything from this company again. The last floor mat I had was from Office Depot. It cost about the same, was of heavier, clear plastic, and had none of these issues. So after I throw this one out, I'll head back there for a usable floor mat that won't try to trip me.

title: NOT shipped flat as they advertise - Very disappointed in this lie.
text: First off, the mat itself WOULD be very nice, if it had been shipped as they state: "shipped flat, not rolled up." It was folded over, in half and put tightly inside a cardboard envelope-type box, that was taped on all 4 sides. I cut open the sides to get the mat out, and it has 4 ripples going down the length of the entire mat where it was folded over. The reason I purchased this one was the statement that it was shipped flat. Also, it had a very strong smell when I cut the box open (between the smell and ripples, this was probably packaged up a fair while ago).. Hours later I can still smell it when I walk in my home office. Good size and it stays put on hardwood floor, but the ripples and smell had better go away very soon or back it goes. I should have just gone to Staples or WB Mason and purchased one that was flat.

title: There are better blenders out there
text: I was really excited to try these since I use Faber-Castell Polychromos colored pencils and they are oil based.  So I thought it would work really well since this blender is also oil based.  I was pretty disappointed.  I did a side by side comparison with this blender and the Derwent blender and the Derwent was way better hands down.  You could really see a difference in performance.  I’ll be sticking with the Derwent blender.

title: It’s alright but not for details
text: I originally loved this sharpener but I soon realized that it doesn’t make a very sharp point even on the sharp setting.  I bought it for both graphite and colored pencils.  I started noticing the point when doing animal fur and it’s just not sharp enough.  There is sandpaper in the shavings container but having an extra step is tedious.  I ended up getting the Derwent Super Point Sharpener.  Now that sharpens your pencils to a pin point.  The Afmat will be alright if you’re not doing anything too detailed.

title: Love the point it makes for Polychromos
text:
I’ve bought different brands of manual sharpeners and this is my favorite so far. It’s the only sharpener that gets my Polychromos to that super fine point that I like. I like that you can adjust to different kinds of points. I prefer the 3 setting for my colored pencils. My complaints are that the close setting doesn’t close anymore and that they don’t last a super long time. I’ve already thrown one away as it didn’t sharpen to that pin point anymore and that was after several drawings. If I find a sharpener that sharpens as well as this and lasts for years then I would switch but for now this is the one that works best for my needs. It is a bit pricey to me (about $6 at the time of this review) considering how often it will need to be replaced. I have been buying the 2-packs for that reason.
UPDATE:
Well I said if I found a better sharpener that I would switch and I did. For about a year now I’ve been using the Derwent Superpoint Manual sharpener and I love it. I still use the T’gaal sharpener when my pencils are too short to use on the Derwent.

title: An average tool meant to organize students. 3 to 3.5 stars
text:
The benefits of purchasing the Mead Five Star 2015-2016 (August to July) planner are:

1. The size is perfect. It fits well in a large purse or backpack.
2. The thick plastic cover is attractive and seems to be durable.
3. This is the perfect tool for a student (or non-student) to get organized.
4. It covers a school year….August 2015 thru July 2016. It is divided by the month, which is on two facing pages. Following each month is a daily option with bullets for you to write events or tasks.
5. Scattered throughout the planner are other items that are beneficial for students: proofreading symbols; conversions; the states and their capitals; spelling tips; maps; dates to remember and holidays.

The cons of purchasing this planner:
1. It is kind of expensive ($18) for what you get. I think someone in the market for a planner can find one that has more features (i.e., times, scratch paper, etc.) or that is just as good, if not better for less.
2. This planner would have been superior if there had been times that corresponded with the daily section. That is a feature that I normally look for in a planner, and is a feature that I think would appeal to some consumers…although you can write in the times of the events by the bullets.

In conclusion, while this planner is aesthetically pleasing to the eye, it is nothing special and in my humble opinion does not warrant the $18 asking price. Therefore, I can only give it 3 to 3.5 stars.

title: Um it's cute, but not really practical. 2.5
text:
Here is why this product appeals to my 13-year-old: (1) Looks fun to write with. Simply stated it's easy to use (the lead lowers from the body with one click), looks cool, and it's easy to change the colors of the erasers and body quickly. (2) Comfortable to hold with a nice grip. (3) writes well and is #2 (so you can use on standardized test). And since it is a starter set, I assume that you can refill, but he hasn't had to yet. And (5) is a brand that he knows, likes and trust.

Now, what I don't like as a parent: (1) The price. On-line and in the stores (the price is comparable) this product is about $10. For just a single mechanical pencil that only comes with changeable erasers and grips, and NO lead refills, that's a little pricey. I have seen cheaper Paper Mate mechanical pencils, that may not have the cool eraser colors, but are just as effective. So while this product is cute, it isn't really economical (practically speaking). I give this product a 2.5, for the cool factor.

title: Came Damaged.
text:

Cons: The material used for the edges are very cheap. It will fray very quickly. The plastic scratch’s easily, especially if there are staples.
