title: Poor Design
text: I've had this thing for a few months now and I find it to be poorly designed.  First, the legs constantly fall down to a fully extended position anytime I lift up it up to get or move.  Second, the one of the legs will collapse into folded position if I'm not real careful getting up to move.  Both issues have caused my laptop to slip off the surface and hit the floor.  While the concept is good the actual functioning is very poor.  The legs extend and or collapse too easily causing accidental drops.  I just cannot recommend this product to anyone at this point.

title: Slippery, Clunky to adjust, Way too tall for a lap desk
text:
I am 5'7" tall. This is not made for humans my size (or shorter) for use as a lap desk.

The photos show items sitting on the desk on full tilt, such as the phone and the ipad, staying in place. They had to glue those down, or those are photoshopped images, because this is so slippery, that even on the lowest tilt my mouse and laptop fly all over the place. Using a wireless magic mouse, so my mouse on the screen goes all over. This is also way way too tall to use as a lapdesk - unless you like carpel tunnel and shoulder/arm pain, it's the complete opposite of ergonomic. I didn't expect it would be, but I also didn't expect it to be so bad. I thought because of those photos, it would be possible to actually sit on the couch. I have deep seating, so figured it would be fine - it's not. Even with deep seats, the tips of the legs don't sit on the couch at all - about 4 inches stick out - and it's so high up, tilt doesn't help. You do NOT want to keep your arms up so high when working, and with this on the lowest height, my arms were raised up very high, maybe 11 inches higher than they should be for proper posture. Use at your own risk!!

I think this would be useful for kids to color or have a snack while sitting on the floor - this is NOT for professionals using it to work on, and I wouldn't even be able to use this for a few minutes on a laptop for any reason. It's not comfortable, it's not possible to keep your laptop and mouse from sliding all over the desk unless it's completely flat with no tilt - which is impossible to use.

title: Good but not ergonomic
text: It’s ok but I noticed my wrist and forearm started hurting after about 25 minutes because your wrist is holding all the weight of your arm. The mousepad section is not smooth, it has a texture on it. Not sure if that will interfere with the mouse or not as I haven’t tested yet.

title: Weak and received 2 of the same side
text: I received 2 rolls of the same side so before I asked for a replacement I tried sticking it to the fridge and it was so weak - my fridge magnets are stronger than this. I returned instead.

title: DOES NOT WORK WITH REGULAR CARTRIDGES
text: Don't kid yourself into thinking you can buy regular HP ink cartridges and "just not sign up" for Instant Ink. It doesn't work like that.  I never had instant ink and after about 10 or so pages, it stopped working. I bought new ink, and still never worked. Pages came out so faded they were almost blank, no ink at all, and jagged. Basically unreadable. Went through the tech support stuff with phone calls, chats, etc. and step by step fixes with them. Ended up sending it back to them for repair and they sent me a refurbished replacement (which diminished my 1 year limited warranty to 90 days!). The replacement did the exact same thing. Guy on the phone tells me to switch out my brand new ink cartridges with the Instant Ink that came to me with the replacement. That WORKS beautifully. But after 10 pages, I get that message now that says I can't use the ink anymore until I pay.. See what happens is this - you pay for Instant Ink, then the cartridge allows you a certain number of pages, then stops until you pay more.... It's extortion...

title: Good for color coding, but could benefit with a stronger adhesive
text: They work well to color code things, but the adhesive is not strong enough for using in moving, I used them on boxes to indicate which room they go in to, but many fell off. It’s a good thing I had to foresight to also write in directly on the box with a permanent marker “just in case”

title: Leaky cartridges!
text: I opened the magenta and ink went everywhere. I took as much care opening it as I did the others and the others were fine. I'm hoping they'll send me another magenta for the one I lost. I didn't put it in because I was afraid ink would get everywhere inside and do some damage. The ink doesn't come off easily either. The print quality however was fine.?I am glad my printer accepted it and will use it because it recognized that they were not HP cartridges.

title: Cover is open error when it's closed
text: I was never able to print anything because it kept giving me an error message that the cover was open when it was not. Apparently, this is a common problem according to the reviews. I tried everything suggested, but it kept throwing our that error. I am sending it back. You have to use the QR code to get the app. I first downloaded the NiiMbot app and it required a monthly subscription. Without their software, the printer will not work.

title: A $16 Sticker.... not worth it
text: This is a giant sticker. Not at all what I was expecting or what was described

title: Pain to load and difficult to use.
text: Returned it. Horrible.

title: Design Flaw
text: I loved the overall features of the product. But, it blows my mind how the engineers overlooked designing the laptop "brake slot" and the "book-holder frame" slot wide enough for the user to determine their placement comfort and logistics. If both slots were the "full width" of the frame you could place your laptop/tablet to either side. Then you can view more than one page of an open book without peering over your device.

title: Do NOT buy this product.  It is a total failure.
text: This, so-called, "desk" is a joke.  It comes from China and it comes in several pieces.  Save your time, money, and frustration by looking elsewhere for a lap desk.  I have one now that I thoroughly enjoy.

title: Updated: Customer service experience was great.
text:
9/8/21 Update: I contacted their customer service via email to request replacement parts or an exchange. They responded that day to ask for additional info, the order number and place it had been purchased. After I sent this info I received a replay that same day asking if I would like to have a code to redeem for a new item from them or have a refund, with no return of the broken desk, applied to the Amazon account that was purchased. I chose the Amazon refund and within 2 days it had been refunded to my mom’s account, purchaser.
It had been 9-10 months since it was purchased and they have a 12 month return policy. I’m very happy with the customer service and plan to buy a replacement bed desk from Saiji. Hopefully this was just a defect in this desk or I just need to loosen the screw that tightens the leg lock so it doesn’t crack on the new desk.
I’ll update if I have issues with the new desk, but I'm changing my star rating in consideration of my customer service experience.

First review: I got this as a Christmas present and loved it until it started to break. I have online classes so I use it almost everyday. I really liked the adjustability of this desk, but it only took 3mo for the plastic leg fixtures to begin to crack. And I have no idea where I can find replacements just for those parts.

title: The plastic leg locks are cracking after 4 and a half months
text:
Initially I loved this lap desk, it folded easily, the side drawer was a good size for my purposes, the table tilted easily and stayed locked in place. However, after a few months I noticed that one of the legs would fold with the slightest pressure. I thought I might just need to tighten the screw because it had come loose over time. Instead I saw that the screw was fine, but the plastic was cracking. After looking closer I saw that the plastic was cracking on both sides of the plastic fitting on the left leg and was starting to crack on the right leg. This was a Christmas present and lasted less than 5 months. This isn’t a cheap lap desk either. The plastic is obviously not durable enough to withstand regular useless. I understand that in order for the legs to lock in place and fold the joint needs to have some give, but apparently this plastic does not have that capability in the long run. Perhaps a metal joint with a rubber bumper would be a better more durable option.
I’m really disappointed that this table was so easily broken with just normal use. I’d like to keep using it and just replace the broken plastic joints, but I don’t know where I would find them.

title: Not worth the price
text: This product is flimsy and not worth nearly $100. The legs and the table top do not lock in place as advertised. The legs collapse and the desk top moves from its "fixed" position if you lean on it. For the price I would expect that it would be more sturdy. I was going to give it as a gift but decided against it. I was going to send it back, but stuck it in a corner and forgot about it till it was past return date. I would not recommend this product.

title: Solid wallet
text: Solid wallet

title: Leg is not stable
text: One side leg is not stable. It was good only for two months.

title: Don't waste your money!
text:
I bought this tape knowing it is not premium quality. My preteen uses tape for everything. She puts it on the carpet, her dolls, her bookshelf, etc. I thought a lower quality tape would be a good alternative to her expensive tape habit.

After receiving the tape (on time), we pulled a piece off. I touched the sticky side twice, and that was it, the stickiness was completely gone... and I mean COMPLETELY.

I bought the tape as a birthday gift. My daughter was so disappointed.

There is no way this tape would hold wrapping paper together... I DO NOT RECOMMEND. Go with a different brand.

title: Poor quality/over priced/ripped off
text:
The book holder does not fit into the slot at all. It is definitely a defalt/over sight/mistake/etc...

The legs do not stay in place, thus the table keeps dropping down on me.

This item was quite pricey for such poor quality.

I feel ripped off. I would not recommend this seller.

title: DOESN'T RECOGNIZE THAT TONER IS IN PRINTER
text: UNFORTUNATELY PAST THE RETURN WINDOW.  DOESN'T PAY TO STOCK UP.  CANON MF445DW DOESN'T RECOGNIZE THAT ANY TONER IS IN. WON'T LET YOU PRINT.

title: Not for everyone.
text: It makes me realize how I don’t do anything for fun (no options because of going to school and working full time 3rd shift) - I liked the idea of the journal, but it isn’t practical for what I wanted it to do. It was recommended to me by a friend and just....doesn’t work for me.

title: Won't hold the tickets
text: When we turn the barrel, the tickets fall out

title: Returned
text: Returned item

title: Waste of Money
text: Broke the first day and couldn’t return it

title: Not suitable for all smooth surfaces like stated
text: Unfortunately idea but the flat painted surface I was trying to put it on. Not only took the paint off the surface but also now they won’t stick so that can’t be used again.

title: Card are cute
text: Envelopes are not sized to cards, cards are 4 x 6 and envelopes are 5 x 7.  Does not look very professional, and I hesitate to mail them off now.  Will keep for small children, it's all I can do as I do not want to spend time and materials to ship back.

title: Needed for Art Studio
text: I have used these mechanical pencils for years.  This batch is very light and the lead won't stay still.  Also it is more narrow.  I understand the need to bring things in line for cost, but I would rather pay a little more and get what I am used to purchasing.  I now have a whole carton I may give away to a student.

title: Mid year planner
text: It is a nice planner, but I did not notice or maybe it was not there that this is a July to July planner, so I dont have a full 2019 planner which I thought I ordered.  Impulsive purchase other than that it is a great planner

title: Three Stars
text: They were cute, nothing to write home about, but they worked.

title: Not a beautiful and high quality one
text: Not a high quality one . The material does not look beautiful . I will return it .

title: Too slippery and the legs don’t go low enough
text: It is too slippery, Unfortunately I am not able to use my laptop on it . I have macbook 15” screen and it slips as soon as I put it on the desk . Also the legs don’t get shorten low enough

title: I would have liked something more durable than construction paper
text: These are really cute in my classroom,  but I could have made them myself.  I would have liked something more durable than construction paper.

title: Not suitable for adults
text:
Not much leg room for a normally built adult.
Should be okay for occasional work. Can't use it for a long time(> 30 mins). Easy to fold, easy to adjust height. Tilt can be adjusted, but it's either too straight or too tilt. Couldn't find a good tilting angle. Material looks sturdy. Ended up returning.

title: Short girl? Not  for you.
text: Let's just say if you're 5 ft or shorter this is not an ideal desk. My arm reach was too short to reach over. There's not a height adjustment on this. There is a tilt, but that's not a great idea if you have a  ton of multi tasks going on. So...... if you want to Jimmy rig some kind of pillow bench for lift it will work. Otherwise it's best to move on.  I'm bummed I really wanted this to work.

title: Worst work at home purchase so far.
text: I wouldn't recommend this if you have serious carpal tunnel, arthritis or any type of hand elbow shoulder pain while typing. This has a small lip on each end so it ends up rubbing into my skin and creates irritation. The online photo gives the illusion of a decent arch for your wrist. It's just that, an optical illusion. If you're looking for a good ergo mouse pad..... keep looking. And please let me know.

title: Misleading description.  Slightly disappointed ;)
text: Just about everything was great. But I chose this one because description stated LINED paper. It is blank paper. And if your anything like me and tend to write all over the place without lined  paper  it makes for unattractive review. Not to mention takes up to much room.  I  suggest to correct the description ASAP.

title: Don’t buy
text: Don’t buy these, they are nothing like the picture

title: Buy a different brand.
text: Only opened the box 4 times and now it won’t open.  Going to have to use a crowbar to get it open.  The key goes in, turns, but won’t open and has important information in it.

title: It's okay
text: I have small skinny keyboard and I wanted to elevate it so I didn't have to reach down and cause more pain. I have to lift this up and rest it on my wrist rest in order to make it work. I wish I could find one that is adjustable on the front.

title: Too hard
text: I have artritis in my feet it's way too hard to stand on. I returned it.

title: Was unbalanced
text: It was hard to make this even on each side. When I locked one side, it would go up and down when I was adjusting the other side. The legs were uneven once I was able to adjust ot and it was wighling a lot. For $80 I expected something way better.

title: Would not buy again!
text: Not true to size, and they are thin, see through  and not very durable.

title: Waste of money!
text: Very flimsy and thin. Smaller than dimensions given. Costs more to return than the item.

title: Not worth it
text: It’s horrible you have to take the chip out the old ink, put into the new one But ink still isn’t being recognized or working for my printer I would not recommend getting

title: Terrible quality.
text: Very thin.  Not recommending anybody to buy

title: No sticking power
text: These are adorable. That’s the only reason I’ve given them 2 stars. But they don’t stick. So they’re pretty much useless.

title: Missing packs
text: Good cards but the shipping package came broken and I was missing 3 packs of cards so I took off 3 stars.

title: Adjustment clip does not work.
text: I could only find one flaw in the lanyard but for me it is a big one. The clip to adjust the length is very weak and the Paracord slips. In just a few minutes of light walking and it sled to the end of the lanyard.

title: Returned product
text: Returned was not happy. Was not what i had hoped for.  Looked cheaply made to us

title: Poor quality
text:
It came with the edges chipped and peeling up.
The replacement came the same way.
Returned both not worth the money.

title: Smear & leaky this is what these pens should be called.
text:
When I first saw these pens made by sharpie I was excited about them because I love using their products but on this one they did not hit a home runner.

Fresh off the box started to use them as my hand went over the previous writing I started to notice I was smearing all over the place then I realized I had it all over my hands and it just wasn’t with the first pen it was with every single pen.

You would think that such a large company would test their products before putting it out on the market.

title: Not waterproof
text: " Waterproof " this is the wrong choice of word it's weather resistant but definitely not waterproof.

title: I want to return it, but it is too late.  It only fits one cart and that cart is cheap
text:
I bought this for a smart cart. At first, it was great. I filled it with my not-too-heavy oil painting supplies and tested the cart around the house to make sure it was easy to move and strong enough. It seemed good.
On my first use, the telescoping handle on the cart broke.
I tried buying different totes, but none of them would fit well enough to use the insert. Because I took up too much time trying to find a tote I could use with the insert, I am stuck with it. I have no use for it, unless I buy another Smart tote, which I will not do.

title: Not sticky
text:
While I love the larger pads, especially the checklist pad, the smaller pads do not stick at all, rendering half of this notebook useless.

The larger pads have a larger adhesive area which probably help with the stickiness. They also leave a bit of residue on the bottom sheets after removing a top layer.

The book and colors are super cute, I wish these worked better, but they just don't.:(

title: Sat in drawer and eventually lost stickiness
text:
These are clips with a very specific purpose but they look and work great!

I have the clear ones and they disappear into the wall nicely so you just focus on the lights.

Very easy to adhere and attach lights!

Update: they lose their stickiness very quickly. Also I had some unused pieces left and when I went to try to use them for some other lights the adhesive wasnt even sticky anymore? Not sure what that's about since they were just sitting in a drawer...

title: Too tall and bulky for average height woman
text:
My first lap desk, I based my purchase on other reviews. I'm 5'5" and this is obnoxiously tall at its lowest setting. Trying to type or write with my arms so elevated was painful and obnoxious.

I tried folding the legs down and using a pillow under it, which worked, but was quite hot and my legs went numb after a short time under the weight.

Not for everyone. 😩

title: Not really acrylic. Nice markers but not what they’re advertised to be.
text: This is a tough review, because I actually do really like these markers. However, they are not acrylic paint markers. Acrylic paint is water-based but dries permanent. These do not. They are easily wiped away after drying with a damp cloth. These are more like opaque watercolor markers. Nice, but not what I was expecting.

title: Leaks badly.
text: Not sure what’s up with this but I got paint on my pants when it started dripping while I was working on a project. You can see how much dripped out when I set it down.

title: Ok, but they don’t hold much and are expensive for what you get.
text: They are ok, but they don’t hold much and are expensive for what you get. I thought they looked really cute, but they’re smaller than expected. And the images are on plastic film that is uneven because of the spring underneath. After you use them often enough, it breaks through. Just wasn’t very impressed.

title: Very large and VERY heavy. Particle board swelled up after a couple months and looks awful.
text:
Edit: This didn’t last. After a few months the particle board has swelled around the edges and it looks like crap. Not worth the money..

—————————-
This is way larger and heavier than I expected. I actually can’t use it on my couch because it’s just too big. I am using it in my kitchen at the moment, it fits over my sink pretty well and gives me a little bit of elevated storage space above it. Not what I intended, but at least it is useful in that regard. But like I said it’s very heavy. Also, if you don’t need an extra large workspace or the little drawer (which is kind of a waste) you can find similar models for a fair amount less money.

title: There must be like a quarter teaspoon of ink in these cartridges.
text: There must be like a quarter teaspoon of ink in these cartridges. I printed less than 20 pages, which were mostly black with little bits of color such as invoices and coupons and stuff, and I am out of cyan and magenta. Ridiculous.

title: Great while it lasted.
text:
Update:
About six months later I can't print to this thing no matter what I do. It shows offline, then it says connected, but it won't print. Multiple resets, multiple networks, multiple devices. I'm ready to light it on fire. Do not recommend.
__________________________________________________________________

For a color laser, it's pretty petite. My last one weighed almost 80 lbs and was the size of a Smart car. Setup was simple, and I greatly appreciated the inclusion of a CD for the drivers and whatnot. Not everyone has the best internet so it's nice not to have to download all that stuff. Print quality is fine. It took two minutes to get the printer and computer talking to each other. Printing from my iPad was even easier. Click on print, select the printer, and print. So simple. It's quiet and unobtrusive....all in all, a nice unit.

title: Super thin, not clear, not non-slip
text: Lots of false claims on this product's listing. It's very thin, it's not clear as pictured, and there's nothing remotely non-slip on the back. Or the front, for that matter. If I hadn't gotten it cheap through warehouse Deals it would definitely be going back.

title: Not as pictured and described.
text: As others have said, the chair does not come with the ring foot support and it is not a high-lift chair. It's a decent work chair but not the high lift chair it's supposed to be. If you do end up buying one of these chairs, make sure you have a ratchet and socket.......I cannot imagine how long it would take to screw those bolts in without it.

title: Works great unless you've got a Win8 laptop.  Then it's a large paperweight.
text: I bought this and it worked fantastically well.  Until I 'upgraded' to a Win8 laptop.  The software will not install no matter what I do....run as admin, run in compatibility mode, you name it.  It's not like this is obsolete hardware where one could expect this, this is a current high-end scanner.  Support appears to be non-existent.  And it doesn't support twain so I can't even work around it that way.  You cannot use it without installing their software.  Major fail.

title: Came with broken leg
text: I am upset, I've had Saiji products in the past before and had nothing but a good experience, but this desk came with a broken leg. Would like a refund or a replacement!!

title: Not for me... short and hard to hold
text: I’m a hard writer but liked the idea of a fine tip. Shorter than the average pen and it just felt weird to me. Too much work to write. I’m sure it is just personal preference. Lovely ink color though and erasable.

title: The leg on the right was broken would not stay up,
text: Love it if it would stay up I'm a nurse and I do a lot of my paperwork in bed but will have to get a one.

title: Hard as a rock
text: I like the height of this cushion but it’s hard as a rock, and actually cause more pain sitting on it. I have to return it.

title: Returned
text: I have to mention that I even didn’t look at the fixtures of this ID badge holder precisely. As soon as removed from the packaging and saw how heavy it is, I new I have to return it. It’s so heavy without anything attached to it, I can’t imagine that anyone could wear it. It’s weight like you have at lest 25 keys attached together. I doubt that even will stay on clothes without causing wardrobe malfunctioning.  It has no design, just pure heavy metal.

title: It work
text: It works but quality of colors definitely not the same as original cartridges

title: Messy and unreliable
text: This unit jams up easily, doesn't keep an accurate coin count and is generally a pain to use.

title: Label printer
text: Setup was simple. I attempted to use item with a saved label I had that I use for tests and it would not print on the 4x6 format. It was either too small or cut off. So I waited until I got an order on my Etsy shop and tried printing directly from there and it still didnt work. That time, no label printed but the paper did feed through. Overall, useless for me.

title: Poly mailers
text: I gave it 2 stars based on the color. When I ordered these bags, there was a different picture and the color was a lilac/ lavendar (which is what I was hoping for). However, after ordering, the picture changed to a darker purple and that is what I received was a darker colored purple mailer. Other than the color, they are fine and work for their purpose. But I was really depending on them to be lilac/ lavendar and they arent.

title: Bling desk items
text: I gave this item 2 stars because of the quality. First let me say the items are sturdy and the construction of them seems well made, where they fall short is the decoration of the bling. If this item wasn't priced at $60 then I would have rated higher, but because it is $60 I expect much more when it comes to quality/ execution. All of the items have good weight to them and appear sturdy. My problem is how the bling is glued/ adhered to the items. The items seem to have been first wrapped or covered in a white material that looks soft/ squishy then the rhinestones were laid on top of that. I say that because you can see between the rhinestones where they were not all placed as tightly together and there were some gaps left. Also, the rhinestones seem to not all be the same size and color. Some look bigger than others and some shine brighter than others, as though they have a rainbow/ iridescent effect and the others are smaller and silver. Also, they used chain link bling for the perimeter of some of the items and then rhinestones to cover the rest of the areas and you can clearly see the difference. Some of the rhinestones are even laid on top of one another looking very tacky. So, although the quality is there, the execution is not and for $60 I find that unacceptable.

title: Comb binding machine
text: Let me start by stating that my review is from the point of view of a person who has never used a binding machine and this is the first time using one. First, there are no clear directions on how to use the item. IF you have experience then you would know, but for someone's first time, it's very unclear. There are small picture directions on the machine, but without words. The paper directions themselves are 1-2 pages long, each in a different language. Those 1-2 pages in english provide no clear directions either... just information about the product. I ended up looking up a video (not of this machine - because the amazon page wasn't available) to try to understand how to use the machine. I ended up figuring it out and began by using 8 pages of plain white paper. This machine seemed to have a problem punching the holes through those 8 pages when the capacity says 25. I had to press kind of hard to get the holes through. Then I placed in the binding comb (amazon branded), pulled the lever back to open it up and placed the paper on the ends of the combs and pulled the lever forward and I was done. Overall, it does work as intended and is sturdy, but the directions are lacking and the machine has a hard time handling even 8 pages.

title: Printer
text: The printer is a good size for small business; could even be used as a home printer, even though it’s monochrome, for simple print jobs or someone who isnt printing pictures or needs color. It was easy to setup connection to my wifi. I tried installing the software from the disk that was provided on a dell laptop with windows 10, 64 bit, however, it would begin the download process, but wouldn’t actually install on my computer. Once the initial download bar completed, nothing else happened. I looked in my downloads folder and other folders for the download, but nothing was there. I tried this multiple times and it didn’t work. Most companies will put the software on their website as well, but that wasn’t the case here. I was unable to find anything on the website. I couldn’t even find the specific printer/model on the site. So far, I am unable to fully test the product because the software will not install.

title: Scanner
text: I was excited to receive this scanner because the printer I use doesn't have one. This would also be very helpful for me while I'm on the go. Unfortunately, I cannot get this thing connected to ANY computer that I have. I first tried to set it up to my chromebook through the app, but I couldn't get that to work. I believe that's because this scanner can only be used through the usb cord. So, I plugged it up via the cord to my chromebook and still got nothing. Then I tried to connect it to my dell laptop and still NOTHING! I went online to the website and downloaded the software. Unfortunately, after a certain point, I kept getting an error message that the software couldn't be downloaded. So I uninstalled everything, deleted it all and tried again and still it did not work. At that point I just gave up and put the scanner away. Never got it to work or connect to any computer.

title: Not red
text: It is not red, it is pink. Very disappointed.

title: Not grey like the picture, and less than half the advertised size.
text:
This is black, not grey like the picture.

It's also about 4"x3", not 7x9.5. And about 1" tall without any weight on it.

It is slightly more cushioned than my previous beads bag ones of the same brand. Like the beads are more like rubber. Which I like.

title: This isn't soft at all.  Doesn't give one bit under my wrist.
text:
If you are used to and enjoy the softness of a hell pad or bean filled bag, stay away.

Love their other products but this is a throwaway for me.

title: These are minuscule.  Smallest wrist pads I've ever seen.  And not as soft as I thought either.
text:
Sure if you poke hard or pinch they feel nice and soft, but put your wrist on it, and it's really not that soft. The bean bag ones are much softer/nicer.

Also did it have to only be 3"? These things are tiny!

title: Never hardening putty
text: Bought two of these, neither send to harden.

title: Waaay to short, firm/hard, and uncomfortable
text:
Try the bean bags if you want something at least an inch or taller and comfortable. This hurt my wrist immediately and continually.

And definitely not tall enough.

title: Way too firm, hard and not tall enough.  For me at least.
text: Might be because I've been using gel and bean-bag versions for years, but this wasn't remotely soft or tall enough for me.  Couldn't even use it.  Tried it for about 5 seconds and back it's going.

title: Doesn't seem to stay/stick to the floor, so it slides away.
text:
Got this to stop a door which would move every time other doors in the house would open and close due to air pressure.

So basically to try to keep the door "really" shut. Doesn't work at all.

Perhaps it would do better if the the weight of the door was pressing on it, but hard as I've tried to squish it under the door, it simply doesn't "stick" to the wooden floor under it, just slides and slips freely on the floor.

title: Used these on Christmas presents and you can totally see them.  Ugly tape.
text: These are not invisible.  If you are looking to wrap present, but a different brand or item that is clear to start with.

title: SUPER cheap paint job
text:
I managed to scrub up quite a bit of the black pain in the first 5 seconds out of the box trying to get the two string plastic cords off of it it and the lock system . SUPER cheap paint job!!

What's under it it bright metallic, so it looks horrible now.

title: This is NOT a standalone phone!!!
text:
Though all other "additional/extra" headsets say that exactly, AND also say something like "This item requires items X, not standalone.", this item says NOTHING of the sort, leading me to believe it will work alone.

I even looked at the single present question to make sure it had a stand, people said it does, and it does, but it will not plug into a phone line.

This is NOT A PHONE! This is an additional / extra headset for another phone.

title: I had just a single flimsy phone line on these, didn't stay.
text: I put these under my desk at the very top to remove a phone line that would otherwise be under my feet.  I put three up last week and went on vacation.  They are all on the floor now.

title: Stars are for the idea - expect it to JAM! ALOT!
text:
Ordered this for a big presentation I had, it was a waste of money. We have a printer that meets the specifications outlined, the only one being that it be used with a printer that prints 11"x17". We have a Konica (bizbub c452) which is capable of printing on card stock.

I tried using this in the tray with varying stock setting and in the by-pass try. 1 or 2 came out good and then jam. I'd modify and repeat, same results. Finally moved it over to a desktop printer, same results. Finally gave up after wasting about an hour on this.

Maybe the results will be different on an inkjet...

This idea is fabulous, a pretty inexpensive way to customize all sorts of presentations and there is a CD included (no install required) that very easily allows you to format, but not at the expense of the time required, or for that matter the amount of product you end up wasting.

Now I just want a refund.

title: Good but good be better
text: Good size. Solid and sturdy. The only issue, it’s hard to take off and put back on. I have to push it in several times to lock in place and several times to unlock.

title: Disappointed
text: Well, I am disappointed. I love the brand but these are not described as mention. They were not to bleed through, made for bibles. As you can see, this is not the case. The value price is good if they work as described but not if they don't work.

title: Inaccurate description
text: This item is small. I order twice thinking the first one sent was a mistake. This product runs slightly above pelvic bone of back. Very frustrated, upset and furious the description is wrong. Thanks to Amazon, I am able to return once again.

title: NOT WORTH THE MONEY
text: It was  heavy compressed wood held together by hinges if you put it down on its side it dents it and it chips easy.  Not worth the  money.

title: Beware, the book stand cannot fit into the groove of the table.
text: The book stand does not fit in the groove at all.

title: Terrible quality and worst customer service
text: Paid $90 for this table only to realize that one of the legs is stuck, so the table height cannot be adjusted. There are MUCH cheaper and quality tables out there, the Saji one is overpriced and literally arrived defective. Worst of all, the company refuses to stand by their product by ignoring my service requests.

title: Adjustable
text: I returned this product

title: Really Very Disappointing
text:
There are so many things wrong with this desk. Some of them are issues with all of the larger bed trays/desks. Others seem exclusive to this model.

Cons:
1. Legs do NOT lock (just this one) - contrary to the description, they only lock from downward pressure. But if you pick the table up, the legs can slip down, giving an uneven surface when you try to set it back down. This is my biggest issue with this table, since my laptop ended up falling off the first time I moved the table.
2. Instructions are terrible and contradictory (just this one?) - this is especially an issue with the book stand. Fortunately, it's pretty easy to figure out, so this is minor.
3. Always at a downward angle (all) - this is because, if the table starts out flat, your weight on the bed will angle it down. Until they come up with a table that will tilt the other way, this will continue to be an issue. I thought I'd be able to reverse this one, but the slots can't be flipped.
4. Lowest height is still too tall (all) - I have no idea why the industry assumption is that only tall people with big legs have big laptops. This makes it painful for a shorter person to type after even a short time. This can be compensated for somewhat by putting a large pillow under the person's rear, but it's still not very comfortable. I'm not sure what the fix would be, or even if there is one.

Pros:
1. Pull-out tray works well for drinks (as long as they aren't too full).
2. Book stand works pretty well.
3. Pretty light weight for the size.

Full disclosure: I'm currently trying to decide whether or not to return this item. (Most likely I will.)

title: Gadgety, but NOT Practical
text:
I hate these.

First, the stickiness of the 'regular' Post-its are much stronger. With the originals, I can stick and re-stick several times to our bathroom mirror (helpful for weekly reminders and the like), as well as to my office door ("I'm in 248 today"). With these, they fail after one or two moves. Even when just sticking them to a single surface, you will find that they are easier to pull/fall off. I have tested them side-by-side, and the 'normal' notes consistently outperform these. You can see this yourself if you stick a normal pad of Post-it notes into the pop-up dispenser. You can pick up the dispenser with the stickiness of the normal notes, whereas the pop-ups come out 'cleanly'. Or just put them on a table side-by-side, like I did, and see which one comes up more easily.

Second, these are more expensive than regular Post-its. How so, you ask? Well, they are incredibly frustrating to use without a dispenser, so you really shouldn't buy them unless you also buy one of those. That will set you back another $5-10 on top of the notes (although it is reusable).

Finally, to use these with the dispenser, you HAVE to write on them AFTER you pull them off the pad. If you are posting them to a wall or other vertical surface, this generally means sticking them to a table or some such, writing, then moving them elsewhere. Since they are already weaker (see #1), this greatly increases the chances of them falling off by accident.

In short, these are 'neat' and 'gadgety', but not actually practical. Use these as a fun little party trick. Stick to the plain old "boring" Post-its when you actually need to make sure your message gets across.

title: It’s a piece of junk
text:
The print quality is so terrible that you can’t read the label. The use of the app to hook it up to wifi, and use it is also a pain in the rear.

Not recommended at all.

title: Damaged upon arrival
text: Love the functionality but the packaging was heavily damaged upon arrival. Top of desk had a large crack in it. Unfortunate

title: Use a cushion instead
text:
A waste of money (almost $40!!!).

Use a cushion instead.

title: Locking mechanism is not working properly
text: Used this item with no problems for 5 years, average of once a week. Lately though the locking mechanism is not reliable - the step stool closes suddenly even with small weights.

title: Nesting leads to stress on the lower piece whose sides bend out and bind the upper piece
text: Cannot nest. Here's what happened: placed the longer piece in a rather shallow drawer (hey I did not build this place). Placed the shorter piece on top at one end. Noted immediately that the upper piece descended half-way into the lower piece. Thus the upper piece took 1/2 of the available space of the lower piece. Why so much? 1/4 inch tracking would be fine and preserve more space in the lower piece, rather than take away HALF of the usable lower space. But it gets worse! Placed 2 tubes of ordinary toothpaste in the upper piece while in the backmost position and slid it forward. The walls of the lower piece spread apart under this huge weight (joke) and the upper piece FELL into the lower piece as the lower side walls opened in the middle, binding all movement. Poor design, poor thought, poor engineering.

title: Not Sturdy
text: The first few days this product was great, but after that the leg nearly snapped and was no longer stable. I don’t know how to fix it so I have to return.

title: Rickety, Unstable, and Doesn’t Roll with Minimal Weight
text: It assembled easily and drawers worked smoothly, unlike a similar style single tier version which I disassembled and returned immediately. However, after loading the cart with some very lightweight nail art supplies (no polishes!) it was very wobbly and less than stable. The wheels that are supposed to make it easy to move don’t! And if you do get it to roll, the entire cart feels like it’s about to self-destruct. I want to reemphasize here that the items in my art are basically things like little pots of glitter, nail decal cards, cotton rounds, and cosmetic wedges, and roughly 2 dozen little paint brushes! All told there’s probably less than 3 lbs of weight in mine! I honestly can’t imagine what good a portable storage cart is if it won’t roll and is too rickety to handle a certain amount of weight! I’m disappointed because I had high hopes for solving some of my storage problems, but it’s precarious and temporary at best! I’d be returning this too, but I already recycled the packaging. Waste of time and money!

title: Unstable and Drawers Won’t Slide
text: I was really looking forward to this cart to organize odds and ends that have been accumulating on the bathroom countertops. I purchased a 15 drawer version (2 tiers) at the same time for my nail art supplies at the same time, although the larger one was delivered a day earlier. I assembled it just the day before and as it turned out, that was a good thing, since no assembly instructions came with the 8 drawer cart. Everything seemed to be going together fine—until I started trying to insert the drawers. They were just slightly too large to slide into the slots! I loosened the bottom and top crossbars that connect the two sides and was able to get the drawers in with a bit of effort, but they could not be opened without bracing the cart and really pulling hard. Once I retightened the crossbars, it was nearly impossible. Fully assembled and appropriately tightened, the cart is wobbly and unstable and leans to one side or the other. The bigger issue is the inability to easily slide open the drawers, since that’s the entire purpose of a storage cart! I considered trying to figure out ways to get the thing to be functional; I had just spent all that time putting it together. In the end though, I decided that I would very likely only be wasting more of my time with no guarantee that it would work any better. So I took everything apart, repackaged it, and will be sending it back. I’ll get another 15 drawer model if I get another, but I’m pretty much over assembling (and UNassembling) storage carts for the near future! What good is a storage cart if the drawers won’t open? What a huge waste of time! And now I have to haul it to a UPS drop off site too!

title: Terrible doesn’t even work
text: Don’t buy

title: Not like pictures at all flat plastic no raised numbers or letters
text: Returned

title: Too Deep for Couch and Charge $17 for Return Pick-up
text: If you consider using this desk on a couch, perhaps do a full-size cardboard cut-out mock-up to see if there is enough arm and body room. And please be aware the pick-up return comes at at a $17.15 charge.

title: Well made. Doesn't quite fit my needs.
text:
Sits too high for comfort. I need to angle it pretty dramatically to get the working/close edge low enough. This prevents any hope of mouse use unless you're constantly putting the mouse back on to the desk every time you use it. It also renders the tablet/ phone groove obsolete. You can use the book stand to hold tablet, though the lip of the book stand blocks use of the bottom of the screen (home, back, options buttons on Android).

Solid materials and size. Easy to adjust. I wish the legs could be adjusted shorter and it came with a second, or longer, laptop stopper.

title: Cordless mouse doesn't work; had to buy mouse pad - doesn't fit well
text: It is unfortunate that a cordless mouse does not work on this table. The table is the right amount of space it has sturdiness unfortunately the legroom is limited from left to right however the overall desk is very very nice it's just that you can't use a cordless mouse on the surface which is a big problem.

title: ZERO PARTS
text: The little desk came, no attachments. No response from the seller. Avoid buying

title: On Floors, Moderately Good, Otherwise I Do Not Like This At All
text:
I originally got this because sometimes I have a hard time sitting on the floor. This seemed like a great support to have around for those days I can not avoid it. I also thought I could use it on my desk chair.

HOW TO USE THIS
The instructions say only to use this for a short time and then get up. That means it is not meant to sit in for really long periods of time. I guess I don't really understand that concept as most people at a desk that need things for support need to sit for long periods.

COMFORT
OMG On the floor I can tolerate this for a while and it does help. When I try to use this in any chair- the pain is HORRIBLE. It pokes every area of my body and makes it hurt so badly I have to get rid of it and sit on my chair support cushions again.

SUPPORT
On the floor I can use this for about 20 minutes and it does support. In a chair it is horrible- almost like a torture device for me.

STORAGE
Since I only want this for the floor now, it is very difficult to store. Putting it on a chair when not in use on the floor was my intent, but that is silly. I just end up not using it.

THE BOTTOM LINE
This is acceptable at times on the floor for me, but other than that, it causes so much pain all over I can not use it.

MY RATING
TWO STARS. I am giving this two stars because it does somewhat work for short periods on the floor for me. Other than that it is horrible. I had pain where I did not have pain when I sat down when using this thing. I am not a huge woman- about a size 14-16 US size misses at the time of this review. I tried this on several chairs with the same result- PAIN

title: One Of The Most Frustrating Experiences Yet (I WANT This To Work)
text:
EDIT- I KNEW as soon as I wrote this review, I would find a work around. It is not thrilling, but it works. I had to do some extensive research to find anything with N41 in the title that fits the HPRT printer. I ended up finding another driver dated from 2018 in Chinese which works. The caveat is that this driver only has millimeters and not inches at all.

BUT, I did finally find a driver that would work. I forgot to add in my original review that the flash drive that came with this had a malfunctioning video which only played music on any player I tried it on. I also wanted to say that all links in the manuals led to things that did not work.

I am putting my review to 2 stars because honestly, unless you do what I did to get this thing to work, if you end up with a malfunctioning set of driver links, flash drive videos, etc, I just don't think that is acceptable for a unit of this price.
-----------------
ORIGINAL REVIEW

I have been around tech for quite some time. I am not a novice. I no longer have the time to troubleshoot for days on end to make equipment work. I was hoping for a better label experience than I had with another printer. This one, unfortunately so far, has been WORSE.

HOW THIS COMES
This comes in a box very well cushioned. It is wrapped in plastic so if your box arrives soggy like ours did, you will have a chance of this being protected.

INSTRUCTIONS
There is a flash drive included in this with instruction manual (that you have to print if you hate reading on devices), sample print out, and driver installation instructions.

CORD
The cord with this is RIDICULOUSLY SHORT. If you are going to use this at a desk that does not have an outlet really close to where you want to put this, get ready to get a suitable extension cord or power strip. That frustrated me right off the bat.

INSTALLATION OF DRIVER
I would love to tell you that this installed easily and I was on my way to try this printer. Instead what I got was two hours of intense frustration that made me want to throw this away. I am THAT frustrated.

No matter what I tried to do, I could not get this driver to install. I tried EVERYTHING I knew how, other than intense tech level investigation. Most of you buying this would not be doing that. I am reviewing this with you in mind.

WHAT HAPPENED?
I got the software to unload in my system. It says that the device is installed. I have it show up as unknown. I go in by hand to install the driver (which was unpacked already) and it still shows up as not installed. I have tried automatic via windows, automatic via the printer company web site, and manual installation of the driver.

PRINTING
I can not get this to work. I would love to get it to work. I would love to have a label printer I can use. This, however, is not installing and I can not get it to install. My parameters are Windows 10 down to 7 (tested on two devices) which are both included in the compatibility list.

THE BOTTOM LINE
If I am able to get this to install and work, I will update this review. I was putting off reviewing this for a while planning to be the hero and have the fix to get this to work if you are having issues like I have.

MY RATING
ONE STAR. I can not give any more for a device that will not install so I can not go any farther with it. This device comes with the promise in the listing that it will be simple and easy to set up and use. My experience has been the opposite.

UPDATES
I will update if I finally am able to work with this and get it to install correctly. I feel that I have done everything that the average person would do to install this, so until I have a work around, I will leave this as it is for now.

title: I Must Have Gotten A Defective Unit- I HATE This Thing I WANTED To Like It
text:
I have worked with computers a lot, I used to build them, in fact. I am not THAT bad with technology for the most part unless it is something very foreign to me. This is a simple printer. It should work simply. Unfortunately, this has been one of the most frustrating experiences I have had with any electronics.

HOW THIS IS SUPPOSED TO WORK
You plug in the unit both electrically and to the computer. Then you download and unpack the driver and install the driver. It is not difficult, although the instructions could be better.

Once you download and install the driver, you should be good to go.

GETTING PRINTER USED TO LABEL
It is easy, you get the label in the unit, turn it on, and then hold down the feeding button until it beeps once. The unit reads the paper back and forth and is good to go- well in a perfect world, that is. After that, you should be able to feed labels into the back of the printer, and as it needs to print it will print.

PRINTING
Once the printer has read your label, then it can easily print out labels that you send to it. Easy peasy, right?

NOT!

THE REAL EXPERIENCE
From the time I installed this printer until now, I have had nothing but problems with it. The unit itself is crazy. It will read the paper then the red light will flash. Okay, so I press the right light button and it will spit out a label. Suddenly the green light is on and the label is in place- so you try to print out a test label.

The test label spits out and then the red light comes on. Try reading the label again- it might spit it out and then turn red and be inoperable. It might suck in label after label until you go through a whole stack. It might randomly print something you tried to print an hour ago despite it being wiped from the printer queue.

I have yet to have consistent performance of any type with this printer. It is erratic, frustrating, and annoying at best. Out of 15 attempts to print a label, I got two labels. The rest would not print because the unit refused to feed labels correctly no matter what. Out of about 60 attempts total, I got 5 labels not counting the ones that printed on top of each other twice randomly despite being wiped from the printer queue. I didn't include those in the tally- that would make it officially 64 attempts with two double printed labels showing up.

THE ONLY WORK AROUND IS NOT BUSINESS FRIENDLY
The ONLY work around I can come up with (so this unit is not a TOTAL loss) is turning off the printer after every single attempt. I put the label in from the top singly. Then I turn it on and hopefully the green light shows up. I send the label I want to print to the printer.. THEN..

WHAT HAPPENS THEN..
Once I do the work around about 70% of the time I get a label to print out. It is ridiculous, clumsy, and not at all business friendly. I wanted this unit so I could have an easier time of things printing labels for my business. As it is now, just to print out some labels for some friends was so frustrating I just put the printer away and did not want to deal with it. It is too erratic and frustrating.

The work around does work, however, most of the time, so if I am desperate I will use it. That only is practical if I want a few labels and even then there are misses that happen.

PRINT QUALITY
I was able to post a picture of one of the test labels I made to test the unit. When it printed, the quality was excellent. It is adjustable in the software too. I LONG to use this thing. I really do. I am just so frustrated with how horribly it works. My only work around I could come up with is so laborious and slow, but it gives me labels most of the time.

DIFFERENT LABELS
I even tried different labels from another company thinking that might help. It didn't.

THE BOTTOM LINE
I feel ripped off with this. Despite the indications on our titles we still have to claim full value of these devices whether they work or not as if we got paid that money. This is almost useless to me and I don't like using it. I feel envious of all of the people who got a good one. I really wanted to use this for my business but I would be better off getting a marker and coloring in everything by hand including bar codes- it is THAT BAD at times.

MY RATING
ONE STAR. I wanted so badly to have this work. When it does print, it looks nice. Otherwise the hours wasted on this nightmare have left me very unhappy and sorry I ever decided to try this thing. I would love to have one that works as it should. What a treat.

title: NOTHING BUT PROBLEMS- Frustrated With This In My HP M118DW Printer- IT SPIT AT ME!
text:
I have been wanting a new cartridge for my HP Laserjet Pro M188dw. This seemed like the perfect opportunity. Yeah, right.

WHAT IS THIS LIKE?
This comes in a green and white box. The cartridge inside is wrapped in plastic- black plastic. On the box is a list of instructions on how to replace the cartridge. Seems simple, right? WRONG.

INSTRUCTIONS
The instructions show a removal of a tab which is not anywhere on the cartridge. They have no pictures of the other protection that has to be removed, but the drawing seems to be of the same cartridge. I spent a lot of minutes looking for this long thing that they show being removed from the cartridge, and finally gave up.

INSTALLATION
I put the cartridge in the printer after shaking up well as instructed. The printer went through all sorts of gyrations and then it told me there was a problem. Again I took out the cartridge and reinstalled it. It went through the same gyrations but this time, despite it not feeling like it fit as snug as the previous cartridge, it said it was ready to go.

PRINTING
I tried printing with it and BAM it only printed a partial page and then stopped.

BACK TO INSTALLATION
I removed the cartridge again and tried once more to install it. Once I installed it, it finally printed. The printing quality was not perfect, but it seemed okey.

IT SPIT AT ME???
I was printing a bunch of pages, and suddenly about 30 pages into my document, the printer went nuts, the top door opened and spit the cartridge at me!!!

I have tried and tried to get this to install correctly and it does not seem right. The previous cartridge fits beautifully but this one just has been nothing but headaches.

THE BOTTOM LINE
This was a gamble and perhaps I just got a bad cartridge. At this point, it is an awful experience and I am frustrated. I can not recommend this cartridge at this point.

MY RATING
ONE STAR. This has been really an annoying experience. I almost wish I had never gotten this.

title: Frustrated- Sticky Patches Won't Come Off Cartridges
text:
When I got these cartridges, I did not need my ink replaced yet, but knew I would within the year so I figured I would get them and use them ASAP. I do quite a bit of printing, so I figured it would not be too long. Let's see what happened.

WHAT ARE THESE LIKE?
These cartridges come in a very thick plastic sheath. It is sealed well. On each cartridge of ink there is a little thin clear sticky piece of plastic that seals the opening so that the ink does not dry out before you have to use it. To use these, you cut open the bag and then you remove the seal and install them into the printer.

WHAT KIND OF PRINTER DO I HAVE?
I have the HP Officejet Pro. I was running low on ink for my yellow and magenta cartridges, so I thought I would try them out of the new pack before I totally ran out of ink. Boy was I glad I did. (also tried a third, see below)

WHAT HAPPENED?
Ideally, when you remove the seal of the cartridge, you install them in the printer and hopefully it will be recognized and work as all of the others. In my case, unfortunately , I never got that far. I was excited to try these and then when I went to remove the seal from the cartridges, they would not come off. The corners of the clear thin plastic seal all came off and no matter what I did, I could not remove the seals from these. I did not want to poke a hole in them because that could cause damage to the printer. So, in essence these are unusable.

ADDENDUM- CARTRIDGE 3
I tried the cyan cartridge and the seal partially came off, but not entirely. Again, I won't take a chance ruining my printer so it is a bust for me.

DO THESE WORK IN MY PRINTER?
I guess I won't know. My other ink cartridge is plenty full so I am not going to remove it just to find out I can not use these anyway. I guess this package of cartridges just are a bust for me. Without being able to remove the seal, I can not use the cartridges to figure out of they will work in my printer. I like my printer too much to ruin it just to test these out.

THE BOTTOM LINE
Although this sounded good, I could not remove the seal off of the colors I needed to use. That makes them unable to be used. I won't ruin my printer just to test them out.

MY RATING
TWO STARS. I guess it is more like 2 and a half but I can not say if they work or not as the seals won't come off. If I find that by some miracle the remaining cartridge works, I will update, but for now, I am up to 3 of them with seals unable to come off, so this is a bust for me.

title: Ridiculous Set Up, Fits Nothing We Can Find
text:
This sounded like it might be a nice item to have. My legs need to have a shelf to sit on quite often, and this seemed like the perfect answer. Let's take a look.

WHAT IS THIS LIKE?
This hammock is made in a concave manner so that it is not flat. It comes in a carrying case which is made from sturdy nylon with a locking drawstring. The band of the hammock has an adjustable buckle on it. It is attached with rivets on both ends.

HOW IS THE STRAP?
The longest the strap can be extended is 46 inches. That means if that amount goes around your desk, table, or stand, your feet will barely fit through the space between the hammock and your desk. Because this is a loop shape, it will only fit around a maximum of 29 inch board- but that means it will be very tight- no room to put any feet into it.

HOW DOES THIS PERFORM?
This is awful. I could not find a table, desk or any other item that I could use this hammock on. It is way too short! Even if I could find a desk that was only 40 inches wide, that would make the hammock so high, we would be sitting in a jacknife position.

THE BOTTOM LINE
This item is interesting in theory, but in practice, it just does not work.

MY RATING
ONE STAR. It just does not work for anything we looked for to try it with.

title: I Was SO Hoping This Would Work!
text:
We do a lot of canning, handmade lotions and soaps, and other things in our home. The problem is that sometimes the lids can get a bit oily. I was hoping for a pen that would write on them pretty well. This seemed perfect. Let's see what happened..

WHAT ARE THESE PENS LIKE?
These pens come in a blister pack of four with two black, a red, and a blue. The cap goes on pretty tightly and the point is fine enough to write a word with, but not so fine that it is skinny if that makes sense. There is an odor, but it is not that bad.

HOW DO THESE WORK?
Well, these are supposed to write on oily, dusty, metal, plastic, wood, and concrete. I tested these on plastic, metal lids for jars, plastic containers for lotion, and dusty wood. They wrote okay on the wood, but so do a lot of things. As for the plastic jars, I wrote on them DRY but when a little oil hit the side of the plastic container, the letter smeared so badly it was illegible. Then it came off within a day of use.

The metal lids I wrote on were both dry and oily. The dry wrote okay, but when it got oil on it, it smeared too. The oily lid, forget it. The writing would not even go on well to begin with let alone stay there.

THE BOTTOM LINE
I was hoping these would work, but in the cases I tried them in (except for wood) they just did not perform well at all. I guess I will wait for someone else to come up with something better.

MY RATING
TWO STARS. These are not any better than regular sharpies in the applications it claims to be designed for.

title: Until than...signing out!🤘✊
text: I won't be rating this until after June 20, 2021 (Father'sDay). This is a gift for my hubby!🙂 The one star rating is only because I couldn't submit w/o rating.

title: Absolute trash
text: Inferior product. Legs bent and twisted within minutes of use. Refunding.

title: Did not last more than 2 months!
text: While the white desk looks nice, it did not last more than a couple of months. Between the plastic legs slipping and not staying locked when “closed”, not worth the money for such a short life span. Disappointed.

title: Came damaged and used
text:
At the first glance the desk felt used. It had dark scrub marks in the legs. The right button to adjust the desk height was also jammed.
There were two dents underneath the desk which could be felt one you move your fingers on them. Super disappointed after paying almost $90 for this. Returning.

title: Flimsy, cheap, but easy to assemble
text: Can’t hold a laptop or tray. Things just slide down. There’s a little removable panel stopper, but it’s ineffectual. Lightweight, cheap, can’t even hold a phone up unlike in photo. Return was easy but still took a trip out. Can’t this untaxed billionaire send door step pickup?

title: This is trash. Expect Malfunctions every 3rd label.
text: Do not buy this if you need to label things quickly or in quantity, as a label gun is designed to do. This malfunctions every 3-5 labels. Search YouTube for replacement part tutorials but don't expect that to fix something that breaks after 5 labels. Anyway, junk.

title: Total malfunction after exactly 7 tags
text: Total junk. Not some heavy duty grocery grade pricing gun like the pictures and ad says. Skip this one

title: Much better quality Felt Boards out there for about the same price
text: I ordered the ‘Black Felt Letter Board 10x10 inches - 510 Letters and Storage Bag Included’ for review.  I have had the opportunity to review two other felt letter boards recently in this same price range.  This is the lowest quality board of all three.  The edges are unfinished and rough.  You could get a splinter if not careful.  As it is unfinished the frame is not stained as the description picture shows.  The plastic letters do not have tabs on the top and bottom of them, so when you stand the sign up the letters fall off.  Also, the slots are too wide apart so the letters do not fit in them securely.  There is a good variety of letters and punctuation marks.  The frame also does not have a standing leg on the back.  You must purchase a stand to set it up on a dresser or desk.  Overall, I was disappointed in the quality of this board.  Not one to purchase when there are others that are the same price and way better quality.

title: Too large
text: I had high hopes for this however it is too large to use when sitting in a large chair. Very awkward

title: Quality and Affordable
text: Best product I have found for working in bed! Love the sliders which help make the desk easy to move forward and backward. Quality materials. Definitely worth every cent.

title: Too difficult to put together, even for handy people
text: I'm really not impressed with this locker.  My husband is extremely handy and he said this is the most poorly built item he has dealt with... along with many other four letter words that left his mouth while he was putting this thing together. It is a very heavy and substantial locker, but made of plastic. It does hold quite a bit of stuff, but seems to wobble a bit after it is snapped together.  Overall, we are not impressed and I wouldn't recommend this item.

title: Looks great, but now the mouse doesn't work so well...
text: These mouse rugs are really cute.  However, they don't seem to work very well with the mouse.  I had to actually change my settings on my PC mouse to the fastest speed and tracking they could go and the mouse is still pretty dog slow now.  As for my Mac mouse... I gave up and went back to my old mouse pad because it wouldn't work at all with my wireless mighty mouse.  So, my daughter is now using this mouse pad as a rug for her Barbie house.  So... although these are really nice looking, they really don't work well.

title: Great until it prints a page in color.
text:
I have an all-in-one brother laser printer that is black and white and I love it, so when my 10 year old HP color laser printer gave up the ghost, I thought I would try this one. Overall... it wasn't the best purchase.

PROS
1- Extremely easy setup. I set it up to work off of my network print server, as well as wirelessly within about 5 minutes. I was then able to install and setup 2 Mac computers and 3 PC computers within 20 minutes. All worked fine and printed without issue to the printer.
2- Relatively quiet compared to my old HP.
3- Print speed
4- Price

CONS
1- Really, the only problem I found with it was the print quality when printing in color. I was so disappointed. Like I said, I switched from a 10 year-old HP color laser. The colors on my HP were vibrant and true to what my photographs showed. The colors on this printer's (Brother MFC-9840CDW) print-out were horribly washed out and almost made it look like the photographs were actually faded.

Although the price of the printer was excellent, I am going to return mine because of the color print quality. If you don't care about that, this printer is great in every other way. However, if you are looking for vibrant, true colors, like your photographs show... then I would go with a different printer.

title: Wish I could just get one that doesn't have any problems!
text: I ordered one of these two months ago and it worked GREAT for the first two months, then it started having a weird clicking noise every time it would pull from the paper tray and then paper soon started jamming.  We returned it to Costco and ordered a new one.  We just received the new one and I went to set it up and received an instant error that said "Machine Error. Call Brother."  I called them and they told me the error I was receiving was because it was broken and I would have to use the warranty to get it fixed.  Thank goodness we purchased it from Costco, because we will be returning it tomorrow.  So... why the 2 stars instead of 1... well... it was a great printer while it was working. It was fast and with the wireless option, it would work with all the computers in our house.  It scanned and faxed well.  I just wish we could actually get one that works. Chances are... we will probably try one more time to purchase it because there is not another wireless all-in-one that I could find on the market for a reasonable price.  Wish us luck on our third one!

title: Have used lightly over 2 years. Still works but I'm unimpressed and don't recommend it.
text:
I bought this laminator - [[ASIN:B0010JEJPC Scotch Thermal Laminator 2 Roller System (TL901)]] - for $29.69 from Amazon in February 2015. It's so very definitely NOT worth the crossed out price of $80.49! It wasn't worth that then and it's not worth that now! So firstly, don't be misled by the crossed out price. I really wish Amazon would start policing these misleading crossed out prices! This laminator can currently (date of this review is 2/10/2017) be purchased through a well known online department store for $19.97 (with free shipping or free in store pick-up). You can also buy the newer version - TL902 - through another online department store for only $17.99 (with free in store pick-up). So, the crossed out price here is terribly misleading. Note: I can't 'advertise' these stores here, but go shopping with your browser and you should find it around or under $20 elsewhere as well.

After 2 years of use, here's my review of my experience with this laminator:

Pros: It still works fine with light use for the past 2 years. Also, I have found it can give nice results if you only want to laminate items up to 3mm thickness (so a photo by itself or with a sticker on back for instance). It will laminate nicely for a 10 minute period, without warping or scorching. So, it's okay for light duty laminating of items of limited thickness. Note: I've found mine needs to be set to the 5mm thickness if I don't want the lamination lifting soon after being laminated.

Cons: I bought this laminator to make bookmarks for gifts using varying layers of card and photos, and later to use in my small home-based business for the same. I also planned to do cards with pressed flowers, but my machine gives bad results for any of that. I'm now looking to purchase bookmark sleeves, after 2 years of trying every way I could think of to get good results. This laminator seems incapable of laminating nicely varying layer heights of paper and card or card and pressed flowers (up to 5mm total thickness). The issues happen when I use photo paper together with thin to regular thickness card framing and backing the photos, unless it's all a uniform height (so no framing with the backing card). When using the 3mm setting the lamination lifts pretty quickly leaving ugly results. When using the 5mm setting, it may look great at first, but within a day or less the laminating film starts to lift leaving nasty marks on the card around the photo or all round the pressed flowers etc. Furthermore, I've had to be careful not to laminate for more than 10mins, or it gets too hot and starts scorching.

Overall, I'm not pleased with this laminator. It does not meet my needs and I would not recommend it. However, it might be fine for you if all you want to do is laminate the occasional photo.

title: Once shredded (and only once) Twice Shy
text:
What a bunch of rubbish! Failed in use after only 7 minutes in Service, now i can't get the Merchant or the Warranty Service to pick up their phones. Amazon should be ashamed to offer this useless rubbish of their website. PS - i am no shredder mechanic or expert but to my eye the motor drive and the shredder mechanism are disconnected and it makes an awful racket. Won't advance or withdraw paper.

{addendum: I have since had the thing apart to see if i could attempt repair. I'm going to preface what i report by saying this is how it appeared to me upon inspection, no desire for legal issues. (1) Massively powerful electric motor, check, (2) massively well built jaws for shredding. check. (3) the gears on the shred jaws are metal. (4) the drive gears taking power from the motor to the shred jaws are plastic... a sufficiently soft polymer that if the shred jaws lock up, the polymer gears simply tear their own cogs off against their metal gear counterparts. Instant & permanent failure, and by three phillips-head screws that seem to be threaded in nwithsuperglue..a neophyte cannot get at the parts to physically address repairs. Instant failure and PLANNED obsolescence.
A failure in engineering 101, not to mention commonsense. It's simply NOT SAFE to drive metal gears with a polymer-geared drive.
What was it Nader said 'unsafe at any speed?' Yes well i know how he felt. SAD SAD Sad - please i BEG you, don't fall into the same trap as i have here.

title: MAJOR flaw, avoid, do not buy
text: The printer is okay but suffers a MAJOR flaw: It has an energy-saving timeout after which it shuts itself off.  As in, you must walk to it and turn it back on before you can print again!  The maximum timeout is eight hours, and this feature cannot be disabled.  So forget about using this as a fax machine, and resign yourself to hiking to the printer to turn the damn thing back on whenever you need it.  If this seems inconvenient, please be assured it is.  I'll be returning this.

title: Fortunately I found the cap on the Al-Star is slightly ...

title: Awesome pen, but the clip was so tight it ripped my shirt.
text:
Awesome pen, but the clip was so tight it ripped my shirt. Not only is the clip too tight, it also has sharp metal edges folded under the clip. Too bad they do not make it with a usable clip, otherwise this would definitely be my EDC pen.

Update: I also found this pen is not at all like a Sharpie. The ink wipes write off plastic or glass surfaces like a golf ball or lexan bottle. Having that multi-surface compatibility is what makes Sharpies great. They mark almost anything. But this pen is barely good for marking paper.

title: The printer will not print black if I select black-only ...
text:
Review after 9 months:

- Constant print alignment problems
- Smearing
- Skipped lines
- Heavy color ink usage even though I almost never print color or pictures
- Black ink runs out fast even though I use the faded-grey draft mode for more than half my prints

The quality problems are so persistent and grievous that I can't imagine using this for business. I use it primarily to print worksheets for my two kids, and UPS return labels. Every time I try to use it for something where quality matters, it disappoints.

If this was truly low-initial-cost printer (40 dollar job), then I would accept getting what I paid for. While this is still an inexpensive printer, the ink costs add up quickly and I will have to consider dumping this since it cannot print anything decently and is too costly to print casually.

Note: The printer will not print black if I select black-only if even one color cartridge is reported empty. I'm disappointed that the Epson is deliberately set up to stop printing black just because a color cartridge is out and did not allow a workaround to print black only. Shame.

I've found the scanner produces poor image quality. I would like to scan my children's artwork on paper, but I get better results taking a picture of it with a camera. I suppose the scanner function works adequately if you're just using it to replace fax.

Printing can be good quality if the right "inkjet" paper is used so it doesn't bleed too much. I think this is the first inkjet I've had where I won't regret having it instead of a laser printer, but I also wouldn't replace the lasers at the office with anything like this. It's definitely a home, personal or small office, low-productivity printer, and it has limited page sizes. Personally, the thing I miss the most is double-sided 11x17, but admittedly that is another category/price-range.

I have done some photo prints on this, which I would not plan to do regularly. This is not a photo printer. I used photo paper to print some proof-of-concepts for an offset print project. The print quality was quite good, but the printer left roller marks with many tiny pin prick dents on the paper. There may be an adjustment for this, but it's not worth it to me to figure out. It was awkward enough just changing paper sizes and orientation with the poor user interface. For photo printing, I still prefer a laser-exposure mini-lab type system (Fuji Frontier etc.) - In other words, I send it out to a service.

I frequently have alignment problems with the printer. I get places on the page where the image is shifted left or right. I've run the print head alignment utility several times but it still has alignment problems on occasion.

title: warps
text:
I bought this whiteboard because it was the size I needed: 4x6 and because it was porcelain on steel rather than melamine. It has a plain aluminum border and a tray. It cost less than fancier boards in this size which can fetch up to five hundred dollars (twice the price I paid). It arrived by freight in a battered box, but managed to avoid any damage. It's comprised of a masonite backer board, a thin steel sheet with the porcelain finish and the aluminum border that holds the edges together. I haven't had it long enough to know whether the porcelain finish is as durable as I'll need it to be. The only complain I have is the flatness of the board is poor. I hung it by the pre-installed slotted holes in the back. I used two sturdy 50 pound wall anchors. The problem is the board does not lie flat against the wall, nor does it stay flat. I blame the masonite backer board. It is inadaquate, and the mount hangars are inadaquate. I could probably fix it by using large tube of Liquid Nails in a caulking gun and just glue the board to the wall solid the way some mirrors are mounted, but it would be permanent. The board would be destroyed to remove it. I will probably just try to hold it down with some double-sided tape or additional hardware.

I don't know if the more expensive ones are better or not, but this one is utility quality. If I were doing an install in a well-furnished room, a company conference room, a well-appointed classroom, a boardroom or anything like that I would look elsewhere.
